infidelitie hypocrisie semblably writing diuine argument whether vpon scripture treatise consonant thereto singular vse church yet neuer free malignitie men especially either curiositie endure nothing clawes leprous humor carelesnes professe either meddle man writing without putting difference embrace good bad equall affection two former three meane vngratiously nice gracelesly sensuall must say child israel saw must make warre forraine nation vnto day whole land though promised deuided amongst yet wonne conquered lot inheritance euery tribe canaanite enemy still dwelling remaining seeing knew must driuen force strong hand god commanded therefore doubted whether goe warre tribe first begin goe gouerne rest thing waight went lord asked high priest propitiatory mercy seat manner doubtfull case tribe begin battaile exod answere satisfaction goe vp attempt god prospered promised iudah sought helpe simeon brother neighbour tribe consented readily doe prospered attempt victory ouer canaanite set downe together destruction adonibezek king thus much meaning verse generall manner haue meaning verse remaineth drawe thence instruction afoarded v beginning two former set downe first first verse people constrained looke ioshua dead doe themselues peace quiet hee doct verse wont doe wee taught chiefe speciall person taken away wont beare burden many left behinde must put forth themselues take paine put greater plondges oh great ease men could consider aright haue others beare brunt selues may sit peace sauiour christ conuersant disciple earth sheilded note matth prouided euery way bare blowes shoulder pharisies cauilled whereby might easily haue bin discouraged tooke part weake defended said peter litle ascention thou ioh wast young thou girdest thyselfe wentest whither thou wouldest thou art old another shall girde thee leade thee whither thou wouldest king gouerne wisely conscionably people sit vnder vine king figtree said liued dayes salomon hee nathan prophet zadok priest benaiah worthy counseller like also people setled vnder faithfull able teacher watch soules liue corner heauen see obediently sit feete heare may say child haue prouident godly parent regard welfare know sorrow trouble meane glory child father inferiours haue good friend gouernours seeth priuiledged prouided aboue others faile beginneth woe sorrow leaue behinde vnwelcome parting couple mariage husband wife husband true loue betwixt daily seene proued deepe sorrow longest liuer al haue said backed others weigh great goodnes god giuing helpes yeild due reuerence loue obedience lord carefully giuen euery good worke haue great incouragements inioying made common matter thing great reioycing liue according prouerbe best know good thing worth wee feele want therefore good suppose oft time put case worthy helpes friend taken doe left without vine wanting raile prop vp runneth ground waxeth wilde vnfruitfull simile inferiours destitute godly superiours waxe degenerate grow kinde lying open mischiefe saul samuel death sam speake truth pitie rare hardly bee found take great good helpes inioy vnlesse thing temporary ease maintenance seeking note liberty flesh neither forgoe haue grace bewaile losse respect earthly neither doe looke stand vp ought want roome care confidence become lightes good example keepe themselues euill kept doubt good friend prouide ill themselues seeing people israel heere ioshua dead great losse constrained looke better needed doe euen hauing like befalne must take burden themselues borne others men make vse change vse prouide learne want good helpes friend hand arme themselues iob looke change see must need forgoe also acknowledge daily hearty thankes god benefit haue inioy vse doe good may helpe cannot doe must necessitie feele losse great see must lay shoulder burden therefore labour fitter beare vndergoe want wont stand great stead wholesome direction aduice haue helper friend yet remaining easie see euery calamity sustaine made vse comfortably inioyed purpose adde end point oh sweetly good liking haue many liued others beare burden husband wiues subiects child neighbour friend benefit inioyed kindely aright doubt chiefest haue therewith god friend also seeing many depend onely carnall manner liuing still rest god therefore proppes faile desolation commeth vpon enemy vpon vnarmed man particularly taught hereby example sought god doubtes counsell resolution doubtfull doct case fewe partly touching estate towards god partly particular duty action speciall calling condition life remaine earth consult aske counsell god resolution manner hath taught v wise conceale bury want defect trouble v passe sinnes cleaue v difficulty dealing businesse oppresse v prouide ill selues euen liue ignorance sorrow inconueniences annexed thereunto euer yet seeke answere resolution wee must thinke inioyned god doe particular manner high priest might thought great trouble v seeing none day aske counsell v must know haue moses prophet apostle helpe minister god pastor teacher bring v god message minde word thereby instruct v wee selues occasion serueth search scripture answere owne doubt thereby settle estate god ward dauid act psalmes oft namely saith art thou heauy soule psal art thou troubled within mee still trust god praise best againe whereby shall man yea yong man doth psal hardly ouercome passion denie way hee may proue himselfe blessed answeres scripture euen taking heed thereto god word teacheth thus say search scripture hearing reading doe reueale god vnto v consult men brother holy ghost hath set ouer v ende misery age nothing called question among note v thinke haue knowledge doubt nothing waightiest matter pray diligent carefull learne daily search selues word see misse neede helpe nay fewe men care chiefly desirous enquire good god toward haue profited thereby already ought doe carelesse liued obserue want themselues drowsie wandring heare could ordinary ministery grow much setlednesse sound knowledge whereas see stranger taught home resort sound teaching say though know much inquisitiue desirous answered doubt haue daily meanes hand whereby might resolued reioyced much hearer gospell frequent house preacher physitians enquire bodily health hope looked liue euer desire liue long heere bodily health though short season day gone yet time haue seene place meane men woman seruants would rise early dispatch businesse lecture day end might repaire thither inquire god congregation would ready take good priuatly also question good purpose necessary might maintenance bodily prouision many question pray moued one dayes weekes worke bee brought end ignorant knoweth mindeth way eternall life hath many cause day weeke aske himselfe secret questioning whether well concerning account making god doubt matter doe greatly trouble v day wee run sixe leuen blinde man cast staffe looking v might safely guided commeth rash proceeding without consulting god one example booke number may sufficiently numb appeare certaine people israel would need goe vp fight amalekites canaanite owne head sent lord came destroyed another fault committed kind though perswaded bad mind seeing without great danger giue warning men feele many doubt arise reason sinnes fore trouble conscience yet feare lest haue answere liking shame lest bewray ignorance secret bee reproched mocked conceale till sorrow deuoure opening mindes euen water pent bursteth violently note doth much hurt time hauing let foorth vented might haue auoided become people booke actes apostle pricked heart point sword come apostle made complaint saying men brother shall doe yet act strong temptation open griefe much prouoked railed therefore troubled doubt especially conscience bee great straight vnquietnesse feare god displeasure wrath cannot owne knowledge put away trouble mind let inquire men brother well perswaded resolution comfort haue instrument god pricke wound also helpe ease need feare god hauing promised shall find rest soules impossible soeuer seemed bee said first verse next manifest god gaue answer propitiatory verse mercyseate receiued high priest hee vsed doe one ordinarie meanes whereby god spake day onely whereby satisfied question answered also incouraged goe worke set promising victorie warre canaanite saying haue giuen land hand iudah shall goe rest attempting warre word witnessing gracious answere god may clearely see seeking god doubt necessity vaine neither labour lost know perswaded god answereth suite demand indeed otherwise deadly discomfort would discourage v much well dutie maketh see wicked wit end great danger haue helpe god reade saul sought god asked counsell serue owne turne thereby philistims rather please hee answered hee depth sorrow complained cried saying lord hath forsaken mee answereth neither prophet dreames blessed name dealeth neither let trouble say although god answered people israel sought yet hee doth v know promise v aske according grant well hee answered ioh asked therefore psalme saith call time trouble heare thee thou shalt glorifie agreeth psal word sauiour vttered aske shall giuen seeke ye shall finde matth certaine euery child god maketh mone thus poureth complaint shall heard little whet v animate v draw neere god wee hauing sure word promise draw neere v seeking mortall man iam distresse though little aboue v know readily chearefully goe perswaded good answer doubt kind louing affection toward v contrarie hardly wee drawne sue one alienated v seeing care thus standeth betwixt god v oftener come welcome wee true former speech seeing inward beloued abraham moses dauid others repaired oftest receiued say seeing thus betwixt god v lamentable bewailed common men repaire god could marke may easily perceiue neglect doe increase trouble get nothing seeing entred vpon matter thinke amisse shew three sort offend common sort wholly neglect omit prayer altogether first thinking though pray shall speed well haue good lucke terme others shall boldly affirming see good come yet distresse thinke pray hauing neither skill thereto stead thereof curse rage helped deliuered though vtter word passion lord heares read pro pro one vttered none though cannot pray god yet make complaint moane euery man haue acquaintance heare breake mind cannot helpe yet would gladly finde helpe passe present sure helpe found folly nay madnesse say truth god sought vnto sort shift faile haue said speake second sort professor forwarder sort religion former pray faith confidence repentance comfort well desire obtaining thing want patient waiting god leisure euen seeke god manner yet onely right way praying teacheth v alloweth v prayer made without property bare noise word vaine repetition idle matth speech god abhorreth neither may looke receiue thing iames saith ye aske obtaine ye aske amisse iam see receiue thing aske euen well doe gather imagin though falselie vniustly prayer doth good lost labour seeing heard pray amisse waxe slacke negligent therein omit altogether lesse maruell seeing euen good christian come third sort go farre beyond forget themselues ofttimes deluded diuell euen omit zealous seruent praying fall pray coldly deadly many vaine deluzions alurements stand vp way vnsettle misty cloud trouble discourage thus flesh iustleth good resisting time commeth passe euen haue gal learned pray aright haue oft vsually done yet soone decline sometime bee aware fall pray custome matth course hartily aright ignorant wel vndermined slily deceiued malice subtilty diuell euill heart prayer corrupt hinder luk liues breake offensiue therein ought marke declinings decay one well coldnes deadnes pray well liue well contrary want goeth ill v doth walke oft time note heauily cannot say god heareth v heere said people god answered euen haue prayed yet satisfied neither rest faith perswaded god heare v yet one chiefest fruites prayer thus much god answere yet marke barely answere might haue done haue said onely let iudah goe vp shall mine answere addeth gracious incouragement demanded saying haue giuen land hand commonly men suite better aske looke thinking meanes obtaine somewhat answerable expectation god giues asked thought needfull dealing doth adde yet greater hartening incouraging v prayer see oftentimes promiseth giueth v looked deare saint god haue found time ioseph whose feete pinned stockes prayed might deliuered psal prison whereinto thrust suite whorish mistris gen consenting vnchast request god onely deliuered gen brought great honour esther prayed spitefull attempt haman people also god people might preserued deadly esther snare laid liues lord onely saued vtterly destroyed cut cleane shamefull reprochfull manner haman seede woman esther canaan asked christ helpe daughter possessed diuell mat granted vnto beside asked euen would wee luk know prodigall sonne penurie miserie glad refresh himselfe fill bellie swine food desired might receuied seruant father house entertained taken sonne nothing costliest apparell daintiest food thought good whereto tend example incourage v acquaint selues god seeking know oft earnest repairing assuring selues wee shall onely obtaine come prayer oft time much according epistle hebrewes commeth god let know heb plentiful rewarder seeke hath experience god louing kindnesse knoweth neither hath found himselfe doe aske particular benefit euery day inioy one many leade poore life maimed body wanting finger eye tongue c wee receiued oft time aske omit thing long stand vpon hath proofe matter greater waight whereas sometime anguish heauinesse soule feare wrath god iustly prouoked sinnes hee would haue thought happinesse haue bin especially liuing heere haue bin freed feare condemnation say hath proofe himselfe hee hath yet liued see good infallible euidence beside hee desired himselfe made assured eternall glory true god giueth could aske thinke aske name mediation sonne whose merit intercession infinite likewise haue oft time bin depth calamity seeking god helpe therein haue onely found deliuerance therewith blessing vnlooked great admiration comfort god hath giuen v desire way yet least seeme way come short promise hath suffered crosse remaine till hath made v see therefore say hath turned farre greater benefit v presently deliuered v neuer laid vpon v true god giueth could looke asking thinke receiue vphold v grudging time wee thinke god deales sparingly shortens v desire wee blinde reuel obseruing thing want eye salue faith onely make v see thus leaue verse another thing heere worthy marked doth onely incourage v seeke earnestly hebr like large offer made people withall giueth v sufficient incouragement worke setteth v psal doth tribe iudah thou saith shalt fight battels mine enemy thou among others shalt goe worke though enough harten thee command thee yet know thy better incouragement thee assisting blessing thee yea also giue thee victory deliuering thy hand better certainty telleth hath done already yet teach v god speake word counted one v done deed much like hebrwes hebr god denied ill master doe take knowledge seruants worke forgetfull seruants labour vniust leaue vnrewarded telleth deale liberally hebt men promise much performe little yea many vniust set worke neuer willing pay hire come reckoning well content defraud due take labour manner nothing god liberall paymaster promiseth afore hand looke euen make v able fit worke may bee toilesome tedious vnto v beside reward giueth afterwards euen iosuah leade people first land canaan hee onely promised io whole land added therewith thee leaue forsake thee duly considered belieued strongest motiue set v forward cheerefully onely duty workes calling doe cause delight ioyned profit also require much toile haue nothing incourage v god command v would haue v goe worke otherwise namely magistrate minister great work required cheerfulnes readines haue mentioned yea husbandman artificer manner set vpon iohn workes inioyned likewise euen seruants doore keeper hewer wood drawer water basest seruices meanest calling also keeper sheepe swine psal occupied calling long know condition liue serue god bee blesse therein may abide comfort resting vpon prouidence trusting promise shall reape fruit assuredly would say woman place condition worke occupied bruing baking sowing spinning like huswifery stay long behauiour deutr heauenly earthly businesse would better become man would thinke desired sought wise might liue cheerefully peaceably would better become say life leade part led distrustfully vnquietly fretting raging earthly mindednes c trust god successe neither belieue direct helpe also giue good end labour though alwayes attaine outward profit seeke god prouiding better euen hardnes count contentation patience shall greater blessing inioyed commodity might haue bin looked oh wofull people like labour worke god allotteth appointeth take hand thinke good therein promise themselues worldly men mentioned saint iames namely gaine shall haue without promise iam god therefore disappointed could finde heart contend god yeelding hope desire vnto though bee directed yet quarrell dispute faile looke else secret murmuring frettings disappointment thus see ill prouide themselues take worke goe god might also prosper therein wise shall repent iudah heere desire god teach good pleasure haue therein sure shall goe well whatsoeuer take hand respect dauid wished psal meanest place god house say ruleth rather greatest highest elsewhere wel shewing example poore simplicitie make like choice may liue farre sweetly note peaceably mightiest refuse learne salomon ment said dish greene hearbs peace better staled oxe strife like place obiected god dealt farre better obiection people doth day v particular doubt trouble might goe aske counsell god gaue answere againe thereto grant v like manner say good cause deede serue god readily ioyfully haue libertie aske manner like prerogatiue answering v againe answere say liberty granted one respect diminisheth nothing god fauour v people israel promise god common wealth sort abide vnto christ comming cause great ieopardy rooted enemy god gaue leaue thus aske resolued satisfied according promise made wit driuen land whereby knew trouble feared vtter ouerthrow captiuity afterwards season appointed time restored againe psal returned owne land great prerogatiue answeres god particular earthly benefit temporary blessing needed haue stand need haue farre greater meanes saluation farre cleerely brought light greatest benefit seeing wee haue many bookes holy scripture especially thing done spoken prophet new testament wee may well allow somewhat want praying god either thing heauenly earthly haue farre easie accesse god one thing excepted one liberty granted haue said would aswell appeare fruit prayer zealous oft constant therein vprightnes heart vse liberty praying god hath allowed rom compared iam taught v doe followeth third verse second sermon vpon first chapter booke ivdges vers vers iudah said vnto simeon brother come vp lott may fight canaanite goe thee thy lot simeon went although god promised deliuer canaanite hand iudah yet end sitte idle sense waite well incouraged vse helpe thereto hand whereby might bring passe tribe simeon brother possession mixed lying among field iudah therefore called helpe two mutually assisted one neere dwelling neighbourhood caused defend one practise example iustified scripture learne two lesson first although god hath promised blessing v owne free goodnes yet let faith vse doct vers good meanes offereth v effecting rather ought doe iudah ioyne god promise prouidence together action warre bound doe al action peace meane beleeue one serue haue seene tempt god doe otherwise commanded doe god promised helpe psalme yet willeth waite meanes vsing fitte like bring passe thus saith commit thy way thou psal good bring passe therefore dauid god stablished kingdome hand promise yet treason absalom sam sonne onely prouide himselfe saue life keepe kingdome himselfe flying vsed also helpe hushai arkite sonnes priestes ionathan ahimaaz frustrate attempt absolom paul receiued answere god angell act one shippe lose life dangerous voyage sore tempest yet afterwards mariner would haue gone shippe paul said centurion except abide shippe ye cannot safe therefore salomon saith slothfull pro worke sommer shall starue winter dauid though anoynted king saul stead yet much cherefully vse meanes attaine much secured issue promise euen wee except god reueale meaning otherwise helpe without meanes bound doe action spirituall temporall neither haue peace otherwise whither enioy desire doctrine haue great cause learne marke well matter life also concerning saluation must guided sicknes pouerty bodily distresse wee feele cause complaine prayer faith vse helpe physition labour diligently calling vse good meanes haue occasion godlines suffer obtaine come helpe want god hath promised trouble minde wherein haue large promise god vpholding comforting v repaire men brother skilfull wound act also heale god hath promised thereby like meanes send deliuerance slacknes negligence much taken heed greater bane faith waite promise yet another extremity auoided wel neglecting meanes ascribe much tie god thereto vse imagine cannot faile helpe desire one two extremity wicked men continually holden either vse meanes hearing god hath elected saluation saue conclude elected shall saued howsoeuer liue whereas god hath praedestinated meanes well decreed ende vse meanes attribute nothing god glory great wealth wisedome trauaile haue gotten sacrifice net thus much first point second thing haue learne men iudah doct vsed helpe next neighbour simeon might commodiously doe farther instruct v rom loue readines helpe one another neede requireth luk among neighbour vnkinde refusing mutually aiding one another though could liue alone earth sometimes haue neede one another though christ charge little regarded louing one another reason wee ought haue great care dutie besides christ commandement first seeing one time stand need helpe gift one another day thou morrow god hath dealt society men member bodie giuing euery member distinct facultie might agree good whole seeing none could well spared without blemish secondly neighbour set neere habitation end bee neerely knit together affection readier helpe farther benefit though greatest trouble yet time amiable full comfort preserued due daily meeting publike assembly preaching word prayer vse sacrament also priuately may conueniently good communication heb kind greeting salutation auoiding wronging one another discourtesy word deede countenance whereto note subiect readily knowing nourish vphold neighbourhood loue thereby shew willing breake knot hindred selfeloue while euery man regardeth himselfe onely part especially men frowardly churlishly disposed neede oft remember word sauiour saying hereby shall men know ye disciple iohn ye loue one another cannot tell commeth passe one man wolfe lion another yea euen dwell together neerer one towne naballike churlishnes blockish mischieuous behauiour also neerely linked together doe thereby take occasion sooner wearie one another contend also fall small trifle shal want matter sundrie way men carefull preuent wherein yet worse euer iarre one dwell neere doe couer sinne answering agree well enough others farre whereas monstrous deserued bad report among know v seeth easie matter bee peace stranger man hath dealing neither commeth oft company apostle teacheth fetch testimonie christian behauiour good conscience much farre weseldome come especially wee dwell conuerse vsually deale thus saith corinthian amongst liued reioycing cor testimony conscience simplicitie godly purenesse wee haue conuersation world toward draw end point also throughly resolued euery good christian grieue offend meanest liueth either priuat contention iniuring reprochfull note behauiour liue peaceably much lieth rom looke carefully offer friendly good measure may stop mouthes ill disposed haue interest person god shal visit bring christian religion exhort haue hope bring repentance thereby inioy fruit wise kind peaceable liuing loue inward comfort cannot lawfully hold wee comforted haue sought much v lieth thus haue shewed god people keepe neighbourhood loue one another may beware stragers neuer doth good giue watchword vnruly disobedient grosse common contention iarres liue among wishing consider wearisome make liues displeasing therefore studie liue quietly companion euill thinke thus god deare seruants sometime disagree liue vnkindly haue grace though haue much begin auoid mislike vncharitablenesse ill part liues haue grace speedily lest bite one another consumed one another galath deny haue shew neighbourly fellowship among chiefly wickednesse wherein many ioyne easily together concerning friendship inconstant hollow onely friend haue would haue longer briefly way seeing haue said adde word another sort neerest haue heinous sam c sinne great god shew mercie correcting rather seueritie added hee alwaies iustified psalm found righteous howsoeuer men iudge though men dare word denie asked opinion concerning yet god taketh seuerally hand rod vpon themselues rare shall mind confesse note men especially affliction bee long smarty yet lord iust dealing righteous rather crie impatiently handled men would afflictio vpon stead suffer exhorted patience ask wicked king iehoram attend god longer great calamity whereas hauing king mercifull respect v regardeth wee fit beare moderateth chastisement sinne person commit fearefull horrible espie betimes ought haue preuented shunned first entrance god rouse note cost terror abashment especially haue fallen oftentimes haue experience woe hath brought time past could rise vp againe torment hell lay could returne yet would haue man take thus though thought man truly conuerted god alwaies one state libertie serue god holde measure grace time though might possibly yea easily euill note rom heart great part remaineth lusting euill rebellious god though might say easily carried euill psal time wholly abhorreth hath victory ouer doe deny may best pray walke roundly cheerefully calling full vnquietnes much grudge conscience tast hell continue many houres dayes yet heauier burden greater bondage note yet relent vnsetled see themselues thus far liued peace comfort duly considered hath made mee oft maruell men ier know carelesse yet bee quiet think much sinne committed person cannot ignorant haue done put vp cleanely sleepe vpon easily ought adiudged shamefull punishment yet none pitied wonderfull thing spoken one great fauor king euen pitilesse towards might verified true afterward written iudgement shall bee mercilesse iames sheweth mercy hanged vpon gallows set vp godly mordecay say stil euen scripture might fulfilled euery way done might done ester hee purposed doe done alreadie god account wee may bring neerer selues many among v complaine wronged dealing men euill spoken slandred railed vpon say many way abused thinke receiue hard measure men hand hereby maruell complaine none vsed blindnes note couereth eies doe liue know least owne conscience tell haue dealt euen thereby haue giuen cause dealt withall againe oh blind selfeloue cannot see doe see meane thinkes tolerable one selfe yet hee accuseth condemneth another seeth iust iudgement god vpon himselfe men wronging hee himselfe iust de t hath brought vpon owne head hereof thus tell truth sinne hath found haue eares heare v waroe like offender punishment king thumb haue cut c haue done god hath note rewarded men shall come either god fauour amendment displeasure hardning confusion therfore wisedome confesse time wee may bee taught told men conscience crie true haue word deed iniuried haue receiued measure themselues kind particular manner offended yet sure haue done way haue iust cause wel waigh looke god hand therein beare indignity count offered meekenesse contentedly god dealt thus men would neuer acknowledge dislike sinne guiltie suffer lie secret worke mischiefe whereas yet ferreted iudgements god cannot confesse especially bee great feare danger death v warned wee haue part sin common sort wee haue smitten others tongue wronged intended euill way learne wee great regard put speedy end thereto repentance lest god awake preuent v like iudgement againe haue caused end put wee two lesson practise neither heart word deed offer hard vnequall measure man offer rom v possible may without great hurt let v quietly meekely passe make great matter time shall come wherein shall wish wee done haue laid neere heart might easily haue passed v saying god hath rewarded noted heathen vers doct idolater could see farre ascribe god affliction whereby may see bad men doe acknowledge god striker punisher learne though good acknowledge yet many haue baptized doe come curse ban rage fret affliction cry ill fortune call farre resting iustice god say hee hath done righteously also ascribe chance fortune calamity doe runne helpe witch sorcerer oppressed greatly conuicting much see hand god visited heathen haue seene farre ascribe god trouble confesse sinne adonibezek onely checketh haue mentioned laieth hard psalm charge also make shew goodnesse yet doe harden heart vnder affliction know god way though see well enough suffer euill deed neither relent feare iudgements though cannot deny due deierts particularly heathen king shall rise iudgement professor see crueltie vnmercifulnesse vncleannesse nourish themselues oppression also iniuries doe neighbour though bee clearely laid yet pharaoh haue especially god hand heauie vpon acknowledged lord done euen exod wickedest man owne conscience sometimes accuseth hee doth euil ought much haue farre greater light tremble haue grossely offended say thee thee lord haue done euill especially know danger thereby heauie plague hang ouer head although must goe euen tell themselues god one vnlesse acknowledge fault also submit themselues word teacheth howsoeuer shall please correct withall resolue condition liues whatsoeuer indeuour readie obey also teach v receiue indignity men hand yet doct sam looke god set work v dauid said shemei dog doth catch stone leaue smiter though haue wronged v willingly yet wee considered lord lesse mooued offended instrument whereas side beate braines straine selues al pursue seeke reuenged yet lord sufficiently punish wrong haue done example wee quiet word spoken v treason meane doe thinke haue prouoked lord stirre vp ill person v adonibezek see would asscribe israelite saith god thus vnto furthermore heare crueltie thus laid doct owne mouth played tyrant many meaner person king cut thumb hand feete euen seuentie person wee see raging furie vice crueltie depth euil carrieth men wisely consider foulenesse shamefulnesse whereas one man sociable another yea stranger occasion offered seeing euery one neighbour crueltie cutteth fellowship luk nay libertie inioying benefit peace good like cruel man farre worse thiefe yet odious driuen fro habitation men free dwelling house loathsome prison among brutish companion vnlesse cruell also content take share good robbeth cruell man content share might sutable mind haue one time pursueth yea wil thrust house home yea world also satisfied caine little corrupt estate thing entred world gene patterne cruel one cause giuen abel innocent brother hard handling yet accepted god hate without cause vnnatural monstrous rosevp slue pharaoh exod almost tyred poore people god stranger land burden toile asmuch could beare yet satisfied therewith made burthen farre greater til life vnwelcome death itselfe crueltie might manifest haman exceeded herein little take good god people ester hold bondman vnlesse hee might haue liues also speake iezabel woman exceeded men cruell also rehoboams cruell handling subiects storie declareth iosephs brother consented sell far countrey whence might neuer returne trouble hoped agreed take away life also yet killed euen themselues lost liues also famine god sent afterwards preserued ioseph among men might make crueltie odious v many heare desire know manner thing rageth sort like flaming fire deuoureth destroyeth commeth demand godly briefly satisfie may therefore cease maruelling fury crueltie meane bringeth strange effect forth may know vile vitious habit custome whereby men carried thing harsh hard beyond course compasse reason men thus set vpon deale led without reason much without religion chuse bee rigorously handled cruellie delt fall hand maketh cruell man bee hated barbarous vnciuell sucked dragon desert heart bound sinewes iron spoile pursue raging raine tempest rendeth tree destroyeth fruites mooued life man dogge fallen therefore maruell dauid hauing choice plague presented made present exception owne nature kind fearing knowing crueltie men saying let fall hand man heathen seneca saw said thou art deceiued thou giuest credit lookes meet thee haue face men mind wild beast spake man generall would haue said particularly cruell man speech common burne kill cut poison young old men woman brother kindred eate meate whosoeuer doe crosse mistaken word wrie countenance word blow though murther vpon light occasion haue gaine death haue inough take pleasure whither might man goe argument giue instance lower matter kind hereof one neighbour bee trespassed another corne commodity cattell way though bee without fault hath done trespasse readie rage furie seeke reuenge laming hurting cattell hee would doe owner like lamech durst spite railing exacting hand sixe time valew damage detriment sustained though annoy worse manner yet maketh nothing shift cruell part thing little valew vnto neighbour would hee doe thinke wee like minded matter waight stranger much may call dealing crueltie seeing offered one trespasseth another time farre worse manner himselfe like may said cruell landlord master guardian stepmother c measure offend themselues though diuers degree many kind foule vice crueltie yet must know least lowest vnseemely man odious indeed noisome furious bee accompanied enuy therefore salomon saith stand enuy enuious prou obstinate cannot bee reconciled therefore whatsoeuer measure offered certaine shall hard inough seeing prou mercy crueltie remaineth person doe end may possible cast crueltie filthie loathsome garment giue themselues rest til become odious loathsome hard obtaine perswaded looke odiousnesse hath found may fall downe lord feete mercie couer foulenesse forgiue beleeued imbrace gentlenesse mercie kindnesse toward others stead rigor like act iaylor actes though vsedg reat crueltie paul silas yet hee repented wash wound louingly scourging made body set meate house chearefully thrust hungry inward prison cruelly also let teach v pray wee bee giuen ouer hand vnreasonable vnconscionable men absurd cruell malice apostle willeth people pray thes giue thanks wee haue thes either kept pray deuourers mercifully snatcht iawes costly garment fire passe let v weigh vsed crueltie vpon seuentie doct king satisfied ten twentie time continuing cruelty toward many three time twentie would haue done many hundred time hee cut hindred god much mercie prouideth doings shall haue end may learne men haue entred bad course neuer time leaue come especially haue benefit thereby take liking delight therein profit delight growne custome simon magus long time bewitched samaria sorcery euen act c almost whole citie neuer went desist practise till broken preaching phillip demeirius actes siluersmith done like another kind citie ephesian deceiuing people along time owne gaine making siluer shrine temple idol diana true man fall particular sinne twice readier commit twenty time think himselfe note breaking making lie false swearing deceiuing breaking sabbath picking stealing like bad tempering needlesse medling way peter may bee seene neuer went farre intend purpose euill demanded question sudden hee looked whither christ disciple denied truth feare mark conscience hauing done asked second time againe third time prouoked denied oath cursing himselfe knew man iehosophat could warned forbeare fellowship ahab sonne iehoram hauing suffered himselfe take pleasure therein though sharpe warning smarted also sampson loue philistine woman suffering vnlawfully moue question tended loosing life grace god precious cut neither staied first answered haue done though ment tell secret asked yet answered trifled long needlesse dangerous talke last importunitie got sought hee neuer ment shee obtaine till hee found late yeeld giue place euill though twice breaking water cutting banck holdeth simile ouerflowing much ground spoileth making breach conscience yeelding giuing place euill note little layeth open man much bondage anoyance thereby goeth runneth pace top high steepe downe hill able stay till come bottome truth verified many thing salomon hath liuely exemplified prou one saying harlot deepe graue narrow pit falleth hardly get escape therefore come make vse hath said wee know counsell rule physition giueth preseruing health namely wee resist beginning danger shall free euill would follow meete bee followed desire inioy spirituall health soules may feare well take great heed first inticed deceitfulnesse sinne resist strongly delight kindled dally tempted lest bee also hardned doe shall purging corruption finde fruit holy counsell promise gospell watch pray shall yee fall matth temptation oh could haue done ioseph haue gen note inticed could haue shaken leaudnesse euil heart ease freedome might haue walked haue giuing place lust kurbing vp due time brought themselues loathsome state life may see arise many thing condition dealing make part men liues hardlier passed peace quietnes good liking though haue part good successe vsually labour ease haue said doe set downe matter hand may see wisdome mercy god herein mixeth together life smoothly carried easily passed made thereby vnfit change especially great trial come likewise part tedious troublesome nothing manner wearinesse discomfort therefore sort seeke god fauour may also bee vnder gouernment estate may daily keepe aboue thing estate life onely hath promise blessing euery calling condition wanting confusion part breaketh amongst men vnquiet trouble doe vncomfortably go vnder difficulty also enioy freedome prosperitie euen best estate vnprofitable offensiue troublesome seeme strange god thus disposeth men frequenting longing lord house place honour dwelleth hee bare reproch mighty hee willingly zeale toward god brought arke god shouting sound trumpet citie dauid dancing michael saul daughter looked rom rather perish people god forsaken god glory empeached meane well euen king queenes lay downe crownes foot aduance hath honoured aboue others much wee meane inferiours think selues happie may bee imployed thing haue might doe seruice according written mark loueth father mother marke worthie true indeed wee loue nothing well forgoe lord cause therefore saith giue thine heart sonne reioyce aske prou take thing haue yeeld readinesse ought see may iustly complaine say wee like child hauing gotten father hand cast flourish boldly haue gotten speake thinke see mine owne eies god hath inriched men manifold blessing one many considereth hath receiued inioyeth glorieth cor owne setteth himselfe anothers good though hee owed nothing receiued yet aggrauate sin must need adde one thing perswaded greatly shame conuiction many papacie shal neuer haue reward brought error many thing giue much superstitious zeale end may bee saued doe god neuer required hand therfore amisse ought haue learned better readily commanded especially reward certaine doe merit shall neuer attaine ought much doe duty commanded belieue haue best thing freely promised meane eternall life also due time shall bee giuen v god meere mercie bountie caleb would giue daughter wee much giue part substance feede hungry helpe cloath naked may yet reserue sufficient selues besides whereas truth little wee doe good v wee might honour god caleb could affoord best thing yet v thought much little doe way lest wee hinder selues end verse caleb godly man well renowned doct approoued grace greatnesse saving hee would giue daughter wife sheweth hee well learned moses deut doctrine whose day liued namely point many child dispose owne marriage father though many haue lost honour way vnfitter make choice child themselues yet god hath giuen libertie good may conuicted place yeeres fitter make match good sort child part caried much religion good aduisednesse rash beate make owne choice therefore ofttimes iustly requited god ought chiefly obeyed action make sinne better appeare match soone repented many time inioyed moses therfore god mouth people commanded teach parent authoritie prouiding marriage child thus saith thou shalt giue thy daughter sonne canaanite take daughter thy sonne therefore reade sampson gaue honour father mother granting consent marriage many like thus saith saw iudges woman pleaseth well therefore giue wife paul comming long moses agreed faithfull seruants master teacheth dutie belongeth father saying cor giueth daughter marriage doth well signifying giue although speake though might force child marriage list giue consent aduice must bee speciall iust cause shewed expedient may cleare doth bewray boldnesse wilfulnes disobedience many child would thought wise enough know duty yet doe meanely grieue parent also prouide ill themselues making match pleasure beside bring one little better canaanite ofttimes least waspe hagge otherwise badly qualified amongst good kindred themselues seldome agree especially one partie draw thing neerer god hereof commeth passe say onely doubtlesse great part many disordered offensiue match marriage person wearisome one must either parted part themselues cannot yet doe little better dwelling one house yet may many time meete parted bed board must haue another house set together whereby may bee easily gathered manner christian sociable life enioy together fruite reape iustling side commandement god comming together purpose shew annoiances vnlawfull marriage doe poynt fall yea come oft ordinarily god ordinance commandement reiected child make owne marriage without parent seeing occasion may taken mouing question two vers stand little vpon two verse satisfying doubt raised make vse thereof afterward therefore obiected whither obiection caleb aduisedly whither commended offering daughter winne debit knew whether might lawfully keepe promise partie one might haue also obiected winne thought neare kinde othniel name said younger brother might lawfully take wife thing therefore require answere first wee chiefely looke answere namely commendation caleb would offer largely destroying god enemy according god commandement holy ghost intended declare make question whether rightly lawfully charitie suspitious cor iosh rarely commended pietie obedience god becommeth v iudge cannot accuse neither thing gathered text true offered daughter vpon condition mentioned set downe manner respect commended neither charged haue done rashly hath man therefore doe challenge proue haue done rashly shall neuer able doe seeing holy ghost commendeth denied sinne vrge take libertie thereby dealing vse answer rashly without due consideration waightie case case marriage particularly affirming doe caleb aduenture either owne making childrens marriage person whose conuersation doe know let seeke better defence doings example caleb besides must liue rule example neither draw liberty practise whatsoeuer may bee said haue done good man concerning matter skilleth haue commandement marry lord seek defend cor match haue slightly bin made wherein god hath either small hand hath sufficiently branded set marke vpon haue gone finished allowance direction alowed though mariage otherwise bee honourable therefore beautified sweete sociablenesse commodity hath annexed marriage approueth speake large matter shall haue direct occasion offered haue said rash marriage may say take vnaduised inconsiderate action attempt whatsoeuer men haue authoritie taking hand calebs example neither haue scripture place euen thereafter shall gainesayings need goe worke manner next obiection gaue daughter rash offer answere one owne flesh could marrie law god brother therfore vncle say younger brother hee gaue meane othniel kinseman least euery way among brother child father yeeres authority wealth yee obiect text calleth brother answer christ kinsman called brother yet diuines almost grant marie mother sauiour child christ therfore expound place mat kinsman kinswoman matth hebrew word vsed nonlatin alphabet properly signifieth naturall brother put vsually kinseman also posteritie brother scripture cleare plentifull shewing reade example leuit leuit word brother signifieth child brother ouer brother numb child israel ye shall rule one ouer another crueltie numb shall brother child israel goe warre ye tarrie place brother scripture meaneth posteritie child sonnes iacob many scripture doe returne othniel achsah within degree forbidden might haue married commandement god doubteth hee would haue better aduised hee meant offering doe thing offend god say therefore either othniel winning citie could lawfully haue married caleb would haue supplied offer way contentment partie vpon answer question say much like vpon answer former question matter requireth giueth occasion let none gather speech caleb lawfull marrie within degree forbidden though caleb made marriage daughter although called kinsman yet seeing said brother sister sonne therefore haue necessarie occasion offered answere question whether cosin german may marrie together yet seeing haue thus spoken therefore signifie iudgement agreeing haue read conferred although word god doe expressely forbid yet seeing prohibiteth degree great probabilitie christishould common manner consider examine weightie speciall cause doe imbrace abstaine marriage thinkes hath giuen watchword thereof vnto v life many couple marrying together hath found tedious accompanied mutual dislike betwixt party reason could seene thereof beside proofe hereof hath acknowledged haue cause thereof part question hath propounded mee marriage haue know practise many better haue haue say disswaded inconueniences vnlawfull leaue point returne caleb although maried daughter within degree forbidden yet giuen libertie v doe neither doe thing else vnlawfull forbidden word god forasmuch haue direction may either matter marriage thing else whatsoeuer therefore wee ought little regard example leade way thus obiections answered proceed th story first said othniel valiant man took citie vers doct debir notwithstanding difficulty win great wee see besides verifieth prouerb heere spoken man gift preferreth like may said ioseph daniel others men seeke gift god may attaine honour giuer preferreth thereby say besides may learne othniel religious prayer faithfully cron made god reade chronacles god heard yet tooke incouragement offer caleb set vpon great worke may say learne euen godly men may take vse benefit incouragements lawfully offered going worke god commandeth true indeed euen bare word alone ought put life v quicken v duty much promise blessing annexed obeying euery commandement yea great promise reward yet psalm seeing weake flesh striueth spirit v gal therefore haue need helpes furtherance may whet v therefore though dutie othniel set enemy god rest israelite bound doe yet doubt much earnestly set incouragement dutie euery faithfull minister god preach gospel diligently willingly euen commandement christ thou louest mee feede iohn lambes sheepe yet lord blesse labour plentifully people minister readily hee bee sufficiently prouided man doubteth hee shall doe dutie much better seeing thereby hee good reason hee bee highly well regarded christian man laboureth hand calling god hath set ought bee occupied therein willingly conscience sake god blesse good successe shall goe duty farre chearefully better sort thing find thus gospell soundly diligently preached ought ready heare magistrate themselues bee forward way cause others authoritie doe see gospel good account shall thinke quicken euen best much otherwise meaner incouragemets preuaile men lord commandement yet shall better doe also added helpe weakenes looke principally chiefe neglected thing meerely preposterous next way pul downe al right maner going duty shewes thereof soeuer men wil make commonly euer greatest part offend way yet god seeing infirmitie people vnto wardnesse godly duty hardly brought well discharging bare commandement hath drawne fit reward promise incouragements doubteth deare seruants god much heartned helped forward thereby yet god charge haue said ought preuaile though hypocrite timeseruers doe make greatest account little setting meane till god open eies repent till bee hardned one thousand calling condition would labour trauell euen necessarie helpes life vertue bare commandement thou shalt labour gaine profit came thereby proceed othniel meanest father house yet caleb doct keeping promise giuing daughter commendeth faithfulnes winde dishonestly making good word men vse doe euen hee set forth praised many respect praised men praise man selfe matter small reiovcing lord praiseth blessed iob seeing cor god himselfe spake thus satan hast thou considered servant iob feareth god departeth euill commended zacharie iob luke elizabeth cornelius come particularly actes commended meane faithfulnesse keeping promise great matter would othniels hand many thinke shall found wil doe winde standing word dishonestly subtill distinction wrangling wrestings matter setting downe meaning promised especially bee owne benefit aduantages oh lamentable euery behold innocent part poorer sort goe commonly hardest yet let v know meane god take part wronged oppressed therefore let v beware world come hold men word wrighting neither meanes may shifted denied caused salomon cry saying euery man prou boast owne goodnesse shall wee find faithfull man vertue god requireth hee put seruice meane faithfulnesse paul sheweth himselfe counted faithfull tim put seruice wee earthly dealing good part soeuer find seruants yet glad forgoe cannot haue faithfull trustie v vnfaithfulnesse contrarv vnbeliefe began sorrow misery tribe followed end chapter common translation could driue hebrew better translation addeth another word namely went neither originall seemeth bee sense otherwise vnperfit going god vnbeliefe god likewise went god beleeuing ouercame dwelt mountaines beleeuing god promised ioshua seeing iron chariot therfore ouercome vallyes therefore howsoeuer take fault men iuda though may obiected god would giue victory ouer one well ouer answere true fault beleeue word promised doctrine taught hence though doct god bestow many good blessing vpon v beleeue hauing promised euen iuda long hee shewes himselfe v yet wee giue withdraw selues vnbeliefe belieued promise faile v blessing deny v worthy truth much regarded v v men iuda saith sauiour man brought son healed dumbe spirit thou canst beleeue marke thing possible belieueth meaning thereby thing agreeable god shall granted beleeueth faith seeketh nothing contrary reueiled word saith saint iames man want wisdome let aske thing therfore valiantly meane expelling canaanite dwelt hill country lord accordingly yet another thing beleeue namely god would expel enemy dwelt valleyes iron chariot therefore went neither obtaine thing god whereby see may possibly beleeue one promise yet another doct great maruell wee may beleeue case easie thing promised lesse difficultie obtaine note otherwise euen may beleeue one time yet another reason seeing wee fickle inconstant therefore wee fleet change time wee also timerous meanes whereof commeth passe although may brought belieue thing lesse moment former time haue belieued yet time another thing haue experience striketh v greater feare faint giue ouer vse accustome aquaint bend selues note haue giuen credit thing god may find otherwise take knowledge weakenesse thinke strength beleeuing great therefore thus seeing want therein please selues rest haue done looke yet done v saint iames speaketh patience haue perfit worke faith iames must haue perfit worke also thus till time dauid beniamin built againe iuda burnt seeing precise commandement god expell doct vers iebusites thence sinne least may charged slouth negligence seeking owne ease doe thing forbiden dangerous see euil sloathfulnesse ease seeking bringeth wit itselfe holdeth man obeying god though nothing else doe ease pleasure taken therein men dull edge courage forewardnesse good duty one slouthfull whose word lion way meaning thereby hee cannot labour prou euen man sweet slumber vnwilling awaked slouth sweet poyson keepe doth slea salomon saith common sluggard doth loath shun prou last labour therefore loueth bee trifling thing rather worke well occupied doth hee slow duty god seruice let passe omits opportunity ought much regarded word spoken season much worth euen like apple gold picture siluer euen act deed done due prou time namely among wise godly courage ester shewed due season going king preseruing sauing owne life people traine hamon laid season oh euen forewardnes readinesse goe worke businesse god inioyneth v euery condition life extremity side fall worke looke nothing else whereas first sanctified god themselues first workes may accepted others would seeme taken godly carelesse slacke following work calling nay condemne prouident diligent worldly miserable muckwormes extreames bee auoided christian ioyning calling together meane religion labour sloath say little wee take great heed best god seruants may soone drawne way sooner begin waxe wearie well generall particular calling peter suffer selues plucked stedfastnesse therein error wicked caught snared deceitfulnes sin rocked sleepe ere aware case shall easie heb matter awake bring selues backe againe former good course shall liue vnprofitable fit onely consume wast good benefit god oh death sloathfull person vrged duty hath cast hath pleasure ability vnto minister preach old age looked youth estate hath brought eue ruinous house falleth downe altogether let go decay want repairing time remedying mischiefe al annoyed see better direction sauior hath giuen v word saith occupie till come whereby meaneth luk worke calling also euery one prosper vse talent euen gift god hath bestowed vpon knowledge wealth time grace like good bury vnprofitably earth beside fruit idlenesse pouertie theft beggery c god also loueth blesseth painefull diligent thus carefull god direction bee well occupied wee shall bee free euils danger sloath like counsell sauiour giueth saint paul ephesian redeeme time buy hand ephes idlenesse vnprofitablenesse euill employ faithfully necessarie v end rather much pretious time already spent vaine let remaineth better passed recouer losse life christian least stand idlenes without respect particular calling husbandry marchandize trading full diligent heed taking conscience may kept pure good much al may see labour adioyned therefore punishment sloath small wise man teacheth idle man backe shall clothed ragges belly pinched starued want food wee may guesse prou soules diet shall followeth vers also house ioseph went vp bethel lord vers house ioseph caused view bethel name citie time luz vers spy saw man come citie said vnto shew v pray thee way citie shew thee mercy vers shewed way citie smote citie edge sword let man house depart vers man went land hittite built citie called name luz name thereof vnto day mentioning tribe iuda beniamin sense verse order set downe tribe wit suffered expell canaanite neither yet house ioseph exempted comprehends tribe ephraim manasse together first therefore declared two ioyntly together vers word text set downe seuerally verse said ioyntly together commendation went bethel fell lot lord incourage strengthen feared tried way might easily take name citie time past called luz reade genesis iacob gene went padan aram wrath brother esau resting lord appearing comforting called place bethel house mightie god goe forward sent businesse namely tribe ioseph seeing man come citie asked part might set vpon side going comming thereby appeareth shut vp feare israel left secret way necessarie vse goe thereby promising man largely hee shewed way entred slue inhabitant tooke sent man away wel rewarded rather indeed banished himselfe another countrey wealthy hee able build another city called name luz worke house ioseph went namely take citie bethel deuision land canaan ioshua giuen god inioyned doth liuely set eies doct vers glasse dutie god people say readily goe set vpon worke god hath appointed laid vpon yea done whatsoeuer let discouragement may stand vp way hinder hath commanded able remooue impediment rather shal hinder worke hand seruants beleeuing go forward commit successe hath promised bring difficulty might hold backe otherwise wee looke note god faith let way hindred thereby shall cast commandement god behind backe eccles obserue wind therfore sowe looke much cloud therefore reape feare inconueniences shal let passe necessarie duty againe thriue haue good successe blesse god merry crossed curse disguise selues impatience whereas ought enough v god hath brought passe either thus otherwise beside authoritie hee hath ouer v bountifull rewarding v seruice ought incourage v adresse selues worke onely seeing commandeth would haue v doe may owne ease deut willingly readily chearefully lord loueth seruice loueth chearefull giuer know owne part cor men go awkly vntowardly work take hand vnwillingly learne sauiour hath giuen v example iohn herein saying meate drinke father besides made redeemed set end serue lord luke holinesse righteousnes without feare day life please selues hard soeuer worke done v life ioy comfort course walking life death sauory soundly ioyfull bee thus calling condition magistrate minister husbandman artificer master family others doe denie many thing required god one worke another neither ioyfully doe worke god hath set doe readily belly carnall respect indeed otherwise first know themselues bee lord redeemed one may easily obtaine thing hand would euen goe doe god commandement chearefully delight lord sake many excrement cut infinite action done liues much sinne remooued many plague annoiances bee auoided men liues also ala professor acquainted going worke god seruice manner neither find sauour christian course respect onely owne commoditie may bee without feare want penury doe worse spend precious time regarded wee see experience commodity mixed discommodities thing indifferent one goeth without true comfort life particularly marriage well going liuing first many auoid trouble married estate smaller put many inconueniences liue vnquietnesse discontentment vnsetlednesse single estate fall fornication say prooue farre greater many againe resolues marrying make themselues great thereby shunne meane low estate pouertie thinke doe shall void trouble yet looke weary themselues many sore dangerouser trouble though mariage lawful yet attempting good againe rule among married couple one partie yeeld content let like sinnes quiet v without great pursuit offering great violence till haue recouered strength v againe preuailed begun vnseemely manner master v bring forth noisome fruit euen like themselues canaanite grow strong mighty israel held downe god required suffered liue let alone proceed noisome weed plucked vp good seed bring forth fruit may easily see followeth seeing roofe must need totter groundsel bee pluckt away therefore slothfully suffer ourselues grow point seeth offend god sore grieuously prouoke displeasure disobedience tribe making league canaanite expelling began still haue done transgression alike one commandements ought haue rooted person land sinnes heart liues thus haue shewed like canaanite suffering sinnes ourselues haue rooted rather let v also see particular manner like dealing toward others euen failed suffering canaanite remaine amongst expell doe wee suffer little better canaanite behauiour manner abide therein till simile corrupt taint dwell among infection dispersed round poyson men body people israel set themselues seeke owne quietnesse ease though broke commandement god letting canaanite liue still abide land point thing come day drunkennesse gaming ill company like little pursuing person disguise themselues therewith either church commonwealth greater fault tribe let canaanite remaine expell strong enough haue done stronger much haue executed god charge said verse israel waxed strong yet expell wholly onely put tribute aggrauateth sinne time forasmuch note god hath giuen authority men hand remoue disorder greater gift knowledge ability ouermatch euils would haue bee rooted yet wanteth zeale courage goe though thing shall neuer bee brought perfection wished yet much might done vtterly neglected said noted verse generall tribe mentioned therein particularly somewhat bee said manasse ephraim alike behaue themselues seuered vers ioyned together went one roundly worke prospered diuided doct vers compared former vers backward slothfull let canaanite grow multiply obserue heere looke heedfully make much godly society labour enioy therefore take good may wee haue much encouragement thereby whatsoeuer good wee goe wherein may bee vsed wise man saith two better one one lie alone warme eccles many good person ioyned together good worke like firebrand chimney giue glowing heate laid together one alone soone goeth one refreshed helped hartened simile comforted according kind worke take hand one alone much weakened made heauie soone discouraged moses hand failed amalek till aaron hur propped vp moses aanon first second chapter booke ivdges vers neither zebulon expell c vers vers ammorites draue child dan mountaine suffered come downe valley vers ammorites dwelt still mount here aijlon shaalbim hand iosephs family preuailed became tributary vers coast amorites maalehakeabim euen selah vpward followeth verse holy vers story setteth downe particularly tribe zebulon ashur naphtali euen tribe mentioned beniamin manasse ephraim let canaanite liue still among put tribute wherein see agreement sinne betwixt worthy noting may bee singular vse vnto v consented together one doe whereas could yet heare one others say euen mentioned ease quiet make league canaanite contrary god commanded sheweth v lesse maruell see age hath doct age age agreement finne among estate yea sinne mutually resolue ioyne therein paul tim speaking grosse sinnes raigne world latter age christ tels v time people seuerall age tainted therewith day lot shall bee age following eate drinke marrie made paradise haue done liued former time doe doe still sought matth felicity heart desire heere transitorie thing gathering wealth hunting vaine pleasure seeking promotion euen doe many day professe gospell yet estate ciuiler sort greater abomination way truth haue knowne feare god hath eye done one place another yee aske sinne heere spoken alike spread throughout tribe answere neuer day therefore meaner sort receiued word fruit turned saith ppophet ieremy mighty learned priest c declaring hee looked finde otherwise ier behold alike said sauiour day noah shall bee comming sonne man saith latter age whereof liue part eat drink marrie giue marriage thing minde set heart knew nothing danger till flood came tooke away doe men haue done remembrance former day euen thing pleasure haue men saue eating drinking following delight tribe ease pleasure commit sinne euery one owne way doe men euery one doth best serue owne turne effectuall sauing knowledge god found saue heere therein person generally gospell mysterie note pearle hidden one another though bee hidden none shall perish excessiue vnsatiable seeking cor world good age bold prophaning lord sabbath yet hath plainely charged v contrary saying remember yee keepe holy set downe agreement betwixt men liues practise whether compare day former day one man another yet one would thinke example former time teach latter wisedome seeing liue may behold haue taken away oft time middest delight could keepe themselues death others therefore ought worthily cause looke prepare better enduring inheritance must goe hence grow end seeing world like itselfe sinnes haue entertainment alike part one another shew cause teach vse end besides diuels malice ruleth alike heart child darknes draweth euils place besides say men corrupted hart imagination desire gal gen loue euill loath good wherby commeth passe sin one embraceth delighteth also hauing ability resist turne drinketh vp fish doth water nothing able make otherwise one grace regeneration new birth changeth man giues new hart whereby disliketh former inclination disposition led caried amisse hereby deceitfulnesse sinfull heart found groweth loue liking desire came consequently uill word action proceeded mindeth doth contrary thing thus hee wee see turned course life different men world light change grace entreth many resisted rather deadly manner euen sound preaching offered vnto note therefore abide estate wherein subiect grace guide neither indeed thus commeth passe new borne agree euill heart alike disposed vnto carried whereas perhaps obiected good nature many others good education doe put difference betwixt men well sanctification changing nature man knowne vnto best nature poysoned enclined note sinne hath seede thereof best education seasoned religion worke ciuility man restraine outward open wickednesse cannot giue new heart neither therefore make new creature conclude vse doctrine desire better guided naturall men must seriously labour acquainted heart searching law god depth falshood euill great much taught bewaile ier bringeth forth fruit vnto death till obtaine pardon thereof sinnes grace receiue strength though weakely liue well please god yea obtaining let attend sincere preaching fit ordinarily constantly may god draw puddle lie still worke grace whereby shall reformed image christ head similitude member body vniformely gouerned spirit worketh alike fruit onely way come gal iam another thing noted tribe beside haue said already seeing could chuse heare one another doct one led example though one easily agree another euill haue said yet cannot tell commeth passe wee haue example also others bad course much easily riueted thereby nay example much preuaileth although wee haue god commandement neuer plaine contrary threates annexed thereto wee boldly breake onely affect commit former doctrine said wee doe wee beare downe v streame could easily haue thought people israel one tribe another could many haue sought owne ease making peace nation hauing receiued straite commandement expell yet handle matter among vtterly forgotten among grew bee confirmed contrary course one tribe broke ice another breaking commandement became matter lay dead looked would hardly haue thought saphira could haue brought consent holding backe summe money consecrated good holy vse making lye standing stifly knew husband mind goe therein made best lord prayer petic well taught wee directed aske daily bread euen successe estate poore rich heauenly father seeth best v euen daily bread must contented yet added hee hath meate drinke apparell bee counted poore indeed wealthiest hath neither better satisfied hath one gratious superfluity hath counted glory commonly doe see become bane man worse wealth strong hold maketh pro bolder sinne way benefit laying obiect hee would neuer breake couenant heere lord may seeme giue great aduantage hee binde himselfe thus oft time charged heere haue done breake couenant toward may seeme hee tied shall neuer breake couenant seeing hath promised vnto whatsoeuer doe howsoeuer breake behaue themselues toward absurd answering therefore vnderstanding word answ verse two thing considered one couenant hee speaketh saith granted vnto would neuer breake whether hee spake simply vpon condition namely obey two answered make matter cleare first wee know couenant heere mentioned hee neither meaneth particular couenant hee entreth faithfull god sufficient euer hee neuer gen goe loueth loued ere loued end loueth neither doth meane generall couenant sending ioh christ redeeme world vnbeleefe man could make rom promise god frustrate none effect meaneth couenant enioying land peaceably hee brought commodity therein couenant made conditionally obedient thing said one two serueth better vnderstanding speech saith messenger hee made couenant hee would neuer breake endeauour walke hee would continue good land hee giuen blesse therein otherwise would bee free promise hee would cast long bearing disobedience punish sundry way meane season euen seeing kept couenant deut required bound next verse seene clearing forementioned doubt point thus determined doth minister heauenly instruction doct ver v faithfully good hart set selues obey lord yet meane otherwise may v performed would doe great thing v euen world would feede v good thing euen bread wheat finest hee saith psalme earthly blessing answerable would suffer psal proud domineere ouer inheritance soone bring yet wee must know owne people shall sinne correct rod often withdraw sweet fruit fauour light countenance wont refresh psal comfort soules euen priuiledges issue couenant may great part great lie drowned seeke ioy peace confidence prayer like temporary benefit vtterly lost oh therefore notwithstanding many see doct vers large great worthie promise made v yet wee doe labour faithfull couenant take liberty amisse euery one way thinkes good behold sinnes depriue v many blessing might haue enioyed hold many good thing v ieremie ier saith bring many euils vpon v euen prophet esay witnesseth though lord hand shortened cannot saue neither eare leuit heauie cannot heare yet iniquity saith haue separated betwixt god sinnes haue hid face hee heare esa thing rightly weighed may truly said note suffer lord doe v good fill v blessing hee ready doe euen selues wee cease prouoke liuely laid prophet amos saith rained amos vpon one peece ground vpon another wherefore sinne possesse contrary blind reason looke sampson alway goe well v howsoeuer deale god defraud due breaking couenant iudg sauiour agreeth well saith meeke matth shall inherite earth haue shall bee sweeter great rich vngodly shall multiply also god seeth good might make one maruell see counted god people many time run greedily world vaine allurement wise go backe grace fast though god caring nothing like owne though forgotten promiseth sufficient wealth godly life godlinesse tim hauing promise thing earthly heauenly yet catch fastest imago shall speed best may see seeke guided god haue best successe blessing others going without whereas obiect richest part sauour goodnesse ought trouble man full soone shall rich thou prosper thy way text heere spoiled good make v carefull preuent euen vers iudgement among many vpright walking god harmelesse liuing among men foolish precise soeuer course life seeme many wee sinne lest worse thing befall v let v count hard fortune foolish men tearme none wee wasted good neither please wee selues condemning charging second cause thereof whereby whatsoeuer instrument losse hath lord deut wrath waxed hot people bring vpon euery curse written booke doctrine haue taught spoiling men good fruit wrath god sin excepted lord may impouerish people feare fauour mercy may fitly pursued cross good reproch name body paine disease doth men may know shall pay deare stolne pleasure sweet soeuer bee fond account together may hold backe prouoking esay saith one iudgement shall serue turne esa last ver ioel men struggle fight stand god hee smiteth gently hand bee stretcht still looke former hath done latter shall make good wee reade ioel fruit one plague consumed another till vtter riddance follow men bite vpon bridle curse lucke look themselues god strippeth men good casteth bondage hee deale heere hee doth like v one iudgement come necke another v thinke may bee said truly without respect damnation wee haue paid deare stolne pleasure bold taking liberty amisse seeing haue spoken particularly going seruitude nation hath knowne meaneth sharpe scourge yet seeing many fall turke spanyard haue little feared therefore wish reade deuteronomie secondly consider estate people israel egypt lastly lay set deut view eye popish cruell tyrannizing ouer soules heere owne else hee iustly suffereth letteth alone without bridling restraining vomit vp venome note cankered hatred letteth loose satan whereby among many thing may bee learned vncertaine comfort take papist hope shall neuer preuaile protestant popery euer yoke yes god displeased may plague way raising vp enemy easily hee heere canaanite israel without feare way hee may meet sundry sort little comfort may see daily sinnes remoued sight prophet speaketh shall though escape lion beare amos meet went house leaned hand wall serpent bite wee haue heard punishment people appeares doct load enough vpon one would thinke yet though bin enough said hand god holy ghost addeth heere whithersoeuer went forth hand lord bee said whatsoeuer tooke hand went prospered crossed therein whereas godly reade first psalme contrary said set psal like spoken prophet azaria people iuda secod booke chronicle though seene many marked chron disobedient therefore complained yet misery therefore greater seeing goe brutishly foole stock oxe slaughter till dart pierce liuer feele perceiue pro god angry hand experience witnesseth though deale much apparantly enemy bodily spirituall plague doe many loden sorrow misery crieout god fighteth though outward punishment bee seene vpon neither prosper enioy inward peace wearisome themselues cursing lot wishing themselues world nay laying violent hand vpon themselues anguish heart madnesse thinking falsely escape misery heauie thing thinke wee especially know remedy thus euen god hand euer faithfull seruants way god hath set like tree planted riuers psal psal water bringeth forth fruit due season whatsoeuer shall prosper indeed lesse seene finde hard thing middest many discouragement continue vprightnesse may see marke oft vnsetled broken burthen flesh innocency else forced much adoe recouer themselues fallen great heauinesse thereby god vpholdeth grace hee doth also make well liking prosper yea weakest estate respect recouer whereas added pursuing lord doct set hand vnto sworne teach v could otherwise seeing god speaketh nothing vaine much lesse sweare according samuel word strength israel sam lie one iot tittle word cannot faile farre firme mat law medes perfians yet altered lord speake word sweare except conditionally whether threatening prouoke promise good thing trust shall certainiy come passe attempt soeuer contrary daily seene therefore wondred men little moued thereby threat go forward bad course till euill threatened doe come vpon cause crie euen god seruants also doe smart promise certaine beleeued matter oft occasioned bee said people sinne punishment followeth text vers notwithstanding lord raised vp iudges deliuered hand oppressor yet would obey iudges went whering god worshipped turned quickly way wherein father walked obeying commandements lord lord raised vp iudges lord iudges deliuered hand enemy day iudge lord compassion gronings oppressed tormented follow thing mentioned sixth sense verse laying point second part chapter lord raised vp deliuerers oppression cried vnto called iudges cannot bee vnderstood one time seeing sent many iudges among time affliction therefore hee sheweth heere end chapter condition people israel change diuerse course time iudges word thus cried lord oppression pitied grones raised vp iudges deliuerers said blesse yet turned away againe prouoked go afresh set downe latter end chapter verse follow first said eighteenth verse three verse vers bee ioyned read together groned lord vnder oppression saw nothing amiffe themselues must teach v doct calamity search stirre v vp griefe make mone note god anguish heart carelesse iollie soeuer wee haue wee boldly prouoked wee haue carelesse headstrong nothing could serue plucke downe stomackes yet sore trouble haue broken heart neuer otherwise therefore word preuaile lord faine euen maister men strong hand least hee may tame violence cannot bow repentance euen men handle horse beast cannot rule cast keepe vnder binding may worke pleasure wilde asse must taken moneths cannot resist course iob lordis driuen take v wit make heart smart loade sorrowes else would bee rule v thus say faine take v downe according said psal smote sought yea sought early pharaoh himselfe psal felt smart plague egypt sought moses pray lord long men fitted framed heare lord speake vnto bitten sorrow glad see ho compared cap cling ala commeth correction sharp dealing nay say doe bow time bulrush winde goodnesse morning dew goeth away cry onely rod held ouer afterward returne againe old byas heere doe many seeke lord time yet turne aside againe broken bow thus cast downe god afflicteth one would think would neuer lift vp bristle say doe yet waxe bold kicke vp heele shall thinke relent euill doings god heauie hand vpon harden hart dog biteth staffe beateth yee aske bee done groning vnder men burthen sinne punishment haue good effect remedy heere men case finding sin doe also seriously consider foulenesse woe bring tread also vnder foot beleeue better thing bee comming god toward euen mercy forgiuenesse onely able crush sinnes peeces afterwards well make kindly truly acknowledged cried smart taketh hold noted groning behold lord thus complaine cry vers compassion raised vp iudges deliuer hand oppressor spoiler repented suffered oppressed doth oft ahab pitty sinner smarting fault cry doth receiue mercy except truly forsake say instruction wee may know lord easily entreated v waiting indeed repentance giue signes disliking sinnes time note stayeth heauie hand pursuing v would hee doe thinke came home heart must know side hee dealing v heapeth hot cole vpon note head add maketh v vnexcuseable wee hauing faire encouragement hand shall yet keepe loofe shew vnfaithfulnes haue made couenants amendment heere commeth misery verse bee seene vers heere set downe yet pitying shewing great kindnesse toward yet iudges called idolatry heard regarded considered benefit enioy although cried anguish heart helpe trouble common thing deliuerances thus vnthankfully deale lord obeying iudges charged heere haue done chapter following seene briefly let v learne men rarely better deliuerances trouble bee angry man doubtlesse one could bee perswaded affected onely whole life bee daily deadly vnquietnesse also ouerwhelmed thought driuen desperation yet may know hath said god hath iust cause doe sight men whereas ought euer haue v god bounty kindnesse wise may barres way keepe v euen smal offence groser sinnes may much bee kept v dauid affirmeth bold sinne god secret neuer broke shamefully men know diuell called psal serpent word signifieth properly creeper property gen little little creepe winde v withdraw heart note vprightnesse constancy therein also cause god benefit shall meanely accounted v boldnesse sinne creepe vpon v easily wee shall feare attempting great grieuous sinnes also wisedome therefore consider god goodnesse bee great continued v daily shall meanely obserue weigh
