minde beare toward v say wee ought professe fifth petition remit satisfaction haue taken away good may remitting doe repentance ability partie shall giue occasion say punishment hath deserued haue hurt v body name otherwise yet bee expedient wee sustaine great detriment note thereby may remit yet case though forgiue wrong yet wee may vrge partie culpable satisfaction punishment according law god nation wee liue left men emboldened sinne thereby yea sometime wee wronged ought doe necessarily otherwise sin god commonwealth thus achan iosua theefe iosh crosse iustly punished put death god law man else broken haue said matter luk difficulty may see wee bound remit vnto neighbour farre thing verse ehud giuen doct deliuerer said haue bin lame part body euen right hand member might worst missed especially valiant captaine man war called shew strength skil wherin say lesse god doth strange maruellous eye sheweth v hereby pleaseth commonly vseth weake meanes effect bring great matter passe glory may easily seene giuen vnto yet flesh carnall reason yeeld easily thereunto proofe doctrine looke base weake instrument lord vsed vexe mighty king meane pharaoh namely frog louse locust ioel day father left palmer worme hath grashopper eaten residue grashopper hath canker worme eaten residue canker worme hath caterpiller eaten see mighty hand god matter farre exceede god doth often therfore despise weake god worketh neither let discourage themselues grace humility meeknesse loue like small gift shall edifie build vp church christ knowledge bare letter thereby puffed vp shall doe little good ministery cor shall seene people true godlinesse accompanying knowledge christ though ridiculous among men shall much perswading drawing many loue gospell fellowship therein greatest doubtlesse rarest thing seene among people example woman samaria seene brought neighbour christ conuerted selfe yea may bee seene still day euen priuate person truly religious shall humility diligence loue doe much good haue variety knowledge vtterance destitute grace though bee little accounted vse haue said point haue work god meanely soeuer accounted specially worke grace men wee haue say high reuerence comparison gloriousest act men foure point story verse namely reuolting people god lord punishing cry god sending deliuerer thus much matter foure thing second story thus ended remaineth last point namely deliuerer god raised vp people meane ehud set downe illustrate amplifie deliuerance people shall appeare euen god deliuered bondage moabites gaue rest person ehud hath said story shewes hee wrought deliuerance thus first slaying king moab himselfe reacheth verse killing ten thousand men moab verse followeth subduing moabites deliuerance rest people first first place namely killing king laying forth wee consider first thing went namely meanes hee wrought great worke set downe verse act selfe thing followed thing went meanes worke double going iourney ehud king moab first hee deliuered present onely nineteenth verse last act selfe first iourney note three thing one occasion carrying present second furnishing himselfe deed short sharpe dagger deliuering present thus tarrie till ehud might gone past danger said going ordered god might say thus hee would haue know none withstand resist teach v although man would thinke might many way ouerthrow frustrate god purpose yet none shal stand counsell lord would haue thought prou pharaoh might haue kept people israel still land exod none could haue brought mighty people euen many hundred thousand yet behold seeing god sermon though word making vse thereof therefore thus much briefly verse generall said verse ehud done worke doct vers vpon god enemy came forth neither feare great haste disguised manner though hee done nothing worthy suspition neither gaue token guilty conscience one serued god worke liuely setteth eye peaceable fruit excusing quiet conscience behold like iael wife heber iudg hauing slaine sisera whereas act owne head murthering mind matter could hardly haue auoided haue bewrayed himselfe easily palpably bee seene iudas betraying master cried owne fact saying mat haue sinned betraying innocent blood may teach v greatly quiet excusing conscience innocent righteous man differeth guilty accusing conscience vngodly agreeth word wise man saith righteous bold prou lion wicked fleeth man pursueth ground peace discharge duty lord imposed vpon extraordinary case otherwise abominable parricide although viperous brood iesuites pretend like dispensation pettie god pope thereupon harden heart set impudent face vpon matter wound terrour conscience yet truth ground naught cause boldnesse shamelesnesse impudency want conscience wounded hell onely terrifie helhounds god feare haue hardened face seemeth regard man may see double benefit godly reape enioy hauing allowance warrant god duty doe wit inward quietnesse mind strength courage thereby beare outward danger trouble need bee contrary pursue take hold hellish minde toward god terrour dread though bite regard world hardened heart worse waited king foolishly vers clearing haue cast hardest ehud came forth parlour haue stayed haue kept long haue made delay delay dangerous matter weighty vsed thought wise keeping lord master committed failed greatly grosly duty therefore reaped fruit thereof long tarying came last found slaine delay breedeth doct vers thing doings onely danger greater thing haue said thus baa ah rechab negligence king officer slew bed teacheth euery priuate man diligent warie duty belong function calling preuent losse damage especially commendeth vigilancie circumspection al whose hand great matter state gouernment doe passe neither carelesnes conniuence sinister respect suffer mischiefe grow vpon church common wealth prouidence might season preuented ere bee helpelesse fit season therefore bee taken earthly businesse common affaire heere ehud wee must vse opportunity reape corne calleth sickie strike iron hot market must made good peniworth may doe thou hast doe diligence day eccles lasteth night come wherin workes cannot done remember rich man hell torment denied drop cold water hee auoided enioyed plenty haman made request life late slacknesse delay may luk much warned weighty affaire concerne happines cor take fit season seeke lord may bee found driue day day hee escaped hand wound danger hee passing quarry seemeth place betwixt gilgall israelite moabites could get beyond past danger comming seirah place heere mentioned border israel danger safety thus wee see againe wise speedy businesse doe thriue prosper delay time doe apparantly sit owne light worke owne sorrow annoyance wee haue heard euen hauing foolishly refused good bargaine might haue benefit maintenance long mourneth dispaireth like offer opportunity diligent hand maketh rich watereth shall also haue raine cursed hee doth lord businesse negligently people iohn baptist time receiued mat word greedinesse happie hee could enter first kingdome god make hast doe neuer come thither yet striue enter straite gate shall bee receiued glory shall seeke enter afterward late shall bee able therfore apostle tels v redeeme time wise men foolish beleeue euery thing driue taken compare vers ephes snare thus wee see wise take opportunity bring matter thereby good passe haue said speedinesse yet vnderstand thus rashnesse farre commendation driuing time delay thus much ehuds first worke killing chiefe enemie god people eglon king great meane deliuerance rest vers came home blew trumpet suddenly like manner iabin chiefe captaine armie sisera heere named opening latter part vers said haue abode harosheth gentile called countrey full wood word signifieth whereto vnto safe well fenced israel heere suffering euill person foule vice grow vp among v might easily time haue subdued brought vnder say suffering wee haue full willing nourish could bee brought offer violence vnto haue caused sorrow vpon sorrow wearisome vncomfortable day vnto v come would haue bought much cost could thus anger impatience wrath vncharitablenesse reuenge teachines frowardnes note lewd lust vncleane desire many like though wee haue thought worthie rebuke neither could bee brought deface disgrace owne selues might haue ouercome weakened v euen haue mastered v waxen strong v enough disfigure godly signifying repentance haue spoke also repentance father offered god afflicted considered heere spoken like occasion said twenty yeeres bondage doct repented turned god may behold monstrous poysoned disposition nature stoope bow lord true humiliation vntil driuen maine force euen till shut note euery else wee see child stubborne nature neither checke rod breake stomacks nay stripe make cry rougher handling forced roare sullennes til see remedy must receiue correction euill doings multitude stroke smart feele breakes heart length make yeeld euen v bee much wiser whereas wee step aside little christian course ought like willingnesse mind strayed returne rise vp againe prophet ieremy complaineth doth man fall ier rise againe goe way returne rebelliousnesse bad disposition wicked onely lesse bee maruelled let well considered shall found haue sometime serued god truth lose hold haue suffered wicked flesh sinfull nature get vpper hand againe oh hardly put possession againe diuels said sauiour christ thou art come torment v mat time euer soone imprisonment wicked flesh brought vnder lord wing againe put yoke though easie said cause licentious dissolutenesse great account day sort dimme light shineth bee light demanded god people keepe long vnder gouernment loth returne againe vnder answere partly confused knowledge ignorance forgetfulnes returne euer well grounded one cause partly lothnesse vntowardnesse flesh bee pent seeking liberty rather amisse euen thus men haue shelter rotten helpelesse soeuer flie god much shift serue must returne againe lord first husband said hosea let bee wise speed returne ho tim make godlinesse indeed greatest rich chiefe stay seeing alwaies onely comfortable psalme day psal better therein thousand elsewhere seeing wee misery trouble people heere often fall sighing sorrowing yea murmuring fretting yet turne god sinne bite bridle punishment yet last must bee brought vnwillingnesse therefore take heed keepe profession hope firmely wee may yet wee haue fallen let v despaire yet delay turne god soonest haue said againe people many may learne good held vnder vnfolding part vers pursued nine hundred chariot iron alwaies going among vexe oppresse euery side plague great enough one would thinke euen mercy cruell prou yet worst befell god also sold hand thus great misery doe yet twentie yeeres estate able abide fearefull example yet belonging god good v take occasion consider estate vnder sundry sore great calamity lord sending rebellion grieuous prouokings himselfe frowning vpon haue comfort trouble oh affected people hee cannot turne away eare prayer grones vnder heauie burthen pitie deliuer prophet saith mother forget bee hardhearted owne child yet lord cannot bee doth iustly lay esa charge still sorrowes humble heart seeke god deliuerance god kinde setteth himselfe end may harten embolden v beleeue wee greatest need hardly perswaded doe great vnbeleefe v also sheweth compassion v another respect euen wee also learne shew like goodnesse kindnesse brother calamity may much better resemble heere end twentie five sermon fovtrh chapter booke ivdges proceed besides wee haue heard wee may note hereby weake vnlikely meanes god doct vers deliuereth pleaseth hee raised vp ehud man lame right hand deliuer people shamgar weapon ox goade thereto vsed woman shee wife one lapidoth instrument effecting great worke ouerthrow iabin shew power tied valiant mighty men lest glory giuen also strength force though hee allow vsed yet trusted wee put confidence strong rocke strongest enemy prouerbs prayer auaile much bee feruent iam requireth straitely beleeued v hee vseth doe chron also deliuerance people soules bondage satan hell meane men bee great note wealth preferment hee subdueth heart mighty piercing breaking powerfull force preaching wil lend eares heare excellent gift faith may wrought putting heauenly treasure earthen vessel end purpose cor may say praise see hee worketh whose power though sillie man bee vsed instrument woman god vsed deliuer people also endued deboras calling prophetesse spirit prophesie reueale god answere doubt cause said next verse people came vp counsell iudgement thought doct vers oppression iabin great people israel could haue ordinary iudges though rare haue woman prophetess vet god stirred vp miriam sister moses hanna mother vnto seeing gift god giuen bee buried vsed edifying church publike priuate proofe say know prophesying onely taken foretelling thing come making knowne god matter saluation end god vsed woman sometimes cor though forbid forged diabolicall shee saint prophetess church rome boasteth ascribe much credit dreames monkes deserue therefore wee must also heere take heed wee bring example lord hath wrought extraordinarily hath pleased wee tied paul rule set downe corinthian wit woman keepe cor silence congregation addeth reason must bee subiect husband teacher office haue authority ouer taught gouerne also well instruct permitted wife ouer husband neither ouer men seeing lord latter time vseth commonly extraordinary instrument former day especially vnlesse furnish also extraordinary gift ordinary therefore wee admire reuerence goodnesse vse hereof bounden duty praise god highly hee hath stirred vp age light help good church yea thes heb extraordinary see heere want come home selues prouideth ordinary helpes meanes v day building vp church among v behoueth v receiue due reuerence making right vse none presume set vp themselues extraordinarily many separatist without gift sinned betraying innocent blood answered vnmercifull manner looke thou haue said though set worke shift thy selfe comfort thou shalt haue v returne though god hath euery way prouided well v instructed soundly graciously relieued comforted haue said yet lamented many v glutted good meanes wee haue suffer lie v rusting euen thereafter good fruite bring foorth liues thereby vers sent called barak sonne abinoam kedesh naphtali said vnto hath lord god israel commanded saying goe draw toward mount tabor take thee ten thousand men child naphtali child zebulon vers draw vnto thee riuer kishon sisera captaine iabins armie charets multitude deliuer thine hand vers barak said vnto thou wilt goe goe thou wilt goe goe vers answered surely goe thee iourney thou takest shall thine honour lord shall sell sisera hand woman debora arose went barak kedesh haue heard description debora followeth meaning foure verse went worke great businesse lord iabin therefore god commanded sent barak described text sonne abinoam hee goe furnish himselfe tenne thousand men assured god would giue victorie ouer sisera captaine iabins armie ouer multitude barak first feared beleeued went forward worke seeing afraid vnbeliefe therefore refused goe without found fault told god would punish haue honour otherwise haue barak debora went kedesh together thus much meaning foure verse debora barak order direction accordingly haue heard harten selues shunne forbidden obey contrary incouraged promise blessing annexed blessed comfortable direction god seruants day shall likewise end world hath carried haue many plague liues following owne desire way falleth better prosper world yet haue sound comfort thing doe apply affaire men calling therfore say one thing thee whosoeuer thou art wouldest liue comfortably try working doctrine thee looke one weeke thy calling faithfully discharge duty conscionably note farre thou hast knowledge endeauour obey commandements god firmely perswaded promise god thee thou art safe walking hath annexed promise blessing obeying euery commandement yea hundred fold thou forgoest thereby thou wilt aske shalt thou know god doth reward thee answere bee thou iudge thy selfe deale thee example let case thou wilt say thou wert tied strictly obey god thou couldest take thy pleasure merrie company benefit thy selfe men doe gaine get commodity whereas thou tied make conscience darest doe must lose forgo much thereby heare thee heare thou likewise thou confessest profit pleasure thou forgoest obeying god vnlawfull conscience otherwise holdeth note thee put case thou hast gotten god vrge cause thy conscience prick thee thou beest wounded therein stingeth worse hornet god doth one time make men sinne smart sting committers painfull sort worse leaues hardened thou knowest meaneth beleeuest say thee wouldest thou giue healed intolerable paine euen thou hast much soeuer signe thee losing thy soule vtterly thou persist therein shall profit man winne whole world lose soule mat thou fishest golden hooke lost recompensed thou catchest therewith answere mee haddest thou voide rid terrour tast hell thou haddest auoided resisted thy sinne mightest thou haue quiet merrie god seruants thou haddest obeyed lord tell would thy mirth quietnesse haue hundred fold better welcome thee thy profit pleasure hath brought thee hellish torment conscience wound sting taketh away delight thee deliuerance thou wouldest giue thou hast therefore know god giue hundred fold profit ease pleasure thee euen life thou obeyest doest thing sake ouer thou shalt find making thy manifest hee told brother god sent preserue posterity aliue iacob sent away rebecca mother padan aram auoide gen wrath brother esau cause good hee went vncertaine befall strange land therefore hee since bestowed saying came ouer iordan staffe poore gen without prouision haue gotten two band moses married iethros daughter liuing obscurely wildernesse suffering affliction people god would haue thing shall bee time directed good end though see yet wee shall wee may bold say bring passe bee knowne wander heere earth yet darkenesse others neither cast orphan left desolate god careth pet tim v faithfull one otherwise doth rest world v though wee see mind purpose god toward v particular first fall course liues yet wee sure speciall prouidence watcheth ouer v good need doubt god directeth thing end wonderfull stay beleeuing people without faith sound knowledge vse thereof god doings strange v see issue sometime afterward also namely cross affliction distasted v vtterly vnwelcome benefit neuer receiued v good sort right end namely make v trust firmely cleaue constantly whereas much moued hereby commit successe vnto till experience haue brought rom hope shall make v ashamed need bee doubt watcheth v thus clinging sleepe vpholdeth v prou wee walke proposeth good towards v euen wee see likelihood thereof thus v vnprofitable consider ill goeth rest vpon blind fortune call goe strength carnall wisedome looking great matter vaine little nothing acquainted god prouidence lamentable see tossed vexed vnsetled care sorrowes vncertaine doubtfull affaire also sure certaine thinke imagine besides vnprofitable v marke another thing short doct story seeing heber remoued dwelling apart rest brother kenites vpon good consideration otherwise holy story would haue found fault rest departing iericho dwelling tribe iuda iudg border heard chap say heber thus yet cleare story offend god therein wee see vnlawfull people god settle dwelling apart neighbour kindred brother profession may fal meet god hath appointed faithfull dwel together neither sometime sundry consideration respect reade abraham lot reason great abundance cattell want pasture departed one another euen posterity grew multiplied one familie married dispersed diuerse many thing doe cause indeed wee may dwell together god people place best choice neglected desired hartily many shall hindred necessity liberty may bee enioyed v let v make pretious reckoning set selues liue together kindly profitably peaceably many regard doe cannot bee without great inconuenience let v striue god gaine nothing thereby know god hath appointed done v another place may bee wee may bring god remouing bee seated among shall bee like selues may good conuersation shall see turned vnto v two thing principally aime endeauour vnto must change remoue dwelling followeth short degression haue heard vers barak prepared furnished himselfe warre told sisera done hee prepared army likewise hee heard barak done power meane great feareful haue shewed already haue heere principally note addressing himselfe battel difference betwixt one side debora barak thousand prepared themselues warre see went god commandement hee pride owne heart without god trusted promise god victory owne strength note great army went god enemy god friend yea god himselfe whereby may see much auaileth haue doct vers good cause maintaine haue god goe v therein many example scripture testifie warres godly king idolater good cause defence gospell true worship god christian prince would force poperie false worship open warre also maintaining owne dominion bound right great waighty matter recouering vniustly detained christian prince like case may make warre command people enemie may say like leaue instance lay doctrine another familiar common sort manifest like found among v peace wit haue good cause controuersies bad manifest say one sort hath great encouragement goodnesse cause follow rather hath none much encouragement barak haue spoken animate men duty say successe blessing particularly shall follow vse shall certainly reape great fruit thereby abundantly one way therefore good reason doe lord worke diligently contrariwise could bee made consider goe following bad matter neuer dare hold proceed doe wit sisera defend ill cause would feare goe forward desist attempt good bad goe worke alike heere outward preparation like manner like minde like end although sisera wilfully pride heart gone israel god people pharaoh although hee bee properly charged consulting god weighin cause going god people ala heathen therefore ignorant matter yet speake best may said hee trusted chariot horse souldiers munition thereby purposing maine force reduce rebellious israelite hee counted yoake obedience knew also god people indeed wonder tooke course cursed canaanite one leaue come nearer selues admirable among v visible church bee found enterprise life dealing maintaine euill cause one barak sisera though action ciuill religious exercise outward respect appeare little difference yet prophane vnconscionable many hold righteous abomination deface pharisies christ best action see difference betwixt owne others please themselues thus say tush precise seeme doe follow trade buy sell eate drinke marrie c reade pray heare word receiue sacrament c oddes therefore betwixt v yes shall two field mat mill yet one receiued forsaken one reprobate chosen surely differ end differ meanes vsing leade thereto though differ dying outward manner yet differ one dieth happily miserably doe affection differ desire hope encouragement success one asketh shew psal v good prayeth lord lift vp light thy countenance vpon v v abundance light knowledge direction grace assistance thereto godly man walketh looking promise lawfull attempt knowing also lord light guide bee defence also vphold prosper psal blesse walkes darkenesse led erronious opinion sense example nature sometimes shame feare proud confidence himselfe therefore goeth many danger smart sorrowes whether crossed whether haue desire hee reeleth also stumbleth egyptian darkenesse ouerspread israelite walked safety liberty word one serueth god diuell one cheerefull patient confident contrary minde carriage therefore let euery man desireth approued god iudge himselfe others haue spoken doe action though wee know mind let v conceiue best farre charity may yet let v suspend sentence allowance till longer triall knowledge acquaintance consider yee reade say lord giue vnderstanding haue said wicked incensed righteous deed good owne euill consisteth great difference betwixt true christian counterfait lay sort together good consideration shall appeare scripture heere end twenty eight sermon fovtrh chapter booke ivdges vers debora said vnto barak vp day lord hath deliuered sisera thine hand lord gone thee barak went downe mount tabor tenne thousand men vers lord destroyed sisera charets host edge sword barak sisera lighted downe charet fled away feete vers barak pursued charets host vnto harosheth gentile host sisera fell edge sword man left haue heard former verse side barak summe three verse meane sisera addressed themselues battell come neerely intent fourth part shewed whose victorie namely baraks verily debora incouraging assuring euen day wherein spake bee obtained gotten beleeuing went downe men warre though meeting sisera band mount tabor said matter destroyed charets horseman man left either drowned riuer kishon slaine mount tabor pursued charets horseman put sword sisera himselfe driuen flie away feete vaine oh wonderfull deliuerance god gaue vnto people day set downe third speech debora vsed barak verse vnfolding vers mount tabor though last yet least mightie forceable due season appeareth text barak saw siseras huge army dismaied therfore sought fittest place mount tabor furest shrowd himselfe violence rage sisera fainting perceiuing called backe stirred vp fight word perswasions saying power man great fearfull soeuer shall able hinder thee obtaining victorie lord hath purposed giue thee day speech hee animated tooke heart went battell haue heard preuailed notably set downe one meanes whereby power doct faith strengthened whereby wonderfully drawne contemne set light discouragement breake thorow least whereof without would bee ready set man wit end deboras heartning perswasion barak god voyce animate therefore much auaileth heare god promise oft time publike ministerie effectually published fitly applied vnto v fittest manner may bee sicknesse temptation time fainting man much weakened dismaied note haue barak debora forcible liuely quicknings best man able himselfe doe dutie himselfe prayer faith strengthen himselfe time need oh many ebbing faintings liues euen good strength refreshing haue sometime good patience hope vnder cross another time wee feare greatnes swallow v vp especially common againe wee sometime pursue finne haue chace preuaile ouer hath sore laid v wound v farre draw liking consent v vnto sometime carrieth v maine force hath relieued v time truly euen haue able beleeue god strengthen v hath promised doe also prayer fained wee haue set faith worke though hath lien almost dead euen thus grow weaken liking sinne v feare danger shame world dull edged tooles cut head monster although wee brought oft time point doubt yet also striue faith prayer shall vaine doe wee doe feare affliction commeth heauines come know thing estate christian know many time great feare falling finne yea perhaps foule odious though vsually doe call minde god hath promised strength aduersarie power weapon warfare carnall spirituall wee shall able beate downe strong hold prayer faith need requireth set selues doe shall soone perceiue lose ground grow weake barak yet strengthened againe debora hee valiantly afterwards much renowned among worthy reported haue obtained victorie faith hearing deboras word went downe mount tabor men neere riuer kishon sisera incouragement debora fruite barak followeth lord gaue barak victorie rare marueilous verse victorie ouer god enemy lord wasted huge armie sisera howbeit fighting barak men hasted flight toward harosheth gentile safetie whence came ouer taken also put sword none escaped sisera driuen great slaughter battell sore forsake charet wherein hee rode escape foote might among common souldiers considered meanes great victorie gotten tenne thousand vnexperienced souldiers going many thousand horseman footman yron charets lord said gaue barak victorie man doubteth manner necessity thereof doct vers beside action thankesgiuing haue spoken circumstance time also bee marked say day set downe holy story sang debora barak day teacheth v make delay good thing vse yea quickly wee need take vantage bad memory blockish heart meanes although ordinarily performe dutie three time day solemne manner namely morning euening noone tide yet otherwise beside psal god shall giue v occasion common benefit deliuerances prouoke selues hereunto namely saint iames saith note one merrie disposed ioy let suffer affection vanish expresse vtter god singing praise afterward ought continue memory infinite mercy throughout whole life end write whereas grow multitude time cannot alwaies remembred bee wished sort yet least wise wee reade ouer wee may readily renue shall see cause thankes god great men blockishnesse haue said endlesse wandring swarmes cogitation thing hinder wherby see cause hereof doe yet slothfulnesse delay deferre pay due god till appetite gone afterward let hinderance comming way breake cannot performe said thankes second verse shee shewes god bee praised one cause vers auenged enemy behalfe people sake though hee long vsed executioner wrath disobedient people yet sinne come top people sin repented therfore turne come brought punishment another cause thankes people zebulun naphtali willingly offered themselues follow barak sisera although hee authority ouer expressed verse word praise ye lord auenging israel people offered themselues willingly heereby wee learne first god reuenger doct vers iniuries wrong people euen hee himselfe saith vengeance rom mine repay saith lord yea hee doe due time luk right soone saith need marke saith vnrighteous iudge doe right poore widow lest shee troubling oft suing vnto last weary shall god auenge elect cry day night vnto yea though bee long tell thes hee auenge quickly recompence tribulation trouble apostle speaketh waite therefore hee hath forgotten himselfe wise man saith thou seest oppression eccles poore greater oppressor though might much said point like purpose yet beleeueth thing according word sauiour sonne man commeth shall luk finde faith earth teaching v hardly men beleeue though hee gaue therein fearefull watchword thereof come make v better looke complaint may iustly bee made still day wee dull slow heart beleeue truth vttered v prophet luk apostle woe misery wee rest quietly lord take part v child giues v faire strong encouragement let v passe next point verse thing doct vers verse people praise god offered themselues readily willingly pursue god enemy teacheth doe worke god goe willingly cherefully loueth chearefull giuer doth cheerefull doer cor command contrarily cursed doth lord businesse negligently therefore highly bee reioyced god much ier praised men forward god matter waightier excellent bee courage delight men note haue taking hand among reckon preaching gospell profession duty particular calling like wherin forward cheerful people hay haruest going market faires honoureth god highly behold ought praise god heartily giuing gift men rarely seene among doe shew plainly looke reward god goe roundly readily businesse men aukely goe part men forward ready leaud company keeping sin time workes flesh obey lord bee set good worke especially whereof profit like redound goe aukely vntowardly euen euill debter worke creditour pay therefore fearefull grieuous sinne loose liuers bee forwarder zealouser god matter duty ward mocke discourage yet sinne grieuously companion lesse haue spoken former chapter thus much verse next calling prince great person harken vers doe verse teach know whence victory greatnes come ascribe lord according christ word prayer thine father kingdome power glory euer least iot praise thereof due god honour make instrument therein furnish gift purpose meane doe seruice yet though absolute power themselues forgetting lord aduanced ascribe great act victory themselues senacherib hezechia benhadad ahab yea king king got victory tarrie till conquered enemy crow ouer yet great sinne prided themselues done nabuchadnezzar babell therefore put shame worthily themselues brought vnder manner fit bragger would thrust lord helping nay rather challenged euen opposed themselues seene story therefore one battell benhadad lost hundred seuen twentie thousand men hee euen left constrained flie battell wherein many men slaine hee brought greater shame abacement last refuge wit seruants goe king israel rope neck entreate liues senacherib angell lord flue hundred foure king score fiue thousand one night successe least end haue like hence scripture bewraying pride vanity vseth phrase lord smote beniamin israel lord fought israel againe stand still behold saluation lord c among exod name lord called strong battell lord host surely sparrow fall ground without wil neither lot without disposition much doe euents hazard warre depend vpon prouidence oft time matter great weight alteration kingdomes estate come prince must know victory honour giuen god much inferiours ought learne well beggers haue nothing nay wee worse nought rather wee haue ought glory would soone haue good incouragement haue liberty follow course dealing also seeing godlines hath promise present life tim come men debarred traffique vse calling rich men mentioned heauie crosse seeing way spend vpon stocke till wasted soone done renued ala shall family maintained charge defraid freedome gathering men commodity dealing bee taken doe wee see weather little sicknesse disabling man worke causeth complaining much liberty wholly interdicted yet god doe somtime blesse men may looke haue alwaies one course thriuing prospering howsoeuer bee let bee highly thankfull may vse benefit traffique improuing commodity let fruitfull welldoing would readily promise bee againe vnder crosse ioyfull vse preaching sacrament duty true praise god expecteth depriue themselues benefit thereof owne default haue much answere idle person ill husband call lord somewhat alter course taking gaines come short therof ouer somtime fret complaine trade naught shall vndone much like hauing got trade well conceale estate faine themselues bankerupts defeat others good cast burthen vpon thriftlesnes improuidence vpon trade dealing blindfortune forgetting god somtimes blessed therein therefore let v know whatsoeuer bad practises men great fauour god people may haue free recourse market faires like place buying selling commodity euen want thereof sore punishment people neither know vtter commodity buy whereof stand need consisted maintenance said yet lamentable see abuse corrupt custome time hath brought liberty vnto many doe onely steale away god due meane sabbath doe worldly businesse whose common trade practise prophane manner harbour theeues receiue stollen ware entertaine drunkard become baud adulterer spend day leaud vnseemely meeting matchmaking stageplayes reuell rout vnder honest aduancement heauinesse matter hanging downe head righteous w may say may bee seene shall thus surely god people may haue eye dazeled pompe glorie shall see pulled may hereby weaned estranged dangerous poysoned baites would hurt haue done faith ee downfall euen middest glorie heart desire enioy outward thing lord ranke enemy secondly may cleaue god faithfully also waite constantly see glorie turned shame preuent repentance let vse first thing vnto v second note according prouerbs wicked doe alwaies roste get hunting prou doe alwaies attaine promise themselues earnest desire heart whereof haue great likelihood well hope god cutteth great vexation disappointment yea godly shall see triumph debora israel ouer pharao though true fatted haue might looke yet haue destruction yet righteous may enuie see lord take part lest proud themselues thinke god seeth crossed purpose many time hope would willingly enioy lord frustrateth mocketh king aram king secret plot purpose king israel bewraied prophet elisha hee sheweth thereby haue alwaies commandement neither goe attempt without sufferance may verified none else yet euen god resisteth proud lord thus matcheth disappointeth seemeth good common dealing attaine aime looke especially fight god play giant heauen like nebuchadnezzar insolencie vttereth selfe poore church god many chuse fittest obiect vomit poyson vpon lord answerable manner riseth vp scatter lookes downe heauen laugh scorne scatter banded themselues annointed example sake though scripture full let two time suffice one would build citie gen reach vp heauen get name lord set himselfe cast downe building called name thereof babell confusion pride like haue growne god let alone suffered worke goe forward example haman inward king ester aduanced looked yet rise higher vnlooked cast downe dignitie shame made sutable note glorie thus fared sisera stead great success increasings purpose dignity defeated thereof faine lose enioyed lord making ambition next meane ouerthrow god deales many rising dunghill great wealth honour ioynted otherwise oftentimes want nothing life length day enioy florishing estate still behold euen way meeteth death somtime reprochfull enough sure paine woe enough besides going hence hee cut iolitie one blow fearing god might haue liued could haue prolonged day said verse generall ill prospering verse israel fighting particularly debora sheweth verse euen heauen higher region aire starres planet raised raine winde face yea haile tempest fight sisera thereby god shewed himselfe preparation furniture charets horse men seruing purpose disappointing teacheth v god heauen earth power shall fight doct vers leuit exod god enemy euen plague written booke god doe commandement seaze vpon torment haile aboue slew god enemy sunne stood still end frost iosh flood plague tamine haue time fought god haue handled point largely onely answere one obiection place obiected godly obiect sustaine forementioned iudgements like well smitten sore byles sole foote vnto crowne head tooke potsheard scrape answere god sendeth like child trial correction answ heale dangerous disease pride loosenes worldlinesse c enemy scourge wicked best sweete life inward peace growing goodnesse fruite prayer holy labour contentment like may euer worthily perswade get god seruice vpright hearted toward seeing godlinesse tim bringeth many great commodity spake somewhat also contrary may said men seeke lord heart neither carefull way may please prosper long yet like attaine lose euen tossed many calamity greatest god frowneth vpon beleeue danger whereof may easily gathered drunkard prouerbs stricken said sinne fruites whoredome like hee sicke prou beaten hee knew therefore would follow sinne yet still speech vttered debora soule thou hast marched valiantly hebrew soule thou hast trod downe strength namely enemy know great wee take first sense triumpheth generall manner courage furtherance god gaue latter particularly speaketh soule reioycingly trode vnder foote might strength seeing god armed power great enemy say therefore need feare power none hereafter god still affoord worthie instruction wee haue seene god hath giuen v great deliuerance wee trusted heere wee euerafter promise selues chron hee doe like v still seeking like manner note rom may harten selues beleeue agreeth saint paul doctrine experience bringeth hope practise saying god hath cor deliuered v doth deliuer v wee trust yet hereafter also hee deliuer v doublesse experience proper fruit faith bringeth forth without life wee freed affliction haue escaped one remaine still subiect like shall boot v haue ouercommers one foiled another may easily euen lesser without armour vnbeleefe faith wee ouercame greater surely haue booted dauid haue killed beare slaine lion philistim therefore learne hence though ought beleeue promise sake yet much better doe ought doe haue pawne lying v meane experience truth hard case haue neither third thing made vers conceit vngrounded hope comfort easily deceiue themselues therewith whereas looke haue good warrant wherein take comfort else thing common prouerbe speaketh namely building castle ayre euen hee dreameth sleeping imagineth waking thing hee desireth shall euen come passe hee would haue foolish please one selfe thinking may finde masse gold aduanced honour thereupon take pleasure promising himselfe pleasant life hee leade foolishnes thus deceiue man selfe much greater wisedome better ground hath wise men world called doe make common practise yet doe scorne fansies dreames haue naught reckon long shall liue estate hope come better make account great bargaines note shall haue great gainings commings plentifull increase corne cattell commodity shall bring foorth others another kinde euen best liketh humour doe seriously beate braines may reuenged vpon deadly hate meanes way vse bring low haue another sort resolue merrie mate companion drinking whoring sundrie kindes play pastime morrow goe place c iames againe salomon challengeth sort asking boast prou morow cannot tell may fall ere morow changeable world alteration may come obserue may see daily iust condemning meere fooles rest vpon brused reedes broken hold yet goe wise men many haue made account way haue mentioned haue fulfilled vexe god people heart threatning roote haman iewes yet haue themselues note reckoning accomplished brought passe ouerthrowne laid dust wormes looke haue lord commandement appoint hee shall rule world dispose thing serue turnes yet absurd thing one among many ashamed boldnes folly multiplied beautified good thing euen sunne groweth beautie noonetide first sisera shamefully slaine returned home victorie mother also feare much let v learne euill wicked feare shall light vpon feares many scripture testifieth feare shall vpon euery side euen sorrowes also many whereas psal noted doe please themselues greatly hope obiect best thing may thinke contradict selfe saying afraid fearfull answere may haue feare meane hope diuers answ time yet neither good hope deceiuable feare troublesome beside wicked person kinde feare seene least euill boldnes worser sort wicked men incline feare properly naturally companion sinne ignorance vnbeliefe hope presume wilfully ioh labour expell feare though great part doe indeede yet violent thing continuall therefore oft time mistrust feare suspition trouble come place againe may see list marke balaam wishing hee might numb haue died death righteous feared doe may say many running deep debt god conscience accuseth shall one time called vnwelcome account thing feare shall cor come vpon yet come agreement god iudging themselues may bee iudged bee free feare frailtie permit iudgement therefore refusing doe feare iustly falleth vpon saying salomon proueth haue many feares hee saith wicked slieth man pursueth feare prou may seene haue possessed pharisies yet bare boldly men word nicodemus bewraying fellow pharisies ill conscience feare saying christ know thou art ioh teacher sent god acknowledge thy great miracle hee haue added though wee knowne thing men yet thus v wee meete talke thee together afraid aske shall doe shall aduise shake feares plucke vp heart doubtlesse fight conscience make impudent hardned much worse whereas accuse cannot preuent feare remouing cause thereof sinne let next perswaded repent reade third captaine came e beholding king two fellowes deuoured fire heauen message prophet imperiously boldly came submisnes entreated come downe king euen come selues aske thy conscience make thee feare thou findest lord hath controuersie thee depending thou canst quiet goe seeke agreement captaine follie stand lord thy conscience accuse ioh thee greater knowing much thee thou canst come lord say truth thine heart lord feare lest sinne bring sudden destruction vpon haue peace within without thy displeasure goe continually hazard fruite thereof besides eternall therefore say lord humble cause feare sinne punishment turne terror broken heartednesse sin bring peace quietnes againe soule doe thus say thy feares shall vanish otherwise shall pitie thee thou pitiest thy selfe taking way remoue purpose aske priest gospell meete feared christ would need crucifie might rid rose againe bring greater feare vpon last first would wise feare sinne highest yet see constrained feare doubt hardned doe put feare away hauing conscience seared hot iron whose damnation yet sleepeth neither shal escape feare seaze vpon would wheras may said godly much afraid sometime well answere true tendeth good end haue taken libertie amisse rather stolne breake good righteous way couenanted walke cannot bee afraid come againe themselues see haue offended mercifull father therefore cannot quiet till bee fauour againe let know euen much must wit falles feare take rest peace themselues else time commeth feare shall also fall vpon consider duly estate may time trouble come turne foot againe way god testimony god burie indignity haue wrought receiue graciously ho first branch propheticall prayer enemy god might sisera hauing warrant pray became shall wee doe shall doe vpon good ground warrant otherwise take heed wee pray faire pretence soeuer wee haue doe god hath reclaimed bad one know wee may call home among v haue spoken part deboras prayer louers god may prosper abundance good thing grow therein sunne doth strength noonetide let bee noted prayed loue lord onely blessing second commandement loue testifie doe keeping commandements prayer made faith obtaines much asked therefore prayeth one affirmed shall namely loue lord shall want nothing good dauid saith good experience lord withholdeth good thing psal psal keepe heart pure good none doe loue yea marke saith shall grow therein euen strength strength sunne doth euen full beautie speaketh salomon prouerbs way righteous shineth light shineth vnto perfit day signifying thereby prou godly herein resemble lord iesus increased strength luke body addition grace fauour god men also increase daily knowledge grace vntill bee ioyned christ head see lord sion holinesse behold singular priuiledge louers god doe enioy looke carefully constantly preserue vphold loue god euen thereby grow grace knowledge god christ come haue neere acquaintance haue proofe fatherly kindnes toward haue stronger hope shall yet better afterward obedience passed yeeldeth courage strength go forward good course consider miserable course many want gracious gouernment god runne kinde sinne fearefull punishment wicked waxe worse worse euen god deare seruants declinings carelesnes small time see many ill day make account precious libertie bequeathed vnto v behalfe looke maintaining loue god nourishing note thankfull acknowledging euer flowing kindnesse toward speake great thing neede feare worse estate godward haue enioyed alreadie euery day looke better better greater faith better obedience cannot wanting note v wanting selues failing loue god yet meane perfectio cannot vse sinceritie feruencie god seruice euen hath alreadie listeth reade growing grace setting downe may reade twelfth chapter sixth treatise book meane season let speech debora make looke better farre thriuing growth grace fruite desire honour fauour god voide let know cause thereof loue god whatsoeuer pretend contrarie without welfare soule cannot prosper rather decaieth man sicke desperate discase growes worse worse till vtter consumption death selfe doe follow therefore worke small weight trie selues whether loue god quite cost abundantly get wee thriuing hand feare wee shall doe well wee giue good proofe thereof wee loue desire well brother nothing deare still earnest thirsting thing grow haue appetite growth say common care honouring god place liue daily longing home vprightnes constancie euidences loue god cannot deceiue affection wee well assured breake fruite haue mentioned iosephs vnto brother gen song debora holy storie addeth god gaue people victorie fortie yeeres rest quietnes great blessing euen know benefit great deliuerance paine sicknesse prison bondage penurie like miserie especially long continuance much sweete peace conscience passeth vnderstanding ioy holy ghost long continuance trouble minde feare damnation sometime also elsewhere somewhat hath said thirtie sixe sermon sixth chapter booke ivdges vers afterward child israel committed wickednesse sight lord lord gaue hand midian seuen yeeres vers hand midian preuailed israel midianites child israel made dennes mountaines caues strong hold vers israel sowne came vp midianites amalekites east came vpon vers camped destroyed fruite earth euen till thou come vnto azzah left foode israel neither sheepe oxe asse vers went vp cattell came tent grashoppers multitude camel without number came land destroy vers israel exceedingly impouerished midianites therefore child israel cried vnto lord chapter shewed israel againe prouoked lord summe part chapter wickednesse vers lord punished midianites vers cried vnto lord reproued vers lastly called gedeon prepared deliuer end chapter first part chapter begin sinne appeares grieuously prouoke summe first part lord sometime done third fourth chapter appeares punishment likewise long time continued vpon yet death debora barak valiant deliuerers hand canaanite againe depart good course wherein liued fell againe idolatrie sinnes said sinne may gathered first verse begin benefit instruction take hence seeing story set downe well punishing israel begin thus child israel againe euill sight lord seeing say thus may learne naturally ingrafted heart man though bee holy affection kindled good meanes yet time dye wane away stead heart carried againe euill desireth thus haue goodnesse beginning faith faire shewes hypocrite best morning dew though men may perhaps serue god ho good manner yet gone wee aware waxing wearie prouoking god afresh sicklenes inconstancie deeply rooted thereupon falleth carried away error wicked inticements world good course fashioned like men though grosse absurd fall great reason hereof best renewed part much corruptio remaineth purged requireth taking vp thought care meet take knowledge may see haue worke enough haue little note cause idle waxe wearie meane beside many duty crossing subduing euill heart especially seeing reward great yet griefe may said age person church little considering haue fallen course complaine psalme started aside like psal broken bow people exodus like absence moses day fell shamefully idolatrie people exod mentioned iohn counted iohn baptist burning light ioh time reioyced whereby yee may gather time many long stood vpon doe shew soone men decline good course wel v latter age looked better selues well person family almost whole townes wanze waxe cold seruing god yet sometime forwarder sort professor god reserueth desire keepe first loue gospell brother may seed note euery corner land almost teach generation come world continue feare lord aright hee hauing appointed remnant remaine church though small vnto world end teacheth best v need haue desire enioy best meanes namely sincere preaching gospell whereby may grow grace knowledge christ cleaue neerely considering oft wee haue god gracious working v reuiued refreshed thereby dead good duty wee vnprofitable conscience iudges without well winde poisoned baites laid v first foure part chapter haue spoken former part verse somewhat also chapter people sinne second part chapter followes second punishment followed sinne cried lord vnder sixe verse punishment seuen yeeres oppression midianites verse seene manner oppressing set downe fiue verse following oppression midianites let verse doct vers lamen teach v iust sinned god scourgeth men iustly without due desert man suffereth sinne prophet ieremy saith thinke hardly handled punished god let proue themselues without sinne else let hold peace nay yeeld let able proue haue offended infirmitie rather wilfully knowledge shall either freed altogether great vexation liues else shall freely without constraint confesse god hath dealt iustly yea mercifully visiting rather hath done wrong thus much god punish men prouoke transgression may learne haue place shewed manner midianites oppressing people israel verse sense spoiling victuall namely corne cattell space seuen yeeres without could liue corne destroied sowen field driuen make cabin hollow place earth vnder hils rock hole creuises let light defend themselues field lower part earth made dennes darke place fit habitation might safely lay good substance hide midianites made also high tower strong might see farre could beaten easily shift faine make enemy grashoppers face earth camel beast destroy fruites israelite almost without number midianites stocke came necessarie inquire seeing set downe though writer say beginning thus one abraham sonnes begat wife ketura builded citie beyond arabia south desert called saracen called name midian madian people called midianites madianites supposed kenites came brought amalakites men east helpe grieuous sore affliction thus driuen extremity deut esay want food yet long threatned among many come vpon apostacie idolatrie though heare consuming people israel battell yet beside could many slaine long violent assaulting death cruell liuing famished miserie life greater seeke foode hardly come yet bee reserued scarcely fit preserue life therefore contrary wee may see benefit god land city townes village people may fed fit condition inuasion forraine enemy spoile destroy fruit earth whereby inhabitant preserued famine iudgement god iust cause complaining streetes know great famine mentioned scripture yea smaller famine owne remembrance cry lamentation haue day abraham isaac chiefly iacob gen forced send egypt corne time elimelek naomi driuen dwelling bethelem ruth iuda goe soiourne land moab want food day ioram king israel men way king preserue liues eating nature yea yet could hardly come woman eate child also last besieging ierusalem roman end speake lift vp heart feruently oft thankfull god one benefit plentie although seeth indeed one many yea infinite wee receiue doth god euen end men doct vers may follow calling diligently conscionably cheerefulnes minde walke feare lord continually therefore euill example life abundance god earthly blessing doth flow euery drunkennesse lasciuiousnes doth draw vpon men greater plague want famine leanenes soule blindnes vnbeliefe hardnesse heart impenitencie spirit prophet wee deeply bewaile leaue adde quickning vp best fit note grow meane common esteeming benefit god suppose themselues put case want penurie euen state people god oppression midianites like haue sowne seede spovled face eate prouision haue made liues carried away enemy taken famished want would make better value prize benefit yeeld lord holy fruitfull vse whereas commonly men doe till driuen want decay substance say oh plentie god benefit enioyed another thing verse marked bring double vexation vpon selues sinning lord seeking haue doct word god one affliction sent vpon v sinne stirring vp midianites people israel transgression losse good disease ieopardie liues c vexation proceedeth former many sort may liuely seene present storie namely verse toile time cost beside disquietnes went therewith driuen bestow may include much word defend saue themselues vtmost hurt danger wrought intended shift faine make preserue liues saue good enemy hand yet done could able doe hurt cattell corne commodity sustained onely punishment deare paying pleasure took sinne note bondage could doe nothing else watch ward liues build botch digge delue beate braines deuise hide commodity sorrow vpon sorrow one vnquietnes vpon another heape vpon head till lost welfare liues manner made wearisome vnwelcome death selfe fruite sinne good bringeth committers thereof yet lay fruit sinne cain esau absolon could staied committing better thing could say better fruite could proue yeeldeth committers baite pleasant poore fish biteth caught hooke bringeth paine torture wearying selfe saue life needes taste pleasure sinne haue said great good intendeth follow one kinde tooth naile also lie sucking draw pleasure childe doth breast let taken condemned fooles master profession vpholders trade occupation yea let bee reckoned number prouerbe speaketh foole beleeueth euery prou thing againe ye fooles long ye loue foolishnesse prou haue chosen way seemeth pleasant issue thereof way death doe certainly take paine goe hell righteous doth heauen reuolting brought vpon miserie let haue falsified promise broken solemne couenant god seeking zeale greater fruitfulnes watchfulnes care let say also feare euill conscience wil draw vpon one accusation trouble another decline greater sorrow bring vpon themselues haue brought point haue made question whether might lay violent hand vpon themselues auoid terror minde also obserue shift chuse make rather doct would seeke god humiliation repentance release loue freedome well hauing citie besieged enemie till extreame famine compell eate dogges cat vermine noisome nature yet chuse endure difficulty rather yeeld doubtlesse loue lust well suffer themselues bee made slaues drudge rather would abandon returne lord vnfained renouncing ala must leaue shame double repentance length haue wearied themselues till owne rod hath made smart may tell vnfruitfulnes toilesome trade toilesome may truly say considering great adoe bring sinne ripenes perfection shift vndergo winde themselues woe miserie stead fruite sinne brings vpon good piece life adulterer first compasse fulfill vncleane lust hath done couer keepe himselfe shame make faire weather againe thriftlesse spendgood adoe make scrape together somwhat maintaine riotous humour brought beggerie must cast afresh hee may defray auoid gallowes base wretched life word true salomon saith ecclesiastes sinner god giueth paine eccles giues sowre sauce sweete meate painfull seruice sweet lust yet without god speciall goodnesse neither shall preuaile lewd person pull loue liking though cost deare though beare bring foorth paine sweate face found hiel build iericho though hee knew cost neuer dearly therefore happie god hath entertained house hold vnder gouernment neither word tedious matth last commandements grieuous trouble befall first know sting borne good cause shall goe vnder without disquiet vpholden grace count great ioy suffered people israel haue heard former verse kindly shew verse doings nature disposition sinful wicked person little trust god trouble forgot flie succour refuge earthly helpes stay tower dennes munition defence forsaking holy storie sheweth verse none preuailed neither preserue although shifting saued liues got saued foode much adoe kept staruing yet seeth miserie indured extreame pouertie bondage feare euen wee must know enough wicked person beware enemy fence themselues common trouble world first chiefly preserue themselues wrath god like fooles doe preuenting auoiding seldome escape free therefore lord prophecie habakkuk laugheth scorne made defence men obedia lord saith habak obediah thou dwellest cleft rock whose habitatio high saist thine heart shall bring downe ground though thou exalt thy selfe eagle make thy nest among starres yet euen thence bring thee downe saith lord doe see god hath thousand way fight plucked pharaos charet wheeles broke horse exod iud ester chro hoofes sisera drew vp great lord haman gallowes tooke heart ammonite moabites stead fighting iudah fell vpon slew one another weakened zenacherib slew angell one night hundred foure score king fiue thousand armie doe see say thus shew might mightie one many way beside hath done like also frustrate attempt hope day also spirit slumber cast vpon blindnesse hath taken hold cannot see beleeue like iudgements shall meete till haue felt smarted therefore let men make peace god first turne sin may also turne fierce wrath else make reckoning peace prosperitie length day deliuerance enemy trouble contrary euils fall vpon note presently yet hand alwaies iustly feared come oh proofe haue wee seene say former age haue done also many might haue done well prospered carefull reconciled god leane owne deceitfull dreames vaine hoping life still haue granted lasted thought paradise welfare soone cut reason men goe worke without god neither seeke fauour direction either action affliction therefore enterprise either crossed else cursed vse enioying trouble seeke either abide get good manner thus wicked man vnhappie way whether hee prosper either hee feares change else feare commeth vpon armed man therefore consider thinke beleeuing christian twice happie euen iudged miserable men world hee hath chose good part mary hath sought haue god side doth keepe fearefull iudgements sure defence time need maketh portion testified declared signe thereof cry insist vpon thing place haue done note hence seeing sought last haue first refuge may note another point vnthriftinesse foolish dealing men world needes goe trie crie prou heard whither goe doe farre fetched iourney haue taken yea full vexation wearisome besides note haue lost former labour conclude therefore aduice warning haue eares heare seeke lord may esay neither could obtaine thing vnlesse come faith probable whether cry lord sent man god mentioned vnto cannot certainly said sure god great mercie sent prophet preach bring true repentance speaking much like messenger sent father bochim repeates god benefit iudg deliuerances chargeth disobedience also word wee may see fit time preaching worke verse men inwardly stung smart affliction appeareth man god sent preach vnto n suffer themselues easily reproued sinnes cause themselues see cause word receiued doct heart readily whereas otherwise commonly hardned hate reproued yet men come prepared daily ordinarie preaching profiteth nothing danger like quench spirit dull edge good beginning grace certainly come passe carefull stirre vp daily men haue elbow roome thinke preacher yea god himselfe must beholding hearing god hath cooped narrow compasse roddes held ouer preacher welcome yea sought earnestly god plied confession prayer see though griefe haue great experience practise secure irreligious sort though mind god yeere long yet fall prayer deuotion great thundring lightning tempest doth astonish likelihood death vpon word heare daily without great reuerence terrible workes seene felt though seldome make hide themselues corner feare whose example see need lord hath bore eares soules terror amasing iudgements iob speakes chap word wound men finger made iob confused noise many water sound beating aire going one eare fast let boast themselues spared except applie themselues hearing god voyce minister skill doe message regard earnestnes either behind belong god must haue somewhat quicken appetite thereto make sinke deeply heart worke vpon powerfully good else woe vnto lord likelihood hath cast taketh pleasure greatly feared affliction shall come vpon yet reason former vnbeliefe contempt instruction shall doe little good thing doe lord laieth hand vpon let examine themselues touching affection word little moued time health prosperitie may easily finde blockishnesse carelesse vnprofitable hearing deadnes fulnes stomacke like earthlinesse wearinesse wandring drowzinesse c haue caused lord send trial vpon inward outward might grinde flat note blunt edge set sharper physicke word mercy chastisement none breake heart helpe hope vse extraordinary course looke hee preuaile priest going conscience bringing christ death moued resurrection therefore wisest put lord keepe memoriall haue done reproued deliuerances trouble calamitie saw might yea must haue lien ouerwhelmed drowned lord good time brought v deliuerances say bondage prison sicknesse paine body anguish torment conscience like oft haue enioyed v comfortable welcome vnto v ought daily remembred acknowledged heartie praise god well benefit hee marketh shall finde many great beside common may truly say god hath deliuered many death people forgetfulnes former age see oft put minde one deliuerance bondage egypt therefore prophet dauid holy penman psalmes behalfe people doe often call minde sometimes admiration astonishment god former deliuerances whole psalme witnesseth thus lord side may israel say men rose vp v swallowed v vp quick water ouerwhelmed v c oh forgetfulness like kindnesse god enough accuse godward though wee sinnes seeing wee cannot ignorant danger depth sorrow haue sometime note plunged wee lay cry complaining perhaps praying also vnder burthen would haue bin thought could euer haue forgot lord kindnesse euer haue brought v yet hath done yea againe againe done haue pharaos butler nine leaper forgot gen whereas haue learned many yeeres euen long wee reape benefit deliuerances yea euen till death praise god according taught father psalme let israel say long deliuerance god gracious psal mercie endureth euer haue spoke thankes deliuerance trouble adde benefit innumerable required v lesse thing alwaies wee thankfull bewraies blockishnesse thess vrged giue thankes aske wherefore haue wee receiued others enioy part common blessing doe c thankfulnes extraordinarie dutie lying onely vpon person rarely fauoured god lord requires thee doth equall thee nay inferiour thee benefit thou like swine takest commeth regarding whence thy turne serued thus deuourest many blessing thy brutishnesse godly christian would make matter daily praise inlarge greatnesse musing vnworthie least ill goe case want lord exercise vnthankfull blockes disease many deare seruants suffer paine colique strangurie burning feuers stone giue portion penury cleanenes teeth nakednes sicknes c would cease extenuating god benefit coparing themselues inriched greater themselues yea would thinke freedome chastisement great cause thankes though wanted many blessing full stomacke hony prou combe sweete others thinke dutie discharged haue tongue tipt formall word blessing thankes though heart loue set vpon blessing bestower therefore fountaine commeth bitter well sweete curse god easily least thing crosseth blesse hee pleaseth humour seasonable weather plentifull crop good successe affaire c whereby bewray thankes froth prophane person comming lust satisfied euen prayer also trouble extremity saint iames speakes third sort better former iames yet cannot brought season whole life thanksgiuing paul requireth neither yet thinke themselues worthie reproofe vnthankfulnesse say hope neither lying whoring wronging c suffer afflicted alwaies thankfull sinne make cannot repeate say word often answere say vnthankfulnes indeed direct sinne man farre greater high degree wrong offered god neuer goeth without heart life tainted many lothsome euils corruption therfore let example rule god people follow let whole life honouring god thanksgiuing beholding maiestie farre greater fauours stranger let prayer otherwise vsuall practise entertaine dutie also daily companion token vse god blessing boldnes loosenes wantonnes licentiousnes get strength life may fare better thankfulnes good meanes indeed thankfull man weigh aright onely good christian life voide goeth much disobedience shall see next doctrine tenth verse man god telleth lord charged vers serue god amorites yet obedience like thankes neglected shall need proofe like liues witnesse wretched people wee receiuing charge hath done v good could neuer haue desired v yet though tyed bond dutie refuse subiect obedient thing command v heathen centurion could say haue souldiers vnder say one matth goe goeth another come commeth seruant doe doth haue solemnely couenanted lord haue may say hired blessing serue wee turne backes vpon owne benefit strengthen selues grieue breach sabbath bring v egypt lord hath forsaken v deliuered v hand midianites vers lord looked vpon said goe thy might thou shalt saue israel hand midianites haue sent thee vers answered ah lord whereby shall saue israel behold father poore manasseth least father house vers lord said vnto therefore thee thou shalt smite midianites one man wee haue heard third part chapter turned lord reproofe man god though bee expressed appeareth god sent tidings deliuerance fourth part followeth wherein victorie ouer midianites promised promise amplified foure way first naming person deliuer gedeon verse next granting signe whereby hee might know hee spake vers third charge casting downe idolatrie giuen lord vers lastly gedeon attempted warre idolatrie destroyed god granting double signe whereby might know haue victorie end chapter thus much said generall fourth part chapter particuler branch follow first gedeon deliuer sense verse israel hand midianites declaration foure point also considered first angel
