appearing shape man saluting thus lord thee thou valiant man shall well appeare courage god giue thee waightie affaire follow gedeon thrashing corne hide midianites might preserue life thereby liues speech angel gedeon told deliuer people hand midianites verse note diuers thing first men wealth doct vers place gedeon meane tribe though hee spoiled necessarie helpes maintaining life rest also men say refuse labour husbandrie honest sort gedeon seruants yet thrashed corne himselfe thing reade haue onely practised old father mentioned scripture writer time free either religious ciuill affaire imployed cattell corne would spend precious time eating drinking play idlenesse abhorred euen religiouser yea ciuiller sort gentrie also doe take vpon honest imployments one sort reading diuine bookes chronicle statute whereby may benefit themselues others knowledge god law man haue read matter helpe gouerne doe good commonwealth although little looke religion haue recourse husbandrie namely first sort abraham isaac iacob others gedeon whose father ioash authoritie among people yet sonne contemned practise husbandrie may spoken iust charging many age bee borne worshipfully thinke base meane soeuer wealth either set appoint themselues time reading haue skill honest state husbandrie saue onely take rent liue yet commendable consume rest time idlenesse pastime worse whereas tillage keeping cattell planting field grafting like imployments delectable gainfull honest chace away many needlesse charge much ill company great waster ill spending time vaine exercise delight allowed men worship passe time manner euen must occupie talent till lord come luke passe time fleshly ease taking play idlenesse like prophane behauiour much lesse tollerable meaner person ill imployed beside seeing fit occasion lead speake therefore say little vnprofitable common sort people part setting aside skumme townes meane vnthriftie riotous godlesse poore liue vpon sweate others may say take paine enough man shall need spend much time perswading worke hardly beaten obserue due manner working end ground whereupon motiue penurie end couetousnesse manner brutish want would haue defray hard world bestow vpon lust maintaine themselues pride life neither worke thinke sin idle looke fruite labour saue bringing peny see whose commandement labour gene therefore goe vexation discontentment distrust gen endlesse carking tying god girdle giue successe desire get take granted loueth storme impure thing impure calling tit doe workes commonly shunne noysome lust temptation fruites sloth serue god prouidence neither sharpen fit themselues thereby religious exercise good duty auoide offensiue burthening others doe good relieue want c obey god nay speake truth shop market field far setting god eye much lesse doe beleeue god blesse worke well occupied duty meerely religious sinister end cause doe compell yeeld obedience god commandement doubtlesse men worth might liue themselues haue worker see word saying oh man happie need worke toyle doe liue easily enioy world bewray could bee content doe necessitie vrged doe otherwise therefore labour displeasing god idlenesse manner vse wofull thing an without curse god vpon learne better direction whereas goe worke faith beleeuing god beloued therefore god giue rest blessing successe others rise earely sit vp late drudge psal droile eate bread care drinke water affliction yet either thriue least much seeke souleprouision meane grace hope saluation end wearisome life beginning whereas shoud haue first work came yeeres discretion teach v wisedome giue god short formal pittance seruice church sabbath seeing great worke seeke therefore giue diligence thereto make saluation sure sixe day may wholly giue vp selues affaire without much minding god godlinesse lord haue v serue religiously well action ciuill religious owne nature holy scope third commandement tieth seruice god euery part liues common course liuing well second doth religious duty therefore must extended particuler calling greatest part time wherein liues taken vp proceede next sermon end proceed left thirtie eight sermon sixth chapter booke ivdges gedeon thus hard worke labouring doct vers angell came spake comfortably vnto bin praying like exercise terrifie teach v businesse work calling let v fro hauing comunion fellowship god neither doe hinder presence comfortable v may said calling themselues ordained bee meane base waightie therefore lord iacob gen iourney way hee going brother esau wrath rage hee made gospell effectuall lydia paul preaching seller purple rich yet truly conuerted god lord blessed two tribe calling habitation saying reioyce zebulon thy going thy prosperous voiages sea thou ishachar thy dwelling tent meaning thy quiet keeping home thy traffique businesse haue said let v marke long selues lawfull calling businesse hindrance v seruing god holily religiously thinke may goe prayer like exercise good manner euen note wee may although may truly say well learning ioyne wisely rightly together affection delight set egerly towards sauers earth gaine cause measure commonly kept therin dauid saying rather doorekeeper house lord dwell tent vngodly would haue said men attendance vpon basest worke lawful calling hindrance god seruice may word stay comfort many weake christian thinke much letted duty godlinesse euen vsing calling spirituall prayer like exercise end let vse hath said thus much vnto v wee note euer labour innocent well gouerned al earthly businesse workes calling may driue lord v haue alwaies v spirit truth direction comfort haue heard hath gedeon earthly affaire vsing aright kinde next thing verse though lord sent angell gedeon owne reliefe comfort also people yet wee see done till brought neere extremitie helpe man past refuge vnder god prouide themselues flying dwelling saue liues example gedeon whose father authoritie therefore none poorest yet point euen thrashing little corne aide nourishment wherof might flie midianites farre lasted carrie learne god seeth expedient wisdome sometime leaue godly long vnder crosse put end trouble ordinarily vseth doe according said psalme heauinesse may endure night ioy commeth morning psal againe commeth come tarrie knoweth heb ho well vseth doe wee commonly conceiue hope thereby affliction sicknesse disease losse hold v long therefore deuotion short cold neither honour god haue proofe faith patience neither experience another time beare trouble aright note cause lord sometime disappointeth false hope putteth v greater plunge holding v longer affliction end may search selues deeplier may throughly touched feeling sinnes rebellion turne faith amendment cause lord holdeth v sometime racke longer paine sicknesse penurie also bondage haue superioritie ouer v vse great disquiet wearying v pray long deliuered lord seemeth heare v pray letteth burthen remaine still vpon v wherefore thinke doth professeth afflicteth willingly neither delighteth therein lament yet lie paine griefe answere lord seeth wee yet tamed humbled sufficiently great hath pride heart inconstancie vnfaithfulnesse vncharitablenes also sinnes mindes set world excessiuely wandring diuers lust like returne course againe set libertie soone desire therefore doth seeke weane v like continuing vnwelcome cross vpon v wee cause depriued oft time deare companion mariage great part death selfe driuen owne habitation fearefull prison taketh much delight liuing yea tried sudden dearth oft time excessiue raine wet sometime drouth gedeon hard case driuen flie owne dwelling manner famished like god leaueth seruants cause haue mentioned also end deliuerance ease giuing may precious commeth hauing long desired thirdly end holdeth roddes longer ouer v patience may haue perfect worke v himselfe haue whole praise example hath said wee haue ioshua ioshua people hauing promise god assistance went men al making question speed well done iericho loc sudden smitten enemy astonisht till lord tels ioshua cause ye looke saith lord ye time see cause contrarie looke well matter ye shall find sacriledge among ye therefore ye cannot stand enemy though worke god yet found infection made lord crosse hope might purge sinne goe worke better manner many wonder lord saieth long vpon sicke bed whereas health say worship publike priuate cheerefulnes wheras lord aimeth matter would purge coldnes hypocritie carelesnesse sinnes accompanying euen good duty may returne thereto reuerence conscience reade paul great lifting vp heauen buffered vnwelcome temptation though hee prayed might rid yet lord suspended helpe paul might humbled fitted vse knowledge fruitfully followeth salutation angell lord thee thou valiant verse man marke ebbe low estate gedeon haue heard wonderfull heare newes brought lord note lamentable see distresse hee heard word message vttered much angel said lord loueth thee one deare one thee euen comfort preserue thee euen thy oppression therfore none shall thee hurt thee much said time calamitie afflicted person yet wee must know yeeldeth v like instruction euen great outward trouble inward disquietnes minde body would thinke god good men aduersaries yet god v hath made couenant yea loueth careth v deare precious vnto euen christ iesus sonne loue though without beautie among men withered branch despised esay esay therefore spouse canticle saith blacke comely ye daughter cant c meaning lord iesus husband esteemed whit lesse neither whit lesse amiable eye tanned sunne perfect beautie indeede sinne causeth lord afflict odious affliction selfe argueth make much v thereby would purge v misliketh affliction hath wrought kindly lord soone change hew restore former beautie iobs example witnesseth reason hauing testified loue freely vnto v effectuall calling shedding plentifully heart rom holy ghost saying soules saluation exceeding great reward god alsufficient binding v beleeue gen remaineth like himselfe changeth therefore hee requireth wee doe faith hold fast perswasion doth lord affected v depth affliction freed middest prosperitie hardly beleeued time crosse oppresseth v vse labour aboue thing iudg builded vp holy faith wee ouercome difficulty ioh world may thereby ouercome feare doubt also middest calamity namely tribulation wee may shrinke backe perswasion yet god v according holy man saith psalme yet god good psal israel euen vpright heart though outward shew might seeme otherwise againe deepe meant sorrowes cried psal vnto lord heard deliuered make one point two vse ought make word angell calling valiant man true god said yet gedeon vnlikely yet found afterwards let teach v giue god due namely beleeued al saith yea saith vnto v though able see feele much present time neither gedeon point worthie marked seeing god giueth note good testimonie fauour reuealeth thing readie ioyne part doe faint doubt wee see bodily eye thomas desired doe thing promised would whereas troubleth many wicked take occasion hereby despise see god seemeth regard hee abaseth let know mistaking matter false surmising god good meaning shall hurt fixe eye mindes vpon god vnchangeable constant al way also learne esteeme themselues according knowledge inward feeling haue god ancient loue regard time past enemy scorne neerer lord take away reproch well cleerely laid next verse therfore passe vers appeareth verse neere god gedeon yet saw concludeth seeing people land vnder oppression midianites could well neither could beleeue god confirmes himselfe therein reason though strength thus god indeed father saith brought egypt wrought many miracle hee people therefore could thinke said god spake gedeon heauie heart euen angell sent directly glad tidings let v examine word make benefit saying lord could doct midianites oppressed shewed great weaknesse said former verse affirming could beleeue hee saw whereby may see hardly faithfull perswaded lord affliction ready soeuer bee acknowledge time speake though none dan three child cast hoat burning furnace daniel lyon denne haue left worthy testimonie inuincible dan faith great extremitie many age past among v yet time calamitie must need said especially belong smartie corrupt nature vntoward hardly suffereth v giue credit god promise furthest letting v see beleeue diuell readiest worke vpon weakenesse time take opportunitie thereof feare terrifie v fiery dart vnbeliefe pierce heart whereby v oft vsually gedeon much lord euen neare v promise comfort incouragements sufficient content stay v yet wee see neither thinke seeing giue selues studie note consider aright point distrust vnbeseeming v burdensome v remedie must spake shall haue cause mention againe rest vpon word promise god though see present helpe christ said martha tell thee thou shouldest see glorie god thou canst beleeue ioh profane person want faith wonder measure god loue present flourishing liuing ease wealth enioying outward thing whereby lust may bee satisfied wonder iudge impossible deepe distress cross euer wade wee reade prince iehoram israel fore famine hearing prophet message god touching suddaine plentie bee next day hee said though lord would make windowes heauen powre downe king corne prouision yet thing could come passe else bold presuming great blindenesse hee apprehended derision prophecie like see daily brutish people hearing v preach doctrine depending vpon god sufficiencie faith euen affliction doe little better scoffe giue v wealth say corne wine giue v fill meate psal drinke money faith take whose therefore prosper merry nabal god giue suddaine blow strike downe flat neither haue armour beare dint thereof neither faith beleeue shall euer better much worse euill conscience make feare trouble disgrace either sicknesse losse vndoing haman friend comforted doe themselues hest hester thus thou sh lt surely fall yet iollitie haue apparance hope great confidence estate shall continue better better looke feare change till come say vnbeseeming beleeuer haue much tang strong vnbeliefe deepe sorrowes wit onely wish otherwise sort disalowed eagerly desire redresse impatiently beare burthen sinne hath brought vpon little vpholden god god vallies well mountaines loue king trial also appeare greater prosperitie vnwelcome crosse sweete contrarie flesh men haue eares heare doctrine beleeue god neare vnto yea euen middest suffering looke onely prosperitie god estate contrarie therefore god absent therefore man hand promise health fauour reliefe sicknesse trouble losse lift vp eye open eares voice though come man like themselues god hath promised bee thee leaue thee forsake thee cannot bee comforted saying still looke full heauily swearing gedeon euery one himselfe oh lord bee thou art euill trouble come vpon euer promise thee saith ioshua aduersitie betide thee nay rather haue sent euill thou mightest therein haue good proofe loue toward thee vpholding thee therein learne lesson yet better yesterday day euer odious v heb doe onely faile thus great searching trouble euen smaller also yet v ready accuse israelite question moued calling fleshpots garlike wildernesse sometime egypt murmuring foode manna wanted water thus tongue ready descant others censure goe vpon ill becommeth shew fainting vnder lighter cross strength faith small shall regarded god acknowledge men must doe may continue duty imposed vpon flesh philem familie yet must vnder colour cold backward dutie loue neglecting letting passe opportunity good offered vncertainties come waste much vpon lewd companie play gaming whoring drinking shall one day know cost lash spend good blessing god vnprofitable hurtfull manner whereby many member christ might relieued intertaining bestowing good part men good manner speake commended gedeon receiue men mutuall good edification euill carnal end therfore christian selfeloue worldlinesse fast handed scantie nigardly towards poore brother sauours small liking ioy haue communion saint fruite profession whatsoeuer loue god pretend practise loue mercie must approue godlinesse sound frothie yet apparent many man saueth vpright conscionable walking feare god hee made conscience mispend vpon lust many doe would well serue allot applie good v returne angell thus resolued gedeon signe mentioned departed cleerely sheweth end came vnto falleth oft time god seruants end one trouble vers briefe meaning ad larger vnfolding verse beginning another ariseth new trouble gedeon deliuered former doubt danger next verse shewed hee brought hee giueth god thanks trouble seene angell god therefore feared hee die maruell wee shall reade many place old father seene god might seene angel sore terrified afraid die vnperfit speech saying haue seene angell god hee ment also must supplie thus shall die iacob awoke gene perceiued lord present place lay dreamed night afraid said lord place aware hauing wrastled angell thinking man maruelled liued manoah knew angell lord spoken iudges said wife wee shall surely die seeing wee haue seene god people said moses mount sinai god came exodus deut downe afraid desired moses would intreate lord speake manner lest die reason feare sinne made adam afraid gen god voice sinned reioyced aboue thing heare thus darkenesse came sinne able abide light god presence conscience draue flie god almighty holy pure abide vncleannesse mortall men full euen tainted wilfull sinning god esteemed present death haue god present good prophet esay testifier saying woe vndone mine eies haue seene lord hoasts though confessed hee man poluted lipp neerer men come god lesse blemish smaller see esai themselues yet know indued grace others came iustly troubled conscience vnsound vnpure seeing god himselfe nature author life comfort therefore feared appearing gedeon place full mercy goodnesse many thing decclared vnto though knew lord euen brought himselfe saying ala haue seene angell lord face face teacheth high reuerence ought haue god oft doct vers come presence hath promised especially appeare present namely assembly people bee otherwise affected wee thinke pray vnto yet without terror consequence euery haue learned euery rather wee follow example seruants god reuerence god yet learning resist immoderate feare contrary lightnesse boldnesse many point doe thinke god sort highnesse maiestie doth require yet speake euen worst sort prophanenesse brutishnesse contrary extremity gedeon walke reuerence god proceedeth farre worse cause imagine wit meere grosse ignorance infidelity appeareth behauiour publike place god specially present priuat whither resort pleasure businesse one passe time sleeping prating laughing gazing wandring mind like vnreuerence drunkennesse wantonnesse gaming rotten cursed speech behauiour cause extreamitie great vnreuerence haue said least ignorance meane prouoketh see deuotion though poperie shamelessely calles mother thereof diuelishnesse length desparation contrary excesse gedeon arose beholding god amisse much obseruing glory without goodnesse reuerencing god either word work fruite meere blindnesse darkenesse vnbeliefe returne seruants god ought carrie themselues high reuerence place specially worship prayer word sacrament indeuour doe thus yet deepely thinke consider owne vilenesse wretchednesse god greatnesse glorious maiestie flesh humane nature christ without applying suffering obedience v faith cannot without danger sense swallowing vp gedeon oft time ouercome almost ouerwhelmed doe best wee thinke christ able easily led carried spirit bondage feare therefore may thinke superstition poperie hath caused people carnall feare god slauish terror seruile worship bane poison infinite thousand people doctrine driueth dispaire leading men horror god wrath sheweth way escape stand stead iustling aside vnfained faith onely knit v god christ cause v pray draw neere absurd sort seeke fulfill lust heart whereby wee multiply bring trouble vpon liues thing therefore may note gedeon doct soone faith ouerwhelmed affliction though angell prooued good contentment man doubted feare last seeing angell stay seeing point hand know could deliuer israel told beleeued must die time came yet considering said affirmed resolutely hee die yet israel deliuered euen much apostle bee rooted also bee confirmed abound faith col thanksgiuing let v consider end fruit corruption thus feare doubt wee beleeue reason god promise affirming cannot performed wee see likelihood false rather confuteth husband message angell concludeth doubtlesse shall liue die word god worth resting vpon owne conceit thus bee v note alwaies carried full saile faith cast downe neuer men neuer good meates yet bodie prospereth similitude full corrupt humour doe thriue good action wee take hand goe fraught clogged sin knowne suspected v till filthie corruption purged therefore also saint peter requireth men put away maliciousnes guile like annoiance first new borne pet babe desire sincere milke word may grow thereby sore wound bodie though neuer good salues laid thereto healed thereby vnlesse corruption hurtfull humour similitude first drawne v onely true generall reformation church also particuler member person order lord vseth fitting people vse first mortifieth quickens neither could lord iesus haue risen againe iustification rom first died sin transgression let would haue sound comfort dutie first learne obedience subdue bring subiection rebellious euill heart lust currant bee zealous profession yet manifest number subtill hollow hearted dissembler deceiuers grant ignoranter sort feruent false religion blind deuotion yet rest deceiue world zealous wilfull open apparent sinnes thus day doe men storme rage minister god god ordinarie instrument gedeon extraordinary see content dally good earnest striueth pull ignorance formall could worship god vncleanenesse whatsoeuer sinne cleaue vnto idoll baal serue poore man gedeon adoe saue himselfe furious eager multitude minister hath many place gospell hath preuailed defend himselfe swarme hornet flie eares ready sting might rather haue said wild beast deuoure cursed reprochfull slander virulent tongue casting baal ground also appeareth many gedeon vpright hearted men openly shew dislike idolatrie could easily find light vpon guiltie partie counted slight inquiry eminent pietie saul stature taler people could lie hidden odious man many hee yet could haue seene beholding also grone wracke perished wee see eiesores odious one good professor gospell companie prophane hickescorners troublesome life leade amongst baited vexed pleasure made laughing stocke sampson philistims whose sake yet suffered lord liue may come repentance neere inough likelihood vtterly destroyed brought naught may reade story gene genesis ten righteous men sodome city consumed yet though haue benefit sticke sweare might liue merrily without disturbance therefore god hath prouided better people muzled mouthes tiger beares may professe gospell without danger feare pursuit scorne better commonly wing protect inferiour sort base spitefull person let see acknowledge great libertie release vse wisely inioy church samaria iudea actes galilee booke act lest god take prop ornament protector make say many doe full heauily would gladly zealous fruitfull profession ala cannot soone peepe doores pelted againe beaten back frownings disgrace opppositions mightier selues point anon thus farre outrage people answere ioah verse sense next two verse wise magistrate first suppresse bridle rage people said ground groue altar bullock pertaine ioash cleare also vpheld idolatrie thus lightly suffer act sonne gedeon passe vnpunished man perhaps aske find fault people seeking punish trespasser baal answere ioash certified god likely gedeon sonne sampsons father marriage sought philistion woman lord howsoeuer hee doth shew god stirred vp fauourer sonnes hee doth three reason driue people hold beates backe purpose attempt first reprooues boldnesse priuate men without calling take vpon bee reuengers baal quarrell contrary god secondly threatens feare god iudgement presently thirdly ironicall speech baal saying god let pleade himselfe shameth driues enterprize said layingout verse giues name according answere hee made people name ierrubbaal generall occasion offered consider strangely god doct verse wrought gedeon enemy beyond al expectation stirring vp ioash assist oppose would haue said people would haue borne downe gedeon backed strongly hauing idolatrous magistrate side behold lord turnes heart pleaseth make stand defense sonnes act whose cruell iudge like bee condemne death mad people required looked wee must thinke small courage doe thus though magistrate concourse people ordinary iudiciall manner mutinous vnlike demetrius case dianaes worship god hee saw meet caused lysias heathen captaine become protector paul iewes paul himselfe preacher gospel persecuted also hand yet shortned like good church incouragement people according saying wise man man way please lord make enemy prou friend consequent thing feared like worke make worke contrarily euen good furtherance besides god turnes heart men riuers water example haue cyrus restorer iewes worship god pilate wife achisth dauid c way onely particularly may see ioash idolater instructed god wickednesse soone hee able resist stand teacheth ignorance vnbeliefe causeth many practise maintaine either false worshipping god like wickednesse though denie doe worse though know euill yet doe wilfullie better hoped lord vouchsafe mercie ioash shall soone bee changed former ill course abhorre stand deadly maintained practised therefore detestable state liue popery much seeke brought hearing gospell preached therefore lie still therein confusion doe like vnto whereas many kind sinne brought preaching turned god true repentance agreeable whereunto paul persecutor blasphemer tim c lord mercie vpon ignorantly noting one cause sect conuerted sauiour saith ioh knew euill therefore sinne remained incourage liue ignorance least punishment condemnation men preferre ioh darknesse light whatsoeuer cause christ saith matthew iudgement tyrus zidon shall bee easier corazin matth bethsaidah day god comming repented instructed vse comfort affect ignorant hoping thereby escape god wrath whereas rather consider ignorance wil procure yea chiefe cause sinne causeth yea easie hard matter simplie wilfully ignorant get knowledge faith would applie themselues hearing therefore seeing persist blindnes cause inuincible ignorance grow vpon themselues shal seuerely punished obstinate disobedience contempt let god hath mercifully enlightned consider pitie thousand lie darkenesse praying god preuent light wondering iohn god reueal himselfe rather world also may learne hence god sheweth mercie one doct kindred family oft redounds many rest one raised promotion rest fare better god reuealing himselfe gedeon father familie brought knowledge true god reason whereof double first god blessing vpon seed stock righteous secondly god hath wrought graciouslie one kindred family commonly wrought great desire doe good rest great tendernesse loue paul professeth roman heart desire israel may rom saued although doe alway preuaile saluation followeth god election nature yet often doth otherwise iuster condemnation proofe sauiour christ himselfe may bee example brought disciple kindred religious hath taught v gospell compared leuin spreaddeth thus one god hath well seasoned grace many rest haue like manner made partaker grace ioyfull sight behold would poperie one draw many wished might seene common receiuing gospell effectually rest familie affinity say often seene though commonly one city two tribe prophet saith meaning yea often seene godly abigail coupled nabal iob foolish woman truly said many good parent child vngratious tell samuel face yea many parent also badly disposed sam euen child shall rise vp condemne go knowledge feare god wedded take scorne learne nay well would learne good teacher abused authoritie curbe discourage child third sort wofull estate like father like child head foote ignorant brutish vngodly esay saith ioash answer let v consider thing people occasion offered speech vsed note doct vers property worthie magistrate wit defend god true worship cast downe idolatrie oppose himselfe seditious cauillers wicked men euen vnto death countenance courage power beside affection ought manifested magistrate defence stablishing god seruice also meaner men commonnesse euil strength hath got al place dulleth edge day slacknesse matth coldnesse magistrate truly cause iniquitie aboundeth euill hauing vpper hand doe cause publike officer iustice priuate person vnable resist vnwilling goe punish may thanke themselues dauid professeth himselfe betimes would cut psalm house god wicked scorner maligner sound worship worshipper god oh wished indeed pray earnestly wee iustly complaine gouernours dauid minde rest might liue vnder authoritie honest quiet life free noisomnes goates horne stinch pester sheepe would faine liue peaceably serue lord common sort see swearing blasphemie contempt sabbath drunkennesse abomination swarme many place seeth dare boldly doe shall scorned grieued see may note sinne ought odious vile doct account much grieued behold maintaining stand ioash armed idolatry demaunds blind people would stand plead baal yet might haue replied plead thou thy selfe hast done lately whose groue baal placed case altered ioash euen paul preached gospell persecuted notable token repentance men affection desire quite changed euill thing could drawne yea cor breake holy indignation themselues sin committed god although know forgiuen surely vpright hearted man would thinke abhorre sin hateth grieueth see another deceiued held snare hath bin holden therfore count absurd maintaine delight whereas contrary day may bee seene hee diligently marked stand well minded may soone noted shamefull boldnes likewise marked word ioash saying ye plead baal doth let die morning although saw magistrate yet blind stood defence idolatrie euen may say great boldnes growne vp age doe euils openly men woman former age haue blushed secret sinne zimri cozby like also dare reuile raile vpon speake lewd doings truly verifie saying wicked men deceiuers tim waxe worse last day perilous time day world groweth neerer end sinne waxed measure sinfull number sinnes see new addition fashion daily measure also meane greedines impudencie pertinacie sinner ashamed euils harlot prouerbs wipeth selfe cleane filthinesse virgin wee see whore growne time degree boldnes tamar iudged whore father couered face gen maske long agoe pluckt onely bee occupation spirituall adulterer day farre ashamed shew face thought master trade dare spit face modestie reprouers said aged men wealth haue somewhat beare euen youthes sex whose honour blushing euen heathen called colour vertue brasen faced inferiours al sort take vp cursed speech lord psal ouer v oh doth see lord marke set vpon shame sorow belliesful misery come daily euery one course wofull end furthermore well answered ioash let baal plead himselfe doct meaning need cannot shame pleade god could plead owne cause elia also like king case said blind people may said maintainer idolatrie like abomination idol god worship let keepe themselues fire need thinke doings good maintaining reasoning stockes let waite see end thereof come well set worke plead farre helping neede hee could reuenge owne cause would deface like master serue lastly verse former gedeon seruing god doct commendably commanded also hee name commended worthie person beleeuer yet called seditious heb themselues indeede therefore hee counted worthie die yet meane whereby liue note wicked charged neuer iustly euill doings yet euer returne accusation vpon accuser example doctrine god word preacher thereof doe god blessing become meanes outward instrument much good turne euill way thereby dissenting among rest see wise fall commonly exclamation teacher follow doctrine troubler people themselues haue done euill euen papist crie side disturbed disquieted may suffered serue god would bee glad doe priest set foorth pedlary ware sale ignorant superstitious sometime deceiued fellowes many place still doe lesse palpably simon magus people samaria sorcery bewitched suffer idolatrous worship hand bee ouerthrowne say people said ieremy worship queene ierem heauen moone starres foolish people ephesus cried mad mood great diana ephesian act yet vnlike make tumult sedition accused paul companie leaue returne began thus crie wicked lewd doings bee reproued iustly pulpit preacher seditious make strife tumult come draw people whereas quiet well enough draw euen forsake companie speake leaue cursed manner behauiour depriued therefore make part good cry seditious thus elia charged trouble land taught true seruice god reproued idolatrie shewed troubler land list know euen obedient commandements lord may see charged troublesome person whose preaching bewraieth bad sort therefore incensed euill deedes brought light neither obey doctrine though bee hated greatest part saying sauiour teacheth came send peace earth sword debate againe matth come set fire earth desire alreadie kindled luke ciuill distension trouble follow vpon preaching professing filthie heart rebellious sort stinch commeth dunghill away better sauour ioash called sonne ierubbaal baal shall contend doct vers reproch memoriall brought idol contempt hee called ierubbosheth sam sheweth farre ashamed owne sonnes fact reioyced idolatrie foile lord gaue occasion gedeon bringing midianites assistant land preuaile get victorie ouer trusting word god lately well strengthened prepared goe lord armed drew helpe together tribe neere vnto seene text israel againe restored great multitude thus trouble gedeon otherwise feare doct vers midianites prouoking israelite battell many hurt yet god would see haue true worship set vp idolatrie cast first haue heard wise men world though allowed would yet haue deferred till victorie note hereby much pleaseth yt post great waighty comandements worship seruice earthly affaire bodily businesse though waighty time enough discharge lay aside exercise praier hearing reading like owne pleasure selues may see meete expedient cheerefully may goe one wee haue well discharged whereas deferring leaue vndone altogether sometimes appetite much quailed returne therfore reade great neede make possible speede rescue church great distresse time yet hester sought lord fasting hester prayer went king went great courage helpe preuailed otherwise v part first serue selues though thing lawfull seeke owne profit pleasure great sinne yet hauing done also least occasion easily brought omit lord due altogether many time haue said least performe slackly coldly halues good vndone appeareth true common course men many dealing worst namely one haue set order praying house perhaps doe omit altogether afterwards yet part meete performe dutie god haue serued selues filled belly first case wee commonly oppressed note drowsinesse sleepe man would think vtterly vnmeet accompanie god seruice therfore little pleasing farre better dispose fitter time businesse yet thing bee left vndone wee must take heed speake like take hand lest giue iust suspition thinke thing good enough lord publike worship god church hath giuen better example doe duty god refresh ourselues abraham seruant hauing message master doe diligently follow executing hee would take owne necessarie repast gen hunger wearinesse till faithfully discharged businesse iehosaphat neerely driuen moabits ammonits first seeke lord fasting prayer would take weapon hand let marke lost thereby whether hee could possibly haue found like helpe present speedie following businesse policie power hee could haue made yet adde would lay burthen needlesly conscience man necessitie cannot auoided man may omit greater dutie lesse could else done opportunitie watched taken doe afterwards conclude matter let practise gedeon teach v rule wit giue precedencie alway duty best price withall greatest necessitie call necessitie commanded absolutly alwaies sinne neglect omit watch beleeue repent c may left laid aside cause heare word season season commanded also doe earthly businesse sixe day yet omit time sin commanded time done may case time dispensed omitted euer necessarie humbled sin beleeue god also loue feare god patient like duty first commandements absolute duty charged vpon v generally alwaies businesse may preferred whatsoeuer delay admitted though vnder colour serious returning thereto afterward take libertie selues case god curseth v satan get ground v worke lay aside commonly naught worth done best manner therefore wee see felix pretending would heare paul againe leisure thing terrified conscience durst heare longer present neuer leisure heare againe seeing ought might second sort duty prayer familie priuatly selues like although duty simple necessitie action may euer hinder yet let haue solemnely couenanted lord vse seene great cause thereof fruite thereby beware winde themselues course vpon vnwarranted occasion shall neuer want one shift salue matter till breach growne great slender patch mend nay griefe slight repentance scarcely repaire wee see close smooth lid frame warpe easily brought leuelnes againe god shall teach wisedome case lawfull omission leane much long owne till haue laid themselues vnderfoote chiefest duty thing rightly considered ought haue said preferred word sauiour patterne prayer matth clearely shew mentioneth matth petition tending good soule body hee command v aske thing concerne glory god stand comming kingdome possible good might aske pardon sinne deliuerance euill necessary life without respect god might bee honoured great sinne doe saluation man soule hazzarded neglected might bee rather stand comparison moses paul request people forgiuenes conuersion may appeare secondly midianites banded themselues israel doct like haue spoiled liues good almost done consider change estate subiect euen vnto loosing good thing god hath inriched v make liues comfortable oh health peace abundance well married feare god accompanying doubtlesse little paradise wee liue earth wee note may looke comparison may see enioy liue among wise acknowledge giue god praise bringing foorth much fruit yet god affoord v could vse well good seeing men nestle iohn themselues vpon vncertaine thing little wisdome doe bold tempting god see strange alteration fall liues estate changeth say men age sickness disease onely subiect towardnesse hope likelihood goodnesse sometime therefore haue rooted growne forward therein neuer waxe much worse worse affliction much disguized time cruell enemy domesticall forraigne meane world haue oppressed may easily bee suite debt note suretiship prison haue molested commonly fall vnrulinesse disobedience child vnfaithfulnesse leaudnesse seruants vnpeaceablenesse vnappeasablenesse neighbour landlord great iniuries offered shall vexe together sicknesse calamity meet say mothes garment haue eaten beautie estate decaied consumed case say altered changed neuer person elimelech famine constrained change dwelling good dauid owne sonne almost driuen kingdome euen much sundry forementioned way shall afflict bad men doe shew vncertaine hold haue yet haue hold better thing greatest price heere among men together reproches disgrace befall say nothing sundry kind death cut sufficient proofes say haue good cause beare low saile note euen highest thinke haue little haue looke change prosperitie make heauen habitation go hence earth pompe beautie small vncertaine rich indeed glory thing must haue end yet commonly god prouoked much vnseasonable change men prosperitie misery kindly inioying god good liking though sometime god afflict thus end iob c many god deare one prouoke turne blessing delight temporall wife child good beautie strength c sorrowes punishment must else would bee worse let also beware breake least sinne wilfully committed repented speedily cause procure themselues roughly handled commonly euen like men particularly grosse abuse outward thing themselues subiect bee deformed disguized strange rare affliction god hath good thing store also soone strip thereof ieremie saith person iewes lam euen hee withholdeth altogether thought good say though somewhat argument hath said followeth god furnished gedeon gift spirit wisdome courage whereby according hee said goe thy power thou shalt saue israel hand midian new fitted teacheth god appointeth seruants charge businesse hee inableth goe ministreth helpe accordingly paul saith farre greater tim worke gedeons god counted faithfull put plainely powerfully iust challenging boldly take vpon waightie calling doth concerne sauing destroying soules men hauing furniture preaching gospell soundly clearely neither care looke way grace knowing bountiful rewarder heb pay master yea godly would take hart themselues god businesse considered lord causeth many resister enemy goodnesse turne practise cleaue vnto reuel profession worship feete serue god worthie fruit innocency though procured onely good report generall allowance draweth others heartie intertainment truth loue thereof much noted somewhat point ioash vpon entrance threashing flore dew might come fleece onely might drie vpon earth wherein maruelled promise god confirming doubt aske signe answere vpon due consideration thing though may like inough hee altogether void blame yet hee herein tempt god asked signe christ authoritie desired onely haue faith confirmed thereby would otherwise haue wauered man gospell beleeued yet prayed lord helpe mine vnbeliefe gedeon besides lord granted mar request without reproouing like hee would haue done gedeon doubted last rather thus perswaded reckoned epistle hebrewes among heb commended faith herein consider weakenesse beleeuing occasion doct vers gedeons asking double signe louing kindnesse lord pitying v therein bringing v euen yeelded selues may said though wee beleeue god promise yet ariseth naturally v daily continuall weakenesse faith partly yeelding much carnal reason partly ineuitable frailty note flesh fighting spirit v hereof faine wrastle battell cumbat daily vphold preserue weake faith otherwise would soone faile giue ouer experience haue oft found selues example peter comming water christ martha raising lazarus dauid complaining sadnes heauines heart disciple much ascribing christ bodily presence hundred scripture doe testifie much may said selues yet feare frailtie assault haue cause daily doe learne rest god deare seruants god wee much staied heart well eased thereby respect former time say little particuler contrary wee haue obtained god gift beleeuing freed condemnation wee shall haue eternall life rest looke daily reuiue heart hearing word often whereby feeling god fauour reuiued quickned also remembring applying god promise day day time time labour also reioyce therein may kept holy compasse thereby wee shall euer flitting stand vncertaine stay shall onely first beleeuing least doubt euen haue stablished setled therein first assurance easily obtained ordinarily till haue experience god louing note kindnesse towards v owne vprightnes euen may say beleeuing god promise temporary thing shall faint therein without forementioned exercise hardly beare cross goe vnder paine sicknesse haue victorie ouer speciall sinne mortifie corruption hath much preuailed v pursued earnestly promise grace bee oft vsually recorded feruent prayer god strength denied much fruite shall follow shall sensibly perceiue wee get ground selues behalfe grow neerely acquainted minde god grant v preuaile difficulty yet wee grow thinke shall neuer obtaine grace corruption outgrow discouragement well beare cross finde blessing calling notwithstanding vse publike priuate meanes yea wee doe minde looke thing slightly also may well know fruit expected come thereof cause destitute true faith often time new begin thing long going standing stay small profiting subduing striuing vnbeliefe commeth barely altogether frailtie would gladly preuaile cannot great part yeelding temptation occasion drawing v violently sinne conscience causeth man hold vpon promise faile exceedingly much giuing place carnall reason perswadeth wee neede note giue attendance thing meane wee see greatly set backe thereby manifest without diligent heed taking strengthening faith easily grow distrust god promise much hearken voyces shall oft heare sounding eares neede take paine haue head beaten occupied whereas diligence giuen thereto attaining excellent gift willing offendings god weaken selues small need haue may easily see consider wee fall doubting vntowardnes heart without adding sinne faith fitly compared fire may well goe negligence adding thereto wilfulnes quenching thereof sinne hardly giuing credit god aggrauated hereby deale men great matter wee easily satisfied beleeue wee haue word writing manifesteth plainly distrust towards god nothing inough stay v vnlesse thomas may grossely feele see desire nay say compasse matter owne pleasure profit preferment oh bold full courage although must goe vnder perill losse like thing obtaining suffer difficultie danger much stretch faith beleeue hope waite god hath promised though hee giue v neuer great cause incouragement good euidence testimonie note former experience others selues yet wee haue heart therefore wise let v much stronglier built vp confidence god fauour promise take paine abide therein pray watch occasion vnsetling chaine vp great ascribing haue done sense reason shall see selues well propped vp vpholden though haue promise miracle doe gedeon one signes gedeon asked wee haue heard followeth gedeon desired one signe fleece might moistened dew ground drie desired dew vers earth fleece might drie signes asking god yeelded would haue easily done approued teach weaknes timourousnes wee wisedome repaire god make mone feeling burthen say confidence lord strengthen faith staied eased distemper whatsoeuer left selues forsaken many said haue learned doe therefore whole life conflicting doubt feares rising anew mindes endlesly malice diuell disquieting molesting hindring resolution holy boldnesse god alloweth commandeth whereas enemie buzzeth presumption hold promise forgiuenes life otherwise doubtingly fact gedeon earnest doubled requesting strength confirmation god dash quench proofe god answering prayer one time wee learne vse meanes againe like manner often neede shall require another time knowing god honour beleeued promise stand good liking often sue giue v cleere insight belong v though wee tye certaine measure may staied neither omitted gedeon second suit commeth deprecation owne boldnes importunitie god must warily vnderstood hereby followes god angrie gedeon bold making request gedeon sinned highly knew would anger god rather inward feeling vnbleefe hee desired forgiuen supplied confidence also deepe humilitie considering great libertie sillie worme might speake freely almightie admitted familiaritie maiestie vttereth speech full reuerence angrie thy seruant hee say iust thee bee displeased weaknesse beleeuing lord pardon bee angrie seeing craue strength thou giuest leaue doe let desire granted infirmitie couered respect named saint god scripture haue euer vsed themselues thus reuerently humbly lord respectiuely gedeon doth example abraham shewes praying gedeon wise able vse priuiledge al seeke knowing base mettle euen dust wormes priuiledge say yet admitted presence god glory admire humilitie giues v accesse oh affect v yea reuerence draw v euen poore man come often friend borrow money come saucily loosely common matter little beholding caries thanks reuerence countenance behauior story gedeon purposed say concerning selues haue say lord namely respectiue child ready eare giueth prayer yea particularly point strengthening faith gedeon twise desired signe confirme god granted shew haue said could pray long grace precious granted v would bee glad inioy weaknesse fainting doe plie god feruent request may note setled belieuing either power ouer speciall sinne shal giuen v hope patience beare trouble oft god behalfe earnest wee finde god would furnish v accordingly aboue wee could looke thus abraham dauid paul others grew strong faith whole chapter seventh chapter booke ivdges vers ierubbaal gedeon rose vp earely people pitched beside well harod hoast midianites north side valley hill moreh lord said vnto gedeon people thee many giue midianites hand lest israel make vaunt mee say hand hath saued therefore proclaime audience people say whosoeuer timerous fearefull let returne depart earely mount gilead returned people mount giliad two twentie thousand ten thousand remained lord said vnto gedeon people yet many bring downe vnto water trie thee say thee man shall goe thee shall goe thee whomsoeuer say vnto thee man shall goe thee shall goe brought downe people vnto water lord said vnto gedeon many lap water tongue dogge lappeth put themselues euery one shall bow downe knee drinke put apart number lapped putting hand mouthes three hundred men remnant people kneeled downe vpon knee drinke water lord said vnto gedeon three hundred men lapped saue deliuer midianites thine hand let people goe euery man vnto place people tooke victual trumpet sent rest srael euery man tent retained three hundred men hoast midian beneath valley summe generall part chapter first bee considered summe part chapter particular view taken afterwards summe may laid part three first god made gedeon send people saue three hundred backe againe many battell verse second god assured againe victorie dreame one enemy interpreting another gedeons hearing verse third victorie selfe ouer god gaue end chapter first part chapter come first part difficultie hee sense first part pitched army ready goe meete enemy lord caused send away excepting three hundred lest giue ouercome midianites owne strength three hundred hee also appointed taking ten thousand remained sending two twenty thousand away gedeons drawing neere enemy armie wee may see sense first verse doctrine note hee confirmed faith hee obtaine victorie whereabout doubted much although grant meet staied great meanes god vsed purpose yet see faith commonly failes triall greatest danger neerest therefore heartned incouraged saw great number midianites small armie comparison meete fight cleare well perswaded truth god promise cast confidently thereupon thus faith grew doct vers shewed selfe apparantly haue much laboured belieue preaching gospell haue selues also much occupied attaining thereto say look fruit thereof namely haue proofe faith indeed common difficulty wherein time past wee haue bee foiled found almost impossible sometime least vnlike preuaile faith euen say looke haue strength thereof otherwise former time example man seeth sinnes guilt though truly humbled euen lift vp hand faith heauen lay hold mercy god christ also time temptation resist temptation beleeuing god wil giue v victorie againe man must lose good life hee hath gospell else forsake cleaue fast vnto beleeuing shall great gainer thereby man wanteth meat drink apparrell yet euen acknowledge god prouidence though weake meanes rest peaceably like manner hauing long heard word make profitable selues belieuing grow point wearie rouing wandering sleeping discoursing disputing like vnpleasant flesh say samuel speake lord thy seruant heareth ready rest thy whither reproouing commanding incouraging yea vpholden guided reformed kept within compasse whither terror commandements promise ought part dutie readie say euery one himselfe lord haue learned worke note calling vse peace prosperitie behaue selfe secret others walke throughout life innocently fruitfully belieuing shall lose fruit labour blesse thy name ready bee put triall altogether time past occasion offered thy maiestie welcome incouraged stoope meekely vnder mine affliction see thou hast sent belieue thou art readier assist mee bearing thou wilt giue good issue therefore farre plunged note amazed trial haue euer learning neuer come knowledge yea alway child going helpe others neuer alone propertie changeling thus wee shall find good martyr found god called stake endured fire though hee could endure flame candle singe much finger like haue proofe faith thing much bee reioyced good signe faith groweth strengthened otherwise hath time past according saying apostle colossian rooted grow coloss faith ye may abound therein might say many thing particularly impatience anger wrath vncleane vnchast desire excessiue feare trouble conceit terchinesse rash iudging many haue pursued chace disliking condemning long time oft praying looke victorie ouer faith prayed rest perswaded meanes shall bee vsed v vaine looke rootes fast setled heart loosened v dailie shall appeare euen new occasion shall bee offered shall prouoked offend liuely shew though wee shall neuer vtterly void reliques ex crements corrupt rebellious heart faith better confirmed word commandeth v purge man would thinke honour christian boast iangle faith faile triall ridiculously easie religion learne might goe payment man might say tongue thine lustily bragged faith zebul said gaal cap also see though gedeon promise god doct ouercome midianites yet hee lie still serueth god prouidence furnishing himselfe armie good could conueniently goe ought vse ordinary meanes bring worke passe appointed v god though wee haue promise good successe yet againe side attribute thing detract god due large fortie five sermon seventh chapter booke ivdges goeforward left verse god tels vers gedeon people armie many giue victory vnto lest ascribe themselues speech lord sheweth vnfit wee bee haue great matter committed v trust gouernment wee note lam prone abuse therefore faine ofttimes take away many good thing v lest much hurt v though might wee could rightly vse turne great good benefit others people israel gone altogether battell got victory would haue acknowledged god haue giuen owne power skill yet wee know miserable little gedeon himselfe complained distresse low brought one would thinke vnfit inongh ascribe ought themselues ought rather hauing brought bondage yea might also easily haue seene cause giue glory god two thirtie thousand especially many thousand fainthearted souldiours subdued hundred thousand person odious people would haue abhorred leaud conceit quality themselues remained vnder bandage yea asked feeble respect enemy lord would destroy midianites would thinke god fought mightily oh would haue confessed lesse seene cause great thanks true till victorie gotten themselues foiled midianites may saul ieroboam vnderlings would haue counted greater priuiledge themselues highly indebted god hee would haue bestowed lesse matter kingdome vpon got shewed vnable made partaker great felicitie wee see fit haue weighty glorious matter kingdom committed vnto euen wee see meane beggarly person neuer knew belonged wealth dignitie yet raised vnto cannot beare nay ground cannot beare bee set horsebacke ride reason euen till breake owne neckes whereas ingenuous welbred nature aswell carry themselues condition especially education grace meet together poorest bace simple surely many v hardly beare little wealth small reuenues hundred nay note score saul could kingdomes though ere wee lowly meane owne eies fellowes therefore said may see soone abuse god benefit good liberty bestoweth vpon v rich health promotion credit would might say spirituall gift also euen pharaoh princely estate greatnes rich man gospell wealth herod luke actes praise commendation giuen people challenge nothing god hand due debt v trouble sorrow fruite sinne lamentable case lord sparing v much sundrie calamity furnishing v benefit diuers kind draw v know loue belieue honour cannot al soone inioy thing ought worth wee set vp brustles wee forget cursed estate whence came kick vp heeles lord yet easie bee seene estate men kind god benefit lord loue v seeth better way taken v good take away liberty againe v let humour seeing breed pleurisie v crosse v lest steale desire seeke aboue thing florish haue world happie bee counted especially owne reckoning neither shew themselues wisest men end like may bee seene weigh come yet neere noted text onely men abuse god benefit way one way also vaineglorie said people mentioned would haue done therefore holy story addeth reason lord would haue many goe battell least say preuailed owne might haue taken god honour themselues wee learne god denieth doth giue v attempt many great meanes sometime doe yet good successe least hee wont doe although man reason bee likelihood enough yea great man would snatch glorie himselfe nabuchadnezzar said great babel haue built zenacherib dan e king blasphemed lord captaine rabshakeh benhadad grosly got himselfe boasting would doe hee answered wisely manner let girdeth harnesse boast himselfe putteth iames wrote foolishly concluded successe bragged gaine iames knew haue would haue done thinke alreadie enioyed also strange whereas wee pretend wee might partake blessing wee would bee much thankfull seruiceable lord conuict v dissimulation falsehood telling v know owne heart wee would bee proud bold vainglorious lord bewray v poison lurkes v thinke himselfe great wrong cutting many short desire might like doe seruice enioying whereas ala knowes hee loseth honour himselfe dealing men nay hee hath much adoe meanes keepe men destruction least deepe dishonouring returne true god denie much vainglorious person desire would neuer giue due take themselues insomuch wee see doe onely vaunt wealth birth strength like haue onely good qualitie prouident husband keepe promise pay due owing glorie thereof disgrace faile therein though doings may cast dung face shame giue vnto god due promise selues nothing vpon condition god acknowledge wee giuer one hath right dispose hath giuen v denied successe wee hope bring passe let v token confesse lord may iustly ioynt v fume fret raile curse much lesse vtter much word others thinke accursed wee see another fault ephramites gedeon fault ephramites wit enuie enuied honour got victory whereby though sustained hurt neither worse better yet could beare gedeon haue glory may see foule property enuie greefe enuie sadnesse prosperity namely bee equal poore man enuieth king hee may bee grieued himselfe wanteth good thing king hath enuie may note difference betweene hatred malice one side enuie end wee haue heard one may word hatred therefore greefe conceiued one cause least thinke ahab hated micaiah king hee prophesie good euill tooke appeareth also contrary word holy scripture hated without cause say enuie greefe equal eminency prosperity haue aboue v meane kindred estate yeeres dignity gift like v cause enuie wee troubled though hurt danger comming towards v enuie another affection wit feare cankred stomacke cannot beare one note better selues bee lifted vp high commended farre aboue v cursed mind v wee cannot bee willing another fare well neuer worse wee haue euill eye reioyce mary luk elizabeth mutually reioyce one welfare blessing god much detestable affection whereas partly naturall nay bee taken good part euer euill meere corruption contrary loue loue enuieth cor paul plainely forbiddeth galathians hee also sheweth cause namely desire vaineglory saith desirous galat last vaine glory prouoking one another enuying one another heere seene ephramites desiring glory victory themselues enuie gedeon affection sheweth selfe thing desire excell yea best euen gift spirit therein would haue none account aboue v appeareth preached christ enuie repined fellow philip comming eleuenth houre hee pennie well himselfe matth though worse prosperity neither doth diminish thing good estate yet enuious man thinketh gift himselfe darkened blemished thereby vnlesse haue especial grace abate mortifie thought therefore aggrauate sinne know enuious sad prosperity another worse made ioyfull disgrace abasement pharisies crucifying sauiour iosephs brother sold yea cursed humor enuie opposite loue whereas hee loues vnfainedly would part euen precious iewell sake loueth enuious person would willingly pull one owne eye vpon condition might lose grudgeth vnfitly paul speech fornication may applied enuie sinnes without man enuious sin owne body health prosperitie thereof god iustly plaguing kinde while pine eminencie another reflecteth beateth backe hurt vpon selfe feedeth vpon precious spirit soule life consumeth seldome harme fretteth heart blood bowel selfe enuie remedied shaming selues wee cannot abide brother haue doe good god gift considering also thereby hinder god glorie also shall loosen rootes enuie thinke meanely selues god onely wise denieth iust cause vnto v wherewith blesseth others thirdly shall helpe weaken wee consider god hath rather deserued infinite thankes v granting v blessing perhaps may want respect wee enuie great mercie lam wee consumed one wee see wee behold much whereas eye seeth worse anothers seeth better much lesse another kinde see well doth foote enuie eye seeth eye foote goeth contrarie vertue spake twice gedeons souldiers gedeons communicating nephtali ephraim victorie speake ephramites thinke amisse third sinne sin father doct adde father ephraim younger preferred iacob elder brother manasse stocke ofspring exalted themselues since age age noted oft time historie old testament iosuah reade among discontented portion twelfth booke posteritie contended iphia calling battell ammonite ouercome euen ephramites gedeon esau himselfe deadly hating brother deriued sinne posteritie edomites ahab idolatrie generation came hereby may learne force blemish corruption stocke kindred haue infect almost whole posteritie god iustly thus punishing sinnes father vpon child many generation punishing say sinne sinne example kindred bee proud haughty stomackful boaster giuen adultery hollownes heart flatterie lying mocking stealing rest stock guided grace part euen bodily disease runne blood posteritie wee see noble stocke stained treason may easiler restored blood ciuilly indulgence prince reformed naturally reduced loyaltie fidelitie truth forcible meane outward meanes scarce able expell eint onely grace doe although euen grace selfe often time scarce roote sprig old stock appeare grafted another stocke yet one thing note ephramites namely slight fourth sin sl ghtnes subtiltie doct subtilties doublenes hollownes lie hidden men heart till haue occasion shew grace repent would seeme haue great iniurie called battell whereas owne sin went forbeare feare danger willing stand lying winde waite issue gedeon brother israelite ioyned lost day blame haue bin laid vpon ephramites got victorie god direction blessing complaine side iniurie theselues said bidden helpe battell wherein wee may behold deepe subtiltie hypocrisie farre simplicitie plaine dealing according prouerbe howsoeuer world goe saue one howsoeuer fall prouide themselues one harlot pleaded salomon fellow twelfth book king iudg iphta set vpon ammonite sought aide hand men ephraim would help afterward fighting ammonite preuailed ouer ephramites came make warre called goe sinne adaies common practise namely bargaines gaine certaine play hand cunningly couenant generall doubtfull manner hit fall well shal bargaine readie challenge make claime slightly soeuer couenant made fall ill picke quarrell say meant taketh therefore make bargaines plaine couenants sure certaine slightly conclude though agreed one depart one another breaking like word shall agree vpon vncertaine termes let man loueth peace buy note sell deale world goeth except hee willing stand hardest take measure shall offered willingly partnership also many secret subtill deceiuings one another yet good shewes equitie shall seene selfe full pretended like vnto promise great friendship man perceiue better brooke person frowne vpon shew kindnesse must dishonest manner finde fault also alleage cannot therefore shew kindnes doe promised prouide thing honest men dealing apparent dishonestie aduersitie disgrace right good men shall iustled wall yet againe restored former estate accounted fauour better shall sought vnto regarded iphta like dissembling seene ephramites manner dealing contrarie simplicitie plainnesse good christian maine blemish nay staine vtterly remoued abandoned bad enough euen ciuill dealing appeares matter religion farre worse infinite degree detested whether shewed toward god men meane subtill politique manner feare frailtie grosse though euill men abstaine conceale affection gospell till see whether time bee like fauour note frowne vpon meane carrying darke ambiguous countenance man tell make yet cannot carrie matter thus plainly bewray opinion iudgement counted foole shiftlesse person indeed hee worldward nothing else regarded possible make true cognizance temporizer coate moone serue belly ambition purse leade follow god serue none religion onely stalking horse play part cunningly till turne serued say committing sin toward men odious man shall promise pretend loue faithfulnes neighbour yet meane intend thing practise contrarie gedeons milde answere followes considered maketh verse quarrell expostulating ephramites hee answered foolishnes like giuen good brought broile thinke would haue betweene hee defend answering hee strong enough himselfe neede helpe like prouoke neither commended owne labour care industrie could willingly haue heard neither yet vnuizer telling quarrelled without cause sought helpe way exasperated contrariwise yeelded much truth good conscience hee might neither hee interpret contentious word come bitter enuie gaue cause rather hee hath left commendable example meeke patient seruant god respect honest lawfull emulation teacheth right worthie matter doctrine vnto v namely wee deale insolent contentious fierie thinke though neuer vntruly haue wrong hand case must well staied see giue men ful due wit crosse prouoke exasperate doct rather seeme see roote bitternes breaketh containe selues till fitter time seeing case told make best euery thing asswaging gentle answer especially equal inferiours one word answere foole according foolishnes prou giue ill measure bringeth lest wee like remember taught another place prouerbs namely man glorie cease strife consider alwaies bearing minde better rule owne heart subdueth prou citie except thus giue place many euils like follow fall v church commonwealth familie course life yet hereby may doubt part bee auoided least wise bee smaller fewer therefore let yonger sort herein learne yeeld elder inferiours better though deale ought seeing wee see gedeon afterward iphta superiours forbeare deale inferiours might haue done iustly prouoked doe yea let one learne take lesson toward another manner haue set downe husband wiues master seruants peace holinesse may preserued among heb yet sheweth foorth meeknesse wisedome bee seene common iarrings quarrel men count glorie boast afterward word bee fierce stinging fellowes come furnace seuen time hotter saith thinke would turne face put downe word trow gaue full measure hee brought yea tenne one spared whit loe fooles froth owne shame whereas salomon shewes face glasse doe saith angrie man stir prou vp strife multiplieth transgression prou indeed honour man depart say see frame answered angrie word therefore durst striue outshoote diuell owne bow hee thinkes commeth count reproch professe fight corrupt nature therefore let dead burie dead meane fit nothing else let giue taunt taunt scorne scorne free righteousnesse bondman owne lust haue learned rather repay good euill euill yet taken though thing ought yeeld froward peeuish person owne priuate case onely lawfully may case matter contrarie god preiuditiall honour example ephramites would haue set vp baal altar againe sort tollerable gedeon haue borne hand much lesse haue yeelded thing noted answer worthie example whereof wee haue paul resisted peter gaue galat place point collusion iewes followeth fruite meeke milde answere vnto vers wit anger thereby alaied agreeth well salomon prouerbs milde answere putteth away anger againe meeke tongue breaketh band second blow make fray prou prouerbe saith reason thereof double first wrath wanteth matter worke vpon opposed secondly meeknesse shameth anger euen humilitie make pride hang downe head must odde man rage fiercenes otherwise thus dauid abigails mildnes staied bloodie attempt nabals boysterous roughnes prouoked vnto grace meeknes mildnes christ pronounceth blessed haue matth matth philip actes numb wils v learne meeke lambe shearer opened hee mouth thereby abraham preuailed lot moses excelled vertue said meekest man vpon earth contrary cured contrary wee know physitians cure world contention vnquietnes whereto grant many prouocations must obey lord wee shew meeknes tit vnto men say booteth vse meeknes either word deedes toward vnreasonable person obiect gentlier entreated play vpon aduantage insult ouer others yea yeelding furie incencing addeth oile flame answere roughnes towards bad answ base nature meete kindnes man keepe measure vnder colour resisting sin another disobey god thus elisha willeth elder answere iehorams seruant person king cannot safely controll though lawfully let v say good prophet lord see iudge lord rebuke assure selues god hath way enow throte matth would heare meeke plea end rough boisterous proud spirit much shall suffice time fiftie one sermon eighth chapter booke ivdges second part chapter vers gedeon came iordan passe ouer hee three hundred men wearte yet pursuing said men succoth giue pray morsel bread vnto people follow mee wearie may follow zebah zalmunna king midian prince succoth said hand zebah zalmunna thine hand giue bread vnto thine army gedeon said therefore lord hath deliuered zebah zalmunna mine hand teare flesh thornes wildernesse brier went vp thence penuel spake vnto likewise men penuel answered men succoth answered said also men penuel come againe peace break downe tower zebah zalmunna karkor host fifteene thousand left host east slaine hundred twenty thousand men drew sword gedeon went dwelt tabernacle east side nobah iogbehah smote host host carelesse zebah zalmunna fled hee followed tooke two king midian zebah zalmunna discomfited host gedeon sonne ioash returned battell sunne yet hie second part chapter holy story former digression ephramites contending gedeon sense vers proceedeth orderly set downe end battell namely midianites east slaine one another rest remained fled away fifteene thousand men gedeon pursued ouer iordan three hundred men wearie faint hauing laboured night comming succoth city succoth meane tribe gad another place called succoth desert mentioned number hee asked somewhat refresh souldiers men succoth haue helped gone pursue midianites israelite neighbour vnkindly denied giue brother much bread answered gedeon contemptuously cause hee threatned returne victory hee nothing doubted tels deale thereafter euen teare flesh brier wildernesse heere gedeon followed fifteene thousand midianites doct vers escaped greatest number slaine already shewed wisdome godly care preuenting euill danger might haue come vpon people afterward fifteen thousand suffered runne away without pursuing might doubt would haue renued power haue come againe afresh yet gedeon wisely preuented teacheth v singular good lesson wee haue well discharged dutie enioyned v gedeon done yet ought labour hold haue receiued wisely may preuent whatsoeuer might stand vp way frustrate cause v lose former labour fruit hope euen gedeon heere pursuing fled midianites instance wherein might bee laid innumerable onely alleage two three briefly man enter league sound friendship another neuer strongly entirely solemne manner dauid ionathan betwixt themselues whereby one sam doth repose himselfe rest vpon yet renue couenant loue oftentimes two confirme strengthen might annoy breake wil fal many occasion weaken yea make vtterly void also report carried fro betwixt absence one another strangenesse arise thereby especially conceit tetchines taking thing ill part rash iudgings former kindnesse forgotten league soundly made neuer broken let say bee vnderstood couenant made marriage selfe farre thing mentioned may fall therein testimony true loue mutually declared euen betwixt couple need daily shewed stead renuing couenant else loue fall ground also passe another instance man yea let bee good man entring affaire world disliking bad course taken men commonly get wealth doe purpose heartily dislike yet let look daily performe hath purposed stand firme therein let watch pray prouocations contrary disgrace owne eye note vnlawfull course dealing may bring commodity contemne filthie gaine feare danger soule vsuall many dealing world yea though lawfull let say thus go worke looke himselfe without question like grow point wit become worldly minded man drowne religion earthlinesse say sicknes hath made many great promise amend life recouer neuer liue badly afterward done say hee renue couenant lord day day remembring considering made promise note earnest maner man shall reuolt good mind fall old byas againe though hath purposed dauid psal sonilitude yea sworne yet shall keepe righteous iudgements hath neglected care therefore faileth purpose feeling men want getting fearefull sentence pronounced omitted mercy compassion well wrought iniquitie goe ye cursed euerlasting fire matth hungry ye gaue meate naked c reason fought safety israel wee
