become rogue contrary god commandement saith shall beggar israel good order taken cut rogueing place place without certaine habitation setting poore worke ministring necessity want able maintaine charge labour good order faithfull christian vpholden great sinne many stead thereof doe nourish rogue indeed notwithstanding bee straightly commanded hee labour eate sooner moued thes compassion toward toward pooe neighbour whose need behold daily eye men succoth answer answere prince succoth heere followeth gedeons vers word againe like suite carried answere returned gedeon messenger sheweth fault people answere gedeon manner denie bread giue also rough scornefull word therefore gedeon vpon priuate reuenge one authoritie doe seeing fault redounded hurt commonwealth committed onely gedeon men answered would auenged wise would haue relieued also good cause neede haue gone let v examine word zeba zalmunna thy hand alreadie haue said would haue giuen thanke owne benefit credit honour seeing hand vncourteously barbarously denied brother doct vers subtiltie lest ouercome midianites haue hardlier dealt withall prince midian hearing relieued enemy subtilty ioyned selfeloue two string men bow shoote action arrowes good doe done commandement conscience note sake selfeloue owne priuate benefit hoping gainer thereby may done heathen religion feare god hold back good conscience ought doe euill minde hold back men succoth feare lest doe fare worse hand men succoth like point whereunto obserued men ephraim hereby wee may see barbarous rudenesse yet brother countrimen israelite gedeon gouernour vpholden peace middest last worke pursuing midianites rescuing israel shew themselues barbarous voide humanitie house top fire nether part lie still though fire could hurt man standing vpon onely bough high tree thereby kept danger falling hatchet cut downe fall breake necke rudenesse irreligiousnes many brutish people day onely helper want necessity god people either soule bodie hinderers yea gripers senselesse blok neither heare see sauour good towards nabal gaue thing dauids men rated railed thereby casting mist vpon vnmercifulnes might seeme tollerable may note falsehood subtiltie dastardlinesse sought saue liues wee might marueile see readie betray forsake yea lend helping hand persecute natiue prince countrey brother yea religion selfe broken shiuered hope transitorie life safetie yet misse also oft time seene speech mordecai hester remaine danger doest thou looke besafe god reuengeth falsehood cowardlinesse sauiour saith saue life shall lose vse though matth life sweete yet preserued subtiltie falsehood preposterous feare lord haue bee brought triall requireth note hand euen thing subteltie dastardlinesse auoided simplicitie courage practised god willing conspiracie men schechem abimilek gedeon threatneth men succoth barbarousnes vers boldnes towards deliuerer iustly deserued euen teare flesh thornes desert iustly magistrate sauiour teacheth hee scorneth brother neighbour worthie highest degree punishment much committed gouernour might thus met requited threatning wrath vpon good consideration deferre speaking punishment till inflicting mentioned let marked gedeon euen speake preuailing zeba zalmunna without feare alreadie subdued therefore saith lord hath deliuered hand doubting would teare flesh brier meane time let v marke hee left greatest necessarie dutie must necessitie presently done wit pursuing midianites namely punishing men succoth done also might better bee deferred wisedome discretion learned v duty done v euils auoided danger punishment followeth doct first done necessitie must first yet neglected omitted due season regarded also instance may bee many visit parent great sicknesse requireth present duty without delay preferred performed rather iourney profit though lawfull also may well done another time also preferre hearing sermon common businesse greater hurt c say onely common action must giue place season euen one season another best rule wee preferre season occasioneth worke presentest vse although dutie higher nature offer selfe yea obserue euen ciuill season may sometime bee preferred religious example falles man offered fauour hope release trouble reconciliation aduersarie mightier himselfe vse present helpe else cannot enioy may hath summe money pay vpon set day vpon great forfeiture sent vpon errand life death say fetch chirurgian let master parent blood desperate case otherwise commanded serue prince c commeth opportunitie hearing word prayer familie bee necessarie kind due time wise ought iustle aside needfull done time may attended vnto leisure giue leaue tide staieth man therefore must beware lest ignorance though cloaked honestie neglect especially wilfull contempt leaue greater lesser causeth partie offending shame sorrow oft time shall answere follie neglecting physitian case said shall thereby finde wife father master dead past recouerie case may one wee measure rest paul vpon ground omitted opportunitie good asia act hee act might goe ierusalem let v ouer much iust eccles wringeth nose forceth blood prou ioyne caueat prou vnder colour preferring greater dutie wee take occasion neglect smaller afterward doe wee shall bewray selues rather subtill shifter dispenser duty boldly loosely wise redeemer time example publike worship god fall vpon time ordinarie priuate worship let yeeld howbeit wee readily returne priuate againe due place time pretend diligence one way colour negligence another way feast better ordinarie feast may better spared man depriued ordinarie starue weeke adde preposterous nature whereas one dutie make v fitter another wee rather neglect one hearing conference meditation prayer sucke poyson sweetnes waxe auke vntoward yea wearie priuate wee thinke wee haue sufficiently quit selues publike dutie either preaching hearing like manner vnlawfull man preferre companie choice seruant god either one may haue benefit calling attending family bee carried grow distaste neglect calling duty god priuate seruice inconuenient yea argueth ye diuel hath blinded v delusion strongly either ignorance simplicitie worse weary necessary dutie continuance vnder colour zeale fall seldome preferred lesse needfull dutie needfull hee leaue meane pursuing rest midianites though hee might easily haue discouraged vnthankfulnesse brother scoffing many would haue done case men vnthankfulnesse discouraging v scoffes doth cause v many time breake good beginning whereas neither men ephraim succoth put course teach v haue warrant god goe auoid regard regard temptation discouragement hindered broken good course neither elisha mocking note king sauiour apostle opposition found king nay rather incouraged paul disswasiues others actes dauid michols scorne wee ought likewise act sam see fewest countenance assist v saying yet vile lord sake reward shal common shall counted medlers busibodies answer let god v men whose commandement meddle call aduised perswaded ground haue may reape good comfortable vse thereof receiue fruite promise men succoth fiftie two sermon eighth chapter booke ivdges goe forward rest text remaineth vers eight verse word went thence penuel forth read last sermon may see another discouragement repulse gedeon sustained men penuel souldiers faint weary denied bread succoth wee haue seene men penuel also appeareth verse went faintnes wearines souldiers repulse whereby might easily haue tempted brought thinke feare god approue iourney set himselfe note wont conclude ill successe haue euen good attempt especially let forcible many diuers one necke another iobes affliction among hard message brought calamity befalne one fire god fallen heauen burnt vp sheepe seruants god may learne thing sometime may goe contrary desire liking expectation duty god requireth haue done v v v yea hee would crosse v set purpose dutie looke god bid v doe man god sent iuda haue done drawne old prophet bethel contrary god commandement eate indeed case alway alike difficulty befall v sometime king may clearely see cause thereof may bee man case one time doe good action yet euill inconuenient manner another time well occupied take good thing hand doe good manner kind may fall hath many discouragement thing succeed whe goeth best manner latter two may lord trie faith patience crossing first kind much may say maruell lord crosse hath done good thing bad manner end may call himselfe due examination himselfe amend amisse ere take hand holy duty god wil eleuen tribe fight beniamin person true repentance iudg fit businesse yea zeale wanting principall wit faith god would bee goe worke amisse great cause therefore lord fight fast driue repentance reuoltings fought beniamin teach wanted meekenesse loue discretion temper feruent reuenge withall might doe holy worke god holy manner therefore case let men contented nay glad god crosse may better spie poysoneth best duty desire pride rashnes boldnesse learne hereby meekenesse humilitie repentance feare c god doth iustly suffer many discouragement vpon also oft time deale israelite going vp canaan egypt exod may stay course euill exod attempt proceed aduisedly commendably doings falleth sometime said sore great difficulty stand vp men way vnlike gedeons wherein lord deales sending iourney would make heauen earth trauels greatly admiration astonishment would haue said dauid chosen god king yet promise thereof oft renued confirmed seeing discouragement many strong met whereas saul came kingdome easily without trouble case wherein haue much dismay v yet satan euer hand also worke vpon weakenes set v much backward especially wee shall bee brought thinke god deed seeme contrary word promise death shunamites child yet bin giuen vnlooked blessing pleaseth god trie v seeming set barres way v wise inough see least rightly consider thus v god suffereth thing trouble v though wee thereby iust cause complaine expostulate note begin doubt wil make good promise v whether may go forward good course haue begun yea impatient perhaps much disquieted least doe also fret fume discouraged good beginning whereby may see froth rather faith seemed bee good substance feele stinch vnsauourie heart vpon small occasion cast euill smelles yet herein wee differ gedeon found discouragement cross farre greater courage confidence wee triall great matter trifle part onely wee bee crossed hindred good action thus haue one let way euen common businesse distemperature haue spoken shall possesse v haue lost something though small valew yea though missing way hindred weather ordinary oft falleth rashnesse note stumble hurt foot stone bee like going duty haue many great let way crossing v may easily meet v also sent god resist v therefore singular onely grace god inable v belieue bee perswaded hee doth oft time thing trie v may shew foorth grace faith patience v therefore hold peace seeing hath done hinderance crossing fall sometimes going prayer priuately familie hearing word preached receiue sacrament c wise body say withdrawne pretence though wee pleased god therein seeing euen let rise vp way hinder v like may obserue discouragement within selues example minister course preaching shall find ill measure hand others whose good seeketh see purpose god toward moses israelite first sent vnto exod shall exod despise god prouidence toward pharisee said haue luke done thinke like worke vpon shall feele within himselfe great vnfitnesse moses exod exod vnwillingnesse deadnesse drousinesse want assistance god discharge worke ministery great dampings man hath vsed best meanes furnish himselfe knowledge conscience yet euen best sometimes haue proofe hereof themselues thought thinke like arise case therfore man looke resolued hand quailings may fall also hee armed temptation may arise therefrom wonderfull diuell may weaken faith zeale slacken purpose diligence lord worke side case hee able stay himselfe considering trial vsual lesse best seruants minister god alway haue haue ebbing aswell flowing eliah paul yea sauiour himselfe strong discouragement singular benefit much hauing ouercome first onset shall second place meditate end lord hath abasing thus occupied god owne worke hee may teach humilitie yea flee himselfe depend immediatly vpon lord sufficiencie assistance trust wit study memory tongue gift others make onely refuge therefore often disappointed oh gaine shall reape thereby say paul neuer fitter god seruice lowest mine owne opinion hereafter therefore boast wil boast mine owne infirmity apostle speaketh glory god perfected aduanced cor vers gedeon receiuing like discourtesie rude answer men penuel men succoth doth like manner threaten throwing downe tower much gloried threatning seeing afterward put execution crosse discommoditie needlesly owne sin bring vpon themselues may see many author causers owne sorrow trouble need haue sinne stoutnesse wilfulnesse stiffeneckednesse vndutifulnesse rude behauiour doe say bring vnseasonable affliction vpon themselues euen men succoth penuel wee know peace men liue without feare great benefit soone lost hardly recouered men wolues lionlike one another especially prouoked haue authoritie superioritie one ouer another may iustly vexe shal fal hand wicked desert leaud behauiour therfore take heed prouoke one another least maner gal last lamentable men make breach peace losse commodity rigour crueltie high mind proud heart bearing least iniurie bending themselues reuenge looking good measure bee offered others yeelding little kindnesse againe peruersenesse also euen betwixt many couple married estate causeth continuall iarring vnquietnesse whereas peace man would thinke fitter seene betwixt speake commanded seeke men much lieth yea pursue follow though flee yea buy peace though heb cost somewhat sel hand much lesse trifle thus abraham bought peace lot let men learne end know consider pulling downe pecocks feather gene euen earth earth earth bee weighed equall ballance farre worse nothing spake verse chapter gedeon goeth forward rest midianites findeth vers clearing verse resting alwaies dangerous euen gedeon tarried rest himselfe one night way hee lost labour fruit wit destroying midianites god diligent hath promised blessing good successe gedeon found men succoth penuel labour fruit hauing diligent approoue selues haue found truth scripture iohn verified v saith faith ouercommeth difficulty world haue growne contempt many sinnes subduing great measure sometime shall reape sparingly mete lord measure v againe laboureth eate laboureth much enioyeth fruite thereof thirtie sixtie hundred fold euen diligence oh strange see men set themselues work earthly hee wrote prince succoth elder thereof euen seuentie seuen men came vnto men succoth said behold zeba zalmunna ye vpbrayed saying hand zeba zalmunna already thy hand giue bread vnto thy wearie men tooke elder citie thornes wildernesse brier teare men succoth also brake downe tower penuel slew men citie verse following shewed gedeon taken vers prince midian returned succoth seek diligently know name chiefe men elder thereof brought shewed prince zeba zalmunna vnto hee kept aliue make boast might shew god deliuered hand hee made doubt thereof might ashamed accused done men denying bread thereupon hee vnto threatned tare flesh wit succoth thornes brier wildernesse ouerthrew tower men penuel slew citizen either insulted arrogantly men succoth else resisted gedeon trusting tower slaine whether succoth died paine punishment like whether flesh onely torne yet life remaining though storie doth declare yet cannot ignorant sore extreame paine kinde execution done vpon men penuel themselues putting death storie setteth downe sure slaine without good probabilitie torne death also gedeon meeting young man causeth set downe name cleering verse chiefe elder gouernours succoth contrary men practise thereto conclude wisdome spirit god giue occasion almost euery sentence sometime oft chapter end commonnesse sin might bee somewhat checked often repeating reproouing therof adde warne men ought demeane themselues place reason either great successe vnlooked preferment occasion soeuer corrupt flesh might take forget themselues say let men beware iolly lusty merry moodes remembred reproach losse shame yea ruine heere see euen heathen haue prudently obserued wise man carrie himselfe otherwise prosperous one considereth one day may miserable indeed iolly fellowes need warrant euen manward shall neuer fall decay estate seeing else seeth fruite reape scorne pride wit vnderfoot men reioyce ruine make pastime none pitying taking part whereas others lamented reliued miserie pitieth herod eaten vp wormes would proudly exceed bound man counted god haman hanged vpon gallowes readeth ioy rather grieued hee aloft made himselfe terrour church crueltie iob haue answered nothing halter stabbing like deserued plague god befalling perswade truth hereof let goe let god people looke god aswell men beware especially forget themselues way walke humbly due weighing owne vilenesse changeablenesse thing else euen esay may fall ezechia gedeon heere lawfull v prosecute brethren doct vers wrong murther yea meet doe booke number appeareth onely priuat respect flesh numb kindnesse shewed also much publike behalfe church commonwealth much concerneth sinne vnpunished lord requireth salomon king word may bee gathered hee spake ioab saying let bee slaine euill may remoued wee may bee guilty innocent blood hath shed returne point hand good reioyce friend liue together mutuall good also token vnfained loue toward pursue wrong dead highly commendable done according god law commonly gone meane flesh blood carnall reason doe rule highly displeaseth god likewise marres action next point shall appeare namely pursue suffer desert doe hurt companion euill therfore iustly suffer hand one another although magistrate punish offendor euen case also drunkard quarreller shed blood lord himselfe hath put difference betwixt casuall vnwilling killing wilfull murther ioshua appeareth appointing tribe city refuge safegard innocent farre iustifying cruell pitie spare guiltie murtherer himselfe well plague shall seeke stop due course iustice also find murtherer himselfe notwithstanding secrefie wherewith much villanie cloaked one time eye eye tooth tooth exod sheddeth blood blood shall shed blood slaine crieth strongly eares lord abel widow luke importunitie compelled iudge heare doe iustice aduersarie condemneth deadly reuenge betweene many person onely family kindred also vpon murthers band themselues take part irreconciliably fit pagan indeed christian ioyned together loue rather diuide themselues sworne brotherhood mischiefe like two simeon leui lastly bewraieth leaudnesse romish pretended pitie mercifulnesse protecting guiltlesse sauing vilest malefactor hand lawfull magistrate god hath appointed terror ill doer mocke maygame shauelings pursued get temple rather dennes theeues rescued sanctuary feare law punishment againe gedeon saith sweareth hee would haue killed saued brother aliue ought haue done pursuing people god neither authoritie saue though hee destroy holyghost commendeth act teacheth hard matter doe good action aright follow doings example agreeable rule guide v looked vnto god men teach v specially examine action manner end affection minde wherewith done thing doe aime lay foorth thing wee doe ignorance darknesse suspect danger euen traueller riding straight path rode hedged side hee cannot goe amisse oh sillie man consider thou bearest thee bodie sinne euill heart euen good heart wonder much euill cleaue thy best action thing looked good hypocrisie ignorance boldnes pride corruption thereof lieth vnseene vnpurged nay corrupt humour set man worke doe good dutie may lurke vnder vizor thereof anger malice vnder zeale holy reuenge odious nadab abihu leuit offering incense strange common fire hearing prayer good action yet sauiour saith take heede ye heare paul saith luke ephes watch selues prayer ephes yee looke narrowly selues keeping selues attentiue reuerent confident humble feruent throughout diuell watch good neuer whit neuer better done euen thing religious much indifferent vnder pretence angrie merrie companie eate drinke recreate body c thing neither good euill nature forgets change nature come action cannot indifferently done good bad according manner therefore though anger euill selfe yet lord iustly challengeth ionah saying doest thou well angrie meaning corruptly ionah carnally therefore easie worke men thinke carrie themselues aright yet let know transgresse rule either pietie loue sobernes goodnesse indifferencie worke shall saue harmelesse instance zeale neither aime god glorie reformation partie moderation affection zeale folly rage error thing rather holy zeale point haue spoken booke often shall speake afterward god let adde caueat minister teaching especially doctrine duty beware lest teach men libertie learne soone themselues catch greedily large therein slight short teaching rule named restraine abuse thereof rather short former warie large latter cut lewd pretence wee see paul doth hauing said angrie fearing haue disciple many straight way eph addeth sinne cut combe libertine doth wise preacher eccles reioyce young man take thy pleasure c know thou shalt come iudgement best subiect eccles failing shall said worst surely wonder regard otherwise make minister god stale god himselfe make god cloutes must take frothie repentance satisfaction good part please themselues surest hand first satisfie desire inquire aftewards whether well againe good duty cannot doe well themselues euill indifferent luke though say let v alone know may doe wee take order good enough manner end like fooles runne contrarie extremitie else monstrous excesse vse libertie truly said set slipperie place delight set foote brinke ditch riuer seeth danger loue walke vpon plaine ground might doe safely slide suddenly end perish remedilesly gedeons mouing sonne fall vpon two prince traine doct vers acquainted pursuing ill cause person assoone grew fit teach vouth bee cruell quickly prick thorne selfe need sharpning either sinne example well approued best rule christian frame child betimes yeeres permit discerne good bad beware vse tongue behaue themselues sight hearing child euen tender seeing apprehensiue enough note lewd especially parent shall strengthen inward pronenesse euill authoritie god willing shall better appeare chap action howsoeuer may seeme crueltie cannot iudge yet pietie obedience god commandement youth age need wise manner moued may perswaded embracing following good instruction religious walking soone possessed ill education companie sinnes time neuer age memorie although act good vrged yet feare modestie young commendable must time settle youth euen good take roote easily much lesse growes bring foorth fruite especially shew appearance euill gedeons sonne vnexperienced kindes manhood courage falling vpon two valiant prince boy commended feared doe father well vrging tendernes excused obeying example may worthily set schoole many youth bold owne accord without instigation attempt set vpon doubtfull vile action theft whoredome drunkennes swearing ribaldrie like odious god man breaking bound modestie feare bashfulnes enioying comely ornament youth doe stand instead yet religion seeke keepe holde backe great shamefull euils bold fellowship lewd huswiues companion iustly may take vp lamentation ouer time want ciuill godly education youth whereby sinne hath got vpper hand boldnes wee haue seene growne sinner men ripe yeeres astonishment wee behold execration euen child youth new come shell parent guiltie least irreligious doe particular neglect care child disswading discouraging sinnes time good education keep behold disease groweth ere bee aware common desperate parent shew care way well religious parent often time nourish winke euill quality child two prince see youth fearefull men impatient delay prouoke gedeon fall vpon slay rid way descant vpon youth tendernes gedeon well aduised child say doth according age fit worke like discourse make answer gedeon like thee say like child king together bewray spirit nature first verse denie fact describe person slew prince fellowes haue said declare greatnes courage stomack abase themselues low aske pardon neither craue fauour may see prop whereby wicked desperate men stay vp hearten themselues misery extremity prop prophane diuelish magnanimitie desperate loftie stomacke call braue minde yeeld itselfe fault neither blush seek fauour senselesnes god wrath ioyne therewith second reply verse bewray also say fall thou v dispatch v thine owne hand note much shame heathen wonder though better reformed shame come church better yet led spirit blinded hardned diuell thinke ornament chiefe point manhood shrinke nothing beare head shoulder say seeme men set light violent death appeares desperatly cast themselues ladder hell god bee mercifull contempt death yet contrary owne nature feeling within sinne resteth worst proiected sort reacheth many professor haue done euill yet set good face meane bold relent wise knowne know themselues bee sort wee finde gehezas seruant elisha prophet haue sinne couertly bewrayed master saying whence commest thou gehezai answered boldly king lie thy seruant hath meaning wit businesse diuelish shamelesnes hardning heart euer seruants god bee turned relenting melting meeknes spirit else may bee sure wicked meete much sorrow point hath bin said elsewhere chap therefore touch way touching gedeon became dispatched wherein setting aside fault mentioned hee executed vengeance god vpon ring leader hee done vpon multitude midianites thus wee see goodly end people god sore one saith sinne correct psalme c louing kindnesse neuer take meane forsake good cause hee punish correct may stopped bad course driuen backe againe saint paul timothy saith perswaded lord mercie vpon tim well men example benefit mine owne thus example duly considered scripture wee haue consolation hope farre v say nay hee fallen let shift himselfe better opinion hee deserued see hypocrite demas reuolter oh man way thee procure thy selfe compassion others thou shouldest fall hadst like need thou sayest god forbid stand need answer thee thou shalt doe wisely preuenting occasion done highminded conceit thing shall befall thee rather feare thy selfe thy frailtie neither thy tendernesse others shalt thou made subiect fall watchfull falling lest thou shouldest say shall fall heare apostle saying lest thou thy selfe preoccupated doe like gedeon fallen wee haue heard followeth wee see one particular blemish many wiues doct mentioning sonnes selfe neither spoken make way next chapter poligamie hauing many wiues first institution though iewes vse yet sauiour rebuketh saith gene matth deut beginning god forbad king themselues might inioy greatest liberty euen turned hart god hunt pleasure forsake lord may done also single marriage confesse much poligamie cor vnlawfull giuen ouer licentiousnesse like course besotteth maketh drunken therewith sort become impotent good besides inconueniences haue accompanied polygamy disagreement iealousie hatred god displeased highly hauing many sam wiues obiect v abstaine many wiues prohibited law licentiousnesse answere yes much true polygamie men hart stolne god single lawfull marriage also may bee haue said yea certainly men giue themselues bridle consider one end thereof bee restraining strange lust liue holily made fit marriage seuerall duty doe regard vnseemely speech offensiue behauiour towards woman doe apparantly testifie liue vnchastly marriage offend god grieuously thereby much would bewray leaudnesse badnes way vncleannesse body also either restrained law shame else married estate mixed many fearefull great trouble doe lust somuch many would giue ouer themselues farre worst dare seeing cooled held downe affliction wise vse marriage helpe whereby hold neerer god become dutifull doe otherwise seruants god shall easily see abusing awknesse god seruice vntowardnesse good duty wicked vnconscionable make estate marriage sutable part life say naught said gedeon hee concubine sechem vers another blemish whereby may know vsed men well wiues inferiour wiues superioritie familie seruants euill also euen poligamy malachie reade mal captiuitie put away wiues married strange one also obiected man god namely abraham wee reade say answered thus sought godly seed lightnesse wilfulnesse although according first institution yet much reuealed clearely sinne former time liued since iust defence comming satisfie lust light god knowledge sinne selfe also euill end follow teacheth v doct haue rule guide action wee may wise follow example good haue done rule try rule paul requireth thessalonian trie thing hold thes cor good willeth corinthian man follow followed christ hath noted largely also consider better sonnes ierubbaal seuentie person reigne ouer either one raigne remember also bone flesh mother brother spake audience men shechem word heart moued follow abimelech said brother gaue seuenty peeces siluer house baalberith wherewith abimelech hired vaine light fellowes followed went vnto father house ophrah slew brother son ierubbaal seuentie person vpon one stone yet iotham youngest sonne ierubbaal left hid himselfe men shechem gathered together house millo came made abimelech king plain stone erected sheche summe chapter first set downe vsually doe together summe part chapter part three first namely abimelech seeking kingdome hauing got men shechem side killed seuentie brother except one seuenth verse second heauie prediction ouerthrow one brother iotham escaped bloodie hand best haue pursuer punishers euill doer infamy shall neuer put god beside shame befalleth men without vnfained repentance common thing world yet accounteth passe othersome vile irreligious monstrous person oh good faithfull friendly neighbour worth highly accounted meane among one may dwell peaceable without feare whose faithfulnesse man may rest may much reioyce though infirmity hold vnder yet flourish lift vp head high count themselues onely happie people righteous call say counted honest ciuill dealer cannot blemished open blot staine infamie oppression falshood vncleannesse yet void common vertues practised outward worshipping god peace men yet scripture testifieth farre happinesse hath noted say partly lest men deceiue themselues others erroneous conceit good search heart purge filth yet glorie repentance partly god people may see cause endeuouring measure grace true holinesse rather faint therein breake good beginning lord doth oft time therefore plucke whole ciuell men note loue bee counted eares fellowes example many suffereth disguise themselues grossely falling sinnes haue scorned disclaimed others adultery boasted themselues free say god faine doe crie hollownesse ignorance vnbeliefe euill heart conuicted hath laid dirt sinnes neither would brought thinke whereas yet haue committed grosser accuse themselues smaller also therefore happy lay foundation peace credit safety true welfare toward god lay say deeper storme tempest wind weather may cast downe neuer ceasing till haue faith purged strength poyson corrupt bitter rootes euill heart faith haue obtained found mercy god may feare good conscience sake goe vnder must need bee discredit bad men rather credit sake smother conscience building soone decaieth sandie groundworke thereof returne shechemites againe haue yet noted verse set downe particular sinne added rest say help forward cursed impe abimelech vsurpe kingdome giuing peece money common treasurie house idol baalberith naked pitying oppressed base matter looke marke though shall know one day cost haue poore among end may doe good thought thing far east west yea death part shred good v iames empty purse bottome bestow vpon lust roytous life drinking whoring excesse till bee brought morsell bread else another disposition namely gather increase substance endlesly neither themselues wise man tell haue posteritie leaue yet many want leaue remaineth haue done time place many good deed diuers ciuill religious necessary v otherwise accursed haue part doth good pleasing eie owner know many smart penury say nothing wicked increasing great part oppression defrauding men whereof haue many wofull example among v time time lord therefore hath giuen heart doe good consider also somewhat else bestow cost vpon well vpon themselues especially vpon lust meane worship god procuring good minister relieuing distressed kind abilitie reach shew god word meaner account lothsome lust touching abuse men wealth outward blessing sundry kind doctrine haue occasioned v speake neither shall bee needfull make set discourse vpon place onely adde word two touching tooke peeces treasury baalberith whether tooke treasure appointed idolatrous v probable treasurie imitation treasurie house god whether common treasure place temple laid vp safe repositorie free violence sacriledge robber vse temple especially time war danger pillage reade prophane ecclesiastical writer euery say affirme neither encline former opinion think robbed temple supply want abimelech sacriledge may wel stand treason tyranny spare neither thing holy prophane vpon coniectures collect nothing whether soeuer sure thought idoll sufficient treasurer keeper siluer else would haue made temple treasurie durst trust preciousest thing yet neither eies see hand power defend robber wonder may man say durst trust money durst venture liues soules vpon protection day eliah king answer king lesse wonder indeed wee saw christian worshipper god professe themselues ieopard saluation vpon promise yet farre behind idolater thing venture cast good vpon safegard thinke lord meet trustie keeper wealth put hand willing lose may say much beholding whilest hath giuen liuing temple stone temple baal owne making euen poore member lord iesus commandeth cast superfluity substance hee promiseth ouerseer steward treasurie reckon returne againe beneuolence double trebble vnto yea tenfold vse gaine enough nay hundreth fold rewarding euerlasting habitation hath vndertaken become surety haue said repay loane againe abundantly wee thinke bee word keepe principall fast let interest goe v temple count sepulchre deuouring al asking giue giue neuer returning ought againe ecclesiastes thinke lost cast vpon water well bestowed idolater confederate baalberith shall stand foorth witnesse eccles shame thus helped forward may see maner doct vers person hired prouided bring wicked purpose passe wit empty lightheaded naught worth lewd loose carried headlong sound reason whereby haue description graceles wicked hangbies wherefore serue shall good purpose note cause one wit may see iustice done executed liuing idly part need must must worke laid late yeeres honourable counseller worthie memorie kept ranging seeing seldome punished best vse make beware first know haue spent liued idlelie without practising profitable trade calling haue spent full leaudly badly gaming whoring gusling caualering fraymaking c yet hanging men debt secondly malecontents owne penury welfare others yea state selfe often commonwealth wherein liue thirdly ruled reason much lesse religion disposition run head bee set gadding rouing c wherefore stay waite euen troublesome time tumult insurrection may fish troubled water desiring change present condition peaceable time fit occasion practise set work diuellish disposition peace gouernment emprisoned ioyning themselues vaine loose person like themselues wandring fro imployment home ciuill magistrate headborrowes townes wherein lurked neglected yet owne parent kindred haue seene executed deut worke ought eate suffered whose thes life idlenes let therefore purged among v place let broke peeces rather stand vp way hinder purpose resolued goe forward therefore whatsoeuer opposition come hee would beare downe flood windes pull downe hils bankes bridge gate tree whatsoeuer come way whereof deadly sicke disease feele bred nature aspire minister people graue godly man dare doe ministery euery youth bold fellow almost dare commoditie thrust himselfe many preferment ashamed honest ancient inhabitant abhorre flie contend quarrell iudge others puffe vp themselues conceit gift thinke fooles respect themselues yet dare doe best thing come short farre behind time hath reuerent high conceit worke ministerie though erroneously amisse must need say men altogether drew themselues thinking themselues wholly vnworthy buried many talent earth extremity modestie wee complaine age contrary ouerweening selues vnder prising easily answer paul question thing sufficient another sufficient indeed since looked benefit burden occupieth honest man hee think lesse enquired rather oh bramble matth thy sweetnesse men gather grape thornes figges tim note thistle doest thou thus teach season season thy feeding thy watching thy planting watering cheare grieue rather heart god good men oh shall heale thy barrennes barren creature haue cured miracle art wombe earth water thou wert oliue vine figgetree though fruitfull helpe thee cutting digging compassing remoouing bramble shall make thee fruitfull oliue forrest thou exaltest thy selfe neither hast oyle vnderstanding oyle grace much lesse thy vessell full thereof thy abundance others may refreshed yea thou haddest thy due lord forresters thou shouldest say haue place aboue tree allowed stand among conteine selfe part following parable iotham denounceth men ver shechem abimelech saying yee haue done well yee haue done reioyce else ioy shall god breake let v see reioyce doings according whether good bad let v perswaded durable sound ioy god alloweth nay commandeth v doings see deut deut cor elsewhere wit commeth well good conscience ioy either wicked haman adonijas absolons rom vaine repented young man eccles eccles compound bitter sweete bitter durable sweete soone vanisheth men merrie mirth suffer knowne sinne dishonour god among reioycing good christ cor woe meeteth saith woe laugh luke shall waile weepe common course life led affection ioy hath good ground warrant ioy note euill shall turned sorrow woe yet deny mirth yea euen naturall mirth thing transitorie indifferent allowed moderated yea especially vsed nourish spirituall ioy end ordained god supporting greatest infirmity euen god earthlie benefit likewise speech iotham wee gather although good bad doct former verse meete together seeme merrie seuerall companie yet greater oddes betwixt man would imagine vngodly man mirth bred tongue countenance therefore controlled heauie sad heart tels considered aright matter hee hath small cause merrie turne meriments heauinesse godly man ioy heartie entire sound therefore lasteth cannot checke himselfe iustly except merrie ought iotham saith wicked though reioyce together yet adde sound onely frothie deceitfull ioy fellowship reason ground societie euill godly ioy secret god fauour happie estate good duty doe appeareth going performing fruite meete together ioy note encreased multiplied euen mirth doubled musicke pleasure whereas therefore christian complaines much sorrow within without corrupt affection loosenes cross reproch world bad example abundance iniquitie temptation let man know euen sorrow good ground reioycing seeing sorrow good sorroweth euill see abound sorrow euill conscience still good long ioy warrantable onely ill conscience marres feast quiet minded merrie hearted christian reioycing good conscience saith cor apostle good man doe bad man ioy like affliction come vpon innocencie though may dampe outward mirth especially fitted yet take ioy soule shall returne againe double treble name written heauen knowing affliction luke greatest malice satan blot thence therefore affliction godly compared sowing know sowing cause haruest wherein great ioy therefore let beware lest disguising psal themselues wounding consciece cause themselues needlesse complainings feares sorrowes halfe ioy stead sound shall neede feare god fatherly correction shall hurt see good day liue chearefully let looke good heart bring foorth good pet fruites bee reioyced flee euill sort yea though world count peazants meacocks time shall luke come iollie fellowes shall ioy abimelech shechemites shall sit downe put head betweene knee sorrow shame miserie yet greater sorrow behinde iotham mentioning father saith put life danger deliuer vers shechemites againe requireth men shechem deale accordingly posteritie say vprightnes righteousnes wherein speaketh scripture doth euery men haue good measure offered stand vpon knowledge ciuilitie honestie much profession behaue themselues others walke example onely common sort sensualitie neither better alleage much law enioyneth yet may conuicted palpable iniurie vnthankfulnes good man law law himselfe oh much accounted faithfulnes requites loue kinde dealing rare found yet contrarie barbarous yeeld euill good many doe men shechem heere charged iotham haue done yet wee haue learned wee ought render rom good euill referre reader first last verse chapter wherein haue large spoken point foretelleth one shall destroy another vers doct abimelech men shechem euen came passe may teach v ill practises doings shall haue euill end kingdome part wickedly sought part wickedly granted could end good worke euill howsoeuer time appeare greater faster knit consent one another iosephs brother sending selling away far neuer trouble counted hoped gen came strangled rather haltered done arose little trouble crie confesse cruell handling yea long chiefe cause neerer ioyned together theeues yet commeth time pealing one another wherein cry oh vndone woe v euer wee linked confederacie together greater friend wicked conspire together goodnesse good men bewraied greater ouerruling power called reckoning deadly hate betwixt matth reade iudas wicked priest shew greater loue betwixt caualering drunken companion forsooth called good fellowes doe embrace sam ioab abner armes goe potcompanionship yet ere arise alebench one stabbeth another ioab thrust abner thorow weapon euen embraced call yee loue diuelish loue brings foorth fruites therefore let beginning attempt alwaies good yea well followed also else let v neuer looke end shall bee better one thing excepted repentance come way may end well repented thing vngodly propounded end wicked act neither could sure obtaine rarely befalleth reade point verse following mentioneth fulfilling prophecie last verse speech iotham said hee fled hide verse himselfe feare abimelech marueile though fled men haue impatient hearing rebuke age euen may bee reproofe either men estate doings admitted borne neuer vnsound wicked especially great world part hoseah prophet doth sufficiently testifie ho saying though swearing lying stealing adulterie c land mourne yet let man reprooue another meaning bee vaine sauiour foresaw willing disciple flee citie citie noting men would beare reproofe matth loue darknesse would hate light especially reprooued messenger god bringers thereof reade asa good man handled messenger god hanani chro seer hee brought message god wroth put prison many know owne strength able doe great wealth authoritie iustly soeuer reproued see pretend preacher seeke bring neck vnder girdle dominere ouer alleage reason refuse reproued let conscience tell feare respect men small account world yet take occasion shake sermon priuate company vnder pretence colour hope meanes may attaine easily haue sought doe desire wit may boldly goe forward sinnes man shall haue accesse allowance tell thereof followeth goe forward still till ring euery man eare euery man mouth talked also dye manner without repentance bereaued greatnes left helplesse hopelesse great basenes contempt farre estate wise pray let righteous smite v may fall hand wicked bought sold vngodly psal pleasure world well nigh sings note ierem ho wicked people anathoth preach v pleasant thing let none reproue though neuer neede yet point come euen base one admit yet wee suffer heb wholesome word exhortation reason reproofe vnwelcom worse men daintie iealous handled roughly told plainly fault drawne wee see tenderest face least endure nipping weather galled flesh abide rubbing truth tart bitter admit except tempered sweetnes flatterie though man know dangerous viper sting killing ticking yet men rather tickled death healed corrasiues reade one historie cured impostume sword enemie opened issue flesh let corruption till lord giue wisedome suffer enemy call minister galathians paul telling truth wound gal owne selfeloue nourish impostumated matter within breake inwardly lack vent destroy euill spirit men neither innocent might walke boldly pike yet abide bee called question prou note deserue blame formost yet forwardest reuenged vpon shall controle though bee god commandement neither scripture minister god himselfe may stand vp lawlesse exempted person oh man consider thine enemie wish thee shrewd turne could inuent greater thou shouldest want admonisher warne thee refusing thou hurtest thy selfe thy greatest enemie hurt thee lord threatens iewes hee denounceth seuere punishment therefore thou maist reproued especially publike man priuie matter thy selfe think greater portion many farre higher place enioy profit thou thou wise accordingly might think iotham ranne away said durst stand must know put life god hand hauing discharged duty auoided much could lion mouth danger bound put finger fire wilfully yet like afraid thereof god giuen enemy hand called seale truth blood therefore let none condemne rashnes cowardise hauing rebuked sinne boisterous malicious shift themselues prouide may owne escape safetie rather condemneth cruell disposition reproue cannot iustly conuince error slander rashnes like haue owne conscience condemning offence yet suffer liue peace haue done duty discharged conscience iustly reprouing shall brought conuicted may relent amend cannot endure accused mercie god considering spitefull nature wicked godly iotham minister word may bee suffered keepe standing awake admonish vnruly hee may saued compelled flee runne away feare opposite hee hath reproued although hee hath told truth good benefit kinde manner god muzzle doubtlesse hard iotham euery lewd offender might haue place beare much sway deterre minister weake fearefull medling challenging sinnes place laying hard offender yet god hath charged streightly denounce doe hinder course ministerie verily themselues may secondly open warre made way thereunto verse destroying one end chapter first said lord sent euill spirit betwixt euen spirit satan therefore must need discord betwixt verse appeares thus dissension prouoked fight till slew haue said enter lay open thing considered first said abimelech ruled ouer israel three yeres word preparatiue followeth thus taken word iotham thus vttered abimelech raigned three yeeres notwithstanding men shechem made shift hold together long man would haue thought iotham parable dreame delusion three yeeres short time speake king enioy crowne come lord threat began take effect otherwise though little deferred time long men might easily haue forgotten iotham within three yeeres thus fulfilled might remember prophecie note accomplishment thereof thus lord haue thine army come first occasion abimelechs shechemites destroying one sense another next occasion mischiefes followed set downe namely thus incensed one fall open warre set forward came way one gaal men shechem hired captaine abimelech helpe went gathered grape otherwise durst haue done made merry cursed abimelech boaster gaal hardned affirming thrasonically would put downe men shechem knew scripture set downe whence came behauiour bewraied say knew foolishly receiue rest vpon stranger though boaster know madnesse take trust though stranger yet boaster howsoeuer sinne great intertaining yet indeed god hereby hastned destruction light vpon captaine themselues souldiers might well goe together wonder boaster ambitious easily accorded although giuen vp themselues would haue trusted thus men shechem prouided themselues abimelech like followes men shechem foolish dangerous doct prooued ouerthrow giueth warning receiue beware resting vpon rotten hold broken staues sort many men deceiued grossely shechem folly cast welfare vpon boaster psalmist mentioneth saith put trust psalm chariot horse prophet ieremie teaching men shunne ier sawe danger saith let wise man glory wisdome strong strength rich rich let glorieth glory hee knoweth saith lord may rest men much lesse weaker stay doe present estate peace wealth habitation wife friend health like prophet saith cursed maketh flesh arme trusteth ier man heart departeth god prophet dauid crieth saying trust earthly prince cannot saue others themselues psalm king asa said thou trustedst king aram chron lord hence foorth thou shalt haue warre god onely trust must reposed salomon saith otherwise may vse man helpe prou psalm meanes vaine vse doctrine retaine danger trouble hope confidence god promise slippery helpes comfort thereafter wee rest appeareth clearely greater matter doe doctrine hath diuersly occasioned one thing adde answere might say shechemites shift shroud themselues vnder like defence therefore blame sought shelter tyrant could get answer seeke succour vsurper lawfull meanes according vsurper set vp themselues neither greater violence therefore say might thanke themselues brought wilfull bondage vpon themselues indeed case stood either must fence citie people brought snare led abimelech else yeeld perish cursed thing men either vse vile person patron desperate quarrel else bring themselues point might come vpon one sought waited destroy therefore let men defend sin plea driuen straight haue remedy fall vpon smaller inconuenience may auoid greater brought wretched choice vpon god alloweth child walke large vnder gouernment keepes streights cooped narrow roome surely owne sinne men haue liberty wearie till bestreightned driuen shift therefore defence bad crime selfe men haue sheweth sam hauing sinned scorne beare shame especially extremitie auoid bee onely punishment bodily comonly streight men seeke shun sin doubly prouoking god indirect meanes al saue themselues fro momentany trouble danger indeed two euils temporall lesser may chosen auoid greater two euils morall mortall sinnes much lesse one temporall euill morall meanes adulterer may say haue way shift one buy shame except would bee shamed euer thou wofull man thou haue deserued beare god haue laid vpon thee church micha saying beare punishment mich haue sinned thinke shift escape shame guiltie vnlesse thou fall greater without recouerie shechemites afraid abimelech durst gather vers grape haruest therefore hired gaal helpe see sedicious boaster deceiuer conduct goe foorth field great lasciuiousnes reioyced temple cursed abimelech among manifold discomfort warre place obserue let one numbred yt men thereby cut doct earth haruests liued ere spoyled farre life death yet worse death lie feare pinched penurie could goe doores reape fruites till made shift gaal yet neither safe house besides many like effect warre frearefull time brought warre set vpon man would thinke knoweth preserued like sore oppression would binde themselues liue submit themselues god dutie willingly doubt would readily couenant doe vnder oppression vpon condition might obtaine promise deliuerance sheweth good cause doe say marke men doe thus smaller trouble see ala contrary remember said psalme lord smote people sought yea sought psal earely found came triall false heartednes vnfaithfulnes vtter griefe knowing zebul ruler citie heard word gaal sonne ebed wrath kindled therefore sent messenger abimelech priuily saying behold gaal sonne ebed brother become shechem behold fortifie citie thee therefore arise night thou people thee lie waite field rise early morning soone sunne vp assault citie people shall come thee doe thou canst abimelech rose vp people night lay waite shechem foure band gaal sonne ebed went stood entring gate citie abimelech rose vp folke lying waite gaal saw people said zebul behold come people toppes mountaines zebul said shadow mountaines seeme men vnto thee gaal spake againe said see come folke downe middle land another band commeth way plaine moonenim zebul said vnto thy mouth said abimelech serue people thou hast despised goe pray thee fight gaal went men shechem fought abimelech abimelech pursued fled many ouerthrowne wounded euen vnto entring gate abimelech dwelt aranna zebul thrust gaal brother dwell shechem verse shewed broile grew hotter betwixt abimelech men shechem warred fought one whereby destruction drew neerer first zebul heard boasting gaal sent word abimelech therof hee officer gouerne citie absence gaue aduice thought best done set downe foure offered let innocency faithfulnesse appeare bee seene prou alwaies prouide loue bee without dissimulation may bee safely rested time need depend vpon v rom touching dutie faithfulnesse loue fruit let reader see history caleb elsewhere foure verse shewed abimelech strengthened himselfe clearing vers aduice zebul officer message sent prepared foure band men lay waite al night men shechem farre citie gaal comming foorth citie goe heare seeke abimelech pretending would set vpon inuade zebul came together though subtiltie conspiracie intended end gaal might suspect nothing earely morning yet cleare light gaal hauing shimering abimelechs band scout soone suspecting feared hee bewraied much zebul hee saw men lie waite yet knowing nothing zebul side bare hand draw feared without cause tooke shadow mountaines men vnlike farre dawning morning vnto gaal replied otherwise afraid indeed meane light clearely comming gaal abimelech neerely approching one toward army gaal could goe backe conuenience hee gladly would haue done whereupon zebul cast bragges teeth gaal challenged contemptuously spoken saying abimelech must need goe forward comming neere abimelechs band sore chased gaals returning toward citie shelter thence shut zebul meanes whereof abimelech preuailed exceedingly slew many men shechem iothams prophecy began bee verified destroy note part story first readinesse doct vers abimelech put execution zebuls counsell may see selues taxed double fault first shooke al tediousnesse toile bare vncertaine hope preuailing gaal enemy whereas hauing sure hope blessing plentifull wee obey lord obeying great reward yet slow psalm backward whereby verifie prouerb lyon way ready faint iust reproch bad men ill case prou forwarder good hauing yet great large incouragement reward promised v behalfe former historie haue largely spoken example iuda simeon chapter since diuers occasion second thing bee noted abimelech zebul officer disdained aduised furnish himselfe gaal yet zebul hauing familier talke hee might haue like enough haue vnfaithfull abimelech master setteth doct many v schoole learne refuse better aduice matter greater waight nay wee scorne oftentimes bee counselled though good best thing especially inferior folly naaman committed done owne vtter vndoing king body soule bethought himselfe taken better aduice first receiued prophet answere ill part lost dauid hearkning counsel woman nay blessed god highly himselfe afterward foolish sam pride men onely matter world euen ghostly heauenly thinke bee vtter discredit shame confesse ourselues defectiue vnable mannage euery businesse pertaines v well sufficiently whereas knoweth euery foole easily runne himselfe breath hee need wise man stop bad course settle himselfe againe good order frame without helpe counsell nay prodigall licentious person imbezle weaken estate credit health good posteritie oftentimes ten wise men turne hand restore redresse againe case soule indangered deeply satan hell among hundred willing aduised time till thrift stocke hope helpe quite past recouerie indeed bottome yea worse men aske enquire thrift sobrietie discretion oh much better haue admitted counsell irrecouerable mischiefe counsell euent counsell either lamentable pitie bitter rebuke wished folly bound heart youthfull rehoboams although euen shall finde sharpe enough taught mistresse experience well ancienter yeeres whose commendation ought bee shew foorth example staiednes wisedome younger sort neither able aduise themselues willing aduised remaines euen heathen poet condemne miserable therefore glad counsell soule body make much time may come precious desired want body turned prison beggerie rag soule many grieuous plunge hell paul aduice ill pilot reiected end become haue scorned beholding act meane yt sailed remember therefore wise man saith establish thought counsell act prou know without thought come naught ointment perfume reioyce heart doth sweetnesse man friend heartie counsell refuse counsell shall eate fruit owne way filled owne deuices gaal also well abimelech earely vp follow matter going verse citie see done whether hee could perceiue danger hand shame may spoken backward meete v speedy forward concernes belongs peace happinesse haue said example gedeons hastie pursuit medianites though earely vp yet appeareth storie neuer doct one verse neere end teach v earely rising late going bed care may taken sufficient bring attempt businesse passe god please blow vpon endeuours lord alloweth doings vpright heart taken hand according knowledge vpon good ground perswaded wee ought vouchsafe blesse saith psalmist except lord build house psal gouerne dispose thing pertaining familie labour vaine build except lord keep citie keeper watcheth vaine yet deny god doth suffer wicked oft time prosper long neither abimelech long yet greater ouerthrow pregnant example hereof iehoram father ahab another king king c intending voyage enemy aram moab hauing rebelled failed outward preparation politike deuices ouerthrow enemy prouided themselues men munition confederated themselues strongly neuer considering theselues rebelled greater lord euen lord hoasts went headily fearing controlement nay thinking god pinned yea bound one found cost hee went worke edge desperatly though spared time notable ruine came passe afterward yet hee found himselfe plunged driuen extremitie want water threatned losse beast owne people destruction enough proue played foole getting two king side god shut sought laughed scorne enemie oh heart people regard looke toyle moyle say bee brought passe would haue doe neither commit affaire dealing god prayer neither goe worke direction consult may please rashly owne wit goe look fall according desire therfore thriue neither prosper would mad men impatient outragious speede better haue good successe praise owne wisedome good hap fortune stead god looke largely handling point example sisera preparation iabin come successe gaal meeting abimelech vers note went end said obserued gaal triall timerous boastingly said abimelech afraid say soone least suspition likelihood danger arose appeared vnto looking soone able discerne dawning perceiued band companie men farre better discerne afraid said much zebul enemie thereby bewraied dastardlines vnto heard great brag boasting abimelech whereby wee may cleerely doct glasse obserue propertie disposition boaster prate bragge great matter effect small rather none like benhadad triumphed ouer ahab arrogating himselfe glad send men left two mightie army rope neckes sue life owne vnto ahab exceeding great shame small hope obtaine example laieth boaster colour noting one vainglorious frothie humour vndertakes great matter performes nothing lesse therefore stead honour purchaseth himselfe shame folly commonly boaster bodie triall like vnto torrent standing water winter swelleth similitude runneth maine vse sommer drought coole refresh stand man stead faileth drie impotent nature man boasteth gift god inward outward interuerting holding backe thankes god presumptuous bragging selfe part gift rather supposed indeed boaster therefore triall come thraso bragger ridiculous beholder amaziah boasted valour greatly prouoked iehoash without cause needed hee sped thereafter sore foiled late miscreant meane powdertraytors boasted deuice almost vpshot god man say hezekiah gloried treasure nebuchadnezzar boasted building achitophel policie counsell see word sam herod wit eloquence adaies naked hee hath somewhat vaunt nothing else yet neighbour towne contendeth ouercroweth gone another boasteth skill profession trade another selling deare buying cheape crossing aduersarie matching c boasting hath small acquaintance men thinke yea need man prouoked little bragge pride blush say better though haue good purse thou yet haue proud stomacke thou thine heart euen thus may ye heare poore man contending rich earth earth earth consider thou iercm braggest euen thy glory thy shame thine owne mouth shall condemne thee professeth resist proud boast worse matter say quench zeale precise one pet terme honest men wearie pursue till haue made eate word renounce precisenes psal psal say neere lord despight disappointment rest therefore scoffeth boast enemy casting brag teeth saying tell tower gate see walles sion c say haue cast downe looke well consider yee shall finde stone thereof remoued bad member wee see tongue boasteth great thing small purpose therefore make vse hereof let wise strong rich boast ierem wisedome strength wealth hee boast let boast knoweth saith lord boast shall note feare arrogancie seeing knowledge god euer seasoned humilitie loue let v consider sinne boasting seldome goeth without vsurping god honour man selfe lying capitall crime first second table grosse rich man boast worth wealth man borow man iob great summes boast well monied absurd able say need vtter thy well vsing thy gift thou regardest much else thy craking gift themselues shall witnesse thee giuing vp thy account yea rather let best say v lord belongeth shame confusion face haue small cause boasting saw selues sort vilenes nay let none boast much morrow know one prou day may bring foorth man worme meane base laid colour rather breake admiration say prophet lord thy mercie consumed lam rather boast thing aboue reach absurd ill beseeming euery way especially odious dangerous vsed people god iezabel elia rabsakee king railing heathen good king ezechias men boasting king threatning discourage true seruice god haue said gaals boasting zebuls answere zebul abimelech saw boasting gaal vers abimelech sent word thereof heard hee might prepare himselfe come forward fight heard himselfe fleshed matched another kinde wit subtiltie dissimulation yet spake faire seemed friendly wee see hee went citie end might suspect nothing yet giuen warning abimelech lie waite time hee come foorth readie set vpon middest feare danger gaal zebul subtilly deceiued bin cause feare egging drawing subtilly could shame yet full faine would haue broken away besides wee may note dissimulation lying slie subtilties world euen among pretend great loue friendship seene zebul point haue spoken alreadie booke wee may see men euill quality matched doct vers meete together gaal marke wee may see one boaster another dissembler subtill vnderminder third quarrellet contentious liuer tainted sundrie dangerous bad quality apostle speaketh say liue deale tim together therfore great goodnesse god one deuoureth another yea lord bridle vpholding peace church commonwealth could possiblie dwell together liue conuerse one stand sort doe contrary bad quality must need fire water destroy one another whereas good magistrate faithfull minister assistant christian doe labour throw downe workes darknesse diuell bridle rage turbulent vnruly sort people herein may spoken griefe opposition pietie goodnesse great although lord working miracle meanes somewhat bee done incouragement restraining yet little respect might desired looked good instrument faint fight lord battels fierce subtile many enemy like prouidence god noted touching abimelechs hiring vaine fellowes vpon fourth verse chapter may adde lord doth vse one wicked person deuoure oppresse owne people may enioy peace safetie see politicke dissembler zebul right picture subtile machiauilians adaies smoothes flatters gaal serues humour one would make fellow drunke drawes leaudly drinke pot pot till quite turned ouer pretended shew friendship intent plot betray abimelech might meane season take sure effect secondly hence let v note one sinner opposite anothers doct drift purpose goeth worke defeating enemy euen thus prouerb saith one naile driues another haue way go beyond shall vse weapon skilfullest mischieuously fetch wile one budget arrowes one quiuer either subtiltie force weapon sligh treacherous achitophel runnes budget cruell malicious efau quiuer lie point shall draw subtillest cunningest fetch shall take thence sharpest deadliest arrow shoot meane diuels bow skill shall ouerreach ouershoote therein prouides artillery sure gainer part soeuer loseth hee prouide kingdome shall increase euen opposition subiects fight fast doe zebul gaal serue two master one sense one abimelech shechem one boasting seekes outface conniuence dissembling seekes root loe meane serue one master diuell hee reioyces much spectacle ioab abner beholding young men play cruelly called good earnest cut sam others throat men cursed doings trading thus sinne would consider themselues sure goe walles forfeit soules whose engins tooles appugne yea considered quarrel serue end make note pageant diuell laugh could see issue hee winneth winneth hell hee loseth loseth heauen gaines onely satan oh would quaile dampe leaudnesse put case ship vpon sea two men walke contrary steppe one crossing motion doth ship carrie one way nill resist simile motion ship wherein saile euen sinne hath one motion though sinner mooue diuersly let striue neuer eagerly must yeeld one motion sinne wil bring hell prodigall man walkes quite aduerse steppe couetous step tend hell one great man seekes ouerthrow another hee subtill take vantage ambicious lay traine following ambicious plot incurreth danger law supplants wisdome one folly hellish closer deeper one aboue sooner may subuert subtiller goeth beyond length ouerreach one man vnderhand worketh mischiefe another againe vnsheaths tongue former like put downe latter owne sinne fast vndoe buyer would match seller dissembling seller would cosen buyer boasting praising ware indeed deceiue themselues aswell vse teach men thinke themselues safe warrantable resist euill except dislike hate also may sinne fast resisting allowing againe let teach men abhorre estate admitteth peace sound consent vnitie fountaine confusion embrace profession practise commeth god order vniforme meanes end vniteth embrace league loue peace better minded let beware errour wicked let thinke libertie hereby restrained may match vngodly kind play cretians cretians fox fox profession bought price serue lord body spirit indeed disswaded practise answere themselues sweare cosen lie temporise world could liue euery one would ouerreach greatly disaduantage themselues forgoing liberty let godly oppose innocencie wisdome spirit subtiltie leaud quality wicked cannot match thereby let willingly take foile submit themselues god rather returne euill euill vrging gaal zebul alleaging owne word said verse abimelech made goe forth ful soone turned face away fled may see god shamed bragges euen among men shechem hee made boasting well might take shame rash vnwise aduenturing set vp head guide saw nothing bragges thus doth god daily put shame boaster aduance cleaue vnto boaster make flourish base vnsetled person admire applaud god doth iustly suffer doe one deceiue bee deceiued accordingly haue prouoked yet great mercy doth humble bring repentance cannot shame see haue done although see pitie better thereby make vse thereof runne bad course made openly ashamed speake well giue watchword bethinke themselues betimes taking better course also great comfort wary aduised shun auoide deceiuers base flourishers doe take like heed care keepe themselues euery euill way returne doct verse gaal driuen cowardly flie made great bragges courage manhood see many doe shew themselues bee triall without grace little difference doe onely meane hereby grosse great bragger haue spoken already others also kind though counted lower degree example many may see shew great liking good thing professe forwardnesse religion dislike others doe beforehand themselues comparison many yet cleere either haue small vse religion best many haue disgrace condemne else reuolt time faire shewes thereby doe openly bewray nothing froth found small cause griefe best make great profession yet many deceiue themselues others stead whereof let god true seruants feare alwaies blessed prou doe infirmity vntowardnesse feele giue occasion thinke better walke vprightnesse hart toward god neglect honour cor shall haue opportunitie giuing good example others gaal captaine men shechem fled many verse fell slaine according lord foretelling sin gedeons house boasting defender himselfe tooke vpon cast citie brother much remaine let learne lesson shunne auoide boaster wit neither put themselues vnder doct shadow flesh euen shall serued men shechem repose confidence man earthly thing doth cleerely shew beginning destruction men shechem argument kingdome tyrannie hee thought liker many preuaile one although commonlie commeth passe men stablish themselues flattery cosoning yet otherwise hee frustrate hope see cast abimelech god dealeth ofttimes doct though many vnworthy person lift vp head build nest high dart misfortune call pride extortion crueltie boasting c yet god many time hindreth course throweth downe soone broke ill course iudas matth king sam sam tooke rich ioab abner achitophel neere king whose day liued yet time cast downe greatnes glory oh hath done like latter time since wil need darken obscure god glory gospell owne pleasure setting vp themselues may see owne eye also applauded haue receiued due reward god hath cast downe shame yet worst behind abideth whatsoeuer change meet meane season best state sin bringeth life haue mentioned let feare godly taste dainty count lest eue reaching gene hand doe taste also punishment wise wish many stripe neuer done verse morrow people went field told abimelech fought citie day hee tooke citie slew people therein destroyed citie sowed salt men tower shechem heard entred hold house god berith told abimelech men shechem gathered together abimelech gate vp mount zalmon people abimelech tooke ax cut downe bough tree tooke bare shoulder said vnto folke yee haue seene doe make hast doe like people also cut downe euery man bough followed abimelech put hold set hold fire men tower shechem died also thousand men woman forementioned slaughter holding gaal citie israelite shechem thought among themselues would summe verse auenged abimelech seemeth went citie pursue neuer considered punishment sustained already rash putting themselues vnder vaineglorious boaster gaal vnaduisedly followed quarrell vnderstanding tooke aduantage attempt disposed band souldiers hee set two take came forth citie slew hee another band rushed entrance citie hauing fought whole day took slew people destroyed citie sowed salt men shechem gone citie walke doe clearing verse businesse perhaps would thinke abimelech haue needed prepare two three band armed men set vpon scatteringly vnarmed comming forth worke gone vpon pleasure gained haue gone forth band person cleare therefore said certaine went warlike manner fight abimelech though went without gaal captaine much prouoked incensed losse neighbour abimelech slaine day many heated much spite rashnesse desire fulfilled see desperate shift men driuen falsehood crueltie rashnesse vaine confidence man like sinnes wise man would looke better end doings god brought vpon trouble innocencie hee would haue taught beare whatsoeuer like haue followed runne vpon sword point therefore sought fight abroad waited set vpon men citie destroyed best end sinne bringeth vpon committers thus wilfulnesse stomacke stubbornesse bring many destruction contrary minded peace contention whoring drunkennesse riot doe like kind seeme bee safest freest danger sort may looke better fruit end euill doings shame sorrow miserable death though enemy men shechem found whether bee bed wrought owne hand one repentance breake euill course god seruants behold see wofull end euill doings bring many yet iolitie thought god sometimes sweepes away companie bad men euill doct verse worker one place hee whole kingdomes ioshuas time made people possesse inhabit sometime keepeth vnder wasteth enemy degree one another noted space abimelechs raigne point hath handled marke shall finde though hee giue scope libertie time hee doth may repent meane looking thing say mark shall see god either beginneth blow vpon prosperitie east wind note spring beginneth nip hold leaues comming similitude foorth else great frost doth kill doth suddenly send desolation vpon one way time come therefore let seruant god feare dismaied greatnes pride small time glorie iollitie shall vanish shall seene greater surely cut eccles hope lay glorie dust oh righteous could praise god hee hath kept time danger within bound suffering grossely reach hand iniquitie haue seene workes god shewed enemy euer bee firme couenant keeping god thing thus brought killing many doct former verse men shechem thing vnlikely first making abimelech king shall amisse consider little spoile men great yet small likelihood thereof till lord sent euill spirit betwixt abimelech would haue said time agreement loue betwixt haue growne point become vtter enemy neerely ioyned knit together amitie friendship could thus alienated vttermost defiance one promised abimelech aboue respected preferred would haue said hardliest handled yea destroyed wee must vnderstand two cause hereof one rising one loue wicked cursed bound together rotten band wrath god burning like fire brake consumed band whereby hee raised euill spirit betwixt destroying let wise bee instructed hereby men companion friend euill linked together feare god loue goodnesse fellowship hold long likelihood shewes soeuer continuance thereof euils compact framed deadlier violent shall breach accompanied wicked practises yet euen secret moth selfeloue priuy pride seeking commoditie therby ground agreement fellowship euen wil consume moth doth garment worke sentence agreement alreadie shall surely come naught betwixt abimelech men shechem vnlikely soeuer shall seeme time peace loue say fellowship vnreformed although bee ill end purpose entred let haue well strength place wee may see men haue religion acquaintance god wise great soeuer poore shift haue prouide safetie euen thinke holinesse place god wood stone reliques saint rotten prop shall free trouble feares although seek true god haste much liker worke good yet heart farre without confidence would helpe euen seeking able deliuer bruised reedes spider web much like helpe baal priest obtained calling deceiuing people manner elia caused slaine euen helpe doth king wilful generation papist seminary death greatest need obtaine themselues superstitious votary haue deluded brought snare one principall ringleader death constrained renounce opinion merit humane satisfaction sinne although loth haue gap opened people shame grossely seduced another yet liuing greaterreckoning popish church better meane forced confesse auoiding perill vainglorie carnall presumption safest repose man whole confidence onely mercie god christ iesus see howsoeuer sinister end suppresse truth abuse sillie proselites yet copelled force conscience terror death put away lying equiuocating attaine dye hardnes hart wherein liued whe f lleth otherwise confesse renounce coceits bruised reed vnable support commonly vnprofitable themselues yet serue deterre others venturing resting boldly vpon vngrounded assertion omit third long great account reckoning among people religion visiting vpon deathbed eare witnesse sixe seuen place present also partie shortly deceasing renounced dunghill stuffe religion reckoned poperie deceitfull trade particularly chiefe point thereof yet long stiffe stout defender maintainer thereof oh therefore blessed people whose god lord iehouah know onely true god hath sent iesus christ ioh eternall life men shechem slaine idolatrous temple idoll berith
