aboue see flatterie end came greater enemie true indeed fell according iotham denounced wit fire come bramble destroy cedar lebanon excuseth fact abimelech counsell purpose god touching deliuerance christ death good watchword excused iudas traytor priest act put death good therefore vse made doctrine euer needfull therefore bee heard regarded namely wee take heed trust giue credit vnto say wee haue proued faithfull men shechem may teach v rashly readily trusted deceiuer false hearted abimelech sauiour would commit himselfe said beleeue ioh last knew man much lesse ought doe know much falsehood doubling trust ignorant prophane hypocrite therefore salomon going neere marke could gaue counsell trusting prou men thine owne friend thy father forsake thou c may proofe made faithfulnes vprightnes first rest vpon especially lie v doe necessary gift faithfulnes meane apostle requires feruants meaner sort person one two necessary duty diligence without cannot doe duty well may see thereby needfull greater matter sinceritie rare finde according salomon complaineth saying shall one finde faithfull man paul prou thes haue faith fruite faith faithfulnes true heartednes cause v begin selues vrge heart vprightnes first marueile finde others ourselues may trusted vpon word approue selues would taken obseruation experience good dealing wee finde thereafter let v giue credit vnto yet meane good dealing hath learned preaching gospell according knowledge vprightnes good dealing men bee led chusing companion mariage hearken euery glosing tongue make faire large promise haue deceiued thousand also seeking seruants haue may child faithfull well religiously brought vp care chusing executor comeprimitters would put trust demanded shall found may trusted matter importance answere beside haue said already euery one aske question must first begin himselfe practise sinceritie hee may better complaine want thereof adde call finde worthie goe without although doe hereby excuse void offer contrary euill measure say worthy goe without would full gladly finde deale carping biting note scoffing accusing precisenes labour endeuor keepe conscience pure good many age cannot soone perceiue man woman withdraw themselues sinnes time bee afraid offend common sort doe cry precisians allow none vpright conscionable way life matter though meete dealing shew small conscience vprightnes toward god iust make others measure haue measured others salomon saith kinde eccles teach know vpright hearted man eccles worth make much rather discourage one example shall serue cruell landlord cry vnfaithfull tenant hath broken day may runne away rent fault poore tenant dare appeare lord craue differencie cruell lord hath borne hand hath let good peniworth whereas indeede hee hath racked fleeced fitter begge reliefe pay debt farme hauing nothing neere sufficient owne labour vphold himselfe let crie vnfaithfulnes till weary pitie let dead bury dead sauiour saith serued haue deserued let reape haue sowne answere let v lament pray vnfaithfulnes common least let v pray may free hauing doe vnfaithfull men commonly also vnreasonable least beguiled ere aware abner amasa ioab except lord giue man wisedome sam discerne cannot alwaies bee auoided besides least trust hath found experience let men wise repose least trust put precious liquor broken vessell hauing proued vn vse folly venter dash foot stone remember hath hurt v therfore say let men trust whose fidelity truth haue proofe rather cotrary least may without great detriment themselues must need trust let bind strongly let vndertake suretiship beware lose liberty bring themselues bondage estate posteritie wilfull penurie let christian beware vnder colour loue seeke vndermine betray get somewhat might tend danger brother wounding owne conscience speake many silly christian thinke themselues happy get countenance benefit superior knowing benefit vngodly forked bring backe bestow boner mischiefe flattering poore men till abiured truth crueltie cause salomon admonisheth well saying desirous prou daintie meates deceiuable meate without inquirie obseruing best manner selues others rashly beleeue euery one speake v faire indeed faire word make fooles faine according prouerb say light credit send present example let looke became smooth word faire shewes abimelech made men shechem kinsman mother brother reposed confidence greater enemie euen neither let looke find better measure though may bee laid forth kind fellowship among men yet commonly seene earthly dealing wherin scarcely promise kept liuely seene marriage note solemne kind ioyful beginning haue many might worthily haue prouoked beholder thereof praise god reioyce goodly ordinance like bring foorth answerable fruit beginning betwixt couple themselues marrying comming together liking betwixt delightings one another could neuer enough neither might one well anothers sight continuance longer shorter haue turned contrary dislike wearines hath one another alienating affection crossing one chiding railing reuiling separating bed board yet must need liue together afterward vtter casting one speake heauinesse lord chastisement meeting taking hold doe raise euen best subiect wherein haue promised companion one helpe beare burden kind behauiour would preserue loue doth betwixt others speake say correction lord mischiefe euill corrupt heart false raging proud wilfull inconstant haue wrought betwixt disguised nothing like person seemed bee first meeting oh therefore towards men wee bewray disease much feared professing repentance god secret thing hid men comming word sacrament need haue vprightnesse two verse shewed meanes slew cutting downe boughes tree bidding men doe vers putting hold setting fire till men shechem therein died may see force example especially bad touching though haue spoken large especially chap end sinne tribe neglecting lord charge recorded desire reader turne vnto yet vnto apt occasion somewhat say also gedeons men followed carrying pitcher lampes great danger feare midianites commendable wicked cruell commonly followed yet denied giue good example would follower also meeknesse humblenesse innocencie faithfulnesse mercy pietie patience like namely rich men would part begin rest go others deed charitie sell lower price poore thing deare common price would example mercy harmelesnesse gentlenesse like hard say good might done thus hauing religion holy instruction high account louing heartily well esteeming god people come men wealthier sort especially whereas might bring many christian practise well haue ala cold loue good cause slow backward therefore deadnesse vnprofitablenesse bee seene thicke threefold learne diuell labouring cannot make sort alike wickednesse leaue giue countenance note good thing may bee men bee vnapt learne performe duty aright except see good example cannot tell set vpon goe euill course need none goe therein find way thereto without guide though much fleshed drawne haue breake ice best example giuen let bee rule wee follow otherwise follow christ doe let perswade v al zeale forwardnesse cor duty first table reuerent receiuing word preached right manner preparing selues lord supper like exercise wise follow common sort behauiour practise duty men second table let v goe forward vnweariednes also cursed abimelech businesse marked one thing another toyleth himselfe yea without perill life base worke one would thinke goe vp mountaine cut downe boughes tree bring necke set hold burne good enough thus men toile indanger themselues pleasure profit base manner though come nothing soone lose hee doe sort men poore liuing yet oft faile notwithstanding whereas meane godlinesse great rich lieth dead tim perswasions brought seeke least delighting therein whilest yet god alloweth time trauell enough thing meet necessary example duly come sermon lord supper though might reape small benefit thereby doe accordingly sit wearie sleepie preaching word yet part men two action prayer excepted shew much resemblance religion whole life beside oh euen god faithfull seruants grow many like point shewing much vnto wardnesse word sacrament yet haue approched great reuerence chearefulnesse former time men asked endure toile paine take world cold duty heauen ward answere man borne labour world hard labour shall neither haue food rayment make psalmist saith rise earely sit vp late fare full hardly poore liuing ah poore soules haue got speake many way offend god getting yet oft time disappointed seeke either leaud spending god curse vpon say haue doe ye see solemne day death count great gain fruit labor soule yet vnprouided life little enough feed clothe bodie thinke vpon short warning prouide soule soule much value body nay world yet getting saluation soule bodie shall fare better also yea euen shall bee better able doe earthly labour chearefulnesse without vexation put finger cold water think euery little time bestowed way toylesome tedious particularly giue diligence obtaine faith repentance commanded vnwelcome charge thereof vnto v yet easilier obtained assured successe wee seeke wee would find durable possession necessary daily vse farre pretious gaine exceeds rich prince without vpon deathbed al confessed yet whole quarter thought men haue life strength want heart thereto generally let learne men shechem ioyne doct verse themselues acquaintance wicked men hope gaine pleasure preferment god meet recompence deserue one time may seene abimelech great promise repaired cleaued vnto got end nay sought much lose euen liues themselues intend seeke commoditie hand doe said last point saue one euen bring themselues bondage haue conscience accuse beside taken vp thought wit gaine shall get manner diuell occupieth draw mind better imployed beside say must need goe ill professe gospell seeke keepe good conscience shall consider papist libertine prophane bad liuers held hope flattered get lose best case haue least doe ala suspect seruitude labour bring prou borrower seruant lender much receiuer giuer hunt precious soule whose benefactor would seeme bee aiming marke especially euen make child hel fully themselues yet farre worse neere lincked fellowship bewitched enchaunting intising word cannot tell bring themselues backe againe maze wherein grant make shift digest thing till day visitation come wit end verse abimelech went theber besieged tebez tooke strong tower within citie thither fled men woman chiefe citie shut went vp top tower abimelech came vp vnto tower fought went hard vnto doore tower set fire certaine woman cast peece milstone vpon abimelech head brake braine pan abimelech called hastily page bare harnesse said vnto draw thy sword slay men say woman slew page thrust died men israel saw abimelech dead departed euery man vnto owne place thus god rendered wickednesse abimelech vnto father slaying seuentie brother also wickednesse men shechem god bring vpon head vpon came curse iotham sonne ierubbaal thus haue heard god punished men shechem sinne gedeons sonnes abimelech also plagued prophecy iotham might bee verified vpon laid foorth word followeth vnto end former two mischiefes abimelech wrought men sense vers shechem destroyed citie people strong place hold rest resorted safetie burnt say holy story addeth hee went another thereby shewing yet satisfied blood former therefore went wit citie neere adioyning called thebez also probable though vncertaine either ioyned shechemites least refused subiect abimelech going tooke also thus see cruell baseborne tyrant proceeded bloody attempt thereby also shewed extremitie people thebez brought vnto driuen shift themselues tower citie wherein vers doct though might shelter themselues day yet could long liue must need bee famished least thing could see like danger men lie open changeable world whereof see likelihood little may teach v vncertainty al thing yet men repose confidence man vpon good ground say morrow shall bee like day speech lord luke bad luke soule take ease eate drinke bee merry seeing hee laid vp much good store say speech may bee seene lord said vnto thou foole night thy soule shall bee required thee whose shall thing thou hast prouided euen day died lest bee thought bee case alone added shall bee laieth vp treasure himselfe rich toward god therefore many may see heare fearefully taken away many wasted haue estate changed neuer inioyed regard thing like haue much doe shall see owne prosperitie fade like manner oh shall vtterly vnwelcome say lesse smaller change losse sicknesse pouertie disease hard stooping come yea although thought sort prouided said teach wise liue stranger make heauen home though walke vpon earth warne foolish seeke wisdome cling fast earthly stay delight bee foole spoken cast hence vtterly seeke true happinesse also followeth done thebez opening verse lord brought time confusion meane abimelechs also well men shechem effecting god iudgement vpon said sped well haue heard attempted tower thebez take also drunke former successe therefore looking like hee receiued deadly wound due reward woman great disgrace cast downe peece milstone top tower going close doore set fire broke braine pan whereupon strooke quite dead yet past possibilitie recouery called presently page thrust thorow preuent shame thought might else haue said wit woman slaine hee came end also last attempt hauing sped well former wee may doct verse see wicked fleshed successe haue bad course bee blinded therewith make stay till cut middest make account shall doe haue done dreame resisting say themselues like psalme tush lord doe neither good euill time god make feele power displeasure acknowledge teaching going forward til god stay course see cannot breake make sinne greater like shall obserue god willing beniamites chap booke herod hee slaine iames sword saw pleased iewes went take peter also till attempt lord cut maruell actes though god vsually deale thus wicked know measure future successe former make see wrong ground thereby imboldned goe god successe corruption made vnfit returne againe must know word god followed obeyed carefully v bringeth good successe indeed wee may rest yea blessing soeuer pleaseth note lord send v outward thing hee promiseth many saying doe thing shall cast vpon haue also inward matth comfort thereby neither bought money neither taken v maketh v glad vse imbrace good meanes strengthening stablishing v drunken earthly peace make account considered godly haue small cause repine successe ioyfull proceeding vngodly lord giues scope might bring sudden desolation vpon looke morrow like day much better neither grieue godly themselues often crossed denied successe dreamt desired seeing either enterprise euill therein bee crossed blessing lawfull vnlawfully followed therfore god promise note stretcht indeed reached although doings religious yet may vndertaken much confidence goodnesse thereof meane season themselues doer looked well purged sinnes may easily set behind successe best action doubtlesse christian offends none way shall neuer want successe manifest grieuous cannot hid crieth vengeance either ignorance haue wittingly grossely offended borne may come repentance yet excuse liue light gospell haue knowlege liue abide vnrepentant though grosse offender neither side haue cause flatter themselues whose sinnes notorious though cut vse doctrine respect incourage doe walke way vngodly stand stiffely maintaine euill doings seeing god giueth time repent beareth harden heart take occasion turne vnto fit heare doctrine goe forward euill may euer feare god vengeance comming brought bee past hope life blow woman gaue see hee sought hauing deadly wound woman onely bewraied pride encreased shamefulnesse foile yet slaine page honour great king valiant victorious abimelech thought himselfe top hope hauing brought vnder enemy hath set v habitation stinted time dwelling commandement idle vnprofitable knowledge lord iesus act particular calling attend thereunto profitable v selues others hath purpose appointed pet haue thing bee considered wit double repairing returning god hee afflicted enemy sin forsaking first seeking repulse repentance sound second god deliuered seeking repentance former note foure thing first sinne ioyning nation among dwelt sixth verse second god punishing euen ioyned idolatrie snewed next three verse third point cry god lastly fruite thereof tenth verse forward fruite diuers first god denied deliuer fifteenth verse second cry people god hee deliuered set downe next two verse vnto seuenteenth let thing looked particularly returne therefore sixth verse opening verse particularly begin people sinne said death two iudges whose day enioyed peace fiue fortie yeeres people fell againe prouoke god wee haue heard father committing idolatrie manner seuen nation mentioned liking flesh besides thought nation liued abundance pleasure themselues many delight tickle flesh forward adioyned false worship draw away heart seruing true god aright said forsooke thus much summe verse therein sinne diuers thing considered first teacheth greatly marueile many doct vers age giue themselues popish religion seeing idolatrie hath age common reason hath many playerlike toyes bables sight bleare eye sonets deceiue eare maketh thinke peece paradise embrace made drunke fond conceit indeed thereby caried fast asleepe hell nothing moueth delighteth word god rightly vnderstood blind deuotion false religion wherein haue nuzled vp fond fantasticall conceit shall goe heauen thereby authoritie warrant masse trumperie beginning world nay sauiour christ time many hundred yeeres shred ragge vsed knowne especially end whereas true seruing god alwaies euen beginning heb whole prone people worship god ease farre like whether sound true counterfeit may seene onely poperie coyned purpose deceiue simple strong delusion also religion outward manner holy pure good consisteth hearing prayer vse sacrament substance thereof yet many allow true manner worshipping god doe part draw neere god body heart farre would say would gladly goe heauen would haue easie way thither serue god spirit truth ioh direct way thither cannot bend themselues thereto whereas great delight worshipping god aright psal lord allowance promise two former kindes popish outward worship wanting great delight say sound true performing farre fraile flesh may attaine reward promised thereto vnutterable psal verse also may bee seene fruite people yeelded doct lord long enioyed peace euen wee haue seene father fell lasciuiousnes forgetting god sufficient deut watchword whereof giuen moses laying sinne selues fearefull great let v onely consider thus seeing point hath largely handled already diseased person pained stone note strangury famished hee penury man exile banishment say might set free oppresseth would readily offer couenant doe seruice god yea much feruently men therefore grieuous sin let men iudge may health wealth ease outward peace doe meane serue lord thing requireth yet mean brought leaue considered euery one shal see cause particularly said forsooke lord may doct marueiled forsake loued serued may see force sinne besot make drunken giue ouer themselues thereto whoredome loue world able bereaue sound reason turne away delight prayer good practise forget ioy sometimes yet blindfold shall suspect danger toward al may merrily serue humour therein sampson went farre way let best v feare lest carried away lust loue like wee ought tempt god let v resist beginning euill wee know little may befall v time wee note dare deale loosely vnfaithfully lord suffer selues beled away stedfastnes boldnes carelesnesse thus suffered beare sway v may cause scripture time said verified v haue forsaken lord strength yet men cunning deceiue themselues hoping long embrace another religion shall become iudged hardly though take vp delight sin please thought therefore amisse giue caueat vaine doe men worship god though draw neere body suffer heart goe another way kinde forsaking god though high degree time themselues like come vnto labour lost bestow seruing god accompanied anoiance vnsauourines vtterly abhorreth phrase forsaking god taken wedlocke either partie renounceth interest fellowship departeth away euen phrase selling away vsed next verse god part importeth like action lord iustly giuing ouer part resigned right husband married himselfe vnto vnto strange idol lord put ouer interest vnto strange idolater alienating himselfe commoditie sold changeth owner becomes right another man let men thinke may pleasure breake couenant knot marriage god thinking may returne list list sampson companion leuite concubine neither easie doe neither shall finde god ready hastie seeking vpon occasion admit said people sinne occasion thereof haue heard first point foure three next vers verse set god displeasure conceiued thus prouoked sore transgression prouoked also little like hee stirred vp philistims ammonite vexed sore many yeeres onely land ammorites beyond iorden child israel dwelt waxed bold passed ouer iorden made warre tribe iuda beniamin ephraim able resist wee say must need granted heauy bondage vnder remedie lesse would haue moued wrought vpon would complaine crie god little haue heard kept great extremity haue vexed say may see wee come doct vers vnder sore affliction manner take heart v make liues wearisome may thanke selues god vseth cast punishment vpon men peece meale degree giueth warning part least word alwaies wise men seeing plague comming may preuent prou else laieth hand lightly vpon may first repaire intreate stay otherwise suddenly take away righteous wicked shall haue cause complaine shall rest peace god remoue punishment yet reconciled liue obediently hee giue greater grace faith hope patience beare burthen easily farre greater contentment danger harden heart bow meekely god vnder burthen outward calamitie bondage wee haue heard god punished people committing idolatrie suffered enemy oppresse sore longtime al expressed though grieuous may well see noted also sin turned sunshine god fauour darke vncomfortable displeasure men purchase themselues wilfulnesse rebellion might otherwise go good liking dwell safely vnder wing protection day long madnesse cast themselues deadly feares vnquietnesse anguish soule lord displeasure sharpe arrowes sticking deut fast reproch discountenance god oppression enemy reached people beyond iorden well side onely wherein thereat verified whereof hath spoken idol snare vnto euen destruction besides see miserie spred time side iorden reached euen israelite also dwelt beyond iorden although enemy began first dwelt land amorites yet seeing people side iorden communicated nation sinne therfore plagued alike enemy fareth v many ioyne together prouoking god shall smart together bearing correction though lord begin said shechem abimelech first apart yet fire burneth one house another wil say deuour rest former length plague haue heard hath done said verse cried lord saying vers haue sinned haue spoken also long miserie ere complained therfore wil repeate two point onely noted crie vnfainedly first smart felt hauing repulse god seeing preuailed thereby set themselues seeke lord repent truth heart shewed afterwards first seeking come true repentance appeareth lord reiecting cry bidding goe god serued helpe hee would haue done turned truth hee full compassion readie receiue vpright heart exod wee may see many men extremity doct confesse sinnes god saul hee feared losse kingdome crie yet otherwise hardly wrung neither doe sincerely yet say speake doe hypocrisie say note need hast crie onely consider god looketh truth hand neither resolue afterwards looke aboue thing keepe couenant god neither therefore indeed doe like ahab bow time bulrush afterward forgetting carelesnes negligence said promised whereas truth vnfainedly repent turne god looke duly constantly promise made dauid said haue sworne psal performe keepe thy righteous iudgements need lesse couenant god man would thinke vnlesse boldly grossely shew despise helpe fill church reuolters reade psalme psalm vse repeate referre reader place mentioned verse lord vnto god yee haue chosen let saue tribulation verse followeth god said cry sense people called vpon god began seemed repent god answered indeed sharpely roughly appeareth text whether high priest prophet hardly reproued reason awake bring sound constant repentance yet come vnto haue said yee seeke deliuered ye doe end ye set libertie may returne old byas againe follow lust serue strange god could haue thought would hereafter saith lord haue reuolted call vpon time heard first deliuered yet haue forsaken bee seene day marke ye stil beare haue cast behind back deliuered egyptian ammorites ammonite stead thanks ye forsooke fell serue strange god horrible thus therfore lord haue heard casteth teeth doings namely idol haue said yee see god call able doe could haue helped see would neuer haue sought therefore deliuer seeke ye see cannot briefly end state thus doct laid open lord note rather repeate whole answere lord make heere easie matter men deceiue knoweth heart guile falsehood flattery beguile men charitie ought iudge best heare see heare men good pang either great blessing befalles held vnder great affliction feare death kept vpon racke haue heard powerfull sermon hath searched quicke behold great workes god power thunder lightning wind tempest sea land see god hand vpon men heauy vpon themselues way vpon occasion say heare speech see behauiours men note word thanksgiuing trembling admiration nay confession prayer breake earnest couenants vowes repentance say heare thing time would make simplehearted christian crie amazed feare boldly affirme god glorified doubtlesse person throughly changed truly penitent god truth surely saul become prophet god thus simplicitie doe many iudge occasion see except bee well experienced say like case cursed deceiue yet thus speake till afterward much astonished see contrary thus wee see deceiue men whereas lord wee may see example cannot bee easily deluded neither wil soone satisfied speech still waiteth truth reiected chap sam people deuteronomy feare strongly possessed thereof deut hast protested would obey lord thing moses tell mouth god lord smelt found presently thus saith moses people saith wel haue count hollow person rotten heart false couenant therefore hee one time reckon villany hypocrisie durst couer vnder vizard speech humblenes truth v haue learned practised better let v beware paul king vnpardonable sin speech haue contrarily scripture thing noted god manner men sheweth fearefull speech hee heere offended v note cause doth oft afflict v end may make v search see feele special sinnes sermon saying men brother actes shall doe yet little made light sinnes pricked conscience sense hath said matter may gather manner thing sinne appeare proper colour indeed wit note fearefull thing many thinke true say murther adulterie idolatrie like truth haue vttered verified sin also yet seeme lesse odious anger impatience worldlinesse distrust tetchinesse pride heart sloth idlenesse leaudnes eie selfloue deceiuing reuenge rest whatsoeuer come clearely conscience felt duly considered make common matter little grieued lord therefore driuen awake v heere hee people make v astonished stung heart sinnes wee thought small none wee lay nuzled drowned god open eye see seene may felt shame foulenesse basenesse sottishnesse note committing danger bring wee iudge euen well rest horror doth adultery breed thought committing arrow shot liuer say doubt anger past offended shame may say view hereof may bee taken saul god pursued sinne made crie saying shall doe god hath forsaken sam speaketh torment thinke wee felt iudas himselfe said haue sinned betraying innocent blood sinne wounded conscience halter made end life adam transgression also diuers wrought vpon terrified fled god presence farre could hide himselfe thicket gene among tree reckon vp hundred sinned diuers manner one hath abhorred owne vile god make see therefore martyr rather would commit sinne note conscience feele terrour chose lose liues rather wee may reade plentifully booke monument true men doe alwaies see feele neither brought moued astonished sinne except lord strong hand thus forced vrged end matter hand may iudge shall horror iudgement day selfe thing shall fully made manifest vse let v learne seriously haue sinne horror detestation yea euen put harlot face hath force deceiue v lest heare strike wound v heart wee looke thing shall find deadly vnwelcome vnto v another thing herein marked although dealt deceitfully doct lord former abuse deliuerances also complaint make new helpe yet lord leaues case enough haue hardned made quite desperate euen word defiance whereby hee seemeth wholly abandon protection yet secretly drawes deeper searching themselues far serious meditation estate hee might grant desire receiue fauour againe oh vnspeakable admirable note kindnesse lord thus draw water rocke fetch light darknesse god gracious child seemeth frowne sweete pleasant amiable countenance delightfull promise incouragements cannot forget himselfe farre child though degenerate put habit affection towards euen would play iudge pleasant louing kindnesse therefore although easie idolatrie say yee proue see god doe elia like prophet baal bad cry aloud god baal perhaps asleepe saith c king may meane crie vrge marke well god worshipped therefore thus speaking bidding goe seeke helpe doct idol hand hauing shaken lord teacheth v standeth good reason wee haue serued committed selues must pay v wage lord iustly doth send v patronage greatest need euen conuiction horror yea destruction take v mercie contrariwise yet according equitie sauiour answered peter said fellowes forsaken followed matth therfore asked haue said hundred fold eternall life therfore haue trusted still doe man haue made flesh arme shall know experience one day haue trusted bruised reede god answere worker iniquitie serue satan depart know let know whose portion luke stolne pleasure sinne come time shall infinitly better euer sweete thereafter note shall feele smart sorrow full measure shall remedie reuel redresse papist shall sent helpe pope saint pardon pilgrimage god doth threaten impenitent one haue cast dead workes neuer hee neuer acknowledge patron shall finde bee cold comforter torment shall feele sinnes remembring sought shelter vnto whose seruice life time addicted themselues thus wise parent guide superiour taught answere scapethrift lewd wretch hath brought himselfe need prison miserie idlenesse gaming prophanenes bad companionship like doings hee seekes helpe thus say hee answere get whose counsell ye haue hearkened followed may miserie worse themselues therefore vnfit enough succour helpe god manifest nature shall answere liue manner let v learne conclude man shall end well euill life added vnlessed changed repentance therefore good neuer borne briefly conclude doctrine v thereof wee see secondly god doth import lesse law like equitie vertue farre stronger couenant people persisted faithfull seruice could haue denied suite help defence enemy otherwise reason doth shake send idol serued except meant himselfe would haue besteadded cleaued succour brought plentifull gaine answer cost hope men haue runne themselues rom breath life groping blind happinesse vnprofitable superstitious prophane course length seeing themselues deceiued wish serued taken away would haue libertie liue hold fast sinnes still abide note dearer v owne flesh euen manner many v oft boldly deale lord repentance hardly attained vnto euen sue lord ease trouble may bee willinglie bee eased yet cannot brought see amend thing amisse flatter themselues great owne eies iniquitie found worthy hated yet worse murmur vnder affliction doe hide sinnes particularly cleare people saw euil worshipping strange god would acknowledge til god draue sore iudgements see see prouoke speciall sinnes let v feare wee abhorre weary instruction warning giueth v say bring v thereto sharpe correction best iudge selues iudged lord lord hardly vrging people fell serious searching themselues came better state wee may see hardly god people brought confesse renounce sinnes hauing fallen sometimes haue done yet see feele hand god release issue trouble seene many drawne thereby sorrow repentance haue felt god anger kindled sinnes first hardly part abide told heare iudgements brought home lord hath tamed subdued affliction especially inward rebel pride stoope vnder burden good hope euen high minded doe kicke pricke refractarie note wilfull doe surely come euill therefore seeing may find mercy god affliction neuer felt prosperitie wee storme comming rather looke good apostle iames wisheth v doe telleth iames v matter greatest ioy fall many lastly matter returned serue sinned leaue euill doe good resting god promise submitting ourselues holy say together confession signes repentance infallable euen contrarie failing may easily breed question sufficiencie true repentance scripture doth otherwise commend holy story thus setteth forth people thus repented soule lord grieued misery euen angrie reuolting doth admirably commend god mercy oft set downe scripture spoken ioel c ionas though god mooued affection thing noted men ascribed god spoken manner men euen first grieued misery pitie god said grieued receiuing mercy may truly say god exceedeth mercy ammonite guide iudge ouer led hereto god may appeare lord raised vp iudges ouer confirmed iphtah going story thus laid foorth wil stay little say thing doct vers ammonite israelite first child ammon gone take city ground people israel hand possession oppressed warre israel repentance turning god might easily haue done none durst heart resist appeareth story suffered oppresse till last yeere especially sore distressed tormented besides god also sought lord truth heart heartned imboldned resist stand hope wee see manifestly declare wee may see god keepeth doct vers note many euils trouble deare seruants till hee hath made fit able goe vnder whereas come vpon vtterly ouerwhelmed turneth many affliction away altogether saw could auoide euen hee deferreth many shall touch till hath strengthened shoulder put courage heart made able beare yet leaueth vnexercised one small easie seeth profitable fit beare v well consider shall find goodnes hath herein exceeded toward v choose see first inlightning v faith wee weake might easily haue dismaide hee hath kept many sinnes sight saw hardly kept despaire sundry trouble also appeared v yet wee nothing able heare much lesse beare would haue swallowed v vp note haue driuen v vtter desperation true vnderstand first conuersion euen also v throughout whole life spareth v end may better incouraged serue faithfully know afterward may fit see sinnes also take part affliction abide v euen wee vse child tenderly bee young growne vp set worke shew must labour suffer hardnesse better able goe vnder thus lord cal backe saul pursuit dauid sam likely could haue escaped hand let alone nashash king ammon might easily haue destroyed giliadites first onset vnarmed lord stopt caused hearken needlesse condition whereby time sam protracted helpe sent meane season ouerthrew kind dealing lord resembles friendly person spying furious enemy comming fiercely weapon neighbour vnarmed vnprouided meet stayeth rage one till haue got himselfe arm fit encounter may escape hand hee hath done commits together knowing innocent partie hauing better cause easily foile doer wrong thus lord often doth although seeth time also either quite diuert enemy king ashur comming weake ierusalem else take people part moses israelite exod egyptian fight stand still looke pharao zenacherib lord reserues people till time strength courage suffering may say canaanite come vpon people weake late circumcision greater fauour remoued triall wholly haue onely proofe god goodnesse haue beside triall faith grace precious gold triumpheth hauing got victory ouer enemy whether spirituall earthly thomas bilney godly man imprisonment strong assault giuen owne flesh paine fire feared able endure knoweth would haue done triall hottest hee weakest lord suited time fire put feared foile weake became strong heb ouercame heb fire yeelding whole body wast whereas finger could abide candle great grace therefore beleeue apostle implieth god wil keepe v affliction fit cor note honour liker ouercome corruption betray cause obiect foiles diuers seruants god preuented taken vnawares strong trial cranmer first assault enemy forced yeeld ought c let know god hath diuers end diuers method teacheth men humblenesse knowledge themselues assault cannot answer end may abler trial afterward hauing renounced themselues got firmer hold vpon alsufficiencie god without whose protection note weake men let men beware abuse dealing god owne hurt seeing god holding forbearing trial wee could beare doth require exceeding thanks vpon serious recording manner dealing v time time also growing daily strength suffer greater trouble hereafter grace common grossely inuert note abuse purpose god make vse sparing dandling lap armes weare feare expectation affliction altogether whereby longer free weaker suffer difference point ye make betwixt affliction euer vnwelcome intolerable meane vngodly let christian beware therefore softnesse tendernesse furthermore haue heard seuenth eighth verse philistims doct vers ammonite sore vexed israel eighteene yeeres time neuer durst take vp weapon vntill repented began good courage resist assembled themselues may noted liberty courage true repentance bringeth reason men conscience see haue dealt trecherously god haue nourished followed desire owne heart contrary knew haue done haue hope time neither feele heart strength opportunitie offered iniuriously dealt driuing among right law hereupon hee demanded could streight seeke among indeed could sound reason request fauour hated hauing receiued measure could hee trust could denie shame remember would preferre said make recompence rather perswade thereof confessed whole matter vnto wilfull stood neede saw well cruell spightfull hee would neuer haue condescended vnto would haue held racke learne god doth oft make v stand need helpe doct vers hate despise first end wee may see fault hating take shame cause secondly ouercome enuie need one another would grow strong cause lord dispose tribe euer needed one another see story booke bookes samuel might hold one another idolater might hate spirituall respect god made people stand need apostle railed vpon second act act weighed would neuer hate fall doe easily one another considering plunge may put thereby driuen stand need euen among hand doe v great hurt yet doe rest owne sufficiencie want note wise foresight casualty may befall pride heart present estate would stand neede none neither beholding vnto nourishing hardnes heart high mindednes may glorie themselues therfore rather offer violence themselues vse helpe like ahab spake michaiah stood great need help wished vse godly iehosaphat saith hate doth prophecie king good better haue beholding respect passion restraint nature bridling corrupt heart seeke enemie seeing god doth make v stand need one another wee make heart bow bend especially shall also owne good benefit although must say commendable v profitable v thus farre seeke may feare better thereby naturall man straine himselfe aduantage doe crosse ourselues euill heart rebell v would carrie v contrarie stoope ouercomming poyson corruption also conscience sake may please god therein grace worthie thing indeed done doe well help one another perswade turne away alienate rancour stomacke enemy iacob hath commendably gone v herein esau dauid gen king toward saul prophet elisha perswade king israel handle enemy kindly fell hand yet side must take heed well flattering men euill hating wee may sinne obtaine get men fauour beare crosse contentedly euer wee driuen seeke helpe whose sinne wee haue set outselues wee haue done duty though wee receiue ill measure good god make way v al shall well expedient turne heart towards v said let v make none enemy needlesse prouoking hold peace possible yea euen enemy would haue done iphtah vsed become iehoram king elisha persisted reiecting motion made father scorned king predecessor elija therefore wee wise god may order resist proud men euen haue prouoked rashnes may place doe v much hurt none saue person haue scorned helpe v neede saul newly created king iust humour therefore called sonnes belial defied tush say sam new vpstart shall base fellow saue v would acknowledge take king shortly haue done nahash came vpon despised fellow accounted holpen seeking saul victorie demaunded people spake saul despightfully saying shall raigne ouer v bring foorth let slaine therefore may auoid shame imputation folly extreames abandon man nothing worth seeke acknowledging onely helper let v learne moderation towards neither burdensome greatest yet beare scornefull minde toward meanest samaritan man fell among theeues knowne one scorned better like one would haue loosed relieued extremitie yet may well thinke case hee must haue rare proud stomack would haue lien still wounded paine rather beholding helpe let giue poore caueat concerning humour must depend vpon yet hauing proud heart wish depended vpon sometimes vtter word effect say vnto ill becommeth richest euen may bee sure one time smart proud stomacks much worse beseemeth poorest rather salomon saith vse entreatie let breake heart make holy vse god affliction vpon submit themselues bearing burthen heart wealthier iustly hardned also see desiring helpe iphtah doct vers expelled oft time thing men reiect god chuseth doe great enterprizes cleerely verified sauour stone builder refused made chiefe act corner stone also liuely verified apostle paul himselfe saying himselfe good done rest al made cor gazing stocke world angel men day doth lord gather church together counted abiects world doth make member church dearest vnto counted meete liue earth therefore let faithfull seruant god dismaied discourtesy discouragement shall meete vnthankfull world lord seeth workes hath neuer lesse account plentifully reward point need say much hauing often handled booke alreadie sixtie five sermon eleventh chapter booke ivdges let v proceed iphtah answere made elder gilead first therefore hee repeateth vers rippeth vp fault time past committed telling comming distresse might well marueiled neuer hauing made agreement easie seene hee answered might lawfully doe putting away gall bitternes meete secure euen lawfull v good occasion offered doe hee like case wit rehearse men great iniurying v would make nothing yet necessarie followed practised v alwaies iphtah said namely repeating doct vers fault partie able fit beare weightines matter requireth without due regard ripping vp matter note fault betwixt haue variance oft time reuiuing increasing strife betwixt party men gilead seeing many offence bin great apparant excluding therefore hee maketh mention iniurie offered hauing good opportunitie meekly kindly yet gedeon wel ripping vp burying iniury done men ephraim passing ouer silence yet sore prouoked therefore herein must craue god spirit wisedome direct note v deale like case whether repeate wrong done vnto v farre word heate passion vttered passe shall found expedient rehearse wrong yet must resolued v doe without bitternes prouoking haue hurt v make see fault well end affection loue let v goe seeke hand cast teeth ease satisfie stomackes thereby stinging earnestly desiring good thing wee say neither denying mentioning offence helpe wee yeeld benefit shall see cause speake let v also take heed harshnes tartnes speaking whereby heart otherwise easily incensed set fire aware answere exprobration made vers let v verse note doe deny confesse doct vers iniured indeed shew conueying cleanly another way vtterly vnwilling heare telling came namely make captaine deliuerance kindnesse offered hoped said make amends may learne commendable followed doe grant faulted iniured euer bee done v contrarily washing away men fault whereof may iustly bee conuicted facing lying otherwise hiding cloaking extenuating must carefully auoided meanes wee doe lay open god put remembrance onely way couer confessing renouncing belongs promise forgiuenes prou psal called true couering god himselfe psalm wee haue sinned wee ought acknowledge according nature qualitie kinde thereof whether god man publikely priuatly yea one according iames direction word acknowledge fault one another cannot brought iames willingly much hardly offer resistance violence corrupt nature sinnes doe require yet come yeeld farre yet doe houerly fashion get seeke confessing howsoeuer may bee commendable men yet god nothing worth hasted hearing much matter harsh doct hearing sore bewraieth corruption noted v ouer common wit vnwilling haue fault brought light care little seldome heare note thing corrupt nature euill practise yet ioh ready heare hardest knowing wee debters rom flesh enemy professed token doubt filthie hard heart much putrified ready purge poyson putrifaction burst kill v particular practise men like gileadites haue slandered brother whispering report corner thinke safe enough comming light afterwards charged make good take shame thereof eating word cunningly winde themselues argument turning speech matter thinke better please accuser least may couer owne lewdnesse pressed oh say let v vpholding maintenance fruit owne doings haue sought owne vntrustinesse breaking promise whereby haue lost credit together honesty day many care deceiue yea vndoe others therefore come nought themselues also part whereas faithful conscionable vpon bare credit liue maintaine charge borrowing men forbearing whereas obiected behalfe vnthrifts deceiuers must borne withall though cannot pay haue borrowed answer see likelihood repay much seeke borrow take hand men good argueth little honesty therefore well content wind cunningly craftily whereby also impouerish others diminish occupying least manner though goe aboue reach detract belly pastime pay owner therby shewing care come due right whether euer haue againe thing thus may note beautie religion planted men soundly indeed winnes credit hath contrary dealing maketh approoued faithfulnesse conscionablenesse honesty whereas void liueth vtter discredit iust reproch whereas ye say make shew religion doe yet deceiue deale vntrustily creditor answer shew religion practise carrieth beauty speake taken religious offend way know wee religion imboldneth dealing haue little true also haue credit deseruedly doe sweetnesse lost credit better trusted common men answer distrusted first seeing mortal men might lose good securitie whose hand secondlie contention may arise betwixt posteritie party shal come againe seeing deceiuers world would prouoke euen honest contention see hole open espie aduantage rule holdeth also firme good religious action god honour christian continue constant loue truth church god fruit men trust vessel oyle wine sound whole yet begin leake run commit thing vnto danger losing sauiour asked peter sayest thou mat tooke word deserued whereas afterward hee satisfied one two profession rush vpon commonly carelesly prophane habit herein worse heathen counted worthie societie intestabiles called admitted witnesse commonly prostitute themselues gaine sweare falsely magistrate many lord egypt walked wildernesse vnto red sea came kadesh went wildernesse compassed land edom land moab came east side land moab pitched side arnon came within coast moab arnon border moab also israel sent messenger vnto siho king amorites king heshbon israel said vnto let v passe pray thee thy land vnto place sihon consented israel hee goe coast sihon gathered people together pitched iahaz fought israel lord god israel gaue sihon folke hand israel smote israel possessed land ammorites inhabitant countrie possessed coast amorites arnon vnto iabbok wildernesse euen vnto iorden therefore lord god israel hath cast amorites people israel shouldest thou possesse wouldest thou possesse chemosh thy god giueth thee possesse whomsoeuer lord god driueth v possesse art thou farre better balak sonne contention growes past recouerie cease end iphtah asking wrong done came warre giueth vnderstand absurd odious thing doe wrong deale hardly haue done iniurie v therefore hee saith haue done wrong good vttering rashly whatsoeuer heare spoken may doe good neither telling truth wee bound vtter truth shall see expedient doe iphtah onely withstands vntruth also sheweth reason wee vers must withstand vntruth reason approued scripture selfe yeeld may shew themselues vnreasonable bee accounted better wash away sound reason able resist breeding quarrelling contention hereby wherein pharisies priest went neuer resting sound reason wherewith sauiour commoning conuince withstood shamelesly alleage reason v dutie yeeld laban himselfe though idolater answered abraham seruant matter hee dealt seeing report made thing vnto currant reasonable say neither lesse saith hee gen thing lord verse way vse hereof reason haue heard wit child israel offer violence themselues rather would least manner wrong therefore would much lesse take away great portion ground nothing neither prouoked learne neuer finde sweetnesse comming profit amisse namely hurting wronging first seeing wee thereby prouoke god v god auenger thing life god gen matth v besides deale shall dealt againe lastly besides ill name wee shall haue ill conscience also wee may see iudas offer hard measure none least poore cannot beare losse able stand v suite wee commandement god relieue pleasure wee take plucking god threatens rom heare crie oppressor yet poore griped pilled obserueth shall find either god maketh themselues wrong complaining iniurie hard dealing would cease branch came lord sihon deny passage israel doct vers land also prouoke warre might giue land hand withall giue passage country euen many doe wilfully stiffely oppose themselues innocent suite law vntill wealth bee consumed fat lambes sunne others meddle needlesly haue cause oft time neither reason bee disswaded yea better proud stomack contrary counsell salomon lord meaning let fall euill suffer meet match may pay griping vnderlings smart owne sinne otherwise would able hold back way thus adulterer drunkard cauillers wilfull person go kicking prick goe forward sorrow destruction much verified take counsell reproofe law god turne away eares yea liue long time vnder vnprofitably till waxe obdurate surely thus al others vnhappy people lord hath purposed promise ministery gospell conuert saue else case aswellas cauill say either god bound deale paul hee saued violence god hardning men author perdition answere first god free agent bound none creature need al stop euill course much lesse striue breake opposing balaam iourney king numb moab latter say lord need cause man destruction stay runneth owne accord lord find matter sinne neede infuse therfore doe mollifie heart waxeth hard selfe without hardning see wilfulnesse stiffeneckednesse euill doct vers rebellious person redoundeth benefit god seruants many time haue doe reason god resisteth pet proud giueth grace lowly whereby commeth passe wilfull person meete much hardnesse prouoke although want power yet crueltie violence rashnesse runne themselues rocke contrarily algoeth much better part though sometime borne downe suite comprimises innocency good dealing seene rewarded thus lord gaue sentence dauids side saul chose rather house rewarded innocencie one gaue vp reprobate sense two verse see god seruants may good security doct vers boldnes vse inioy possession good god hath giuen much better reason think owne haue howsoeuer haue come whereas haue sanctified vse thing enioy hauing right title god christ heire al although meanes lawfull vse besides come vnlawfully many much meane haue right christ also haue sought good conscience vse accordingly blessed vnto say may learne iphtah answered king ammon thus thou thinkest thine chemosh thou imaginest hath giuen thee much may enioy land amorites lord hath giuen v toucht verse frame argument wee may obserue arguer discretion conuinceth aduersarie ground confessed himselfe handling comparatiuely manner thou saith thinkest thou hast good right giuen thee chemosh doe account selfe hold firmely iehouah god hath granted wee know might haue said much may lay claime iehouah gift thou thy idoll indeed hath authoritie deitie might haue discoursed much truly touching difference betweene god idoll heathen iewes true church god purpose might haue ridiculous could dispute haue conuicted teach v men must bee alike handled confutatation error heresy prophane customes ground acknowledged themselues must bee vrged confesse truth conclusion would acknowledge man putteth new wind old vessel man punisheth frenchman english law take himselfe stand bound law neuer consented vnto law ciuil like common law sometime may take true confession aduersarie argument forcible two truth therefore selfe confuteth contrary necessarily also consent therein whereby shew wee would dissent possible auoid sometimes wee may vse owne confession though false bee conuince doe good otherwise must abuse errour hurt manner arguing though conclude directly yet strong holdeth apostle paul conuict athenian false worship first argues absurd confession absurd reason ye worship saith vnknowne god title altar importeth therefore ye know ye worship whereupon doubtlesse worship preposterous false worship know paul vseth one kind apologie heathen festus felix another agrippa iew borne teacheth v dealing aduersary truth smite owne weapon god weapon drawne armorie scripture truth reuelation nature therefore vnreuealed vnto paul doctrine resurrection profane stoicks church smiteth infidell spirituall censure capable spirituall direction doctrine none erronious hold truth truth hold may serue infringe error maintaine brought suspect renounce falsehood may sooner perswaded admit truth strong preiudice suffer doe heathen confessing deitie may graduall consequence forced acknowledge vnitie workes deity vrged confesse worship due thereto inward aswell outward also see folly manner worshipping thus prepared hee may better instructed truth reason former point truth vniforme repugneth falsehood though discerned demonstration popish transubstantiation lutheran vbiquitie best confuted owne position confession also error heresy neither hard doe since impossible writes many truth contradict himselfe error ere aware let course vsed ignorant vngrounded neither let v presently raile vpon abandon perswaded thing forcible v let kindly drawne little little driuen thus much bee said hitherto hath passed betwixt iphtah king ammon sixtie seven sermon elevnth chapter booke ivdges proceede communication betwixt king ammon iphtah followeth vsed another verse reason king ammon messenger prescription long continuance time euen yeeres well nigh time ground neuer claimed balac king moab israel newly come city belonging dwelt neuer challenged contended yet hee stroue enter owne border reason iphtah must vnderstood follow vpon former pertinent reason manner prooued directly land part ammonite land proues ammon could lay iust claime second respect part amorites land bordering vpon saith might moab aswell nay better challenge ammonite yet neither done yeeres space reason thus considered concludeth nothing doth directly follow ammon title moab none thus iphtah answered committed successe god king ammonite hearken although iphtah sheweth yeeres israel enioyed country doct verse amorites quietly yet hee brought reason also drawne right reason aswell fact possession made strong haue heard laid together sufficiently prooue land king ammon trouble vniustly without cause say may know prescription time may fall though seldome doe sufficient reason hold commodity may right side good proofe yet law supposing great likelihood right side haue long enioyed land hath well determined controuersie giuing v hath long enioyed v predecessor seeing otherwise many endlesse contention might arise like aliue alleage good reason long cotinuance time neither bring thing certaine former time ouerthrow equitie law aimeth vsually though generally infallibly holdeth part ordinarily iphtah saith balak king moab stood israel stiffely hold going land yet hee stroue recouering land amorites might iustly haue done king ammon hee prooueth thereby nothing doe right vnto teaching thereby men deadly set aduersaries matter seeking thereby vexe sorest manner would shew rancor bringing foorth greater crime accusation doe whereby might much easily bring downe prouided whereas seeke blemish name impouerish estate afflict person restraint libertie imprisonment banishment doe old serpent bite heele cannot breake head would gladdest shed blood god indeed pluck back vomit poison great mischiefe conceiue fall short poison nothing lesse deadly want matter worke vpon manifest two signes one content take slightest occasion rather choose ridiculous malice malicious aggrauate slender accusation slanderous addition owne inuenting combe warpe woof crime amplification thereof diuels forge lying heart braines innocency aduersarie yeelds iust exception thus enemy sauiour want matter suborned false witness periurie argued would haue spared produce true greater crime could haue found noted daniel aduersaries dan chap wanting matter treason faine bring religion contriued matter law made purpose toucht life also found ought lay charge would rather haue vsed doctrine serueth answere pretend couering malice whereas vexe aduersarie one way could doe many way say haue greater cause pursue one alleage speech bragging boasting without iust cause greater doth man doubt would take aduantage vsing prosecute smaller hotly vpon forementioned reason concludeth hee gaue cause make warre done hee stirred vp doct vers vniustly iphtah bold accuse auouch owne innocencie hauing good proofe euery one proue goodnesse cause shall bee able boldly defend owne innocencie aduersaries accuser shame iust reproch owne peace comfort whereas must driuen vse shift lying dissembling boldnes heate multiplying word false witness may seene cause priest pharisies accusing sauiour pilat truth seeketh corner see note vpon verse hee appealing highest simplicitie matter iudge therein endeth message thus must wee able doe meane afraid make lord iudge cause though iustled walles vnequall iudges vpon earth yet may rest god testimonie vnto v cause therefore fearing man may confident verifying prouerbe righteous prou iob bold lion kinde iob speaketh saying though mine aduersary write booke would hundred stripe auaile froward humour possesseth many would easily thought therefore discouered much worse beseemeth euen ciuill courteous person still sometimes religious either suspect themselues may commend affection onely whole duty father heauen aswell father earth speake would teach contest parent descant lawfull demand beware left obeying man good intent offend god maine neither doe best obeyeth lord vpon knowledge saith seeing thou art reuenged thine enemy doct well content dye speech might well haue become experiencedst seruants god though vttered young damsell oh let example beare band hardnesse himselfe alone hee say could haue wished hee actes might haue borne brunt free loue wee beare pretend church god great part ioy bee diminished vnlesse might ioy v may complaine together draweth head life grace partake wee euen singular fruit communion saint sweet note conuersing wee next vnto dwell among prayer wee onely present spirit though place farre distant therefore next communion lord iesus himselfe sweeter meditation haue fellowship bodie whereunto hath granted singular priuiledges hee hath beautified many admirable gift grace wee haue part haue part thinke christ diuided body subiect dismembring v draw head influence grace wee singular selues separate selues brother doth great part felicitie hereafter consist shall haue fellowship saint light euen light god lamb immediate presence reason let v bee perswaded enlarge selues bee streightned within selues neither part sorrowes prosperitie others duty required v toward whole body pray peace mourne left contrary ill beseemed ionah checkt labour seeing varietie necessity estate diuers particular church member knowne v manifold must thinke duty easily discharged without great measure loue heart returned met daughter stricken great griefe shee knowing sense hee made vow meane thus first meeteth offer perpetuall virginitie lamenting common sense sheweth contrary daughter knew hee met authoritie vow virginitie yee say nay meant daughter haue answered besides vow burnt offering expounded virginitie likewise absurditie fact vnnaturalnesse owne child hauing lord requiring lesse madnesse though power doe haue either vowed intended thing much execute therefore although ill grant ignorance offering yet cannot hee vowed virginitie hee meant hee vowed offer sacrifice first meete see answer made false accusation bee proudly giuen v reproch hurt doct ephramites iphtah say suffered passe lest author bee imboldned thereby doe still yea goe salomon teacheth saying answere foole according prou folly lest wise owne conceit waxe bold make practise though wee walking innocencie vprightnes good conscience regard taunt vniust reproches euill eccles tongue commonly send v much lesse hearken say v wee neuer quiet yet weightie matter touch profession credit thereof ought obtaine note vse helpe magistrate restraine slanderer respect mephibosheth complained dauid ziba procure
