verse ephramites dealt iphtah men succoth penuel doct ver dealt gedeon hee followed prince midian wit zeba zalmunna dealt roughly vnkindly iphtah gouernour sent helpe vndutifully denied yet much worse came quarrelled hee got victorie shamelesly affirmed called battell would bee thought haue deserued much fame commendation victorie iphtah seeing boasted ready haue gone ammonite indeed meant therein bewrayed two foule fault odious bee taken heed one hardheartednes barbarous vnkindnes helpe brother need case owne well ioined disobedience iphtah gouernour fault subtiltie way side soeuer victorie goe prouide themselues first taught beware vnkindnes incompassionate hard heartednes bee senselesse misery necessity brother moued pitie toward distress wee doe commandement god cause selues subiect fall like trouble doe also one time case conscience beare v witnesse iustly forsaken left sinke sorrowes smart calamity none offer themselues pitie v seeing wee shewed little mercie kindnes like trouble rather hard hearted towards doubtlesse one cause wee note may see euill seruant pitie fellow therefore master wroth deliuered tormentor matth one cause say god afflicteth v much otherwise neuer pitie brother trouble thereby learne commiseration towards looke chap deboras complaint chap vers fault subtiltie double dealing hauing doct vers ill conscience propounded themselues ammonite victorie ouer iphtah free hurt danger seeing stirred aide iphtah preuaile would come forth florishing boldly lye affirming cause take hardly hee got victorie proudly would call bee partaker indeede thus men say two string bow falsehood common world deale subtilly hard know trust salomon complaining asketh faithfull man shall found touching vngodly policie prou subtiltie enough hath spoken vpon like occasion hollow heartednes falsehood ground adde somewhat particularly sinne committed many way three thing especially subtiltie bad policie appeares three thing chiefly remedy obserue first professing religion secondly friendship betwixt among men thirdly men bargaining worldly dealing remedying long discourse large done first many professing brought like religion credit profit vainglorie fall againe small occasion therefore take instruction let power beautie gospell perswade thee become professor rather hope profit seeking credit thereby c thou hast felt note haue wrought thee powerfull preaching thereof faith new life thou seest safe well liking hath made thine estate vnto thee comparison god blessing shall worke faithfulnes thee honour beautifie thy profession thou shalt start aside many doe otherwise thou shalt neuer hold thy profession faire shewes euer thou makest thou doest yet thou shalt reape fruite peace haruest profession best sound passe second remedying doublenes dissimulation second remedie friendship let one chiefe rule chuse thy friend goodnesse excelling others pietie vertue especially hee approued continuer therin one free strong affection note choller anger tetchines loue still seeing thing desired man goodnesse whether kindness prou enioyed therewith faile yet hold principle still nourish thinking true friendship rare precious let counsell salomon forgotten thine owne friend thy father forsake thou beware thy selfe tetchinesse prou conceit yea though thou thinkest hath giuen thee cause talebearer would set diuision betwixt thee neither prou repeate matter ought haue buried forgotten may easily alienate thee wise let hope earthly commoditie tickle thee want thereof coole diminish affection thee towards faithfulnes friendship preserued hollownes dissembling auoided otherwise like league fooles soone broken remoue falsehood vntrustinesse bargaining worldly dealing thinke good thee thou seest euill hurtfull third remedie note another especially meaner man wealth thy selfe poore body worth value ware commoditie shall agreed vpon plainly without subtiltie willing giue penny penniworth abraham weighed siluer according manner custome time ephron hittite peece gen ground bought bury dead thou pay currant money coyne according couenant neere may may equalitie day set paiment keepe least let fault thee let seene thou art disappointed hindred paying thy common wealth regarded thee thine owne priuate onely thou shalt come neere rule sauiour giueth earthly dealing looke ye matth would men doe euen doe yee vnto shalt thou guiltie double dealing falsehood thou thus note shunne three hollownesse subtiltie thou shalt haue great cause reioyce thine vprightnes sinceritie easily brought halting dissembling matter let v proceed iphtah answer ephramites saw would helpe saith put life mine hand meaning doct aduentured without rested god going foorth smaller helpe could haue greater paterne wee taught hang neither depend men good thing take hand example neither thing concerne owne happines directly meane seeking faith conuersion pertaine sanctification life godlines mercie loue righteousnes innocencie must neglect good dutie see backward rather look example forwardest faithfull generall speciall calling wise let v regard follow come behinde good thing acknowledge doe preuenting mischief neere hand iphtah following hard ammonite ephramites refused helpe abigails wisedome eare commended sam imitated many degree nabals folly senselesse blockishnes euen let v say ioshua goe ioyne ioshua v yet serue lord sauiour saw many offended doctrine departing away asked peter name rest ye also goe away peter answer whither shall goe lord ioh forsake thee hast word eternall life sure therefore prouide ill selues pinne zeale forwardnes vpon others gather strength enough owne assurance god peculiar goodnesse towards owne soules keepe v close firme purpose cleauing daily doth wise matth build vpon rocke assault shall batter building declining starting backe others leaueth saying thus stand fall owne master whether haue euer truly perswaded god fauour towards cannot tell know haue beleeued therefore men blind shall put owne eye see world generally disposed coldnes note loosenes lukewarmnes shall presently repent zeale forwardnes haue resolued vpon better ground may shaken euery blast winde frowning better want encouragement men see thing price account among cannot iudge onely serue god faithfully many liue towne carelesse prophane god ashamed many rather hee acknowledge reiect multitude oh wretched part ashamed men feare base sinfull man whose breath nostril god cast body soule matth hell point see chap verse compared former saying god deliuered ammonite hand without doct helpe manifest wee see first gratiously god prouided seruant whereas hee could meanes procure aide ephramites lord dealt hee needed went prosperously obtained best assistance god forsake trust hee helpe defence time neede much father mother forsake hee taketh vp thing greatly flesheth vngodlie ala little know refuge righteous haue time neede wit haue friend might wealth thinke ouermatch aduersarie thinke hee hath shift lord exclude must either fall reproch make shipwracke conicience although god see expedient hee disappointeth frustrateth hope thus enemy dauid daniel sauiour insulted contriued purpose mischieuously manward saw way pursued escape say iewes let v see god helpe pinch oh fooles god farre also hottest furie ye said somewhat indeed loe neerest carrie laugh enemy orne iphtah desirous ephramites helpe denied lord wrought first complained hee needed ephramites helpe lord hoasts side make supply let added encouragement spake last doctrine hakednes solitarines meane want men countenance furtherance ought rather driue cling closely vnder lord wing able make enemy people prou friend way doe please hee vse meanes vphold without helpe either muzzle shall note hurt would hee enable courage boldnes shall contemne contempt little regard opposition may doe hurt yet lord grace shall goe vnder crosse willingly bee rather confirmed vnsetled good course thereby let would willingly bee religious saue onely reproch others yea euen owne flesh would cast vpon let say labour beleeue temptation shall little trouble againe obserue hence blessing god giueth weake meanes men goe worke simplicitie good conscience good attempt ought encourage offer themselues willingly worke tenne thousand men zebulon napthali iudg lord battailes hundred thousand siser armie came case god hath set v worke heartned v let v discouraged meanenesse shew reason indeed able doe little hereby may perswade haue greatest men account haue brought greatest light gospel vnto men meane iudgemet world euen many dealing effecteth great matter weake meanes see noted vpon iphtah victorie eleuenth chap verse word vpon promisses iphtah concludeth interrogation asking doct wherefore come fight haue said saued liues sitting home ease reason haue yee therefore thus come may learne wee good god commandement proues v bad disposition shall found iniurious hurtfull innocent men ephraim iphtah may say doe v hurt good though liue innocent whereas heathen doe good doe good c vse matth doctrine liue among men wee may charged iustly conuicted wronging yet rest ready doe good may stand calling shall able shall wee sure neuer feare accusation vnkinde vnbrotherly dealing brought may answere iob mine aduersarie write booke take shoulder reade iob listeth touching reiecting apologie iphtah point hath handled eleuenth chapter although wilfulnes farre worse became heathen king ammon yet somwhat adde fit occasion like wilfulnes troubled iphtah little especially gouernour loth haue turned edge sword vpon owne people could haue auoided besides yet could suffer haue graue iust defence slightly reiected fruite expected hand came ready armed trie matter force like would stand debating reasoning long came preiudicate resolute minde contrary said indeed gaue eare reall refusall hearken appeares proceeding warre yee say eighth booke predecessor bewraied contrary wrath appeased answere gedeon answere indeed vsed like froward child condiscended vnto proud angrie humour pleased gaue ouer much adoe bin beast nay doubtlesse could although would angrie man cannot continue anger long would fewell remoued praise man humoured may say giues ouer though honour appeaser yet shame haue ouercome himselfe shame say respect although indeed desisteth meanes better implacable returne dramme good nature indifferencie religion none would well haue abated spirit towards hearkning sound reason father gedeons mildnesse yes doubtlesse impossible order vnreasonable paffion reason mad reason let set eye god minister disposition ordinary hearer wee may learne armed discouragement yoked stiffenecked opposite nature winde finger serious charge lay vpon conscience hosee declare vnto large ho c weightie thing law account strange thing long information fare neuer heard make word course wee spoke vnknowne tongue vnto looke receiue god doe yeeld subscribe hearken may say haue piped vnto ye haue danced c doe matth conceiue meaning tune song yes otherwise resolued haue another course runne ephramites god complaineth hee knew entreate ho therefore hearing vnderstand seeing see winke harden heart v must need grieue v yes ought make v mourne moderatly physition ouer patient whose disease pas skill ere medled indeed ought let v feede cast away meate thriue discredit v diet good ordinary could wish could find appetite well food past skill died famine surfeit meanes vsed therein rest say sweete sauour lord perish manifest signe god reiect god would perswade v ala perswade haue saued owne soules blood vpon owne head died want physicke wilfulnes meane ephramites iphtah came ciuill warre betweene next sermon lastly many could agree together wicked action lesse two fortie thousand men many lost liues thereby may see easily men agree together euill traytors rebel confederate euill doe whereas hard yea dwelling together one towne better sort agree together good matter euill committed therein though owne great ease good doe seeke punishing sinne farre gone themselues deepe therein one kinde must hold backe shame lest owne punishment procured vrging busily vpon others besides men commonly owne corrupt nature slow backward good vse purge clense selues care euill soule bodie keepe heart diligence cor good life may come thence shall wee neuer neede feare wee shall vpholders sinne agree prou purpose good note degree wee grow either height sinne euen heere may bee learned example ephramites like fort may bee seene first anger kindled iphtah bred heart wrath followed continued anger next hot contention consent ioyne warre band themselues innocent helpfull yea euen point haue handled heretofore thus much ephramites quarrelling iphtah answere seventieth sermon twelfth chapter booke ivdges followeth fight cruel warre vers summe verse ephramites iphtah wee haue heard would wise relent sound good reason iphtah brought disswade battell resolute proceed therein wherefore fought ouercame might escape hee preuented tooke passage ouer water iorden could passe ouer returne home also many taken slaine come verse seuerally fourth verse whereas summe verse marueiled iphtah made ciuill warre ephramites know could staied disswaded making assault vpon therefore free respect streight defend himselfe although priuate man much wit head chiefe ouer sword authoritie put hand whereby onely goe forreine enemy also suppresse punish rebellious seditious land offend manner lord gaue victory ouer despised sought right law take gouernment ouer gileadites cast strong hand hee rightly possessed duly considered punishment destruction doct vers befell thereby euen losse two fortie thousand men liues perswations would yeeld peace laieth heauy iust iudgement god vnthankfull wilfull seditious worth noting see proud spirit bring vpon themselues trouble themselues seeke trouble others either god taketh vengeance men vpon achan ioshua said vnto seeing thou hast troubled v god shall iosh trouble thee day stoned death else lord doth himselfe without meanes said recompence tribulation thes trouble teach v follow peace men holinesse without man shall see lord face heb fruit men wilfulnes deare price costeth haue noted somewhat elsewhere knit vp point therefore marke iustly god met ephramites shame vnto first disturber peace good order foully foiled beaten prouoked iniuriously falleth falleth alwaies cutting combe pulling downe proud stomacke carrie away field preuaile alway liue defence innocet preuenting confusion would otherwise ensue intollerable boaster hee hath lord resists pares nailes horne short though heart full curst seeing say makebate contentious person put worse well serued teach liue within bound meddle giue cause let v prouide dealing others cause honest well grounded affection sutable carried passion heate rage hath note wronged v fall wee defeated put foile may looke case god himselfe take v bad course shall wee able hold vp head shame men reioyce ouerthrow surely hee need impudent beare god men owne conscience downe altogether blank shame owne boldnes hath brought vpon measure successe haue leaudnes thinking becommeth well enough prosper shall said verse following verse reason added gileadites slew ephraim wit railed ephramites branded themselues many foule sinnes together haue heard bad yet added rest railed also railing word vsed contention iphtah vpon gileadites doubly incensed seeing quarrelled iphtah threatned wonder grew disgrace whole familie meaning gilead smote ephraim ephraim besides sedition added disdainfull reprochfull termes dwelt betweene two tribe tooke occasion call mungrels hangbyes men set tribe neuter hath said though tribe ephraim famous tribe among rest none meanest yet see best birth descent may possibly degenerate grow companion base shamelesse worthily measure offered brother leaudnes quarrelling tumult railing may thus disguise themselues easily nay vsually thinke may seene vile abiects ofscourings may dwell among worthy right honest seruants god good christian kindred also many vagrant idle person doe hang prince court neither hired belonging house shifter belly backes offering themselues runne meane person errand townes city vnruly disordered fellowes either shrouded vnder wing godly kindred nestling themselues among good note religion note honest behauiour without calling brought vp labour without liuing voide grace ready set worke mischiefe opportunitie serue diuers city reade booke act apostle waited bee hired make tumult vprores therein yet would haue none take thus though meant speake poore folke townes meane estate liue say many follow calling diligently labour painefully liuing gospell truly preached religious approoued good christian speak know although deny also many idle hangbies may reckoned worthily among spake vse helpe weede men haue abilitie authoritie chiefe men townes bee furtherance hereunto preuent idlenesse irreligiousnesse liuing without calling whence annoyance doe arise looke chapter haue heard subduing killing many ephramites vers battaile mentioned followeth rest slaine taking passage iorden many found bee ephramites slew put sword lost liues one time two fortie thousand many passed ouer iorden reubinites manassites well ephramites therefore tried language speech whether ephramites tongue pronouncing bad pronounce shibboleth full manner could said sibboleth able pronounce meanes discerned taken slaine first thing noted occasion moued gileadites doct vse policie bid say shibboleth ephramites asked made lye saue liues denied tribe true satan said iob skin skin iob man hath giue life euen truth honestie marueile may blame lying weighty case life selfe thinke put might doe saue life indeede confesse life sweete lying lawfull case case perill life one thing man omit dutie law mercy sake owne life another commit expresse sinne negatiue law therefore although bee lawfull man preferre life dutie commanded put case sabbath day duty yet man may magistrate answere falsely equiuocatinglye vnder colour mercy sauing life onely omitting dutie grosse fault herein therefore rule true euill must done good may come thereof negatiue rule law admit exception except god dispense israelite robbing exod aegyptians aboue law hence followeth lying bee sinne well sinne lye defence man life lye needlesly please three officious vaine shamelesse lye cloth though colour equall deepe dye v christian seeme hard condition neither cast selues vpon god rather beholding lye life case stand better liue liue note worse death accusing conscience abiured protestant time persecution witnesse fond foolish pretence colour warped subtile braine man diminish one iot commandement god much lesse disanull saue life euill indirect meanes shall lose done see ephramites gained lye conuicted tongue made one breath matth truth case stood fleeing enemy bad quarrell little better looked hand lye shift themselues hauing brought themselues briar contention rebellion railing let v beware bring selues streights sinne shall finde matter hard enough helpe selues extremitie danger trouble god brings vpon v better fenced faith good conscience danger former desperate remedilesse elsewhere haue fully declared shechemites captaine gaal chap secondly whereas text saith ephramites failed doct full pronouncing word see although tribe spake one language yet euen therein difference one spake see ephramites could pronounce reubinites manassites euen also greekes haue great difference englishman namely southerne northward differ much one another dialect manner pronouncing though speake one language teach v oft wee heare thinke hurt detriment comming thereby call mind bee humbled selues sinne caused confounding language first fruite whereof remaineth among v day ought iustly humble v much toyle time spent learning vnderstand language might else haue otherwise bestowed also strange tongue wee see wicked keepe many vnderstanding pure word god romish prelate long haue done could haue one language speech ouer earth besides difficultie respect speake doe many trauell forraine land exchange ware commodity end purpose except haue learned language cannot speake interpreter labour bestowed translating scripture writing else might haue bin spared done commeth short naturall tongue language insist inconueniences arise translation euen controuersies religion faith part cut one language bee generally embraced translate best attaine vnto significancie word proprietie meaning naturall language would affoord without difficultie like discommodities arise diuision tongue although liue home owne countrey conuerse speech themselues doe much obserue let consider god mercie confusion reacheth doth confined though within large bound againe let v know men dishonouring god tongue periury yea swearing blasphemie cursed speaking specially imprecation might bring deeper iudgement vpon person though generall little trouble euen taking away speech altogether kinde example neither experience former age owne haue wanting although god smite oft prouoked bee end conclude therefore let bee watchword abusing language lest wee prouoke many daily doe curse punishment god bee made example feare others seeing men would admonish v lastly hence slew could pronounce word doct learne lost liues returning homeward though escaped battaile wicked men passe one danger yet shall fall another lord neuer safe free feare perill euill light vpon although cause prophet amos saith man flie amos lyon beare shall meete euen see experience escape lying friendship money like hand men god himselfe certainely meete pestilence arrest strange disease debt imprisonment shame note visitation el worme conscience serpent shall bite haue conscience seared hot yron yet plague shal take hold euen hardned heart cannot repent dying seeke get plunge doe certainely perish vtterly without recouery throwne gulfe bottomlesse weeping gnashing teeth although ill disposed person dye alwaies company multitude heere flood noah time commeth often passe according occasion offered therefore lesse marked yet obserueth shall finde bewray vpright harted dissembler hollow haue fauour gospell good thing behauiour speech companie doe testifie bad liues say yeeres scarse halfe nine score men duly weighed euill old iacob told pharao euill haue day thy gen seruant oh rate would men buy lengthening miserie madnesse much extreame want might much allay people lord chuseth many yea heires saluation vse sauiours word matth seasoned matth gospell beleeuing expound word doubtlesse comparison great one called nay many cor haue striuen mediocritie estate yet agur preferreth best serue god haue forsaken owne mercy see tenth chapter verse thereof angell speaketh barrennesse might receiue doct vers message bearing childe thankefully ioyfully barrennesse day generally holden kinde curse noted chap end fruitefulnesse blessing wee see god turneth curse blessing counted doubt woman great worke mercy hee gaue childe barren well power dauid reckons thus complained long heauie burden oppressed conscience feared hezekiah neuer bee eased length met comfort long wished although first obtaining esay thereof indented god hee bee yet time haue worne remembrance kindenes pharaoh butler iosephs let others whose conscience gen note beares witnesse lord hath made fruitfull barren kinde soeuer haue brought forth sower grape wilde oliues made themselues barren againe fruitfull let say looke backe view matter yet better pay rearedges run god lest length wish bin beholding god lesse except fruit might haue made lord may say beholding haue yeelded luk hath shall giuen hee shall receiue fauour vpon fauour keepes old precious remembrance regard occupying whose talent occupied whereas hath shall forgoe still till haue lost hath forgotten receiued hee hath shall lose hopeth yea principall hath one point besides example lord sheweth v hee turneth chastisement doct verse benefit vnto people issue iobs affliction witnesseth taketh away good thing correcteth receiue greater outward benefit forgoe yet waite god shall haue proofe grace faith patience obedience oft haue already noted booke farre sweete outward libertie lose forgoe let people god prouide walke vprightnesse shall see whether life bee replenished comfort followed many token god loue pleasure shall finde day vpon earth sweetely passed exceedingly well prouided till taken glorie angell prescribing woman shee drinke doct vers wine eate vncleane thing said childe beare nazarite lord law nazarite himselfe bee tied certaine ceremony time one also abstaine wine secondly rasor come head thirdly hee touch come neere dead body reade booke number nazarite one separated others particularly numb c one serued lord strict manner samson continue estate throughout life peculiar person therefore type christ onely death victorious euen life wherein sauiour fulfilled righteousnesse signification nazarite lord would haue come neere vnto seruice separated common sort doe examine way rule god word walke owne heart desire hereby vnder ceremony hee requireth plaine word doth elsewhere saying ye shall therefore perfect father heauen perfect also purifie selues euen pure mercifull euen pet heauenly father ye holy holy insomuch another place saith without holinesse man shall see lord signification heb nazarite doth exclude vncleane vnsanctified lord presence fauour seruice true ceremoniall rule abolished church new testament permitted man vowe regular seruing god according outward obseruances order placing religion therein much retaine obseruation nazarite much lesse inuent new rite order yet holden onely religious men woman day church rome haue solemnely entred order haue many confused order owne forging therein ayme perfection let disorder goe equitie institution still remaineth firme bindeth v lord haue know set liue serue list bee seruants owne hand hee tieth rule order according whereto haue walke rule spirituall first vniforme bindeth without exception rom summe whereof haue said giue vp themselues bodie cor soule lord inward subiection heart outward obedience life strictly clensing themselues superfluitie filthinesse either body minde ceremony also required vsed nazarite signification mentioned text two one suffering haire head growe cut time vow nazarites remained vowed either certaine number day moneths yeares vow end time keeping expired offering sacrifice burning flesh fire cut haire burnt fire free returned former course life although otherwise samson lord appointed nazarite whole life though according common manner made nazarites signification much time taken vp nicely trimming looking body seeing know must consumed earth become wormes meate therefore ridiculous folly forget please selues deceiueable fancy also minde set curiously worke dangerous token pride bewrayeth slenderly regardeth inward apparrelling nicenes curiositie weaker sexe spend many good houres vainely vnfruitefully kind argueth pride folly foule abuse men matter disguised wearing long haire thinke defend themselues practise nazarites yet world would conuince part furthest strict worship god sincere walking nazarites doe also mocke skorne embrace thinkes strange argueth somewhat common badnesse thereof among many change corrupt english fashion worne expired yet vnnaturall fashion paul calles man weare long cor hath suruiued know nourish amarous lightnesse minde others supposed ornament person marke gent ie least imitation gentleman thinke might wisely forbeare seeing become fashion habite basest swaggerer ruffian diuels marke hath set vpon many wil reformed first vsed either ensigne ornament speech worthie reuerend iudge land vse long locke first taken vp branded fellowes couer shame honourable personage circuit sitting place iustice vpon malefactor practised according former obseruation commanding saw beset deformed haire immediatly cut shorne whether discouer eare marke shame vnseemely guise know yet many farre enough nazarites may thinke set much haire put religion therein loth haue sheares rasor come vpon signification abstaining wine strong drinke simply forbid vsing wee see nehemiah lord giueth nehe people libertie eate fatte drinke sweete commanded nazarites time continued abstaine therefrom signification say thereof teach god people auoide excesse way lest thereby dull blunt power mindes must necessitive vse shamefull end giuen farre excellent purpose say iust condemning beastly drunkard pot companion though better beare drinke without open disguising themselues yet spending time wickedly needelesse brutish deuouring nothing inferior sinning sundry respect much worse many sinne occasion haue spoken particularly said rule nazarites caueats thereof generally adde former prohibition like lord would teach v high account hee hath heart well mortified purged drosse superfluitie lust concupiscence stuffed withall wee see enioyneth nazarites much actuall worship straight restraint flesh vnlawfull excesse shadoweth two diet cking body abstinence doubtlesse possible man equall angel obedience cheerefulnesse readinesse integritie seruice yet possible againe olde man desire passion might still remaine aliue wrath malice couetousnesse vncleanenesse hollownesse loosenesse pride vncharitablenesse vnruly tongue c religion man altogether vaine reason lord saith sonne giue e thy prou heart meaneth rotten heart corrupt need heart well searched well drained sinfull affection lust heart calleth chuseth knowes mortified note heart also heart quickned life god fit dutie within without chiefe seruice god inward inward stand especially repentance first consisteth change euill habites quality soule ere new put man grafteth vpon rotten stocke put new wine old vessel christian man fetch surer euidence hence reformation particular dutie affirmatiue commandements morall law soundly distinguisheth himselfe hypocrite seperate part repentance diuide false sound rule many good christian behinde hand worke euer shall man pure hardly forgoes one old relikes adam therefore looke much man profiteth peece religion much hee groweth truely religious vse haue chosen easier course seruice meane note doe good duty doe better tend part christianitie hath lesse regarded trauaile denying themselues ouercomming passion abstaining crucifying corrupt nature strongest shall religion prosper better beseeme though harder part two yet time bestowed therein counteruaile labour plentifullie good man debter lust vnseemely rom seruer fulfiller obeyer thereof haue weapon sinne still vnmortified fighting righteousnesse paul speakes monstrous thus much nazarite verse angell telleth office childe bee doct vers borne wit come age fit begin deliuer people bondage philistims wherein lord declareth tender loue care people oppressed tribulation doth pitie thinketh euen easing redressing sorrowes whereby would draw relenting sinne ashamed prouoking punish hardning heart lying still offence without humbling themselues cry lord mercy deliuerance yee aske hee doth well take obiect trouble well pitieth therein suffered people lye bondage long enemy till samson grew vp able deliuer answere willing ready doe much answ might good cannot still harbour nourish sinnes would procure vpon themselues greater vexation continuing wicked course lord deliuer repent hath bin often proued example israelite cry ease neuer heard till repentance iudg lord grieued miserie god suffering oppression hold vnder long time people namely birth samson till hee came man estate taketh pleasure afflicting hee professeth contrary relent neither cast themselues lam draw compassion lamenting therfore sam long abiding vnder tribulation doe argue exceeding example help others much lesse grace humbled repent therefore vse none ordinance wholesome end appointed sin guiltlesse hath offered faire themselues willing accept neuer lord leaue himselfe hardned angel word prescribing woman abstaine thing forbidden vncleane seeing childe nazarite must borne yet prescription chiefly child learne thing seeme lesse likely commanded forbidden much apparantly seruant childe must keepe holy sabbath command much parent master doe minister appearance euill forbidden much euill selfe smaller thing commanded forbidden much greater iuster condemning heare taught see many well gouerned christian giue example herein yet onely follow neither doctrine heare offend shamefullest foullest manner let v know lord commandements haue seruants vnderstand great sinne dutie expressed rest kinde neuer small special much hee manifest liking disling lesser euill secret doubted lesser dutie seruing lesse necessitie ought collect hold v guiltlesse euils committed duty neglected manifest either light nature apparant scripture allowed forbidden hold excused wise gather lesse greater woe carelesse commanded streine gnat swalloweth cammell thus much proceed text third part chapter vers manoah said angell lord pray thee let v retaine thee vntill haue made readie kid thee angell lord said manoah though thou make abide eate thy bread thou wilt make burnt offering offer vnto lord manoah knew angell lord againe manoah said vnto angell lord thy name thy saying come passe may honour thee angel lord said askest thou thus name secret manoah tooke kid meate offering offered vpon stone vnto lord angell wonderously while manoah wife looked flame came vp toward heauen altar angell lord ascended vp flame altar manoah wife beheld fell face ground angell lord appeare vnto manaoh wife manoah knew angell lord manoah said vnto wife shall surely dye haue seene god wife said lord would kill v would haue receiued burnt offering meate offering hand neither would haue shewed v thing would haue told v wife bare sonne called name samson child grew lord blessed third part followeth signe certified ver summe thing told man god come passe first manoah doth two thing one desireth angel eate hee asketh name whereof angell make answere first order concerning first angel god hath done message vers answered manoahs doubt kindly accepting good tidings brought vnto desired retaine might refresh himselfe trauaile hee thought hunger therefore hee said let v stay thee make ready kid thee angel hauing need eate drew manoah purpose telling would eate led heauenly matter honour god offering burnt offering vnto two verse may consider diuers thing first manoah doct angel answere manoah two following first curtesie thankfulnes offering eate thinking hee man hauing brought message god wife confirmeth v wee haue heard wee receiue kindnesse wee render shew like againe godly vsed offer curtesie seruants god stranger though brought message god called hospitalitie deserue contrary odious brutish commanded doe well enemy loue hate great thing loue kinde well deseruing heathen publican doe likewise vnkind towards haue louing well affected toward worse heathenish hireling returne point againe mercifull forbearance lord euen seene oftentimes one person visitation although lay hand vpon bodie yet oft time minde free spirit able sustaine body infirmitie yet spake substance destroyed friend kindred alienated wrought doubt strongly vpon weakest part lord side yea instead comfort wife others could neither haue resisted desperate impatience euen hearing first heauie message brought vnto much lesse haue said afterward although kill trust therefore although lord doe ordinarily iob thus measure child sorrow come yet let none indent lord thus hee shall deale alway lord tied certaintie necessitie temporall cross best seruants saue onely god alsufficient minister vnto grace shall sufficient many haue fallen streights infectious disease pouertie trauaile c wanted succour comfort neerest vnto onely lord forsake neerer miserie nature make neerest friend seeing woman though regard sexe weaker doct vessell yet stronger faith incourage husband hee fainted let v learne husband may despise wiues counsell god shall grace equally aboue many men case honoured wiues faith experience knowledge humilitie innocencie good gift god might hardly bee wanted much bee regarded haue gift let farre thinking side meanely basely husband remembring commandeth carriage reuerence towards husband againe must reioyce scorne take good vpon vaine conceit wiues deny supremacie many say crow ouer yet want grace otherwise ill qualitied let leane much counsell remembring ahab salomon sinne little differing see vers chapter first reason sound good god said would haue killed v would haue receiued sacrifice hath receiued knew accepted god say seeing bad offer therefore acceptable againe manner allowable god consumed sacrifice doct flame may say like god heare prayer approue weake poore course life wee may assure selues act loueth v therefore aduersitie forsake cast v god heareth lie still sinnes reason woman ioh pithie concludent may bee extended sense seeing god allowed accepted offering lesse ground looke nay vnlike speed desire much would hee time come testifie loue towards hauing passed word token thereof deuoured sacrifice meere goodnesse saith giue v accesse maiestie offer vp request thanksgiuing vouchsafe smell asweete fauour offering needed haue done matter came himselfe free loue v reueile himselfe v specially others doubtlesse hee meant slay v would haue done spared labour therefore argument rather reueile himselfe yet v loue v dearely giue v cause hereafter trust giue thankes saith meanes kill v implieth viz rather blesse v abundantly farre killing v argumentation vnlike paul rom christ dyed v sinner much iustified blood shall saued wrath serues president god people doubt temptation rouse vp themselues deadly feare gather strength againe themselues reason framed according thus euery afflicted soule conscience reason time trouble say himselfe time couenant god promise ground faith vpon wanted hope yet lord visited mercie opened eye see heart mourne vnder burthen sinne come ease finde forgiuenesse since time haue much doubting troubled beleeuing repentance haue driuen proue thereupon haue rested found peace therefore though tempted againe strongly thinke estate vnsound naught yet remember god mercy old therein comforted god meant forsake cast quite hee would haue proceeded farre hath done would haue let lien still darknesse vnbeliefe hypocrisie c taken lesse paine call change reforme gouerne betoken hatred loue deuouring sacrifice argued god would kill manoah wife doubtlesse lord owe fauour shewed mercy freely ministerie teacher onely also father begetting many child god others bring foorth much fruite glorie herein prophecie verified day lord would powre spirit vpon flesh old men onely act euen tenderest young men maiden fruite doubt vnction christ iesus arch prophet church began age twelue yeeres giue demonstration strange forwardnes wisdome grace riper yeeres hee fully declare luke annointed spirit without measure therefore spake vse well gift god dauid samuel receiued youth shal haue gotten experience see god prospereth inlargeth sound great reioycing good many helpe cast downe destroy workes darknesse diuell place bee strongly resisted set loue darknesse light deed euill haue begun well younger yeeres giuen great hope say comming world shall dazled deceitfull note beautie though found better portion grace shall blindfolded profit pleasure promotion thereby cannot former workes shall complaine late must forsake way well could haue seene may see howsoeuer woond diuels hand first maine temptation wherein danger brought despaire next also tended bring presumption yet hath preuailed third glorie present world thereby hath deceiued matth thus much said first thing mentioned last verse wit gift god appearing samson first yeeres discretion second namely storie doth minister matter riddle afterwards speake place shall haue fitter occasion offered namely fifteenth chapter lastly verse said hee told father mother hee lion shewed neither hee himselfe vainglorious onely soone haue heard thereof also appeareth saw cause end vttering time let v learne speake hold peace silent euen speaking doe good hurt good cannot doe hurt rule guideth v silent let v also learne speake namely wee see may doe good hurt good hurt repeated verse agreeth haue often vrged generall wit wee shew godly wisdome well vprightnes doings sauiour mat would commend iohn baptist disciple gone lest mitth haue much hindred profited people vers went downe talked woman thing pleasing eye samson within day herein would hinder make match parent guardian may neither dare seene great blemish themselues iust bee held backe attempt staied therein let therefore submit themselues lord giue parent honour due deliuer people pharaos bondage none exod saw could bee hedged euery side hee made way see thorow red sea high way drie ground euen perswaded hauing appointed purposed v good life feare bring v well difficulty hath promised finish course ioy certainly doe though wee see may seeme oft time v impossible hath many way bring passe euen hee deliuered elisha prophet armie aramites king armie heauenly souldiers hee promised great plentie corne prophet next day yet present almost famished say performe meanes foure leprous person much great man neere king affirming although king god raine downe want forgoe knowing good v haue granted whereas wee trouble feares either grace bee note granted v deliuerances bee wrought v doe either smoother faith feare despaire helpe breake foorth open murmuring discontentednes time causeth v shift make way selues vsing vnlawfull remedy meanes double affliction measure continuance oftentimes else shake asse doth burthen staying god leisure till hee action therefore hauing practise well godly bad people selfe indifferent vsed may done lawfully may also omitted wicked men haue vsed doe nothing well therefore falleth part greatest number meete feast none best may seene oft time conuenient omit meeting lest much wickednesse committed lewdnes tongue behauiour dishonour god easily done haue well filled themselues cannot altogether let passe yet smaller company would bee gathered especially friend best sort people must needes bee placed table set together may bee obserued may bee soone interrupted broken sit neere better minded wise may like doe good take good thereafter vse said point hauing touched hauing occasion speake fullier afterwards said young men vsed make feast marriage therefore samson see force strength custome preuaileth medes persian law easily broken custome people desire prisoner deliuered set free passeouer meanes whereof asked barrabas murtherer rather iesus customes matth bad continued still whereby disorder reuell maintained euen fruit darknesse people reuited though preaching gospel hath bewraied brought light shame odiousnes yet hardly bee broken almost place prophane spending greatest part lord sabbath carding drinking feasting like abomination euery countrey manner thereof making day rather held bacchus saturne lord may said riotous intemperate mispending twelue day certaine day yeere farre worse passed say papist euen heathen oft time vse doe except putting downe faires wont kept sabbath much ado yeeres agone abolished remember many ill customes ouerthrowne put vse ouerthrowing many blind dangerous disordered alehouse vse honest necessitie trauellers hath indeed commendably gone honourable worshipfull person yet vpholding gentleman others small credit remaine still working friend one part philistims holy storie sheweth philistims wit tooke thirtie yong men choice enough friend samson stranger could command number neither like philistims would haue liked cannot meant samson friend took thirtie men countenance honour philistims saw manhood stomacke neede beware gaue thirtie men pretending honour attend vpon indeed feare philistims may obserue two thing one policie care ouer theselues thought danger towards cause feare policie say feared would seeme doe couered faire cloake namely appointing thirtie companion meant set foorth countenance light nature teach keepe themselues danger harme neither meanes euill vsed purpose though must granted one whether much cleerely fully inlightned written word god may great perill seeme feare doe v doct good may put v reproch vse lawfull helpe wee haue hand repell though let appeare euen paul hee great ieoberdie life pharisies sadduces like bee rent peeces betwixt hee bewraied hee feared vsed helpe god shewed policie said loud voyce among pharisie act whereat sudden diuision aduersaries one sect pharisies holding paul sadduces onely let man haue said iustifie shifting vnlawfull policie bringing himselfe trouble among sort shifter day bold dangerous diuelish treacherous crue iesuites haue brought themselues briar villanous doings seeke relieue themselues lying equiuocations periurie flying comming answere thing bee noted philistims wise care keepe themselues hurt samson saw man feared shewed herein set thirtie men countrey would haue honoured much like herod pretended would honour christ sought kill whereas matth intended thing set watchman take heede hurt might wrought light nature thus prouide owne safetie wee ought wisely warily preuent danger comming towards v bee wise serpent beware men well innocent like doues matth haue great cause day beware wee trust commit ourselues giuing credit sauiour hath left v good example behinde whereby wee may take heed farre commit seiues men ierusalem passeouer ioh many beleeued said saw miracle hee iesus commit himselfe seeing knew teaching v circumspect farre wee trust note doe sufficiently know many smart light credit namely heare faire word like satan spake iob though amisse another case touch iob curse thee thy face may almost binde true man laid touchstone gaine especially man knoweth doth doe approue himselfe conscionable honest note againe also agree vpon couenants seale writing take witness appoint day payment deliuerie say yet let ware merchandise meane season waxe cheaper supposed begin franke buyer shrinke palter shift qualitie goodnesse cut short measure vse men gripingly make themselues amends shewing plainly regard thing contract saue onely make pray brother serue turne without conscience ciuill respect maintained thereby disguise themselues neuer well reported honest behauiour yea taketh hold many better sort euen christian bee hardly laid trial prouocations readily yeeld thing euill vnbeseeming see amend reforme dishonestie appeares men secret falsehood though god onely see sufficiently bewray god hath pleasure break liues offensiuely wicked sort whe strongly laid prouoked doe doe worse philistims sore prouoked neerely driuen haue heard time drawing neere must giue meaning riddle else suffer inconuenience fell subtiltie violence yet euen therin see disguised themselues grossely heere told meaning riddle seuenth day declared samson controuersie ended first let v marke woman dealing thou louest verse saith hatest hard indeed first entring marriage though thing falles often marriage many vnaduised couple word true neither therefore beleeued vttered wit hee loued yet wee see guiltie foule great crime whereby proceede let v note iudgement heathenish woman bee hatred neere vnfained loue betwixt couple marriage much among christian verified neuer man hated owne flesh c absurditie say admitted abhorred causeth say wearinesse one another falling among much great shame yea diminishing loue also maketh ready way hatred seeing loue ought strong cant fire cannot quenched many water prouide ill make marriage yet void grace feare god onely ground louely delightfull quality whereas best thing beside flitting momentanie loue yt grounded true christian loue constant bringeth foorth much fruite point importance apostle includes husband dutie therein hee loue wife say good thing wanting hee head relation vnion must flow descend wife comfort welfare must know thorough loue communicate himselfe wife free bountifull plentifull affection dutie whereupon followeth againe reuerend submisse yet cheerefull manner fitted framed yea weightie point loue speake frothie hot foolish loue vanitie vanity except heart man bee knit woman lord one onely religious well qualified also onely person delight liue within speciall kinde fellowship except say generall chusing good woman serue turne neither shall seuerall mutuall office concerne party euer currantly constantly performed much lesse whole life estate marriage blessed comfortable weeping iust cause wee may note doct subtiltie bad woman complaine bitterly husband gaue occasion though hee told hee ought doe must therefore hate although philistims threatned proue hated say therfore leaue selfe let iust cause vnkindnesse offered christian husband let well testified doth many woman doe dissemble charge husband vniustly knowes doth onely bring bent bow make owne cause seeme tolerable good seeke draw inconuenience say doe thus let make christian wise warie fetch teach meane giuing due belongs take heed ouercome way case example spitefull woman call husband loue question hee reuenge falsely supposed wrong another hath offered impotent humour pretendeth proud woman thus vpbraid husband satisfying demaunds touching costly attire allowance money estate admit also iealous woman iustifie base vncomely conceit behauiours husband shall make case good alleaging cheerefull woman company though sobrietie warinesse case let husband see innocent beware prostitute imbondage himselfe wiues passion lest yeelding little lose libertie yet let done kindly peaceably anger bitternes chargeth loued doct tolde secret equitie concerned know reason shee doe shee drew reason wrong ground woman must know husband minde al thing else thinke loue error alone would haue said behold fondnes follie possesseth many woman confesse thing common concerne either pertaining soule bodie present life free readie communicating thing betwixt woman hath right therein well man seeing many thing fecresie besides lie waightily vpon husband doe nothing concerne wife yea dangerous bee tolde foorth many woman weake conceale husband wisedome may impart vnto yet shall iustly charged want loue next chapter god willing saue one samson withstood wife first good reason namely told father mother yet loued dearely long new marryed neither proofe faithfulnes wisedome silence otherwise reason good seeing man may impart thing wife rather denying request well reasonable answer withstand vnreasonable sutes shall shew ourselues well fortified word sound resolution good conscience giue sufficient reason refusall otherwise like drawne sinne although greatly sollicited importunitie others selues vngrounded vnarmed subtiltie loose disposition owne heart though thinke neuer well owne strength must granted greatest danger beside owne readinesse pronesse euill haue prouocations also strong inward temptation outward occasion auoyding resisting ioseph hath giuen v example worthie following neither snared inticed inwardly saw might easily haue desire satisfied neither allured word flattery much hearken whorish mistresse haue spoken men word adde woman wise would learne shake bold shamelesse sutes dare demaund dishonestie reproch vndoing namely prostitute chastity pleasure hauing spoyled doe leaue fruit dalliance afterward said would answered importunate rest seauen dayes feast first verse three could finde meaning riddle woon obtained hand last sought shee told people countrey men philistims three thing may seene verse distinctly importunate vrging impotencie ouercome telling exposition riddle philistims people minister seuerall instruction v first importunate vrging reason would answer wee may see vnreasonable shamelesse bold yea vnwearyed wicked person following bad suite neuer giue ouer thinke shall preuaile one meanes least importunity wee cannot doe like come neere either seeking goodnes men suing god small denyall weake withstanding v men make v soone weary honest attempt may faint like manner giue ouer making request god yea great matter preuaile vnlike woman canaan would take repulse discouraged hardest answer giuen sauiour hath taught v luk importunate could faile goe without ke request made according one speciall point wisedome wherein child light learne child world passe second thing three see doct following thus continuall vrging yeelded suite told meaning riddle withstood first afterwards ouercome teacheth haue ouercome temptation first assaulting v one would thinke hardest doe respect time following yet may possibly ouercome afterwards giuen ouer example whether vnlawfull demaunds incontinencie filthy gaine seeking like reason fickle flexible doe strengthen selues constant one time good thing neither oft instant god feruent praying watching neither couenanting sin looking carefully keeping neither disgrace sin meanes whereof satan taketh aduantage v one time euen samson spoken afterwards like withstanding inticements subtile woman first full purpose time doe still yet yeelded long perswasion vnto vniust vnreasonable request last marueile see thus particular sinne temptation one brought yeeld last resisted first see generall liking imbracing whole doctrine gospell receiued ioy time yet fall away loue afterward neuer imbraced therefore much haue resisted sinne time may possibly afterward fall notwithstanding ought make best v constant watching euill well first remembring sauiour charge peremptory indefinite reaching time watch neuer haue sound proofe forgiuenes death sinne wrought power word marueile inconstancie bee seene please themselues ouermuch good action soone discouraged either within without themselues least occasion best people must plie god prayer hold build vp daily vpon good foundation rush grow without mire man watchfull persist good course hath seemed like hating sinne hee seemed haue disliked nothing set forward matter difficultie flesh blood cannot inherit kingdome god neither satan diuided reioyce men shewes therefore get assurance god fauour patch vp euill heart fewe colour goodnesse ioyned substance also weaknes follie samson passe third point teacheth another thing haue ouercome hard difficultie greater temptation yet may afterwards ouercome small one concealed opening riddle father mother farre greater reason tell hauing long proofe pietie loue faithfulnesse rather stranger hee knew bee void like hee tolde lest occasion haue opened philistims wife vnto follie bewraying wife like sin man god came reproue ieroboams idolatrie bethel hauing charge giuen god goe house wicked place king eate refresh himselfe well carefully obserue place hardest doe king house yet behold hee ouercome went charge foolish credulitie might much easily haue kept fellow hee inuited home king withstood fearing displeasure afterwards moued old prophet bethel goe house eate went contrary commandement lord therefore departure slaine lion high way reason hereof many offend way ouercome smaller sinne haue ouercome greater men afraid committing distrusting themselues seeke feruently god helpe obtaine note smaller sinne doe much suspect feare selues vnarmed ill prouided doe easilier fall thus commeth passe haue slaine lion beare foiles v hauing deuoured camell gnat choke v wee auoid harder inconuenience yet bewray shew weakenesse smaller wee might easily haue ouercome fareth v repenting great trespasse easilier brought relent seeing wee know wee hardned committing yet lesse offence wee shall hardlier bewaile confesse seeing heart committing doth see much euill therefore well god seruants liue former experience renue care pleasing god feare contrary shall bee farre distemper shall able prophet another time beleeue hee deliuered must vnderstand thus hee gaue though chiefe onely named manner spirit god expresse whole oftentimes part besides wee know would otherwise haue contented satisfied know doth become v christian yeeld ill measure offer v see neither samson ouercome euill good must granted hardly yeelded flesh affordeth much ill counsell debtor fulfill desire rom practise innocencie many prouocations contrarie nay although wee pretend wee vse aduantage hath wronged v end may play stopgame say saue selues harmelesse although doe depriue simply owne euen say permitted v except aduantage wee may lawfully take would haue taken equitie whether giuen v occasion reuenge example hee haue wronged v bargaine ouersight may prouide selues ouersight stand couenant deny v due may lawfully seek owne meanes come haue vsed haue respect reuenge streight rule practise euen among know professe let others goe thinke condition vnequall may deceiue deceiuer preuent subtiltie like play cretians cretian dissemble cogge lye farre vprightnes yeeld due rather striue endlesly odde people passe come another point namely samson wrath kindled wife telling riddle philistims therefore going away without father house least telling act bee iustified hee ought moodie manner haue departed wife leaue wondering sudden going giuing cause feare returne home renuing displeasure toward againe say haue left young woman new married doubt feares might befall haue told fault vnto shee fit heare betwixt two kinde reproofe counselling better gouerned haue ended controuersie either haue taken least haue gone away frow sullenly displeasure sheweth fault sullennes bee angrie bodie yet wee bee knowne thing neither shew cause peaceably plainly grieued might make end matter satisfied may answere giuen v least beare patiently little little cut anger either goe companie discontented vnquiet saying nothing broyling stomackes great griefe offence partie anger kindled conceiued thus doe say thing vtterly vnbeseeming christian question bee made two worst either open secret anger say bewraying letting appeare impotent cannot bridle suppresse euils farre tolerable smoothering keeping though vile odious house set fire farre dangerous threatneth greater mischiefe speedie consuming house flame pent hath vent breake foorth euen anger hidden concealed farre worse sheweth selfe may seene absoloms hidden wrath breaking murther except bee high degree inflamed bewraieth much follie soone vanish come end whereas imagineth euill bringeth foorth hee thinketh seeth best yet grant degree sullennes vnbeseeming christian lowest degree yea though goe away time strength ouer without hurt remedie weigh follie shame disguising selues also consider wee bee take matter hotly done v haue prouoked god many time haue haires head much greater cause giue god displeased v consider whether could like lord hide displeasure v execute vpon v would neither aware thus like meanes goe resist asswage bee hardly done first yet afterwards done easily wee labour time chace away altogether reliques remaine v sore ague cause confesse separation betweene married person euery man must owne iudge either ciuill magistrate else appointed god church bee iudges like case must determine manner society like among men husband vpon euery tetch might shorter longer time leaue fellowship wife sure practise one meanes besides many much vncleanenes confusion blood posteritie beggery party family forsaken riot disorder god knoweth sacred ordinance god religious band securing pledge peace vnion order leapt ouer troden downe limit within bound mischiefe like ensue therefore let none guiltie kinde plead samson example little libertie giuen herein whereas obiect samson herein gaue place wrath rather withdrew himselfe abode lest hee might possibly haue broken answere samson dealing outragiously word deed commended howbeit going away passion thereby excused seeing amend matter made worse although partie offended may sometimes auoid ionathan alleniate displeased companie yet followeth partie offended married couple may depart offender goe away adoe thereby nourisheth humour prouoketh rather slaketh either goe forward draw person ought broken dissention day peter chargeth much lesse ought bee separation pet longer time therefore seeing many occasion fall hereof betwixt couple marriage reason much conceitednes one way wardnes inconstancie loue false heartednesse like let abhor note would shunne like wearisomenesse companion neuer cease till renounce disclaime corruption pray oft earnestly arme themselues many renued couenants thing may bee betwixt shall better keepe order vnder shall see breach brawles betwixt yea shall fit set couple together variance shall ill doe abroad maintaine peace home occasion said married couple absent obiect long time one obiected many necessitie following calling cannot chuse long time one another many lawyer merchant sea men therefore charge giuen apostle corinth cor stand wit long absence betwixt couple answere charge better kept therefore much euill committed answ meane long absence one many complaine smart meanes thereof yet redresse nay say plainely see say men suffer much sorrow sustaine great trouble owne fault seeing calling absence must fall betwixt doe neither labour grace themselues beare better neither seeke yokefellowes excell therein neither faithfully take order betweene themselues carefully looke euery way auoide danger god contrarie himselfe neither commandeth contrary long absence one another yet shall follow calling necessitie require last must needes certainely may bee helped relieue themselues first feare god otherwise promise haue god blesse thing speaking matter say feare god good order taking betwixt themselues oft earnest praying part quiet chaste mindes body vsing therewith good meanes neede shall require shall attaine redresse god hath promised consent may absent without many vnquietnesses inconueniences yet doe certainely meete qualified fall adulterie like euils fruit sinne god punisheth meane irreligiousnesse vnfaithfulnesse like fall bee able say many followeth verse samson would haue gone chamber wife dutie husband father philistim would suffer giuen another oh wofull act especially spoken neede wonder reason doe professe yeelde doings dealing philistims wee may see sore punishment haue doe vnconscionable men boldly hold right v deale v wee cannot make reckoning owne must come hand neither sure owne owing due vnto v bondage another haue power authority ouer good nature selfe foundation propriety man good abhorring community cutthrote ciuill society commonwealth labourer done work must looke receiue wage man hath lent ware money denied though hee listeth claime detaine another body sing v song sion rehoboam also willed mitigate psal heauie hand father held ouer subiects answereth king tush yee good measure shewed yee father little finger shall heauier loines slightly bad men deale lord seruice thinke drawing neere body sufficient seruice though heart farre yet himselfe professeth vaine doe worship math saul thought might offer burnt offering peace offering sam lord though contrary commandement would need imagine bee well pleasing doe taking harshly samuel presseth disobedience hee haue obeyed god haue followed owne fancie returne dealing men haue sore hurt wronged make light matter say meant harme like man prouerbs fained himselfe mad cast firebrand arrowes saith sport deale deceitfully prou wickedly friend neighbour say sport meane harme least iniurie bee offered heere philistim samson going daughter make little matter great rather satisfied answere party thought would hardly taken conclude salomon saith young men reioce thy youth c bee eccles sure god bring thee iudgement may say men health iollity lasteth none controll tread vnderlings vnder foot winde god himselfe finger make slight matter sinne say tricke youth small matte many day make adam sin eate apple matter nothing loe posterity must die doe ye esau tush great matter sell birthright gen let goe sooth vp selues say conceit thinkes god papist paint good old man sits idle hee neither doe good euill wee may vse deale wee list god shall take wild asse moneths light cared none pursuer meane shall visit men ier set face vnconscionablenes hard measure haue offered made nothing men made bee tenisballes obiects wrong scorne sin shall seeme small great hill mountaine vnto shall cry saying neuer felt weight sinne till light committing punishment greater wee beare holy ghost threatens adulterer god shall iudge let heb know seeing stout stately common men meddle god take hand iames saith bee aduocate innocent oppressor bee added former point iam end counsell others haue little doe thes cormorant marke cognizance like next point noteth may know auoide better thus much bee said first speech samson father law next followeth offered wiues sister wife hee respected neere blood feared hee saw hee man great stomacke fret sore philistims therfore offered appease wrath yet many heathen know marriage vnlawfull made lawes thus thought put euen wicked men bad dealing found danger feare meanes therof marke recompence offer worse offered none hee heere cannot take better part conscience either promise faire goe pay debt satisfie wrong haue done shall bee done vnwillingly men loss harmes act father law samson tooke occasion vex philistims vers lord enemy hee saw father law mocke took condition offered said haue receiued wrong philistims dealing shall seene better come question ye haue giuen iust cause seek reuenge yet must know hee one appointed god thereto man ease stomacke vpon pleasure may wise reuenge enemy heate heart howsoeuer wee hardly heare saying leaue vengeance god bridle vnruly affection may carrie v euill men ouercome euill good although denie rom commanded god pursue euill must goe readily samson heere heere end verse vers samson went caught three hundred fox tooke firebrand turned taile taile put firebrand middest betweene two tailes hee set brand fire hee let goe standing corne philistims burnt vp shockes also standing corne vineyard corne philistims ripe burned vp heapes rickes corne gathered standing also folly v aske hee plagued philistims way among verse sufficient holy ghost hath set downe punished sore euen way may conceiue fire kndled many place spreading euery place kindled much hurt might soone bee done thereby appeared absaloms dealing ioab setting corne field fire much sam wild creature terrified fire running fro carrying field might doe greater mischiefe thing doubtlesse vnlikely haue come passe vnlikely admonisheth v onely commodity rich subiect losse sundry way may conceiue euen way also cannot thinke would haue thought though windes wet drought might haue lost fruites yet haue spoiled way reason many casualty change transitorie life liuely put mind hereby possesse therefore earthly benefit wee shall lesse addicted man shew many vnlikely danger men good lie open beside common ordinary haue heard late many men commodity brought likelihood past danger haue great part destroyed vermine mouse rat therefore called vncertaine rich seeing man hath hold luk tim one man day another man morrow besides ought set heart cannot keepe neither thereby giue occasion selues disquieted god meanes shall depriue v minde better thing seene mortall eye shall also witness wee haue treasure mat laid vp v heauen wee walke discharge calling whereby god blessing encrease substance yet euen regard commandement enioyning v labour profit comfort selues good conscience comming vsing god promise good successe rather reckoning commodity enioy point haue said elsewhere next thing two verse make profit lord giueth v opportunity offereth v occasion seruice wise see ready vse may testifie obedience god men samson lord would haue set vpon philistims first prouoked lest done without iust occasion offered might haue pursued alone land made much adoe hurt heere till knew brother philistims prouoked thereupon hee sought reuenged vers looke gedeons story samson proceed philistims pursue vers liues shewed verse hot enquirie among spoiled commodity learned samson done reason rendred timnite taken wife giuen another vnderstood went burnt father fire considered done great wrong thought auenged himselfe done verse earnest inquirie done doct great displeasure may see light nature euen lawfull v doe owne case help magistrate seeke finde haue done much euill commonwealth troublesome yet herein must differ heere eagerly pursue doer wrong themselues disorder much wee inlightened word god ought hearken offender procure iust punishment may rather sinne auenge selues thereby salomon dealt ioab ioyned himselfe adonijah king lord annointed hee commanded bee slaine blood shed causelesse might vpon owne head great sin rather would incurre least danger displeasure hand bad person worthie cut sore punished doe suffer goe wickednesse rather withstand bring foorth authoritie receiue due yea rather bee readie excuse fault defend trespasse committed themselues measure pursuing enemy fitter occasion handle offered chapter philistims vnderstood samson thus spoyled timnite giuen wife companion went said burnt daughter house ouer head timnite hurt seeing could come samson take reuenge therefore punished occasion samson spoyling though wise consenting knowing hee vnreasonable act fall vpon way guiltie hurt done lord indeed iustly hereby reuenge villany offered samson looked god onely ouerruled appetite one act iniurious selfe yet lord executed righteous iustice malefactor arming one wicked person another preparing way thereby reuenge philistims themselues shal appeare afterward may see madnes outrage men though heathen therefore might bee thought haue none match grosse wickednes among baptized yet behold destitute grace among v feare man restraineth let loose great sinnes proofe whereof behold dealing furious iewes act could come paul fell vpon sosthenes companion beate day act papist cannot come heretike himselfe terme vse draw picture exactly great despite burne fire shewing would doe person vnlike practise seditious souldiers chopping small herb pot oppose mutinie see commeth passe sometimes vile men giuen ouer furie passion moode shall beare blowes commeth next way though hee fault whatsoeuer next knife dagger cudgel whatsoeuer else whether beate eye tooth breake arme legge one moodie euen shebeares robbed whelpes nay little led sound reason owne rashnes haue hurt themselues doore fall stumbling stone curse one beate sustaine damage losse neighbour satisfied till philistims haue blood least till seeke though hurt done thus doggishly pursued touching rage madnes haue said somewhat heretofore discredit disswade men shewing hideous face therof cursed fruites issuing therefrom beholding lamech furie outrage hearing terrour word would abhorre gen quality yet remaine among v men better disposition though speake plainly lamech could rancour eate heart enemie garlicke saying yet nourish serpent bosomes still fight sword spirit confesse themselues bee beast yeelding farre whereby whole christianitie called question another thing verse omitted whereas samson doct wife threatned neighbour would burne except told meaning riddle wee haue heard auoid danger tell griefe great hurt husband yet behold could auoide philistims burned telling riddle people saued burning samson went father gaue another wife samson spoyled philistims corne commodity cause burned father riddle declaring whereof saued life occasion losing euen shee sought vnlawfull meanes shift shunne meane burning vnlawfull shift procured iosephs brother sought gen rid dreames honor haue aboue told wise could abide therefore sold farre countrey euen thereby brought honour cleane contrary mindes liking cleere gen compared c storie manifestly manifoldly proued experience among v whereas many seeing great trouble comming toward doe seeke euill practises lying swearing forswearing like winde may bee commonlier seene say note thereby bring farre greater sorer trouble vpon themselues seeke auoid worldly sorrow come trouble much lesse plunged farre greater euen torment conscience deadly sting sorrow sinne long time bee plucked iewes sought libertie putting christ death yet matth thereby rose rose againe death cut heart deeplier imbondaged much speake seared hot yron much rather haue thereby brought blood vpon child vnto day stand rather vpon thought foolish part man beare discommodity patiently rather shift vnlawfull meanes counted point wisdome fall rather hand bad men though yeeding sinne commit case god confidence account made though bee man conscience many politikes censure daniel vpright dan persisting seruice god decree made prince say men shift euasion deliuer himselfe elude aduersaries must wilfully fall snare oh foole learne example truth denunciation matth iob saue life giue skinne skinne conscience saue shall lose either disappointed shift god giuing fauour eye enemy count hypocrite shifting seeme gaine somewhat thereby one kinde yet shall neuer enioy penniworth comfort rather checking vpbraiding conscience doe length wearines renounce cast away iudas wage iniquitie hee loseth matth life trusteth god precious liberty rather runne vpon pike haue shall finde hester sauing note ir good martyr changing eternall life short enduring trouble good quiet spirit hope reward shall make tolerable oh men would learne measure vpon deare price sought auoid heathen could say vengeance would suffer guiltie act escape though might shift present word god teacheth v cause god vengeance lord hoasts hath hundred souldiers armed meete enemie though haue escaped one man hauing shunned beare meete amos lion hath escaped former still chace neuer rest till destroyed hee better haue yeelded first story al church verifie truth example abiuring hypocrite met worse measure god took hand shunned hand men wisedome man foolishnes cor god two verse way set downe whereby samson vers hurt philistims body hee lamed pained kicking receiued fish cast sea preserued belly cast vp land extraordinarie prouidence god rather hee lost forsaken samson hauing thus slaine hee went abode place called etham high rocke belonged tribe simeon border iudah therefore said next verse philistims came pitched iudah seeke hee thus slew said verse marked said set downe seuenth verse saw burned timnite daughter seeing onely occasion losse said thus philistims yee haue done thus neighbour owne countrey hurt would doe fall hand therefore auenged cease thus much cleering two verse verse wee may note men cruell outragious doct vers onely occasion hurt though neuer sought intended much shew fury madnes haue done hurt wrong vnto may fitly gathered reasoning samson wee may well conclude say wee bee exasperated doe come way onely present wee sustained reproch iniurie much light vpon hath done wrong v wee shew selues vnreasonable hee cannot beare little much lesse beare great deale fall neere hand hee beate ground stumbled much fiercely rise hath cast wilfully ground samson said hee would auenged philistims ceased hee spake became seeing god appointed doe authoritie set place god terrour rom wicked euen comfort good grace easie matter punish sinne aright seeke winne prou offender great offence doe worke lord negligently fall vpon innocent hastily cruelly priuate person preacher word especially doe likewise wit make sinne odious themselues others farre lieth magistrate punish reproue euen ought like affected sin god abhorreth herein saying good leui father know euen father hee deut goe hinder worke god herein follow wee blessed sauiour came destroy workes diuell haue oft noted ioh therefore presse former verse said threaten vers verse said doe accomplish smite great plague reprochfull maner setting feete vpon spurning vnto death commanded god bin cruelty may learne know except haue charge god execute vpon men seuere sharp punishment meere crueltie set vpon wee wise like much lesse delight attempt wee would willing haue like offered selues haue wee compassion commiseration ouer miserie way selues would like case desire branch former often touched said rocke etham iudah shew abode till hee taken thence men iudah carried philistims soone know said saue onely may see goe hide himselfe corner though hee durst stand hee done like apprehended went god directing take patiently doe depend issue though defenced high place yet open knowne easily remoued thence men iudah came vp thither carrie bound philistims committing himselfe god prouidence whose worke done though went thither philistims yet euen place gouerned let bee wise doe may bee driuen flie answere bee armed beare come vpon falleth oft time euen haue well done instrument diuell bee ready alwaies molest bring trouble vpon notwithstanding yet may reioyce sauiour willeth bee glad mat persecuted reuiled sake well let pet prou man suffer euill hee shall bee forced hide himselfe runne away wicked flying man pursueth yet haue said notwithstanding denyed man rescue himselfe open wrong vnconscionable lawfull meanes neither ought preiudice equity cause eightieth sermon xv chapter booke ivdges second part chapter vers lest hee done philistims hee might haue lifted vp aboue meet thus dealeth intermixing chastisement blessing may held humility one yet may haue sufficient encouragement abide note constantly good course forget lord become high minded easily brought bee wit benefit thus lord saw good deale euen paul himselfe buffeted cor satan hee listed vp third heauen rauishing god spirit yet hee humour remaining needed setling cooling ioy might kept within holy list bound haue noted famous accident iphtah daughter iudg god set abase hee might proceed triumph soberly wee must thinke god seruants deare hee sticketh bereaue preciousest delight end may hold delight turne sweetnesse bitternes meane holy reioycing fleshly presumption reason hereof note else god cannot trust v businesse set v except hee giues v cooling abasement consume superfluity hypocrisie conceitednesse selues pride security vnfit dealer heauenly matter nadab abihu strange fire kindle leuit incense offer sacrifice fetcheth help rather head heart falleth rather contriue fleshly shift auoid ease distresse like saul getting musitian heale troubled conscience meditate sam god former mercy doth make euery new crosse others wisedome till haue brought paid dearely themselues sinne dalliance rst men thinke wise enough guide way though god shut whereas prophet ieremy denieth ierem man direct way bad yet think may much say truth god onely wise knoweth hee doth let bold person seeing needes fall dangerously onely others might learne beleeue admonition concerning offence see example euen offendors themselues pride may bee crackt loosenes corrected themselues made priuie owne corruption glad liue euer thankfully vnder god gouernment yet say point glorie bee counted virgin therefore refuse mariage rather shun discommodities accompanying shall haue small reward god sinne breaking another way sodomie nourishing vncleane lust doubled shall haue punishment accordingly seeing sin samson committed immediatly great doct seruice hee god philistims mentioned latter end former chapter worke came citie azza hee saw woman say wee may see wee haue praised god victorie gotten haue serued good sort euill sort haue well occupied taken vp dutie god confesse grant wee consider well wee seruice note done god samson philistims say senced sweete baites sinne long time afterward meete good spirituall refreshing soules might fitter proceed cheerefully readily one dutie another least farre disguisings samson diuell handleth matter slightly couertly worketh thereby v securitie pleasing selues good companie like inticements thing marueiled haue well occupied haue done faithfull seruice god break amisse go like cain iudas god presence diuels shop forthwith worke busines say would easily thought wee might brought vnto yet wilfull ignorance wee know better neither see yet wee doe sloth pride loosenes securitie bearing sway v wee may possibly bee misled yea easily full soone manner haue said
