peter setteth downe telleth v pet lord patient v case end euen bring v repentance loe good meaneth v forbearing v though wise man part tempt hope spared samson heere sinnes neuer without feare though may without outward danger time yet wee haue done time past time come doe sauiour speaketh man gospel healed ioh disease caueat watchword fit v goe thy way sinne lest worse thing befall thee best case iudge selues speedily euill haue done bee iudged lord bee sharpe smartie euen samson found afterward doe like case find daily cor yet without due regard corrupt heart driue v vpon common rocke wit wee shall hurt selues way many doe euen cry peace peace god deferre punish thinke wee loue flatter selues fauoureth v doth strike v euen wicked said psalme lord psal hold tongue smite sin like vnto mind allowed therein god answered reproue thee set thy bad doings thee thou shalt acknowledge whether thou wilt shew fauoured thee second part chapter vers hee loued woman plaine sorek whose name delilah vnto came prince philistims said vnto entice see wherein great strength lieth meanes may ouercome may bind punish euery one v shall giue thee eleuen hundred shekles siluer delilah said samson tell mee pray thee wherein thy great strength lieth wherewith thou mightest bound doe thee hurt samson answered vnto bind seuen greene cord neuer dried shall weake another man prince philistims brought seuen greene cord dry bound therewith shee men lying waite chamber shee said vnto philistims vpon thee samson brake cord threed tow broken feeleth fire strength knowne delilah said vnto samson see thou hast mocked told lie pray thee tell wherewith thou mightest bound answered bind new rope neuer occupied shall weake another man delilah therefore tooke new rope bound therewith said vnto philistims vpon thee samson men lay waite chamber brake armes threed afterward delilah said vnto samson hitherto hast thou beguiled mee told melies tell thou mightest bound said vnto thou plattest seuen locke mine head threeds woofe fastened pinne said vnto philistims vpon thee samson awoke sleepe went away pin web woofe againe said vnto canst thou say loue thee thine heart thou hast mocked three time hast told wherein thy great strength lyeth importunate vpon word continually vexed soule pained death therefore hee told heart said neuer came rasor vpon mine head nazarite vnto god mother wombe therfore shauen strength go shall bee weake like men delilah saw told heart shee sent called prince philistims saying come vp againe hee hath shewed mee heart came vp brought money hand shee made sleepe vpon knee called man made shaue seuen lock head began vex strength gone said philistims vpon thee samson awoke sleepe thought goe time shake selfe hee knew lord departed verse set downe second part chapter wherein samson sinned againe like manner like issue summe verse former wicked fact god arrest vpon trespasse pursue seeing hee made benefit conniuence hee went away without punishment proceeded like sinne againe behold paid dearly accordingly tempted god farre sinne whoredome said loued another woman philistims vnderstood considered meanes vexed great strength body whereby hee wrought great mischiefe enticed flattered woman easily wonne promising great summe money agreed together therein perswade get subtilty great strength lay might knew vse meanes weaken handle afterward pleasure practise hired readily went made drunke sottish inordinate loue suffered moue question although hee held yet last hee told heart euen asked might bee made weake till hee saw late adam god gone hee gen lost great strength god giuen verse containing second part chapter seeing many matter much therefore auoiding confusion tediousnesse handling draw two point first new occasion philistims laid wait samson againe end fifth verse manner wit earnest suing delilah learne great strength lay second neuer ceased til found brought word vers first touching samson holy story relateth occasion pursuing verse philistims thereby moued lay vers occasion cast affection vpon another woman israelite nation philistims holy story expresseth place shee dwelt plaine sorek woman name loued delilah said samson hee went another woman note doct vers filthy lust satisfied yeelding anger wrath onely time breaketh rangeth still yet fire broken flame standeth still taketh hold one house hath burned another euen simil wicked lust one woman two twenty satisfie vnbridlednesse outragiousnesse thereof would might serued yeelded vnto goe farre salomon euen defile thousand iehu answere iehorams demand peace king tels king mother iezabels witchcraft without number reason hereof vnlawfull pleasure sin doth bait doth fish egge sinner goe forward blind seeing manifold vnfruitfulnesse thereof like gamesters neuer leaue trade pennie left sheweth wickednesse heart one kind many measure sinfull though bee cleare proofe alwaies speake meane vnsatiablenesse men filthie appetite partly seeing sinne secretly committed part therefore hardly knowne many far proceedeth partly sinne kind hardly haue ordinary opportunity effect desire truth say appeareth hath found way confession haue gone farre wicked course life howsoeuer may haue come short number many thousand salomon yet haue made vp full longlying sin leaud companion haue intercepted haue full swinge true affirmed guilt sinne infinite respect transgression infinite maiestie also sinner appetite though actually finite yet extendeth itselfe desire multiplying sinne infinitely could death bad men thinke euill course bee stopped may time past haue done yea age death thing must need end iollity insist instance alone may bee seene sundry kindes sinne theft prodigality drunkennesse rest heart measure sinfull giueth ouer euill till want opportunity till must cease necessity violence bee put vnto delighteth old ribald see heare report pageant story practises vncleannesse remembreth hath wrought though old bone cannot bestirre liuely time past yet old adam within aliue lasciuious euer angry man hath done till haue none angry till hee cut cannot shew might bee endlesse follow particular oft thinke wee peter like haue denied master three time vehementliest last yet hee onely feare meere infirmity professedly much worse neither yet occasion strong great brought thereto euen word silly damsell vse haue said tentation sinne vncleannesse obiect thereof sinne wee prou keepe heart eye possible obseruation diligence allowing liking offer sort curbe vp tie short though carnall reason would perswade v giuing little liberty fleshly affection couetous desire would content satisfie would desire reach note man say worth thus many hundred pound c would rest content yet grosse bewitching v thinke seeing without god speciall grace money encreaseth doth loue thereof also yea next way bring v vtter extreame bondage prouoke v endlesse ingaging selues thereunto nay rather ioyne prayer watching fall mar vprightnesse shall sure fall tentation say lesse haue handled speech adonibezek cap vers eightie three sermon xvi chapter booke ivdges goe forward left heere note wee another thing wit vse benefit wee commonly make god long sufferance patience euen goe forward spirituall delusion sinnes without making question god call v account flatteringly tell selues perswaded well long god let v go vnpunished whereas bee ignorant patience god toward v end acknowledge vnfained thankes might iustly haue punished v hath done others spared v end wee turne againe lord true repentance rather wondring rom lenity much adoe enduring penalty enlightened come selues see wee haue tempted god wise flatter selues lest lord forced thereby tie v shorter vse sharpenesse shal like well like spake samson escaping former verse onely adde fearefull thing loue conniuence god note chiefe bridle containe faithfull people obedience become occasion greatest licentiousnesse argueth tender nature filiall affection waxen hardened degenerated slauish desperate boldnesse like presuming himselfe sure enough master fell waxe wearie worke take vpon iollity doe reckon without hoste shall one thing much sting heart god come take correction neuer well till turned loue father iealousie foe whose swift wing taking reuenge shall sure recompence delay leaden foot slow punish samson himselfe sequell found cost thus much samson sinne shewed philistims tooke vers occasion thereby get hand dealing woman loued intice tel great strength lay might doe desired withall end might draw perswade thereto offer chiefe prince meane large summe money may see wisdome readinesse men world going remedie bodily mischiefe comming toward soone heard samson haunt chiefe went thither tooke order suppressing without great cost charge oh commendable indeed might bee seene v yea much greater mischiefe hangeth ouer v meane wee could offer like violence sinne giue rest till wee rooted heere effected went yet may see haue greater cause doe emminent danger temporall bodily euill see sloth follie admirable lamentable prouidence together cost consent diligence haue noted like occasion former verse maruell counsell deceiue inticements allurement harlot haue good skill fooles woond easily deluded samson strongest reason perswasion wisest carnall friend would neuer haue drawne slauerie shame base companion brought delusion note deceiuing whereby may learne carried away sinne giuen ouer lust depart religion also sound wisdome reason right mindes say deluded mocked disguised euen made fooles samson heere mad beside selues said prodigall sonne hee spent good harlot hee came luk himselfe length whereby cleere beside himselfe reade foole prouerbs hee followed oxe prou slaughter due bee shoaled among driuen companie sober wise men yet thus samson deceiued deluded drawne inticed wicked woman vtter secret namely great strength lay vse make abhorre sinne fellowship person labour retaine godly wisedome guide v holie feare offending rather take part pleasure sinne season shall deceiued deluded otherwise wee cannot chuse yea sottish manner samson inchantment brought bee let bee sufficient shew enough corrupt heart man humble sight god world depth darknesse yea though rebellion deformitie inferior appetite soule originall sinne whereas created obedient subiect pure light vnderstanding thing infeebled infatuated resisteth iudgement minde led away strength allurement euen contrary knowledge still remaineth guide degegenerate become brutish sottish bewraieth selfe euen otherwise goe none simplest vnciuill sort offering money prince philistims also liberall maner much hundred pound piece doct money well nigh estimation shekell reckoned common shekell much twentie penny v therefore eleuen hundred want little hundred pound rate offering say many hundred according number prince came might easily draw purpose one light inconstant falsehearted samson harlot without respect money teacheth v hireing people money hath bin doct euen herod himselfe reuerenced mark stood feare ware strumpet fardall stuft withall euen subtiltie crueltie falsehood tempered together demaund delilah man knowes qualitie predominant among rest whereof speake insolent impudencie shamelesnesse practise cursed kinde euen day paramour demaund vnreasonable pledge vncleane loue appeares embezeling patrimonie maintenance sometimes causing spend insult ouer king vnderling common phrase companion harlot call themselues seruants mistress deed vassal slaues yet bondage great ioyned miserie sweete although indeed sweete poyson reward good enough employment yet many chuse kinde life libertie rather honest mariage returne said familiaritie meete best swell confesse bee high minded humble meeke toward yet grauitie whereby bad may afraid think fit companion except change quality note tit good may cling ioyne companie acquaintance without feare haue familiaritie bad euill vtterly vnlawfull serues onely confirme make bold wickednesse thus many man otherwise worthie samson brought meane account indiscreete vnseasonable laying open minde hee euen imbolden woman thereby aske may bee bound hurt absurd thing either incourage propound seeth samson answering haue admitted speake vers matter telling hee might bound make way euill followed repulsed beaten back boldnes first haue incouragement much lesse doubt haue proceeded afterward great wisedome samson answer balaam answered word asse time haue said numb himselfe thinke hee gone farre enough prouoking god hee opened mouth dumme beast reprooue samson haue thought imboldned wicked behold man intangled snare owne lust sin wasteth conscience hee shiftlesse cannot helpe himselfe readie beare burthen shall laid vpon shoulder rather rise vp vnder therefore great loue god man hauing first preuented beginning sinne ouertaken deceitfulnes first view yet vpon aduised consideration danger leadeth vnto shall awake rouse vp himselfe flie serpent shifting lye though would satisfie yet keepe himselfe safetie bewraying secret wisedome commendation alike dealt foolishly answering hee ill looking stop mouth lye forewarneth v shift selues looke make part good lying though way lie open thereto readie hand see way sinne kind thereof condemned howsoeuer little account made rather bee taken heed seeing oft time runne headlong haue said wee see readier way shift selues wee thinke saue credit auoid greater danger seeing bee looked samson case hee present prouide owne safetie lye poore shield whose innocencie watchfulnes haue defence let v beware entring acquaintance sin bee costly maintaining draw man wretched necessitie adde thereto many sin euen samson must seeke couert safegard himselfe lye want better except first dash would haue gone stitch haue told matter touching dallying humour playing wilie beguily wisdome skill enough shift trifling answer hardest come although sauoured somewhat confidence conceitednes supposed strength much like peter rashnes hee told master denie luke mat yet sequell bewraied common folly hee one eye might easily haue seene lesse euill could follow also shall appeare due place hereafter hee told truth verily thought hee went vers forthwith make proofe word whereas hee told hee weakened bound seuen greene withe cord caused brought foorthwith bound though indeed hee brake oh wonderfull sottishnes suffer certaine philistims lying waite chamber thereby ready take weakened indeed supposed looked thus wee see whereto flattering word tended euen seeke life good may looke haue neere fellowship secret company companion though salomon saith lip drop honey combe euen pleasure selfe man yet path leade destruction prou whore hunt pretious life man haue read many partly haue wofully handled strumpet themselues haue trusted life good partly haue bin deliuered enemy hand slaine maruell hath sold selfe much easilier sell paramour therefore well salomon giue warning shee bee shunned hell prou mouth though bodily danger much feared yet least spirituall hurt farre greater occasion say adde sin farre grieuous abhorre common harlot might easily bewray yet refraine making going least honest stoope lure become whore dishonest second time tried already sought know onely end shee might deliuer philistims hand respect say palpable dotage doe euen next way set forward soliciting importuning till shee got hand therefore degree sinne also bringing misery might haue made wise enough haue refused heare hauing seene philistims lay chamber iust opportunity serued binde take may teach v better sottishnesse bee impotently doct giuen ouer man appetite either way lingring clinging wicked woman pursuing hotly sinne seeking fulfilling man desire way bee remoued especially neither proofe former danger thereby feare present euill foreseeing come yet certaine apparent hold though grosse manner god seruants bee commonly enchanted bewitched monstrous yet let v rest like impotency hunting greedily wealth world ioying pride life c bridle wee keepe vnder wicked heart especially wee haue faire warning bring v like slauery bondage abhorre first entertaine especially hauing proofe woe follow consider fact samson thinke phrase holy ghost vseth describe sinne meane drunkennesse occasion note property drunkard wilfully rushing obserue one venterousnesse boldnesse well said described drunkennes among many property disease put man marueilous confident hope dareth fight man without weapon sobriety durst encounter though well armed wonder braine ouercharged nature oppressed stead purelight vnderstanding mind ingendred frothie conceit appearance stead spirit vigour affection succeedeth degenerate boldnesse foolehardie ventrousnesse men iudge boldnesse drunkard come rather want wit presence courage euen thus fareth samson distemper spirituall drunkennesse still make companion answeres faire farre flourishing casting skill strength enough match goe beyond whereas ala fareth man spake thinking himselfe strong enough goe alone vpright tottereth falleth euery turne although secret yet vttered yet preamble dalliance trifling nibling fish hopping bird bait snare hasteneth yet would seeme hasten vnto doubtlesse samson grace great part imbezeled feebled ere lock cut carried truer measure himselfe better iudgement owne case thinke himselfe owne man able resist mistrisse rather lust bound chaines laid vnder foot foiled vanquished ah poore samson may said thou wert strong enough match lion thousand men grace stand bignesse bone strength armes greatnes stomacke thy lust thy harlot stronger lion mightie men therefore let enough conuict folly samson humour tush ye must tell bad company stealing liberty god denieth would haue think haue shaken hand feare god would bee loth part good conscience others yea may bee answered thought samson would haunt harlot house yet secretly keepe goodnesse lay strength effect poore soule onely foolish conceit boldnesse indeed onely lay foundation woe felt declining weakenesse astonishment shaken louer departed hee feareth nothing till late make sport play matter greatest importance danger therfore bold person say turne loose company strongest enemie foiled laugh say yea shal sure shal laughed though wise pitie rather shall giue counsell escape truly perswade walke humbly feare owne frailty watch suspect owne frailty falshood heart hee say may keepe mischiefe hold venturing dealing aduersary know master looke escape danger yet reiect grace know certainty kind merchantventurers alwaies make shipwracke bring better gaine grace man hath little enough quench dart tentation suggested yet beginning sinne shalt thou adding fewell fire helping diuell forward inward prouoking thy selfe sinne thinke quit thy selfe well hottest assault god try thee grace shall bee sufficient thee thou wilt tempt trouble thy cor selfe know thou hast promise safety kept harmeles maiest looke certainely thy downefall thy owne wisedome grace propped vp pillers shall totter reele house hath lost foundation yea goe worke thus owne head assuredly samson shall fall bewray folly last teach experience fooles wisdome word vnhappy men could doe shall see oddes betwixt keeping innocent wilfull offending shall finde strength one like though little aware matter issue second attempt altogether former vers bound rope againe company lying ready purpose hand bin worke though yet fell hand let teach v onely feare suspect trechery vnfaithfulnesse leaud woman know one generally also wherein soeuer wee haue doe beware defile heart hand wicked action practises whatsoeuer shewes promise giuen offered v remembring word sauiour bee wise serpent innocent mat doues beware men doe say though would teach men vncharitablenesse charity suspitious giue warning god seruants beware cor wee put selues men hand trust faithfulnesse vpon faire word countenance sauiour willeth v take ioh heed giues v example also would commit himselfe men though speake faire giueth reason thereof knew man doe thus iudge men warie counselled religion haue proofe thereof word deed yet finally neither time onely lie knowne euill knowne reformed neither wee one side iudge men without ground warrant neither yet wee side commit selues hand hauing knowledge experience wee haue men vnfaithfulnesse common vpon bare shew heere end time eightie fovre sermon xvi chapter booke ivdges third attempting samson delilah followeth vers next two verse shee seeing hee dealt slightly matter good earnest forbid meddle still dallied tooke deniall sport therfore set vpon againe despairing importuning shee shortly diuell wicked instrument lie way deceiue v draw v snare wise discerning artificial marking goe worke farre hold backe yeelding tentations doe earnestly strength reason resolutely disswade selues feruent constant therein put shift inuent argument greater force whereby may better hope preuaile v diuell dealt saniour according resolute strong deniall slie subtill mat manner refuse bait faintly balaam al shewes numb pet iud made wage iniquity offered shew feare danger greatly like ensue stand strongly owne conceit wee easily withstand sin vpshot haue need counselled day deceiue themselues diuell hath would hand doubt draw v snare commit sinne shortly euen speake finde feele cost confidence seeme haue samson third attempt far giuing ouer hauing twice tryed sought life vtter vndoing yet hee answeres doct third time effeminate sottishnesse howsoeuer hee thought still conceale secret keepe himselfe free vttering euen thitherto done yet hee began third attempt slide slip stagger drunken man little considering hee tampering locke told thing asked came neerer bewraying vttering shee sought hee could hardly conceale saying locke fastened threeds woofe pin hee weakened another man thinking indeed hee came neere point seeing spake locke made triall word hauing done called philistims againe set vpon yet hee held backe yeelding withstood deceiued although hee much adoe see keepe whereby wee may see men giue themselues liberty full doct scope talke fro thing dangerous hurtfull take liking therein auoid occasion resist tentations drawing leading thereto shall chuse bee snared caught therewith though intend thing came passe note shall hardly forbeare containe themselues running headlong giuen ouer thereto led away owne concupiscence saint iames saith inticed also snared iam cannot well go ready consent wee see samson afterward telling whole heart vnto euen say men shall oft long tampering sinne whereto neerely affected come readily speedily consenting committing rather turne away weane themselues betimes least liking longing much lesse hasten liberall talking suffer selues importuned case medling need doubteth shall much easilier yeeld thereto commonly wee call men good nature tainted leaud company grow first dissolute degree desperate wax rotten degree wee see fruit long lying doth wee see running houreglasse euery part sand course hastening houre end though last passage actuall ending reof may say samson dallying houering reply euen first second third preparation final bewraying secret though fourth onely confessed actually fourth away matter whole fourth first second third though obscurely enfolded ala first shifting thought hee might haue proceeded still secret first dash waighty vtter two three dalliance tentation preuailed strong longer shift withhold resist like let v know euen also spokon vnto v fourth attempt followeth shee gaue deadly vers blow warning serue man chuse fall danger great soeuer would meanes auoide might let v heare dealing growne subtill wee thinke thing done betwixt one day foure day together act heere set downe number foure immediately following one another space betwixt might take fit occasion subtill manner renue suite request againe shee beginneth therefore manner whereas hee told hee loued shee subtilly answered shee saw hee loued heart hee mocked three time told asked subtill secret winding impudent importunity earnest vrging wisedome thought holding lie delay iesting manner yet thinking following matter good earnest saying hee grieued saw loued brought thereby pitie wounded subtil flattering dissembling sore vexed see grieued therefore great woe like bring himselfe neuer duly considered ouercome told according desire heart euen hee might bee brought lose strength summe three verse let v weigh thing particularly verse doct vers subtilty woman learned last told loued yet knew doted see artificiall wicked easily grow herein need doubt ye like offender like soone deceiuers attempt doe waxe worse worse ripe subtilty deceiuing saith paul timothy obserue tim part men fitted trade wit meanely bungerly soeuer go worke comparison begin world meane subtilty ouer doe afterward soone grow ripe faculty euery kinde euill dealing experience sheweth cleerely say men obserued would confesse lesse say whether speake begin vnlawfull trade course whoredome oppression flattery beguiling lawfull buying selling letting house land earthly dealing may bee seene vniust steward euill practises luk vsed cunning craft found inuented goe one beyond another otherwise time past part haue done admirable consider shew plainly purpose mind set heart vpon better thing howsoeuer beare v hand doe serue god well best would lesse thought long imbrace gospell grow experienced well seasoned true sauing knowledge holy doctrine whereby abhorre dregges doings attaine finding christian life meate drinke doe may worthily bee complained yea lamented teares euery could doe see fewnesse latter sort many euery swarming former ripenesse sinne elsewhere yet adde vtter griefe euen ripe headed nimble fellowes grow soone master trade haue serued halfe prentiship shall rise vp condemne many better sort blockheaded backwardnesse matter religion christianity long training vp god schoole age bee ripest grace skill passe time fruitfully ioyfully neuer age dullard dunce searching themselues trying whether state saluation seeking acquaintance god considering hath helpes former example present meanes purpose greater euer age since apostle time shall domineere ouer others set vp himselfe shall cogge cosen goe beyond neighbour deceiue hath string bow shift scrape rake pelfe together howsoeuer age may commence highest degree profession skill ripenesse mischiefe bounded within delilah trade though doubtlesse strumpet old age punies subtilty villany extends farre prince world hath subiects ye go enquire hath made christian life easie constancy obedience liueth sweet life void sorrow resolute purpose endeuour abstaining euill watching ouer heart life alwaies also enioyeth liberty god alloweth rest assured loue goe one duty another without vnsetlednesse wearines note disquietnesse word ye enquire man hath improued doctrine gospell hee hath found hundredfold mat measure contentment reiecting lying vanity hee become light example others like thessalonian paul thes calles paternes saint dauid calleth excellent say psal inquirie made yet best yee shall finde meete see affect answere great matter oh euery little enough godlinesse men content mediocritie heere godlinesse vice vertue perfection mastership god trade also without comparison greatest gaine worke tedious men vnhappie cannot hit vpon samson blindfolded beautie hee become sicke seeing grieued must rest good earnest must vtter secret else loued charged could beare vnkindnesse hand louing dearely made thinke subtiltie side care say thus blindfolded oft importunate vrging wounded rather hee would haue thought hee cut loue death thinke hee could hold longer told asked till hee felt late hee vndone make others afraid example make sport sinne trifle matter consequence may learned samson companion vers sinne iestingly dalliance thinking yet themselues goe shall fall good earnest shall bee able auoid might bee exemplified many particular pray giue v leaue merrie saith wanton meane harme harme waiteth dalliance angrie moody person yet knowes dangerous sinne anger giuing reine himselfe resisting occasion time strike wound length kils rage yet ye must let alone cannot angry saith prouoked hath spoken hath done nay many man hath vndone himselfe ere hath done dallying sinne ill playing beares lion fierce creature amiable note qualitie sinne hideous monster man danger deuoured hee playeth onely prophane world doe proue bee true shame many would better thought euen godly doe finde yeelding lust bad desire farre haue power ouer themselues brought point either conscience disquiet sore torment bring foorth sight men sinne much gaue ouer themselues vnto delighted haue heard dauid let bee warning dally sinne iest neerer aware satan meane drawing goe brim banck riuer plunge headlong bottome depth let men rather farre treading step leade thereto haue obserued threefold dallying answere therefore briefer another thing heere samson let v learne euen death men bee put vnlawfull delight pleasure haue giuen ouer themselues brutishly sottishly vnto hee vexed almost death heare tell must forsake could loue hart toward saw yet spake grosse dissembling bondage grieuous greater bondage whore man cannot cling lure whose heart false toward seeketh destruction must take heed rest best thing subiect change much wee hang securitie vpon deceitfull pleasure especially vpon wicked alluring woman rather samson would thinke forgoing behold shameth abandon god conscience speake outward mischief note ensued surely true samson sinned conscience shall say commit secret filthines greedines yet without remorse death think pluckt violence old acquaintance custom become poore man lambe nathan describes dauid euen sam sonne therefore men haue liued long time lewd course without let welcome death make vtter separation betweene lust liued streight league vnion soule body together oh bondage vnspeakable bee inwardly note linked loue neither enioied extreame miserie forgone intollerable vexation let one motiue among others humble sinner god shew measure sinfull corrupt nature also teach eagerly pursue lust except bring world sorrow vpon himselfe time forsaking come though last cast many man renounces old course vngodlines repents yea ashamed doings conscience terrified violent feare griefe hee hath prospereth euil yet ala seeth terror seaze vpon must think seaze vpo al many dying sot liued without feeling part vanish away come nothing great penitent get vp recouer maladie far doe put remembrance former trouble shew distastfull vnto forced bitternes thereof note say thing libertie returne againe naturally byas stone falleth downward oh therefore pray labour may bee good ye set heart delight accounted precious end else bitter parting euer loue enioying loue best thing feare exceed measure besides vnspeakable sound ioy affoord also yeeld euen perpetuitie shall neuer bee pulled away sauiour saith ioy shall man take iohn wrought wise hee thought himselfe purposing shee neuer know shee sought vers hand yet gaue place wicked affection onely snared danger told vnto wit neuer came rasor head locke cut lose strength much told might take life bring shame sorrow vpon deed yet hee might though small effect haue said wit beside euill shall sustaine hereby doe also set lord depriue grace thy sake thus much doubtlesse suffered many good obseruations arise wise man may seek doct begin first briefly two three one shall need complaine hurt wrong doe vnto v common place doe witnesse none greater enemy v selues hee monster men offer note one halfe vnto v samson himselfe may seene behold lesse doe nay many offer themselues storme rage crie hold little due v much wee sustaine greater hurt whereas sinnes worke owne woe yet blind selfloue neuer angrie selues yet wee could finde heart pursue others vnto death oh rend heart sin deeply displeased selues philistims could haue done samson mischiefe himselfe owne folly rather madnesse attempted matter make infamous hee made himselfe would streight haue reuenged nay hee reuenge sequell leaue sinned reuenging come selues dare iustly reproue v fault neuer grosse shall haue badge liuerie presently thinke enemie watch season euen esau dealt brother iacob yet gen farre louing reproofe hurting v wee men wee might keepe hurt speake lighting vpon v precious balme vnto head well wise man say psal see men alous themselues owne hurt endure touch flee face long enough hoped ere wrong themselues willingly indeede reason sensible proofe preposterous man take losse penny anothers hand without storming spend many pound haue wicked desire satisfied nay vndoe himselfe strip himselfe hath yet thinke neuer worse himselfe hee hath done nay man may tell neither therefore preuent outcry late repentance time come time fooles crie lost haue vndone selfe let v learne way become owne best friend greatest enemy sinne preuaileth v threatneth greatest desolation god take man part note himselfe striueth hate himselfe meane corruption within deare himselfe till wee come point haue heartie indignation sin haue delighted wee haue others cause sometime note selues circumuented ouershot bargaine cunning cosener farre repentance estate wise man rest though worke bee difficult confesse speake businesse though man haue many great enemy hinder yet sinfull heart dangerous trecherie whereof onely enemy doe mischiefe doubtlesse diuell strongest allurement rebound backe hurt neither enter heart lieth open euill vnfenced euill remaineth best occasioneth externall euill enemy stirre vp encrease pure angel haue diuels enuious enemy nay sinne make god enemie euer euer reconciled lieth harboured vnremoued otherwise though hee correct v yet hee loueth v father child cause much enemie meane sinne effect god enmitie therefore hee afflicteth sinne count enemie crosse hee inflicteth patiently beare say goe vnder triall willingly seeing haue sinned turne griefe chiefe enemie knowing except sinne vndoe thing shall turne good rather also samson brought hee neuer meant bee wit vtter secret base housewife following importunitie note force widow importunitie luke ouercame wicked iudge grant iustice though mind doe let v see good men importunate v thing else turne wee away hearing ioseph alluring mistresse let v specially vse importunitie gen earnest suite sauiour hath willed v god prayer wicked iudge would moued saith sauiour heare poore luke widow lest make wearie shall god auenge elect crie day night largely chapter like occasion againe thinkes answere samson strumpet nazarite c lock cut shall another man sauoureth incredible sottishnes argueth plainly wretched sinner breaketh course till heate power sinne doe yeeld tyrannie thereof hee bound hand foote carried whither creditor aduersarie whither himselfe listeth cannot enough excuse samson might haue hee would rather haue chosen haue kept secret like brought stockes set heeles brought streight hee would doe hee desired shunne himselfe headstrong lust hauing got hand ouer note vsed impotently made stark beast slauish foole knew sorrow must ineuitably ensue vpon betraying himselfe yet hath say grace vnder boord strength containe himselfe said minde touching vpon verse entice c execution plot doth liuely present eye nature sinne take wisedome man first imposeth condition pleaseth knowing man would neuer vassall long right minde wit samson could say nazarite c could haue said sin shall make selfe purest worshipper god prophane creature execrable samson would say least weigh desperatly runnes vpon pike doubtlesse power though saluation lien vpon time preuent blessed bee god holdeth election men haue lost grace feeling samson lost eye ere philistims put let little enforce vpon iust occasion fourth verse boldly auerre affirme say tell sinne proue good euidence bring sorrow samson peter dauids salomon commit count foole indeed put one thing beleeue thee occasion offered god grace bee stirring effectuall thee watchfulnes iealousie ouer thy selfe thou wilt abstaine vpon meditation ala find grace strength oftentatio sought without yet thou maist haue matter enough thy minde disswade flaite thee denie thou shalt haue small list power weigh ponder nay thy intangled drunken heart make sot thy minde disguised beast thee heart infatuate lust stoppeth freeseth vp passage knowledge cannot succour poore distressed embondaged soule leaue shift conclude samson sin presumptuous impotencie yet vnauoidable case standing oh still learne men haue quit themselues well soone haue spoken bold word sinne generall come particular doe men haue blood saith cursed cain though hanged presently yet hee knoweth shame woe thereof iewes knew well enough scripture saith knowne would haue crucified lord life sometimes denie ciuill men kept crime meane good men offending though strongly tempted goe stifly rule still say thee shall reade beware dalliance venturing farre thou shalt haue power withdraw thou wouldest wouldest thou mightest trust thy selfe thy strength case brused reede best lawes leaue little iudge may man subiect corruption except god grace law within thee suspect strong pursuite lust thou art iudge aduise thy selfe wilt hardly law thy selfe gouerne thee thou fearfull giue little libertie thine heart euill great note shall master thee thou feare anger thou shalt murtherer thou flee baite snare shall catch thee euer beare minde sinne groweth predominant get masterie man may well mad reason sinne reason think moderate yeeld euer slaue sinne force thee yeeld euen strong fit ague maketh doe strongly shaketh thus much time eightie five sermon xvi chapter booke ivdges proceed story see samson though otherwise indued god singular doct vers grace yet impotently giuen ouer loue woman wee doe reade hee else tainted sin let admonish v may possibly weake resisting prone committing one sinne another shall bee amisse v think seeing haue many example scripture sin common among say end euery one v obserue selues see selues weakest vse meanes strengthen selues watching prayer reading houerly heartily seeke better thereby wise dare bold commit seeing cannot bee sure ill successe samson hee husbandman suruaies ground vseth fence quick set strong thicke hedge thin troden downe wee loue lay load need blemish liues make rest disgracefull therefore requireth labour blot wee cannot abide set selues amend much take knowledge yet one dead flie corrupts whole pot sweetest oyntment sweeter sooner salomon eccles excessiuenesse kinde defame excellency gift doe see experience truth hereof honest man saith one couetous hasty vncharitable breaker promise one interposition eclipse light credit yea paul like kinde spake house cloe cause cor weighty case euen tush matter say one infirmity none wee hope many good quality conceit least must priuiledge v license v scape ala erre foully one secret lurking companion enough betray house espied say men v nay hee doe thus thus worse dare trust kind occasion serue oh cast diuell watching fasting prayer oft renued couenant lurketh behind doe mischiefe many others seeme cast till beare thy head high doubtlesse god suffer one prosper doe professing take liberty except wil haue good deed shame euil become execrable company israel achans sinne wee keepe seruant iosh house otherwise none worst painfull leaud quality sake though would giue v seruice shall god endure v man may feele sin hee cherisheth well meate loueth doth know let know god mocked let suffer sinne rankle substantially worke doe god suffering goe forward seeing hee purposed destroy cleerely bee seene spitefull shamelesse attempt priest sauiour seeking life though pilate three time alleaged innocency vnderstand came money hand ready paid according promise besides may see wicked spare cost bring bad matter passe follow better cause looke vpon penny draw backe shall begin say beside ye may see breake promise bee liberall businesse like well successe haue therein would might truly say better attempt oft time drawing backe euen promised farre men furthering goodnes deale heerein doe promise though aduisedly made therein like done elsewhere haue also bewailed impudent shamelesse woman brought prince vers philistims together haue heard former verse shewed made sleepe vpon knee caused seuen lock head shauen shee began vex calling philistims strength gone base thing vtterly vnbeseeming hauing excellent doct gift god become slaue whorish mistrisse bee made sleepe vpon knee hee would turne face thousand men lie downe foot leaud woman oh sottish follie almost incredible thus gift might bee reuerenced say good grace might go many brought shame abusing sin come place way commonly base housewife man gift bringeth honour euen note person deface gift despised faire comely garment simil soiled filthie lothsome channell mire dung hee cannot keepe credit honour god hath giuen worthie without derision memorable lord spake hophni phinees sinne among others despise set light men good sam part neuer set vp much leaudnesse defaceth vile sinne make traitor iudas contempt cast vpon demas tim forsaken paul base word doth many man vncleannesse make nay many professour good hope though haue repented yet brand contempt disdaine doth hee carrie dying day ruben gene dignity gen gone yet sort giuen drinking gaming farre giuen ouer hee rather make basest fellow towne companion sit hee thinketh may doe yet hee loathe basenesse sinne like count repugning common honesty returne men good part otherwaies doe shame themselues grosse sinnes well enough serued need venture farre owne lust forsake seruices god house meanest whereof honorable next thing followed shee caused one cut lock neglected strength christian lie faith truly samson locke faith quailed wilfull sinning man feele god louing giues leaue himselfe offend much fruites also decay feruency care feare diligence good duty c one growes vnbeleefe degenerate deadnesse carelesnesse loosenesse c whereas cauiller lying wind aduantage might say see samson condemned shauing locke therefore long haire blameworthy habite would seeme make answere two way first guise samson common generall permitted indifferent personall belonging vow nazarite abolished abstaining strong drinke suppose greater part plead long haire easily yeeld abstaine secondly say though liberty extended yet equitie might challenge due proportionable nazarite pure worship ping god former respect see small cause vse habite condemne vnseemly wearer thereof prophane worshipper best suppose none pure worshipper god therefore let abuse returne heires first inuented couer shame lewdnes first brought vpon enough wise man said vpon thirteenth chapter foole though hee braied morter yet would follie depart prou said two verse strength gone vers began vexe calling philistims hand fall vpon handle pleasure oh wee see easie matter bring miserie vpon one shall onely destitute earthly helpe haue god also euen iudas time visitation came hee vtterly forsaken god beside hee cast master disciple fellowes priest pretended friend cast samson forsaken louer hated philistims lord left therefore neerely prouerb verified woe alone vnlike thriftlesse debtor folly come vpon creditor haled prison forsaken friend destitute comfort might haue liued comfortable manner haue comfort others wise carefull managing businesse vse thus much fall danger haue men yea friend v sometimes may befall v good cause yet lay foundation strongly lord forsake v chron doubtlesse doe forsake touching cruell trecherie betraying thus reueiled himselfe detecteth like vnfaithfulnes wheresoeuer found christian monstrous falsehearted one farre worse philistims samson awaked see done vers thought hee would doe hee done namely strength shift himselfe could lord departed leauing hath alreadie said without strength body vse grace guide himselfe comfort minde see god hath deliuered men doct oft time danger looke still doe neuer thinking iustly might haue plunged deeply long neither weighing owne securitie little regarded profit deliuerances past exceeding blockishnes senselesnes men prophet saith wise onely doe euill good looke iere doe haue done thing like haue done please allowance note haue god libertie nay rather consider god bad course therefore hast seeing plague hang ouer head prou hast good captaine humble themselues god elia craue pardon king oh let best v know wee may nestle selues ill course though wee haue bold lord time past way wee yet lesse experienced tempt farre deceiue selues haue done imagining shall doe well former day changeable world change come oftest change euill course besides god mocked bad crie peace case much worse thus corah perished companie yet thought haue still time past iezabel deceiued king threatned elia lose head morrow little weighing one day doth bring foorth little lost life king fearfull manner peace vngodly saith isai god thus samson though reprobate yet miserable reuolter fared knew god gone looked escape done disappointed deceiued palpable deceiuablenes bred v dreame god hee psalme said seeing god winke held peace euill therefore hee himselfe approued psal bad course would doe neither good euill change prosperitie thought bee feared confesse god suffereth long administration doth oft time let meaneth destroy goe without stop prosper oxe fatted slaughter whereas hee meeteth owne child mercie though smart bitternes rather perish howbeit neither course generall appeares many example scripture experience whose sinnes haue gone hand doth hold life yet faileth death sure course altred wicked man prophet saith isai though hundred yeere old accursed day commeth whereof shall said yesterday let terrifie vngodly one lest god come vpon vnawares alter condition intollerable vexation let rather men amazed terror god shake hand renounce stale course wherein setled frozen let trie whether vnfained humbling soules obtaining mercie god finde happie euer changed estate doe vnderstand person make farre vse god sparing samson doe occasion themselues sinne boldly still yet promise hath giuen heart feare endeuour obey commandements say may assure themselues shall finde goe well alway marke say alway day yesterday time past samson found hee walked according rule knowne haue fully purposed cleaue vnto god without warping falling sinne doe fully account beleeue soules shall alway note liking fauour blessed men desire haue morrow like day without change meane substantiall change care keepe holding fast good conscience waxe dissolute let look good day shall changed sorrowfull god giueth man certaintie outward estate peace health wealth friend prosperitie much lesse granteth speaketh brought hand enemy pet heere seene euen vseth doe cause seeth meet reason end may rise vp againe falles repent working affliction god blessing fitteth rather prosperity ready abuse presently shall appeare story meane wicked going sinnes readier iudgement one time meeteth taketh hold thus take downe pride boldnesse tempting could brought good knowne cause wee discontentedly beare shall exceed goe beyond god threatneth second epistle thessalonian may see calamity diues thes especially compared lazarus comfort come lay trouble particular let v see one thing omitted samson dallieth dallier faine beare penalty former dealt dauid extreme dealing two great rebellious sinnes adultery murther take away child borne adultery especailly patient respit betweene dauid forgot gentle correction hainous offence therefore waxed hee bold againe lord shewed lenity prouoked againe grieuous manner ambitious numbring subiects escape cleerely god remembreth story well witnesseth set himselfe resolute course reuenge hee till hee made dauids heart ake saw boldnesse tempting god little gained hee stayed till angell well slaked matter ambition slaying seuentie thousand people let watchword v god haue mercifully passed wilfull offence sparing v say count great aduantage fauour dare bold prouoke againe may iustly feare scourge wil bee smartie samson many found bee say wee haue heard many sinnes samson committed doct inward vexation mind god departed though saw purposed little lay particularly outward misery set downe verse done heapes one another first said tooke apprehended liberty yet forthwith put death would bee satisfied short reuenge bee rid hee suffer longer paine meant keepe aliue hold vpon racke much torment vexation might bee worse death vnto therefore plucked eye thereby prouided see doe mischiefe lead one chiefe city put among rascall prisoner made grinde horse apurtenances duely considered may easily seene depth misery plunged yet beside mocking laughing disposed make themselues pastime thereby bring forth purpose see many sin committed certaine many iudgements god looked bee heaped vpon person doe commit euen heapes vpon heapes wee haue eye psal behold psalmist saith many sorrowes compasse euery side cause many sorrowes trouble many sinnes saul though king yet found seeing life full iniquity could free many plague till last made vtter riddance scripture full example godly haue turned aside transgressed many way sort punished accordingly although many escape long flourish prosper world yet altogether void inward doe sting part readinesse shall bee thought come soone farre soeuer seeme greatest iudgement soeuer shall fall suffered go without destruction commeth vpon happy shall haue kept heart pure good heere let v note sinnes doe onely keepe many benefit v also bring many iudgements shame pouerty sorrow doct bondage prison misery vpon v beside quench grace god v faith hope good conscience feare god rest men make little matter see little account price world short hasteth wicked heart desire giue himselfe liberty way knowes god doth allow though bee altogether grosse shamefull samson sinne hasteth owne misery time appeareth himselfe alwaies seene obserue consider samson deepely drunken therefore vomit stronger one two ierkes make sturdy body dance hee stung quicke stout stomacke come downe see remedie hardened heart cannot repent neither without rom violence meekned subtil traitor iesuite first examination farre moone bee knowne nothing held well racke hee confesse bee much good done seuerity god vse rather faile purpose let teach men try god thinke themselues well able stand beare angry countenance venturing far finde opinion god lenity confuted themselues loden sorrow let rather vse meeken heart cry misery great trouble commonly argueth strong rebellion long trouble hard heart singular mercy god haue tamed continuance punishment small cause reioycing haue remoued heart left obstinacie hasten cure shorter shall sorrow god delight punish long much together returne samson granted samson needed whipping must therefore need bee whip note many string none meete see execution done measure prophet complained edomites psal aimed nothing lesse punishing sinne wholly satisfying reuenge god bring vpon samson personall hatred philistims publike good honour owne worke vpon enemy church hee made prey teeth obiect furie oh consider thou obiectest samson simply went god worke god bound himselfe shelter enemy end hee furnished extraordinary strength literally verified one shall chase thousand deut god stood making good harmes could befall owne quarrell else samson might iustly haue complained hee note would haue owne worke goe forward god businesse required hotter pursuit master euen wicked leaud businesse crossed therein hee owne man god seruant looke charge damage befel imployment himselfe defray stand see vsed gift abused owne lust god bereaued sent among master pay wage owne worke god tooke himselfe highly wronged therefore hee take samson hand purpose making worst foe arbiter denie euen herein shewed fauour speake physicke procured recouerie wee thinke god fittest minister fittest quality let v ascribe also wel quantity listeth bodily disease second place one chiefe thing measure workes vpon tenth would haue killed peter yet lesse would haue stirred samson returned filthinesse without doubt restraint forcible god mercifull delight extremitie lam exod iust cannot faced boldnes samson thus led away paine base worke doct vers reprochfull manner see withall constrained leaue goe louer also neerely knit whose sake hee suffered woe much sore hard beare doth see hee might haue free haue continued happie estate wherein could haue shaken alienated mind yet must leaue whether would seeth cause hee faire warning doe euen obserue wee perswasions serue draw v speciall sin whether samson deluded yet god knoweth way enough scare v one among rest wee shall plucked violence though would also shame sorrow belly full shall wish late wiser time saith salomon young man among fooles destitute vnderstanding prou going toward house harlot euening night began darke subtiltie inticed followed straight way oxe goeth slaughter foole stock correction till dart strooke thorow liuer bird hasteth snare knowing danger best end commeth following wicked heart desire committing sin whe meanes reclaimed fro great matter worth marking say lord pul vngodly filthie pleasure wherein liued doth restraine immediate forerunner finall woe pluck godly baites allured indangered dealeth kindly recalling woe repentance enioying many good thing wont deny fauour child granteth wicked wrath one point hereof see two died one death bodily spirituall haman iudas meane eleuen apostle wee shall see concerning two former one taken pompe peeces siluer rid himselfe hastily euer coueted greedily next newes heare giuen ester ouer themselues sinne intended hanged mat ended cursed life cursed death may adde foole gospell achitophel infinite others luk sam top wickednesse held backe god end neerest hand wit good apostle gratiously weaned pursuite would haue bin bane ambitiously sought striuing greatest chiefe among rest sauiour held iohn made ashamed thinke gone lost nay gained rather learning humilitie found sauour sweetnes seruice afterward loue appeareth great lamentation made departing made way enioying worthy precious benefit master ascension euen hee wrought apostle doth elect people note see cannot enioy desired vnlawfull liberty without vtter vndoing begin thinke high time looke doe see depth folly refuse forsake owne mercie ionah speaketh looking lying vanity resolue renue ionah old acquaintance god returne first husband fall old diet againe oh mercie god inualuable may though bitternes flesh sauoureth goodnesse yet fauour god behalfe toward vnutterable could ill haue spared euen themselues iudges therefore returne let must thus roughly vsed samson meane bereaued plucked sinne deare violence ere giue ouer let say beware lest god shall thus crosse like blind idiot wilfull rebel fight god increase owne miserie renuing old sinnes seeking forbidden pleasure gaine little better swine returne mire pet neither forbearance violence doe good vpon may feare case bad others may seeing god vseth commonly remedie cure maladie see end sinne beginning entrance diuell slighly cunningly sheweth foole pleasure profit bringeth iudgeth yea offereth conceit shal euer finde may fittest allure blindfold wise suffereth thinke end vndoing wisedome story israelite plentifull witnes shewing miserable end sinne men need follow wicked lust haue thought good admonish reader good say inticed strongly baites sinne whereby seeth himselfe danger set note owne eye particularly wofull effect former yeelding dallying deceitfull allurement thereof holie ghost doth set downe foure fiue followed samson sinne professor forcibly haled vncleannes woman seeth likelihood turne away let answere himselfe thus sinne abhorred god delight set make mine enemie grieuous reproch profession yeeld burthen conscience importable losse grace vnspeakable griefe conditon prouision haue many made sumptuous goodly building fat pasture commodious ground laid thereto commodity neerly adioyning fishpond burrowes coneyes douehouses parkes orchard garden may bee deuised pleasure salomon speaketh himselfe eccles heerein one followeth another farre wealth note reach looke enioy shew happinesse thereby little time denies seruice performe longer without rest nothing nay vexation spirit also thus death lord messenger come oft sudden sergeant bailiefe arresting taking away pleasant delight samson violently delilah vntill cry againe see plucked vaine seeing none rescue may said haue prouided yeerely reuenewes auoid danger maintaine fleshly reioycings though god good benefit may lawfully enioyed yet set god place made delight men stead fauor gouernment cursed vsers thus must taken enioy longer say themselues death vnwelcome art thou v haue taken vp pleasure heere haue nothing else say wisdome went wisest prosperity hath bewrayed bee meere fooles left themselues nothing rather obey god therefore charged lay vp felicity giue credit told told note rich man gospell certainty earthly thing till tomorrow luk therefore must become word follie wilfulnesse euery common man mouth know wherfore doings note serue matter talke looked haue famous euer vniatiable gathering great prouision making earthly abiding prospering hath said well setled momentany rest thus comforted himselfe soule eate drinke take thine ease thou hast much good laid vp thee many yeeres hee say luk spake thus thou foole night fetch away thy soule thee whose shall thing thou possessest saith much daily pitie warned much like great man died yeeres agone sicknesse grew fast would bee shaken hee hoped would haue first comming could get helpe death approched drew neere hee vttered word last whereby cleere little thinking thing see vanity another hauing builded goodly house hee shewed commodity pleasantnesse plaine countrey man asking liked answered like well man might keepe alwaies thereby marring ioy could commend together deadly vnwelcome remembring momentanie flitting estate thereof vncertaintie enioying ioy wicked better haue said yet none may thinke lord deale partially bee knowne owne people degenerate partake sinne play fooles reioycing euill thing transitorie paradise shall smart likewise time enioy better priuiledge doe therefore let v bee wiser imbrace prosesse ioy cannot taken v neither shall euer repented haue sought reioycing lord word seruice saint short sufficiencie bee said fully point yet handled like occasion chap againe heere let v marke time ioy philistims damped taken met together sport themselues bee merrie furthest thought trouble death losing disappointment pastime euen house throwne downe samson vpon like apostle speaketh men cry peace thes peace al thing safe shal sudden destruction come vpon trauell vpon woman child shall able escape euen baltazar also fearefully threatned losse kingdome dan middest banqueting doctrine doth mauellously crosse vile nature giue selues leaue health welfare meet together abide v time make selues drunke take fill therefore cannot away heare change awaked carnall drowsinesse cause seeing men hearken lord bidding v watch beware surfetting luk spirituall drunkennesse therfore leaues many snare oft time wherein like fooles taken may see god hath prou begun iudgement owne escape shal much grieuously meet afterward enemy therefore iudgement sleepeth enlarge hauing spoken pet place mentioned chap casting downe house know passed strength common man strength restored againe see hee also inward grace appeareth hath said repentance prayer faith therefore since case thus altered must behold another man besotted made drunke wicked woman let v marke difference betwixt time grace man god guideth time bondage god letteth follow deuices desire wicked heart may bee seene samson oh grace could seene eye see darke resemblance outward shewes thereof would admirable manner draw v loue meekenesse moses loue ionathan zeale dauid like would foulenesse loathsomnes terriblenesse sinne cause v abhorre diuell iezabels cruelty ioabs malice haman murtherous mind seene oh shame man hath reuerenced highly regarded approued innocency faithfulnesse constancy good carriage become foole israel base ridiculous contemptible person againe say oh glorious worthy thing see note one reformed cast mould gospell looke vpon thy selfe euer thou diddest serue god vprightly vertues set downe place thee yea prayer sweet thee hearing like fruites amendment pleasant thou hast suffered thine heart carrie thee corrupt inclination thereof thou art become vtterly disguised thou haddest neuer person onely adde sinne maketh men impotent taketh heart committers haue shewed way loathsome odious reade one example end booke lord brought warre vpon people idolatry iudg canaanite said people put hart thinking sinne appalled conscience remembring transgressed among fortie apostle preached note christ saw would cost life slaine would need preach fell indeed preaching shall say therefore killed themselues sought owne death zealous diligent preacher paine study ministery empaireth spendeth strength health said procurer owne vntimely death hath spent strength calling end god gaue paul said ready bound die lord iesus act samson said let lose life philistims runneth rashly death followeth vocation death come therewith vnto yeelds willingly rather brought necessity vpon himselfe owne sinne hee could otherwise pursue god enemy hazard owne life euen valiant souldiers seeke death yet looke vse vse v wee abhorre least sinne way yea speech thought intending seeking owne death yet duty walke estate god hath set v wise onely ready fit willing die also god faithfull discharge duty meet v death hee apostle bee readie yeeld remember hee mat loseth life god sake shall finde therefore let neither life thing haue thought good requires though lose liues yet many doe forgoe commodity commendable god cause heathen spake according light saw vnnaturall men deuoure themselues souldier may disranke himselfe forsake station without emperours permission hath set backward lay money may bee well spared comfort heart god people good v wee yet may reape enioy certaine yea vnspeakable fruite thereof meane beleeuing beloued god shew fruit loue thankfull heart making friend may receiue men eternall habitation popish rout spareth maintenance fugitiue iesuites seminary vpholding pope kingdome may better defray great charge seruice lust put meane pride life lust couetous heart vncleane eye neuer swarmed land day yet neuer great generall complaint penurie many daily v reliefe great increase pouertie people increased well gorgeous apparell royall feasting costly pleasure great summes laid vp purchase made vse posteritie may presently giue contentment flesh note lord shall call reckoning expences wil allowed account taken currant wofull backe reckoning shall bee exacted hand euill steward wasting master good pinching niggardly contribution christ vse laid huge summes men bestow vpon lust shall inditement sufficient condemnation matth ala able doe thing purpose towards easing generall burthen therefore among want heart wofull miser confessed vpon deathbed oh lamentable till better prouision made church grant ti easie thing brought passe men wedded penny meane time let v know law god bindeth people freed ceremoniall cost sacrifice temple like lord iesus himselfe hath substituted roome poore member vndertaking payment take vpon score infinite aduantage creditor enough perswade desperatly couetous inlarge themselues mercie loue christ comforting bowel religious poore except proclaime christ himselfe present would suffer pine starue said vnto whence commest thou said vnto leuite bethlehem iuda goe soiourne may finde place micah said vnto dwell vnto father priest giue thee ten shekel siluer yeere sute apparell thy victual leuite went leuite content dwell man young man vnto one sonnes micah consecrated leuite young man became priest house micah said micah know lord doe good seeing haue leuite priest second part chapter sheweth micah summe verse hauing brought new strange worshippe namely idolatrie house pleased himselfe therein wanting nothing setting new trade worke worke man meane priest say tooke opportunitie offered leuite sought seruice take entertaines content heard son serue priest though none might law came aaron wherby see law god little regarded men set haue owne behold accordingly hee wished offered leuite little commendation hee much better liking taking sonne businesse took therefore receiued house neuer examining prouing inquiring might well throughly know behauiour make priest forthwith applauding himselfe successe reioycing little supposed well first two verse shewed micah got vers leuite priest sonnes roome thus young man ionathan described place hee dwelt familie tribe leuites scattered tribe dwelling went seeke place hee might stay himselfe hee wanting maintenance fell came trauell micah house meanes hee staied abode first wee may see another note badnesse time leuites appointed god
